Pours yellow with light head. Aroma is metallic, berries, linden blossoms, tropical fruits, some flour. Taste is fruity, fresh, light sourness, some flour, banana. Good fresh beer!

Pours hazy light orange from the bottle. The huge crown soon collapses. I generally like the aroma of a good Weizen, but not this one. The traditional yeasty and wheat malt notes are present, but subdued, and there are hints of both bubblegum and something rotting. Taste is sweet, with lemon and banana notes, but this feels artificial and uninspired. Lacks a crisp finish or anything in the way of nuance. The sweetness is syrupy. The effort is further marred by occasional watery notes on the palate. A poor cousin to the much better Weizen brew by the same brewery: the Urweisse.
ErdingeredingerErdingeredingerErdingeredingerErdingeredingerErdingeredingerErdingeredingerErdingeredingerErdingeredinger
the aroma is not bright, fruity, with hints of yeast, banana and some spices... the taste of wheat malt and banana with notes of yeast, apple and spices... sweet and dry aftertaste...

Bouteille 50 cl - restaurant st jean d’arves, couleur or blé, fines bulles très pétillantes, mousse blanche persistante,odeur sur les céréales, le houblon, goût sur les céréales, les fruits jaunes, amertume légére, très désaltérante

Tap @ Mata Hari. Cloudy yellow color. Dense white head with a thin layer retention. Aroma’s: sweetish, wheat, light banana. Flavor is light sweet, light wheaty sour. Light bodied. Not much going on in the finish. Not the best of German Hefe-Weizens.

One of those you suddenly realise you haven’t rated. 500ml bottle at Phoebe’s, Jimei, China on 10 June. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of malt with a hint of bubblegum. Sweet finish. Not as good as I remember it from 10 years ago.

Fruity strawberry and stale malt aroma. Huge carbonation and head. Oily and flavor dominated by grassy malts. Pretty bad weizen. So far Pikantus was the only good beer I?ve had from Erdinger. Won?t be trying their others any time soon. Definitely skip this.

Looks good, big, 2-minutes lasting foam, golden-brown color, average carbonation.
Smell is like fallen leaves in the sour water in the basement of german uncle Axel, unpleasant.
Taste is watery and just a little bit banana, dough and grain.
Aftertaste is firstly almost no, but after few swallows something..0.
As a result - very poor beer...
Not an excellent beer. If you are looking for a good weizenbeer, there are better ones out there

On tap at a Vietnamese restaurant in Berlin, Germany. 

Hazy, gold with an an off-white head and good lacing. 

Aroma of lemon, yeast, light fruit and white bread. 

Taste of yeast, lemon, white bread and light fruit. 

Medium/light body and medium carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Slightly darker than golden, a bit cloudy, lots of bubbles floating to the top. Healthy and stable white head which shows good retention and some lacing. Aroma has soft malts (white bread), strong banana, bubblegum and a hint of lemon. Taste has a soft malts base, fruity esters (mainly banana), a pleasant and not invading bubblegum feel and a hint of clove. Finish is rather dry for the style with maybe a slight grassy note, brings freshness and helps atttenuating the overall obvioulsy sweet feel. Light body, average crispness, smooth and easy but still quite lively mouthfeel. A good Hefe that feels very easy and refreshing but not too sweet.

bottle. i remember first drinking this for a week solid in tilburg with craig the first year we went to incubate. bands didnt start until late so we just spent all day in pubs getting shitfaced then by the evening we were so cunted we made dicks of ourselves at every gig. really fun holiday even tho we had big fights and lost tons of money
anywayz this pours hazy yellow with a foamy lasting head. yeasty bready aroma with lemonpeel. balanced taste of banana bread, orange, and sour tangy finish. sweet and filling and delicious

On tap. 
Slight grainy aroma.
Pours with golden color and reasonable head
Not much finish and a little watery.
Also slightly oxidized and metallic but this is probably due to being on tap.
An OK lager but nothing mind blowing.

Three labels on the bottle but without information about the hops, malts or drinktemperature in detail. The website is terrible - only sales....
A cloudy golden beer with a small head, yeast is dominated, no hoppy or malty, honey, finish is very short, the Erdinger Urweise is the better alternative here,
(I have a 0.5l bottle with batch L151309 1355 and best-before 06-2016)

Surprisingly clear yellow brew. Checked the bottom of bottle to see if it was filtered but there was sediment at the bottom of bottle. Would love to know their secret on keeping the sediment at the bottom during the pour. Other than that, pretty plain with nothing really exciting going on. So while nothing there making me want to buy more I would still buy it if I found it on sale.

Bottle at home. Hazy yellow colour with a lasting white head. Nose of doughy basement aromas, similar to mass produed low quality lagers... Taste is medim sweetness, very low bitterness. Very low carbonation. Meh.

5/5/16. 5/4/6/3=2.9. Pours hazy yellow to orange with a lasting white foamy head. The aroma contains yeast, fruits (especially banana), wheat and grass. It tastes medium to light sweet. Long and wheaty finish. Light body, creamy texture and fizzy carbonation. Could use a bit more punch. 

19/1/18. 50cl bottle from an Albert Heijn in Ghent. Hazy yellow with a big, but diminishing, foamy, white head. The aroma contains grain, malt, yeast, apple, some spices and banana, wheat. It tastes light malty sweet and light to medium hoppy bitter; dry, grainy finish. Light/medium body, slick texture, soft to fizzy carbonation. Too bland, and more of a Witbier than a Hefeweizen.
Bottle at home. Hazy golden colour with a white head. Subtle clove and banana. Lightly yeasty with some bitterness. It’s okay.

Pszeniczne, mętne. Jedno z najsłynniejszych, klasycznych piw i jakość piwa nie zawodzi. Jak dla mnie - jeden z wzorców gatunku, znakomity osad, bujna wysoka piana, długo utrzymująca się. W aromacie na pierwszy plan wychodzi banan. W smaku lekko kwaskowe, pełnie pszeniczne. Bardzo dobre.

Aroma: The smell is wheat dough, with yeast and spices, clove, coriander and orange marmalade
Appearance: A cloudy golden brew with a firm white head that recedes slowly leaving good lacing.
Taste: The taste is like a liquid spicy wheat bun with bitter orange marmalade.
Palate: A medium carbonation, small intense and mouth-filling bubbles
Overall: A very decent wheat beer, nice in the summer sun.
Note: Bottle, with a chili burger. Reviewed 2010-06-22.

500ml bottle. Pours a cloudy pale orange with a half finger of white head that thins to a thick film. Aroma has notes of traditional, earthy, spicy hops, clove/spice, mild bread and caramel, and hints of fruity esters. Taste is balanced. Bits of darker caramel, bread, biscuit, traditional hops, slight banana and other fruits, a touch of spice, and a medium finish. Medium body with a medium-high carbonation. Clean and refreshing in the mouth with a active carbonated mouth feel. Overall an easy drinking beer. Traditional in its flavours but done well.

Bottle. Pours light yellow color with big head. It is not so hazy as I expected. Aroma remind me on nuts. And, of course, some banana and yeast notes. Maybe also metal notes. Flavor is watery with banana notes. Not so sweet. Medium body. Overall: ok but missing some classic characteristics of hefe (eg. Body, stronger yeast esters). Anyway it is easy drinkable.
Лучшее решение, что пить дома - то пшеница. Мягкая и приятная.

Cloudy, orange colored, medium- white frothy head, good lasting. Aroma is of some wheat, bit clove and banana but rather light, estery peachy. Taste is light+ sweet wheat, also light clove and banana, peach estery, light acidity, some bready yeast. Light to medium bodied, average carbonation, watery. Watery and weak in Hefeweizen flavor. Substandard I’d say...

From Tap at Krah Krah, Vienna. Pours hazy, light yellow to orange colour with a medium white head. Aroma of malts with some light fruits like banana and minimal citrus. Taste of light sweet malts, yeast, light banana and citrus, light to medium bitterness and also slightly sour. I don´t like to drink it every week, but sometimes it´s quite refreshing. Not as good as many other beers of this style.

Hazy golden beer with a thick, lively head. Wheaty banana smell. Lively on the tongue, there’s banana and hop in the flavour. Sharp, crisp rather drinkable. There’s not that much to say other than that it’s a decent, very drinkable white beer.

500ml bottle into a weizen. Cloudy yellowish orange, loose white head which didn’t last. Aroma is faint and almost non existent. Reasonably carbonated and sweetish. Hints of banana at the end. OK, but not special.
Pleasant beer. Especially when well chilled. The refreshing taste. recommend

Never liked this one much. Rating in Sheridan’s Pub in Zagreb. Murky yellow to orange, medium white head, frothy and quickly diminishing. Aroma is some banana and peach, but mostly malts and hay. Medium carbonation, thin to medium body, to watery. Sweet but also metallic flavors are present. Very thin finish, hints of banana in aftertaste. This is really not good. Cheap beer sold at high prices.

APARIENCIA: de color dorado, similar a la miel de abeja, turbia, algo de actividad de carbonatación. Corona de espuma blanca de burbuja compacta y abierta de buena retención, lacing presente.

AROMA: notas de pan, plátanos, especias como clavo, pimienta, es lo que predomina.

SABOR: las notas de pan y plátano que aporta el trigo están presentes pero no tienen mucha permanencia al igual que las especias como clavo y pimienta, llegan a ser muy efímeras. Amargor muy bajo, seco y nada astringente. 

SENSACIÓN: Cuerpo ligero y moderada carbonatación.

RESUMEN: Hefeweizen carente de carácter y con poco sabor.

‘Mixed peel’, slightly sour nose – a disappointing lack of strong fruit esters or spice (but my bottle was six months past its ‘best before’ date). Not as bad once in the mouth - like UK supermarket chain Morrisons’ hot cross buns, I understand. Bit disappointing from a German big gun, and not even as good as the Dunkel from same brewery (sampled simultaneously).

Nice wheat beer. Has a cloudy but smooth texture, white big head, which slowly dissolves also very nice. Yellow color. Aroma however is a bit weak., fruity aroma. Classic example of the good German wheat beer. I enjoy mostly in an wheat beer glass out of a 500ml glass bottle ;)

Drunk from 50cl bottle bought from supermarket in Carvoeiro, Portugal. Enjoyable wheat beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Яркий аромат и вкус пшеничного солода. Пена плотная, высокая и держится долго. Насыщенный темно золотой цвет.

Pours hazy golden with a big, frothy white head – definitely a proper outlook for a hefeweizen. The aroma features pale, wheaty and bready maltiness with citrus fruitiness and some yeasty spiciness. Aromas seem a bit more maltier and less spicier than than some other German wheats. Taste is similar; wheaty and grainy pale maltiness dominates with fruit esters and spices only sidelining. Low on sweetness and naturally also bitterness, this wheat is dryish and in the finish slightly sour. The palate is light to medium bodied and fairly smooth with average to lively carbonation. Drinkable but lacks banana and spiciness.
Aroma is a bit weak. Kind of lack the wheat sweet taste. Not very smooth. A bit thin finish. Not a typical hefeweizen.
God weißbier, med frisk og syrlig smak. Lite lukt. Den har en markant, men ikke for sterk ettersmak

Yeast, bread, fairly intense banana notes, huge white head very persistant, turbid gold, light/medium body, medium carbonation, medium sweetness, taste similar to the aroma, quite watery in the aftertaste...not too bad.
Cloudy golden, with lots of foam. Taste wise it stay a little flat, with a medium finish.
Pours cloudy golden with thick white head. Some lacing. Nice, wheaty, some heaviness, citrus fruitiness. Altogether a decent beer that I enjoy time and again
Average and classic weiss beer, Cloudy golden body with very big white head. Fruity aroma. Drank 500ml bottle.
Belle couleur orange trouble, rafraichissante, pas beaucoup d’arôme....encore moins de banane
I tried this on a recommendation after being negative on Weiss bier and wheat beer for years. It was ok but is not what I want in a beer. Prefer the German pilsners and ales from anywhere.
From Alcampo. In Bavaria’s glass. Watching Sons of Anarchy 6x01. Very drinkable and not bad but dull. Not much aroma nor taste and maybe a bit watery

0.5l bottle from marktkauf, 0.90€. pours a cloudy pale golden with a big white head and some lacing. weak aroma of yeast, some citrus, bread, no banana. flavour of dough, hay, yeast. again no banana or cloves. strong carbonation. not a typical weizen.
Not my favourite of the style, but I’ll still get it when it’s available. Big, fluffy head. Lots of banana. Taste is a lot of banana bread, cloves, orange peel.
Average weiss beer. Drank in bottle. Pours with medium head and hazy golden color. Well carbonated.

Bottle. Cloudy golden body large white lasting head. Aroma is Yeast fruits hints of citrus. Taste is yeast biscuits some grains some sourness. Aftertaste is grains with some alcohol and hints of fruits and bitterness. Not good.
Aroma discreto, com amarela turva e espuma branca e duradoura. Sabor suave e paladar agradável.
Me encantan las cervezas de trigo, pero esta es de las menos interesantes. Buen cuerpo y gaseada.
Ça a un meilleur goût quand on la boît en Allemagne... Sinon c’est plutot commun, avec des notes de bananes.

Aroma: lemon and vanilla, artificial.
Appearance: hazy golden color and white head.
Taste: cloves and banana, slightly zesty, yests, semi-dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation
Overall: Average stuff with really bad aroma.
Cloudy golden with very big white head. Fruity aroma, taste is bread, hay and fruits, okay but not really impressing.

33cl bottle. Pours with medium head and hazy golden color. Well carbonated. It was passed its expiration date so aromas might have weakened. Fruity aromas mostly banana, yeast and dough. Sour taste comes from wheat. No hop aromas or taste at all
Fruity aroma with mostly banana. Taste inkludes banana, wheat, bread and cereal. Plenty of better Hefes out there, but its ok...
Butelka 500 ml,koloru złotego mętnego o niezłej piance i srednim wysyceniu.Przyzwoity niemiecki pszeniczniak.
Di colore giallo paglierino. Schiuma breve e di color bianco avorio. Aroma fruttato (banana). Birra equilibrata

Tap Germany. Aroma bread, cereal, dough, clove, banana, Appearance golden, hazy, cloudy, white foam, Taste light sweetness, Palate medium body, lively, Overall a really light beer that can be drunk all day. Not a great Hefe but a good one
A nice, smooth and enjoyable hefeweizen. Sweet tones combined with light bitter ones. A smooth aftertaste.
Fruity aroma with no hops. Orange. Straw color. Cloudy liquid. White weak foam. Light bitter. Long finnish.

Bottle - Hazy golden colour, big bubbly white head, good retention. Wheaty aromas, bread, cereals, some citric sourness, low noble hop aromas. Taste is a bit sour for me, fruity, bananas, cereals, some honey, yeasty aftertaste. Medium body, average carbonation, a bit too sourish finish. Quite good, but not the best.

500mL bottle. The aroma on this is quite nice with hints of cereal, wheat, lemon and scant bubblegum. Yeast esters are present, but not overly obnoxious or dominant. Mildly hazy golden body with a medium, fizzy white head. Moderate head retention. Starts with a little sweet cereal flavoring. The middle has a little spritzy mineral character before some light yeast esters give off flavors of bubblegum, lemon, and cotton candy. Finishes with a little more sweet maltiness. A very easy-drinking beer that’s straight-forward.
Efter min ubeskedne mening en af de bedste weissbier der findes. Farve, skumkrone, aroma og smag er bare iorden.
Hazy golden pour, Tastes of wheat, floral and straw in there too, Standard widely available wheat beer, enjoyable all the same
Botella 50 cl tomada en la antigua internacional Oviedo octubre 2002. Fcpref 10..2003 lote 074111. Aromas y sabores maltosos cuerpo ligero fácil de beber. Normal.
0,5L Bottle from a local supermarket. Another decent hefeweizen. Backlog from 2014/06/14.

500ml bottle from Asda. 
Poured hazy amber with good white head.
Nose is floral wheat, Taste is floral wheat and straw. Standard widely available German beer but good all the same.

Bottle 0.5
Нетипичный немецкий вайцен. И это не комплимент. Пшеница где-то вдалеке. Аромат блеклый. Вкус...опять же, как и аромат, какой-то пустоватый.

50cl bottle at home (21 XI 2015), shared with friends. A typical Hefeweizen beer, this one. Without the bottom yeast layer, you get a hazy amber to orange brew with white collar. With the last drops of the bottle in a little snifter, the unclear wheat beer gets a yellow brown colour. The nose makes me think of rye and wheat fields, dirt, cellar, and lots of yeast. But there are fruity and sweet flavours too, with banana, candy, pomelo fruit. The taste has some unpleasant earth tones, with of course an omnipresent wheat feeling. The sweet, light bitter and lemon taste within this Weissbier make up for the watery features.
On tap. Hazy golden color with small white head. Faint grainy aroma. Mild wheat flavor with some sweetness. Light bodied. Average.

The aroma of the wheat. The flavor of wheat and water. Light bitterness which fills the upper part of the moment. Tasteless and watery. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Tap at Mexican restaurant outside Munich, 25th November 15. Aroma is citrus, some spice. Taste is straight forward, quite refreshing. Not bad, nothing particular

Hazy amber, large frothy white head. Little in the way of aroma gets through the head. Sweet cereal flavours, a little citrus, not much else. Heavy and fine carbonation. Not unpleasant at all but unimpressive.

Flasche 0,5l: Orangegelb - hellbraun, milchig trüb mit festem feinporigem Schaum; frische Nase mit malziger Süße, Röstaromen, Röstmalz, dunkles Vollkornbrot; im Körper süß und süffig, Bananensaft, Orangensaft, hintenraus etwas trockener
Obyčajný tuctový weizen s nádhernou penou a krásnym vzhľadom, tam to končí chuť ma neprekvapila.
WHen cold pours with minimal head and little carbonation. Hoppy aroma is fresh, clean. Not bad
Kurze Review von Untappd: Wohl damals, vor 20 Jahren mein erstes "anderes" Bier, heute mag ich es nicht mehr so.

Draught at John Scotts Avenyn, 151108.
A standard and very nice weissbier. Had it before this and will drink again x many. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The standard Weizen you get all around Germany. When you want to drink one, its quite likely that they have only this - happened to me just a few days back in Berlin. I mean its not bad, but I always sigh when I see it - there are so many better ones. This has so little aromas.

Draught. Cloudy liquid under a nice white head with great lacing. Crisp aroma, banana, typical weissbier. Carbonation is medium and the main flavour background is mild banana, sweetish wheat and balanced citrus character. The finish is very smooth and gradual. Somewhat oily, mild to medium body but pretty good for a weissbier.

It is not a bad beer but if I compare with a weihenstephaner is clearly one class under, in my opinion. It is a typical yellow colour and troubled Weissbier. We can smell the wheat but I don’t really feel this taste of banana. It is heavy with one side of alcohol.

Veiled, between straw and gold color with a peach hue. White extra foamy 3 finger head that dies in 4 minutes. Lots of activity and thick lacing.

Faint aroma of citrus with a metallic smell.
Faint flavors of grains and lemony bitterness.

Slick but quite light with ample carbonation. Short and faint finish.

Overall: the taste is too thin and subtle, missing some body and a thicker finish compared to other wheat beers.

Bottle. Hazy golden colour with a relatively large frothy white head, nose is yeasty and fruity with notes of ripe bananas, taste is sweet and tart with some bready notes and a mild but adstringent finish.
Simple et efficace, sans artifice ni défaut majeur... Sa plus grande qualité, le prix!

Botella. @Cervecería Beerlin, Oviedo. 01/11/2015 BBD: 08/16
Color amarillo turbio, aromas frutales, cuerpo ligero, fácil de beber.

Una cerveza de color amarillo claro con una buena cabeza. aroma de levadura y trigo. El sabor a levadura con un poco de amargura que perdura.le falta este sabor tan especial de las cervezas de trigo -cerveza normal.

Pours clear yellow (didn’t shake the bottom of bottle) with short-lived white head. Floral aroma, malts, light cloves. Taste is light malty. Refreshing weissbier, the way I’ve poured it’s more like a kristallklar weissbier.

330 ml bottle. Hazy honey gold color. Large mousse-like white head. Faint, yeasty wheat malt nose. Soft yeasty wheat malt flavor. Lacks the cloviness you get with traditional Bavarian Weissbiers. Lemony malt flavor. Rather one-dimensionable.

Cloudy, light golden appearance with almost no head. Tastes of light wheat, hay, floral, cheese, bubblegum and banana. Medium body, aggressive carbonation and lasting aftertaste of peppered banana. Not as great as people claim.

0,5 l Flasche. Aroma: Metallisch, grasig, vergorene Früchte. Erscheinung: gelb-oranges, trübes Bier, weißer, grobporiger Schaum. Geschmack: Leicht bitter, leicht süßlich, etwas scharf. Nachgemack: Kaum vorhanden, etwas hefig. Gesamt: Enttäuschendes Hefeweizen, man sollte mehr in das Bier als in die Vermarktung investieren.

500ml bottle. Cloudy orange colour with a good creamy head. Citrusy, fruity aroma. Yeasty taste with fruits and spices. Overall both the aroma and flavour seem to be a little weaker than similar beers. Still, it’s a nice Hefeweizen and I’d drink again, but there are plenty of better ones available.
good wheat beer......Misses the traditional banana aroma german wheat beers are carachterized for but still a good hafeweizen

Aroma bread, cereal, dough, clove, banana, 
Appearance golden, hazy, cloudy, white foam, 
Taste light sweetness, 
Palate medium body, lively, 
Overall a really light beer that can be drunk all day. I would suggest this beer to a friend.
Metny zoltawy kolor z wysoka biala piana ktora dlugo sie utrzymuje. Intensywny posmak chmielu z delikatna nuta drozdzy. Niemieckie piwo w swietnym wydaniu.

Pale straw colour, with a finger and a half of white head. Steady, moderate carbonation bubbles are visible. It looks gorgeous in the official tower glass.
Everything going on is pretty light, from the aromas, to the mouthfeel, to the tastes. There is very mild banana, cloves and black pepper on the nose and tongue.
Years ago, this was my favourite wheat beer, but having this first one I’ve had in a long while, I realize I’ve had many over the years that have surpassed it. Still drinkable though.

Bottle. Slightly hazy, yellow color, foamy white head. Spicy nose, spices and dominating yeast. Sweet taste, light sour, low bitterness. Medium mouthfeel, fresh carbonation. Bready, cereal aftertaste. 

Too sweet, too sour, and too little banana aromas.

If you’re looking for an authentic German wheat beer flavor, this ain’t it. it totally lacks any traditional banana and clove flavors that German wheat beers are known for. Even the wheat flavor is understated. This is really more like an American style wheat beer with it’s neutral yeast flavor. Probably the worst German beer that I ever experienced.

50 cl bottle from Roto dinamic, served in a snifter. Murky amber mit Hefe, with large, thick, long-lasting white head. Aroma is grainy, yeast, very faint banana. Medium body, medium carbonation. Taste is mild, with low, but well balanced sweetness and bitterness.

16.9oz bottle best by tomorrow or sometime before Halloween 2015 - Nose is grass, bubblegum, and faint banana, uh oh. nope. I’ve been looking for good and new German Hefe-Weizens lately and this is not doing it. Reminds me of a Berliner Weisse with some sweetness. Easy to drink, but the flavors are not what I expect. I get adjunct corn and I know it’s not in the ingredients. Maybe one that is fresher will be better.
Nice but weak aroma. Clear yellow, little foam. Medium sweet, little sour, umani.
Bottle. Hazy golden color with thick large head. Aroma has wheat, yeast, citrus. Taste is malty with quite long finish. Flavors of wheat malt, yeast, citrus.

A beautiful wheat beer as can only be found from Bavaria. It’s a classic with a long history and tradition. 500ml into a tall glass, beautiful, with a big head that brings the flavour to your nose before you even taste it. Long palate, delicious and well balanced. Perfect for a summer afternoon.
Moutig en fris witbier. Niet heel erg smaakvol, proef de bananensmaak maar deze is minder aanwezig dan in ander weissbieren. Wel aardig, niet bijzonder.

Bière blanche de 5.3 % d’alcool. Elle possède un petit col au versement. Elle possède un odorat de bière commerciale, genre d’odeur de moufette. Elle possède cependant un goût assez fade, neutre même, enivrant. Elle possède une finale avec un goût légèrement métallique. Très riche également en bouche, légère touche d’agrumes, très minimes par contre. Correcte !
Coloração amarelo âmbar com boa formação de espuma. Baixo corpo floral com toque de banana. Boa "drinkability"
One of my favorite german weissbeers. Nice full taste with some citron taste, with a bit of bananas....
Origin: Bottle. Vessel: Goblet. Supplier: Sainsburys (Bristol). Wheaty nose. Pours a cloudy golden. Light and floral.
Aroma has wheats, citrus and an almost perfumy smell. Taste is at first refreshing, but you get bored halfway through. Semi dry in the finish. one dimensional.

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass at the World of Beer in Pooler, GA.
This beer is a hazy golden yellow color with a thick white head. The aroma is fruity with some biscuit/yeast backdrop. The flavor is very good with plenty of spices and some sweetness to power this beer along.
I found this to be a really good beer, I will drink this again.

Seppur industriale questa weizen si difende bene. Il colore è giallo paglierino, torbido, con schiuma pannosa e molto persistente. Aroma di lievito e banana. Dolce, con punte floreali, carbonazione vivace come d?obbligo. Una birra che sul pasto non si smentisce mai.

La bière est de couleur paille, totalement opaque et de texture mince et pétillante ; le nez est de malts blonds, de citrons (acidulés) et de bananes. En bouche, aucun acide mais la bière est joliment désaltérante, savoureuse sans être pesante, avec toutes les notes que l’on est en droit d’attendre de ce style (pain, épices, bananes, signature de levure typique). Meilleure que la moyenne.
Wheat malts typical aroma of grain rises from the glass. The taste of this sweet wheat beer is with hints of banana. Easy to drink, tasteful, thirst-quenching and encouraging,
Pours cloudy. Aroma of wheat and fruits. Taste sweet, clean, citrus, banana and faint clove. One of my favorite beers.

On tap at a bar in the Zurich train station 

Hazy yellow with a big white head, good lacing. Aroma of wheat, esters and cleaning fluid. Taste of wheat, esters, banana and herbal 
 
Ok but it seems off. To be fair, it was decent when cold but as it warmed up the off flavors came out.
----- I’ve tried it before joining to the RateBeer. ----- Date of tasting: 27.01.15

Botella. Dorada turbia. Muy bien de espuma. Duradera con un dedo. 
Aroma plátano clásico. En boca es muy refrescante con el punto justo de burbuja. Bien de amargor y no resulta cansina.
Muy bebible

Pours on the lighter golden side with some haze. Aroma of a light banana with wheat notes.Taste is pretty standard but mouthfeel on the thinner side for the style. Banana characteristics. Feels like a great beer for the summer.

Ljus och mjölkliknande. Doft som en veteöl och smak därefter och då jag inte är så förtjust i det blir det lågt betyg.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a cloudy straw topped by about a finger of creamy bright white head showing pretty good retention and lacing properties. The nose is apples, pears, dough, malts, and earthy hops. The taste is fruity with apples and pears at center stage. Good acidity and medium body. Long earthy finish. Good but not great as I prefer darker versions of this style for they hold more flavour. Cheers!
Very good beer with good aroma.. With good color and taste. Aroma is like citrus.
Can 0.5 l. Hazy golden liquid. Medium body and carbonation. Very light aroma of grains and a hint of flowers. Taste like lager and hefe weizen combo. Not very tasty.

Barely any taste to it. Too sweet, no bitterness to it. 
I’d rather have a Paulaner or Franziskaner any time.

Appearance: hazy straw with a short, short-lived white head, no lacing. (3/5) Aroma: wheat, banana, bubblegum. (7/10) Taste: moderate sweet, mild bitter. (7/10) Palate: medium body, moderate carbonation, off-dry crisp finish. (3/5)

A - the? - standard weissbier. Decent levels of wheat malt, banana, and bubblegum, but ultimately not all that interesting. Feels a little heavy towards the end of the pint. (13/20)
"Converting" from old excel scoresheet. So there is no comments on this beer.

Pours a hazy pale yellow color, topped with a decent frothy white head. Standard wheaty aroma with bananas and spices. Taste is wheaty and mildly sweet, citric soury feel in the finish. Perfectly decent and easily drinkable.

I used to like it before I knew better beers. Tried it again on tap yesterday and I found it quite disappointing. Creamy white head on a pale hazy golden body, aroma of citrus and spices but taste doesn’t add much: malty and quite sour. Felt it heavy in the stomach.
one of the best wheat beers. They feel the difference in quality, since fermented directly in the bottle
SB Oskarshamn, flaska. Aromen överraskande frisk. Färsk från Tyskland. En mkt positiv uberraschung.
some malt in aroma bit trouble yellow to orange medium bodied faint banana some citrus and malts

Once upon a time, this was my favorite beer just to keep around to drink and compared to the what we could get not all that long ago, it isn’t bad but as my opportunities to try more complex beers has grown so has my recognition that this is very pedestrian. Traditional Hefe Weizen in appearance and aroma with a good long lasting creamy head. Refreshing but not much to it.
500 mL bottle. Cloudy yellow pour, tall fluffy white head. Aroma of citrus, cloves other spices. Taste is a bit more bland, slightly sweet, honey.

Das Pils unter den Weizenbieren.Weder sattes Weizenaroma, noch viel Hefe. Banane und Nelke fehlt nahezu vollkommen. Bei einem Blindtest wäre ich wirklich nicht darauf gekommen, dass es sich um ein Hefeweizen handelt.Furchtbar enttäuschend.

Copenhagen 18/7 2015. 50 cl can from Rema 1000. Pours slightly hazy yellow with big white head. Disappears fairly fast leaving only thin layer of foam. Aroma is sweet peach and lemonade. Fizzy carbonation. Taste is not as sweet as indicated by the smell. Clear notes of wheat - but not very aggressive. A little sourness mixes in in the aftertaste. Fine summer beer. Fresh and not too complicated.

Bottle 0,5. Laundromat Copenhagen Østerbro . Fine white foam cloudy honey coloured. beer. Fine taste - malt and hint of citrus. Find tart / sour balance. The Erdinger Weiss being double fermented  exhibits a very clean and fine balanced taste omitting the banana / cloves flavour typical of most other German Weissbiers.
An excellent beer!
Not that cloudy and with light orange colour. Banana and other sweet fruity taste. Refreshing but lacking complexity
dobro pivo koje se cak i moze piti ...steta , moglo je biti i puno bolje ..fali malo jaca aroma i punoca piva ...
500 ml bottle. Hazy golden with big white head. Smell is sweet ripe apples and spices. Taste is fruity and white pepper spicy. Semi dry with low bitterness and medium carbonation.

Yellow and cloudy. Huge white head. Citrus and other fruits in the aroma. Taste is mainly sweet and fruity and very mild. Lacks taste and sting in my opionion, there are better Weissbier Hefe’s around.

Liquido turvo,coloração alaranjada,alta carbonatação,espuma inicial abundante formando um creme alto e de media duração,aroma maltado com notas cítricas,no sabor malte,especiarias,banana,aveia,porem fugindo um pouco do estilo de forma bem suave,altamente refrescante,boa drinkability,trocando em miúdos uma Weiss fácil de beber.

Very refreshing and light. Not extremely yeasty. Not creamy, not too rich, or spicy, which is a balance that’s hard to yield. Slight taste of lemon and an excellent light portion of coriander. Overall, a great beer that I could enjoy three or four of.

Bottled yesterday and draught b4. Drunk from a large tulip . Drunk in the garden patio of the holiday beach place we are renting . I’ve not had erdinger Weiss in ages ,and it’s the kinda beer to swill fast if you want just a bit of subtle banana and wheat flava without having to think too much about the drink as your GF boosts golden Smirnoff and calls u an ass .
Tap...cloudy golden pour with short lasting head. Wheat, bubblegum, banana, and hops predominate the taste. Very quaffable on a summer day.

Amarillenta, turbia y burbujeante. Espuma muy abundante, aunque poco densa, 4 dedos. Muy escaso aroma para una weizen. Muy suave en boca, superbebible. A diferencia de la mayoría, nada frutal, y con un final carbónico y algo picante, donde salen a relucir especias. Agradable y diferente weizen, refrescante y bebible.
50cl bottle. Pours hazy golden color with big white head. There’s aroma of wheat and spice. Too hoppy taste for a weissbier. This could be much better.

Typical Weizen pour, slightly murky, modest head. A: strong sweet, vanilla like aroma once poured. Closer inspection reveals notes of lemon, some Pilsener aroma, faintest banana. T: refreshing, but a bit watery. Taste is mostly grains (faint), some banana notes (faint), touch of honey. Again, mellow but quite watery. Sweetness starts to build in the aftertaste, mostly banana.
Draught, hazy amber-gold with a fine head, lemon and bread nose carries through to the body, lightly spicy and faintly nutty. Straightforward and very quaffable.
In blue plastic cup (US), so color unknown. Aroma was nice, banana and spice. Taste pleasant but more subtle.

Bottle at a bar in Sursee (Switzerland) on a hot summer day - exactly what I needed then. Rather sweet smell, let’s say honey and banana, still kind of fresh and spicy. Taste is slightly sweet, banana, kind of bubble gumish thing. No bitterness. Medium carbonation. Nice one.

Bottle from Auchan, Luxembourg. Pours hazy gold with awesome, gigantic white head. Nose is more subdued than those of the competitors, I got white bread, spice and yeast aromas with only a hint of fruits. Taste similar, only slightly estery and with noticable hop bitterness. Full and silky mouthfeel. Very refreshing, but not as spectacular as other weizen.

-very high carbonation visible

-bananas and honey

light-medium body with medium-high carbonation

Erdinger is not your typical Hefeweizen.Its very much noble hop forward instead of Banana-clove forward.

Incredible solid beer, perfect for the summer another great European beer, wouldnt mind another one right now

Butelka 0.5l do 01.02.2016r. Barwa złota, lekko zmętniona. Piana biała, bardzo drobna, obfita, dosyć szybko opada i oblepia szkło. W aromacie czuć nuty chmielowe, pszeniczne i drożdżowe, ale ogólnie przyjemnie i świeżo. W smaku takie nijakie, a wręcz wodniste. Nie ma niczego wyraźnego, no może przebija się jakaś delikatna kwaskowość. Jest delikatne żelazo, ale dopiero po sprawdzeniu. Alkohol ukryty. Nasycenie spore, za duże jak dla mnie. Nic ciekawego, piwo poprawne, ale nudne jak polskie koncerniaki. Nie polecam za taką cenę.

Bottle from Sainsbury’s.

Pours yellow-gold slightly cloudy, 2 finger white head. Aroma of banana, wheat, grain, zesty orange. Taste of wheat, banana, grass, grain, some orange too. Nice!
Piwo w swoim stylu słabe, rozczarowuje, jedynie do czego nie można się przyczepić do wygląd (Barwa i piana). Aromat i smak słabiutko. Sprawdzone ale powtórki nie będzie.
taste like regular pilserner but smoother. Hay aroma is not bad but it has less bitter taste
Very nice and balanced. Not so strong as other weisses but still with the different scent and taste.
Good appearance and not much good about this beer. Cereal aroma with some honey. Taste is better: some sourness, refreshing, but no trace of expected weizen notes.
500ml bottle, foggy golden colour, nice steady whitehead, slight sweet grainy taste, really love this beer

50 cl bottle@music event in Copenhagen@approx 12 degrees C - a little too warm for my taste. Nicely balanced hefeweisen tastes honey and banana bread toned down flavours which I like but others may like them more pronounced pours like it should easy drinking.

golden color, cloudy beer, white big head, little bubbles, lasing, as you can expect. Light aroma of bananas, citrusy acid (not like from hops), grains, other aromas. Amarela turva com boa formação de espuma de média duração. Aroma e sabor com notas frutadas, banana, cravo e quase nada de lúpulo. Corpo leve com final médio e frutado. Boa breja, minha história com cervejas especiais começou "aqui".

Butelka. Barwa złota, opalizująca. Mętność na niskim poziomie (osad pozostał zbity na dnie butelki). Piana obfita, śnieżnobiała, trwała, zdobi szkło.
Aromat nikły, głównie zbożowy, estry ledwie wyczuwalne a fenoli brakuje kompletnie. Smak również zbożowy, pszeniczny ale nic poza tym. Goryczka niska. Aromat i smak pozbawione są typowych dla stylu nut goździkowych i bananowych. Kwasowość również niska. Rześkość temu piwu nadaje jedynie wysokie nasycenie.

Comparing to other German Hefe-Weissbiers, Erdinger is little bit disappointing for me. It pours a white thick head with cloudy yellow color. 

Smell: Quite yeasty and citrus with the hints of banana and clove. 

Taste: Not so good, and it is highly acidic for me. Aromas of banana, clove, and citrus are under pressured by the existence of dominant malty wheat aroma. Finish is weak and short lasting. I prefer Weihenstephaner, Pauline or Schneider to this one, sorry.

BBD 6/15. Pours a cloudy golden with just a touch of amber. World class head volume, retention and lacing.

Light nose of banana, clove and yeast.

Light medium body that has a smooth texture. Perfect carbonation with a nice effervescent burst from the middle on.

Like the nose, the flavor profile is weak, but improves considerably as it warms. The key to this beer is consume it near room temperature. It also lacks complexity when cold, but blossoms as it warms and is nicely balanced. Clove is the strongest component, while banana stays in the background. The middle has a touch of bitterness. No sweetness really ever emerges and the finish is a bit dry and tart.
earthy, banana, grass, bread, golden, cloudy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish,

50 cl bottle @ Wasa Line

Aroma is a bit acidic with citrus, yeasty tones and grain. Flavour has citrus, yeasty tones and mellow grassy notes. Somewhat fizzy and vichy-like. Finishes with cardboardy notes. Not that good. Does not feel very fresh.

50 cl bottle.

A great German wheat beer. Yeasty and fruity, but not overly fruity with nice bitterness. Easy to drink.

Lekker witbier, licht maar wel veel smaak. In de zon op balkon.

Cloudy golden with a tight, fluffy white head. Aroma is equally cloudy with some wheaty toast and a bit of banana and very light clove. Gorgeous, full flavor that’s contradicting with clean yet full wheaty tones. Lovely light wheaty toast with a clean yeastiness and just the lightest fruitiness. What a wonderous and clean yet classical hefe.

Golden light brown colour with creamy head. Aroma and taste of bananas, plums. Drinkable beer and for my point of view on RateBeer little too underestimated in comparison with the best examples of this style.
Uma cerveja saborosa,marcha bem. Muito boa,facilmente agrada a um variado tipo de apreciadores
Bottle from Asda, Manchester. Amber with little head. Includes some lovely smooth tasting pale malts, but there’s a lot of yeast here too alongside the wheat. Slightly sweet with a healthy aroma.

Pours a clear golden beer with a big, fine, white head. No saturation though.
Smells spicy, clove, malty, yeasty, some bubblegum, has a small hint of wet cardboard also.
Tastes slightly bitter.
Leaves a fine, gentle, bitter aftertaste, some sweet hint comes back up also.
Okay beer, bit bland.
Good appearance and not much good about this beer. Cereal aroma with some honey. Taste is better: some sourness, refreshing, but no trace of expected weizen notes.
An Average Weizen. Dark Golden color, sort of industrial aroma and an ok taste.

This is a pretty decent hefe that veers to the clove-accented side of things. It’s cloudy orange in color w/ a thin head of mixed bubbles. As mentioned, there is a pretty strong yeasty clove current through this thing. Some sweetness brings out a touch of banana. While it has a pretty thick texture and high carbonation, it is not really the velvety texture I look for in the style. It is a bit bitter in the finish which helps balance that bit of sweetness, which works OK, but overall this is only a fair example of the style.

Bottle. Shared with friend.
Golden color. Light fruity aroma. Very smooth. Refreshing. Good hefeweizen.

Looks: unfiltered, cloudy yellow with high white head.
Aroma: malt, yeast, fruit, banana, light citrus. Taste: sweet and light bitter.
Pearly.
Classic. A nice refreshing and fruity wheat beer.good clean flavor, not over powering with banana flavors, goes down well, pair with a bratwurst or cheese pretzel

Very cloudy hazy beer. You can’t even look trough. The cloudiness isn’t very appealing. It looks like it had a substance of a smoothy. Of course, this isn’t the fact. Is smells like a mixture of... orange juice and beer. The taste confirms this. They could have called it Radler, and no one bats an eye. Especially after drinking a Triple D’Anvers. A pitty.

Z butelki czuć przede wszystkim banany, potem słód i drożdże. W zależności od szerokości szklanki kolor to słomka aż do złota – piwo jest w typowy dla weizenów sposób mętne. Piana wysoka, idealnie biała, w miarę drobna, szybko opada. Aromat ze szkła to w pierwszej kolejności goździki a może nawet i inne owoce – przyjemny, ale delikatny. W smaku …ŻELAZO!!! Ale w jakiej ilości… Jakbym pił zupę z gwoździ – ten posmak w ogóle przesłania wszystko inne. Bawarczycy chyba sobie powinni tanki wyremontować bo im najwyraźniej zardzewiały. Dopiero po kilku łykach, kiedy już się nieco do tego metalu przyzwyczaiłem, zacząłem rozróżniać inne nuty w tym piwie – słodycz, owocowość – bardzo przyjemne i typowe dla stylu. Brakuje jedynie kwaśności, która powinna być zamaskowana słodkim zapachem. Gdyby Erdinger miał w lepszym stanie tanki to byłby całkiem niezły weizen
Tretinková fľaša z Billy. Svetlejšia kalná farba, hustá pena, pekná kvasnicovo ovocná vôňa. Vyšia rezkosť, chuť menej výrazná, ale príjemná, pšenicovo-ovocná na konci s nádychom alkoholu.
Bottle. Cloudy gold color with a large head. Aroma is a yeasty, spicy smell. Taste is a subtle spicy, tasty flavor. Not bad.
Fris witbiertje met fruitige tint. Afdronk is fris en blijft niet lang hangen. Maar dat hoeft ook niet bij wit bier. Heerlijk biertje

0,33 l (!) bottle. Unclear yellow in the glassm big foamy white head. Sweet banana and yeast on the nose. Taste is fruity, dry yeasty with sweetness, mid sweetness. Mid bitterness on the palate, high carbonated.

Medium fast fading foam, cloudy yellow color. 
This tastes more like lager than Weissbier. Too much carbonation, too small amount of aroma. Feels diluted.

500 ml bottle. Very soft malt smell, not particulary good. Golden creamy color with white head, a lot of foam involved. Sour sweet taste. Taste of grains stays in your mouth, also citric flavours are involved, maybe lemon. A beer for laying back, listening to Destruction on and enjoy.
500ml bottle. Pours cloudy, golden with a thick white head. Lemon aroma, taste is creamy, citrus with a hint of coriander. Decent

bottle in Singapore, 1 of the few Hefeweizen I’ve really enjoyed, this poured gold &frothy with a mild fruity wheat aroma, tasted crisp smooth & bitter with light citrus flavours, very refreshing in this heat
Caramel, bread, cereal, nuts. Beer with good drinkability. Flavorful quality. Good carbonation.

Bottle from beer hawk. murky gold with fluffy white head. Aroma is a bit spicy and fruity. Taste is sweet. Heavy carbonation medium body. Not great.
This is a beer with sweet and wheat aroma which pours blonde and dense with a soft balanced white head. Excelent end in lightly banana marks. Good one.
White, frothy head. Pale yellow, cloudy. Fairly intense at nose, not very persistent. Wheat, banana, spiced. Good carbonation.
Fris en rond van smaak en niet te zwaar. Een van de betere weisen die ik gedronken heb.

Recenzja z 31.07.2013. Wysoka piana, ale bardzo szybko opada i nic z niej nie zostaje. Mocno wysycone. Kolor złoty, mętne. Aromat typowego weizena, plus przyjemny zapach oranżady cytrusowej. W smaku stylowo, wysoka, ale przyjemna kwaśność, sporo cytrusów, lekkie drożdże. Strasznie mocno wysycone, aż szczypie w język i gardło, i przez to nieprzyjemnie się pije.
