Poured into a weizen glass in late 2013.

A: Gigantic head, even with a soft pour. Yellow/gold with cloudy yeast at top and see through at bottom.

S: Wheat, citrus, banana.

T: Follows the nose. Very subtle, though. Slight yeast on the back end.

O: The flavors were very subtle in this one. Wheat and citrus were the most prominent, but they weren’t strong.

Bottle pour. Pours a fizzy golden color with a thick creamy head. Mild banana, sweet fruit, and some spices aroma. Fizzy, mild flavor that matches the aroma. Very plain beer here, though nothing about it offends me. Overall not bad.

Big, white and long-lasting head. Hazy orange color. Only a little bit of hop, metal, and banana taste. Light body. Delicate carbonation. Sweet aftertaste. The taste disappears smoothly and comfortably. Good.
Overall good, but nothing particular. Typical.
True Bavarian classic! Typical wheatbeer, a good head, nice foggy orange appearence. Flavours of banana and malt with some spices and fresh fruit.
Large frothy head with subtle tartness and spicy banana aroma. Good mass produced weiss.
Nice orange color with moderately lasting foam. The taste has a solid nice body that disappears quicker than hoped. Very basic wheat beer without relevant deviations for the better or worse.

Standard Hefeweizen appearance. Aroma of a weird freshness, no spices, no bananas. Tastes like bubblegum, also without spice, cloves or banana. A bit of an unpleasant tartness. Boring. Really not a memorable Hefeweizen for Bavarian standards...

Vandaag een fles gekregen omdat deze aan de datum was (12-2014) "om thuis van te genieten".
Goudkleurig met volle schuimkraag.
Geurt zoals het smaakt; licht hoppig. Niet sensationeel in smaak, pilsachtig.

Cloudy gold with frothy white head. Biscuity/grainy aroma, not really any banana, bubblegum or spice as expected. Taste is very much the same. Easily drinkable but disappointing considering what hefeweizens can be.
Bottle. Murky gold with a frothy head, aroma is clove, citrus and banana. Taste is banana, sweetness on a smooth malty body and a rounded finish. Nice

Murky, golden body with a lovely head that was quick to dissapear. Tastes more like a pils, rather than a weizen, no signature bubblegum/banana yeast usually found in weizens, even if it were there, it’s very faint. A bit sour, and at times I felt like I was drinking a random pils. Disappointing to say the least. I got the glass along with the pack though, I can try some real weizens now!

Little bit disappointing to be honest. Cloudy gold colour with a small white head. Mouthfeel starts off creamy but ends up watery. Faint aroma which is more like a Pilsner with grass rather than the expected banana and clove ensemble. Nip of spice in the taste. Average.
Flaska från SB. Generös vit skumkrona, ljusgul lite grumlig färg. Frisk lite söt doft. Lätta smaker av bananskum, söt malt och druva. Lättdrucken med lite krispighet. Obefintlig beska och eftersmak.

0,5l bottle. Aroma is hard to decide. Very little aroma. Hazy, golden colour. Slightly caramel head. Short. Taste is also minimal. Very anonymous. Slightly sour, but mostly watery. The reason for its popularity amongst some of my friends? It’s incredibly easy to drink. Nothing to challenge the taste buds, hence boring and dull.

Draft 0.33ml @ Rio, Greece

Smells acidic, a bit like Berliner Weisse, not fruity at all, no clove or other spice. Infected beer lines??? No esters at all, nothing on the nose... If it was another style I might enjoyed the smell, I was almost hoping that it would be a sour beer(but it wasn’t).

Orange to amber color, hazy with amazing white, dense, lingering head. 
Taste is wheaty, a bit spicy, not bad, nice mouth feel. Medium to light body, medium to high carbonation.

Lovely example of a weissbier, cloudy, excellent creamy white head, nose of malt and warm bread. Must be poured correctly and in the correct Erdinger glass otherwise these characters are lost. I’m amazed at some of the previous comments about it tasting wheaty....it’s a wheat beer it tastes like a wheat beer. Not to everybody’s taste but a great example

Pours slightly hazy dark golden with a thick, stable white head. Aroma is yeasty, bready, slightly malty. Nothing to make that much of a fuss about. Taste is moderately sweet with a soft bitterness. Bready as well, bananas, cloves, yet all too subtle, making it a bit bland to me. Wheaty finish as well. Decent, but still not that overwhelming... Medium bodied, thinnish texture (yet there is a nice creamy mouthfeel) and moderately carbonated. Good as a thirst quencher on the warmer days or during a bbq... It sure is somewhat tasty, but there are better, more appealing Hefeweizeners in the world.

This looks like pilsner, no hefe. Slight haze big White head. Creamy mouthfeel. Taste corn. Not so good. Easy drinker

-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Poured from a .5L bottle. The color was hazy yellow... almost orange color (not quite). Thick foamy head. A bit of a grassy flavor. Slightly bitter finish. A little watery. Better than average hefe.
Bottle. Orange light color and thick white head. Smell off fall. Wheat and hops. Tasted delicious. One of the best wheatbeers i have tasted.
Cloudy yellow, with a huge white head. Smell is... I don’t know, wheaty? You know what I mean. Taste is nicelt sweet, with some grassy, woody notes. Not bad...

Butelka 08.2015. Piana śnieżnobiała, bardzo wysoka, sprężysta, bardzo trwała. Kolor słomkowy, jak na pszeniczniaka klarowne (brak osadu w butelce). Aromat nie powalający - minimalny goździk i minimalny aldehyd. Smak wodnisty, niczym się nie wyróżniający. Goryczki praktycznie brak. Wysycenie wysokie.
Licht troebelig met mooie schuimkraag. Bananen in de neus, licht bitterig met korte afdronk. Het echte Weissenbier!
Mooi goud bier met een flinke kop witte schuim erop. Wat tonen van banaan en wat pikants zoals peper misschien. Smaakt prima.

Pours hazy golden color with a creamy, 3-finger white head. Lemony aroma mixed with notes of grass and black pepper. Some banana-like esters as well. Body is light and mildly oily. Light astringency to the finish. Taste matches the aroma- lemon, with notes of banana and grass. Some yeast shows at the back.
Tåkete lyst oransj med høyt hvitt skum som forsvinner fort. Gjær og mandarin i duften. Smaken er flyktig med hint av gress og frukt. Fint tilpasset kullsyre. Husker denne som bedre.

Green apple aroma, something like pickled cabbage, cant call this but it has very nice aroma. Gold, hazy and sparkling a little. Low head but it comprises fine bubbles. No bitter, light sweet and sour. Medium body, thin texture, a little fizzy, astringent long watery finish.
Pours golden yet hazy as expected for a Hefe. Bread nose. Light to medium mouthfeel with good carbonation. Hints of wheat, Clove and Banana. Easy drinking
Tra le weiss è sicuramente una delle migliori. di buon colore, ottima schiuma, è molto beverina ma non troppo acidula
Jasne, lekko metne piwo o obfitej pianie. W aromacie wyra?nie bananowe. W smaku zbo?owe, wytrawne.

I haven’t had this for years so thought I would pick up a bottle again. Very hazy light orange in colour, initkially with large head which pretty much vanishes. Aroma is bread, wheat, hint of banana and cloves with a touch of citrus like fruit. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter, rather bland in all honesty. Carbonation is noticable although a little watery. Drinkable for sure but nothing to get overly excited about.

Not very intensive aroma of bananas and clove. Big thick head disappearing to small layer. Hazy yellow body. Sweet taste of wheat with pleasant bitterness and crisp carbonation. Good weizen but not intensive in aroma and taste.
0.5l bottle. Cloudy yellow color with small, fast disappearing white head. Aroma of bread and wheat, little too subtle. Taste is sweet with only little bitterness. Finish is watery with some lemon.
Cerveja com malte de trigo bem apurado, gosto que se distingue.. Levemente adocicada..

Appearance: yellow cloudy color with a medium to big head. Aroma: smells like bananas, a little of clove and spices. Taste: citrus, wheat and sweet notes, but nothing special. A little watery in my opinion.
Leicht trübe, goldene Farbe, schöne große Schaumkrone. Schwacher Geruch von Bananen. Leicht bitterer Geschmack, mit einem kurzen Abgang. OK.
Fľaša. Žltá farba, biela pena. Vôňa pšeničná, kvasnicová, chlebová. V chuti jemná sladkosť, trávnatá chuť, nie veľmi dobré.

Cloudy pale orange, with a large white head. The aroma is tame, with hefe yeast, some clove, some banana. The flavour is similar--it’s more subdued than many other, better hefeweizens. The palate is extremely lively.

Bottle 330ml. Hazy light golden-yellow with big slowly diminishing off-white head. Sweet aroma, fruity (banana, pear), wheat, yeasty, bready. Sweet flavor, fruity (banana, grapefruit), yeasty, moderate sourness, hay. Lively carbonation, light to medium-bodied.
bread, hay, cereal, pale, hazy, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter,

Not excellent but not terrible? Almost like a Belgian version of a shitty big beer Pale Lager. Looks okay but the head buggered off quickly, hazy straw coloured body. Piss, wheat, mild basement and cereal rule the scent, mostly the same for the taste. Drinkable but never a first choice....or second....or third. Good peppy mouthfeel, easy to drink. Meh.
hazy yellow. nice aroma, good mix of complexity...banana up front, lemon on the back. smooth with virtually no happiness. a pleasant drinking experience.

500ml bottle poured in a Weizen beer glass. 
A: Pours a pale yellow to orange cloudy color. Head is huge and fluffy. Good retention and many lacings left
S: A discreet smell to a German Weissbier. Strong on wheat and malt. Earthy yeasts. A bit of hops
T: Very Bready beer. Wheat, malts, bit sweet upfront. Very soft beer. Very mild bitterness. Earthy yeasts 
M: Medium creamy body. Smooth. Nice carbonation. 
D: Good drinkability. Easy drinking German beer, as expected. A popular Weissbier. Not that good as a Weinstephaner, a Schneider or even a Franciskaner but...
[ BA Review @ 2/19/2010 ]

0.5l bottle in tall Erdinger glass
A - golden with tall foamy creamy head
A - malt 
T - mild malty no bitterness
P - very smooth not full bodied on and off the palate quickly
O - enjoyable Weiss beer
Dourado palha com espuma branca duradoura. Boa acidez e carbonatação. Seca um pouco no final. Corpo leve. Leve aroma de banana.

Sehr flach im Geschmack, eher wässrig.
--------------------------------------.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Swedish SB. Pours hazy light gold with a large greamy head that settles fairly fast. Aroma is light with distinctive notes of banana and herbs. Taste is mild and refreshing thanks to a generous amount of CO2 that carries slight banana and grassy herb notes. Slight bitterness to finish it off. Very nice beer, but if anyting a little dull :-)

Wygląd: żółte/słomkowe, mętne, drobna piana biała, ale szybko opada do cienkiej warstwy.

Aromat: słodowy + rozpuszcalnik, troszkę banana ogólnie bardzo słaby.

Smak: lekkie słodowe ciało + rozpuszczalnik, goryczka niska ale lekko zalegająca. Piwo ogólnie słabe, wodniste, wadliwe, i mało wyraziste.
From a bottle. Pours cloudy golden colour with a thick white head, fruity aroma, smooth medium body, sharp up front with a mellow finish.

Średnio. Piwo w samo sobie przyjemne, ale... Słaby aromat i w smaku zbyt kwaskowate. Fajnie się za to prezentuje, a piana się utrzymuje cienka i lekko oblepia szkło. Jak na gatunek przystało - pijalne.
Bottle. Bih white head, hazy, pale orange/yellow color. Quite watery in taste, refreshing though.
Bottle. Watery, sweet and bland, balanced in part by a typical weizenesque tartness. Apples, pears and cinnamon bouquet. Forgettable and ultimately disappointing.
Poured from the tap. Cloudy orangey yellow with minimal white head. Very wheaty, mild citrus. Not much more. Fairly one note.
12 oz via bottle at Kinfolk Festival in Lyons. Wheat malts, Belgian yeast, herbs, light spice and light banana. Light to medium body, pretty easy to drink and somewhat refreshing.
En fût à L'Autre Œil. Blache paille/dorée. Céréale. Miel. Banane. Douce. Orange. Sucré. Levure. Pain frais. Simple mais bien.
"here’s a pretty nice banana and clove forward hefe. lacking a little compared to the best german examples (scneider, weihenstephaner) in flavor and body, but a pretty good, refreshing ale."

0,5l bottle. Refreshing but quite thin and watery taste. Average Weizen...............

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great german weiss. Good colour, taste, flavour, Munich standart hefeweizen. Good for hot days

Draft at Oktoberfest Zinzinnati.  Standard hefeweizen. I’ve had this before but guess I haven’t rated it, let’s see what Superspak has to say: " 500 ml bottle into signature weizen glass, best before 3/2013. Pours hazy golden amber color with a nice 2-3 finger fluffy white head with good retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Spotty foamy lacing clings to the glass. Aromas of orange zest, banana, pepper, clove, apricot, wheat, earth, and yeast spiciness. Nice and pleasant aromas with good balance. Taste of banana, pear, wheat, pepper, clove, earth, bread, and yeast spiciness. Lingering notes of wheat, pepper, pear, banana, clove, earth, and yeast spices on the finish for a short bit. Flavors are well balanced with decent complexity; a bit on the watery side, but good. High carbonation and light-medium body; with a lightly creamy and very crisp and prickly mouthfeel that is good. Alcohol is well hidden with zero warming noticed after the finish. Overall this is a good Hefeweizen. A bit watery, but the flavors are nicely balanced; and this is extremely easy and refreshing to drink. I did enjoy it."
A little bit of body but almost no taste. Spritzy carbonation and a light tartness in the finish. May be the most famous Hefeweizen on the market, but it is far from the best

Pours clear, turning hazy with the addition of yeast. Fluffy, white head. Aroma of banana, orange, clove, slighty yeasty. Round mouthfeel and low bitterness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Yeasty aroma. Quite bubbly. Very hazy and cloudy appearance. Looks like liquid honey. String and spicy on the throat 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Cloudy pale orange, with a large white head. The aroma is tame, with hefe yeast, some clove, some banana. The flavour is similar--it’s more subdued than many other, better hefeweizens. The palate is extremely lively. I like it, but it doesn’t come close to Schneider or Weihenstephan.

Botella 500ml. Bonito color Rubio nublado. Buena cerveza de trigo. Suave con sabor a clavo. Sedosa al paladar. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Large fluffy white head (3 fingers). Almost no bitter taste. Quite nice.

Pour hazy bright yellow, with a two fingered fluffy white head. 
Aroma has slightly banana, some faint citrus, some grass. 
Taste has faint sweetness up front, but is prominant bitter.
Watery body, with a somewhat flat carbonation. @rasmussott, kan du gætte af hvem jeg fik den?

Appearance: Pours a murky golden colour with two fingers of fluffy white head that gradually fades. 
Aromas: Yeast, wheat, grass.
Flavours: Wheat, cloves, biscuit, banana and hints of citrus.
Mouthfeel: Thin with lots of carbonation. 
Overall: An alright wheat beer but not one of my favourites.

Bottle from a local supermarket!


Surprisingly, I did not yet rate this famous german Hefeweizen. Pours beautiful orange-yellow with high, white head. Smell has sweet yeast, grains and some spices. Starts with lots of sweet yeast, some grains, spices and floral hops. Goes into a sweet and spicy yeasty finish with some grainy notes. Overall a solid german Hefeweizen!
500ml bottle from local supermarket. Cloudy golden colour, with a medium head. Aroma has spices wheat and citrus. Taste also has the spice, nutmeg, and wheat.
330 glass drank at XinTiandi Shanghai (china). Golden colour. White head. First impression : bubble, slightly watery. Slightly bitter.
Het kan bijlange de vergelijking met belgische bieren niet doorstaan, maar voor een buitenlands bier valt het mee.
It’s easy to see (although taste would be more appropriate) why this is the world’s largest wheat beer brewery. A complexly layered, cloudy hefe, which must be consumed from a glass to enjoy.

0,5L bottle, BB 05.2015. Pours slightly hazy golden with whiteish head. The small head stays for a moment. Aroma is sour, fruits, wheat. Flavor is sweet, wheat, grains, fruits, some citrus. Finish has some mild sweetness. Some alcohol is noticeable. Overall: not offending, but there are a lot better examples available.
Another great beer from Germany. I could drink this all day, everyday! Typical cloudy appearance with a satisfying taste!
Pours a cloudy gold with a great fluffy head. Aroma is a little underwhelming as well as the taste. But overall not a bad hefeweizen.
500ml bottle from The Only Cafe. Frothy creamy head with great lacing on a golden, orange-tinted body. Very sessionable with very slight bitterness and nice carbonation.
Bottle. Hazy golden colour with white frothy head. Very little aroma. Bready flavour, banana, malts. An old reliable.
A mild bitter weizener, with a full flavour taste and subtle aftertaste. A personal favourite and achieves full potential when drank from a big glass.
Bottle at a hotel bar in Rostock. Pours nicely, nice taste and colour. A very good weizen in my opinion.

500ml bottle from Tesco, Hermiston Gait. Pours cloudy yellow, thin short-lived white head. Aromas of light clove, bread, malt. Taste brings more peppery spice, and touch of banana. Bit sweet on the finish, but not bad.

From 12 oz bottle at the 2014 German Bierfest (ATL). 
Light body with medium high carbonation. 
Decent head. Crisp and dry finish. 
Low yeast and wheat flavor for style to extra refreshing. Clean finish.

Hazy, golden colour with a big creamy head. There is a slight aroma of lemon and soft malts. The taste is full, with hints of nutmeg and banana, and lower notes with hints of Armagnac. There is a refreshing bitterness to balance the sweeter caramel and bread flavours. Quite complex for such a popular beer, but not as rich as some of the weißbiers available from smaller breweries. Good value when bought in the bottle. An excellent choice for summer drinking.
33cl bottle, poured into a tulip glass. Cloudy golden colour, with a medium head. Average carbonation, a little watery. Slightly sweet, creamy, with a little sourness/tart in the aftertaste.

Nice, long lasting head, pleasant, but hardly noticeable aroma.
The taste is.. hmm, hard to say, not enough pronounced, a bit watery IHHO.
 Leaves rather strong alcohol trace on the tonge. Good for once.

Semi hasy light yellow color with lots of white head that stays a bit. Not much aroma with expectations of a light malt/wheat flavor. More tasty than the aroma had me expecting. Nice wheat taste with light citrus taste. Could be a little smoother in the palate with lots of carbonation.
Bom drinkability, media espuma, corpo medio tambem, media turbidez. Cerveja bem equilibrada, com sabor levemente citrico, malte, retrogosto doce.
Cloudy amber appearance, very persistent head. Aroma is somewhat sour, taste is a bit bland. Goes down ok, but not the best.
Bottle. Murky gold with a frothy head, aroma is clove, citrus and banana. Taste is banana, sweetness on a smooth malty body and a rounded finish. Nice
cereal, floral, golden, hazy appearance, frothy head.light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, lively. A very good Weizzen!

500ml bottle from Tallinn, hazy light yellow colour, enormous frothy white mostly lasting head, fair lacing. Moderately malty aroma of bread, caramel and hay with mild floral hops and moderate yeast with banana and fruity esters. Taste is initially moderately sweet and slightly acidic, turning into a mildly bittersweet finish with a hint of sourness. Medium to full body, oily texture, lively carbonation. One of the better large-company weizens I’ve tried in a while, no surprises though.

Golden colored beer with a big white head, lots of carbonation.
Taste is fruity, aftertaste is what sour.
Typical weiss beer, easy to drink.
Drink on a hot summer day.
Straw aroma, wheat. Bread, bitter grass, mild sour finish. Quite average, only has the merit of being served on ICE trains :)

Easily available, stereotypical Hefeweizen with very creamy, compact, snow white head and cloudy ochre blonde colour; aroma of faint sourish wheat, sweetish bready malt, apple and yeast, subtle hints of banana and cloves. Primarily malty taste with refreshing ’wheatiness’ but not really sour, subdued fruitiness, thirst-quenching but a bit restrained and ’clean’ for this style, I had many better Hefeweizens.
Light fruity aroma. Cloudy pale golden colour with good head. Light berry flavours with smooth malty finish. Light body with low to medium carbonation.
Buona weiss, specialmente nelle estati calde. Ottima con una buona pizza o a fine serata con un bretzel.
One of my favorite Weissbiers. A complete experience and perfect with shellfish. Top beer.
Very smooth and bready taste. Some woody notes. A very easy going one. Perfect with roasted peanuts (not salty) and smoked cheese.
Nice thick orange and gold color, with bit much head. Smells a bit like a wheat fields. The taste is quite soft, very nice and easy to drink. Specially good for a hot summer day like today!
@joes Clear golden color with a white head. Smells and tastes like a pilsner, a bit banana, malts, grain.

Bottiglia 50 cl in un bar a Rimini.
Chiara torbida senza schiuma.
Molto carbonata, crosta di pane, un po' di limone, pochi esteri classici da waizen.
Bevibile ma non il massimo.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhold

Pours a murky yellow with lots of carbonation. Faint banana and bread dough on the nose. Pleasant in the mouth but rather thin and metallic. Okay for a mass-produced factory weissbier but doesn’t hold a candle to the best exemplars.

Bière très agréable arômes citronnés...très agréable. .mais très courte avec une finition seche
.se boit très facilement
Blanche agréable, plutôt seiche, des arômes d’agrumes, une attaque assez franche qui redescend très rapidement mais laisse un une touche d’amertume en pointillés...
Pretty much a prototypical hefeweizen with banana, lemon, clove and yeast notes.

Bottle from Alko. A bit hazy yellow beer with a smallish white head for a hefeweizen. Mild aroma has sweet banana and some bubble gum. Flavour is quite sweet as well, not very yeasty. Banana and wheat for the most. Quite enjoyable sweet hefe.
Piękny, mętny wygląd. Smak nie powalający, całkowicie pozbawione gorzkiego smaku, musowanie- przeciętne.
Tap in Berlin. Has a delicate aroma of banana. Huge beautiful head. Color is dark golden, non-transparent. In taste there’s a lot of cloves, rather not much of banana. Overall it’s ok.

On tap at Arch Beer House, Athens Greece. Yellow color, hazy as hell, with a nice white head. Aromas of banana and yeast. Taste of banana, clove, some lemon, yeast. Sweet aftertaste, not so long. Medium body with medium to high carbonation.
citrus, banana and weiss aroma.golden color,clear to hazy, big head.light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, thin feel, lively. A pleasant industrial weissbier
White on tan with water body and clean finish. Lemon flavor with a little yeast aroma.
Tap, golden pour, hazy, white head, aroma of bananas, tasty is malty, a little grassy, okay.

Reviewed from notes.
This was poured into a weizen glass.
The appearance was a nice hazy/cloudy off white to a glossed over golden yellow color with a thick three finger white foamy head that dissipated within less than a minute. The lacing formed thick rings at first and eventually slid into the body.
The smell had a wonderful blend of clove and coriander over top of a nice bready/yeastiness with a nice under current of sweet banana esters.
The taste had a decent blend of sweet to spicy and yet had a nice sweet earthy banana aftertaste. The wheat seemed subdued but I didn’t mind so much.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a pretty good sessionable aspect to it. The carbonation was right on par for the style and for me as it left just enough out for it have a good refreshing quality.
Overall, this was a wonderful hefeweizen that should be a frontrunner for the style.
Grumligt ljusgul vätska med tjock och massivt skumlock. Doft av säd, jäst och lite kryddor. I smaken lite rå maltkropp. En ganska lätt beska och förvånande låg närvaro av kryddor.
Bottle. Golden colour with very good white head. In aroma a little bit of banana, with some metalic notes. In taste is quite watery and for that very drinkable.

Bière jaune orangée, bien voilée, extrêmement effervescente, et surmontée d’un large col blanc, très dense, mousseux, cotonneux même, et qui se réduit tout doucement en formant des cratères et une riche dentelle sur les parois du verre. Arômes étonnamment sucrés, surtout du miel, aussi un peu de sucre d’orge et de sirop de maïs. Effluves également de pain frais, blé, céréale… Belle intensité au nez, complexité faible cependant, mais surtout, on ne retrouve pas du tout cette levure fruitée et épicée typique d’une hefeweizen. En bouche, pétillement élevé sur la langue, onctuosité intéressante au palais, on retrouve ce velouté typique des bières de blé. Au goût, heureusement moins sucré qu’au nez, on retrouve tout de même une bonne dose de miel avec un peu de sucre d’orge. Aussi, pain frais et blé, avec, cette fois, un généreux fruité (orange, citron, banane et autres fruits tropicaux…) qui apporte une légère acidité fort agréable à la bière et qui vient, au moins en partie, contrebalancer le sucré. Certaines saveurs épicées sont perceptibles (clou de girofle, poivre…), on peut donc dire que l’on retrouve la levure à weizen en bouche, mais ça reste trop sucré pour le style. Amertume à peu près inexistante. Belle intensité, complexité moyenne en bouche, une bien bonne bière!
Hazy golden colour, creamy white head. Taste is a little fruity but not too sweet. Medium carbonation. Nice and refreshing hafeweizen.

Review according to BJCP2008 (style 15A). Bottle 50 cl - Batch L131303. AROMA: faint phenols (vanilla, banana) with some wheat in the background. no hop aromas. APPEARANCE: golden color and hazy. moussy white head with good retention. TASTE: watered down wheat flavour with some phenols (clove). no hop flavour. PALATE: medium-light body with low carbonation. OVERALL: a bulk weissbier a bit watered down.
500 mml bottle tasted on 11/07/2014. Hazy golden colour with a foamy white head. Aroma of cereals, banana and malts. Taste of banana, bread and cereals. Sweet aftertaste. Next one please!
500ml bottle. Almost clear yellow weizen, with a lot of CO2. Taste first is sweet malt and little hoppy at the end. You can feel ripe fruit beside these. Smooth, a little weak bodied for me.
Pours cloudy yellow. Aroma of banana. The beer is very carbonated. Very light beer....
Served in a lager glass. Hazy amber body with tall frothy head. Head and beer are sweet and beer is incredibly smooth. Yeast and bread aroma

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a big creamy head. Aroma is yeast with sweet ripe fruit, some spices, as well as cloves. Full creamy body with soft carbonation. Flavour is yeast and sweet ripe fruit, with a cloying fruity finish.

Pours a really hazy medium golden with a medium and creamy looking white head that leaves good lacing. Nose is of shy banana, wheat and that’s about it. Taste is fruity and not too sweet, features bananas again and now some cloves too. This is just less sweet and filling than most weissbiers out there but still nice. Body is light and carbonation really, really high. It gets a bit distracting but would make for a nice quenching drink. Overall an OK hefe, not the best for sure but not bad at all.
Refreshing citrusaroma, lime an lemons. Hazy straw white head. Wheaty doughy taste, some citrus good bitterness. Creamy foamy texture medium body. Nice hefeweissen, good summer beer
@ Nedre Mölla 4/7-14. Bottle from Systembolaget. Aroma: Some wheat yeasty and fruity notes. Taste: Wheat, sweetness, thin taste. Body is medium, finishes sweet with notes of wheat and low bitterness.
A little thin wheat beer. Lacks that little extra but on the whole pretty good.

Appearance: Hazy orange, good amount of off-white head.

Aroma: Wheat, citrus.

Taste: Some wheat, lemon. Slight banana. Pretty light and summer-y.

Bought: Drinks of the World (Basel), 500 ml can, CHF 3.60

Info: 28/6-2014, 52/300M, BB: 5/3-2015

Világos, enyhén átlátszó színe van, habja könnyed és viszonylag hamar összeesik. Telt aromájú, élesztős és kissé édeskés, akárcsak az íze, mely egyébként a búzasörök alapvető jellegzetességeit hordozza magában. Selymesen csúszik, rendkívül gyorsan itatja magát, ehhez hozzájárul nagyszerűen eltalált szénsavtartalma is egy könnyed, komlós végízzel kiegészülve.

Şişe @ istanbul. Bulanık sarı-portakal bir renk, hemen sönen beyaz bir köpük. Koku düz, samanımsı, hafif meyve kokuları var ama geride kalıyor. Tadım kokuya benzer şekilde vurucu değil. Düz samanımsı, damakta tat ve gazlılık düşük. Beklentilerin altında bir Alman buğday birası..

500 ml bottle @ Urban Element Ottawa. Pours a hazy golden yellow with a meringue-like white head. Aromas are faint citrus and maybe a little chalk. Tastes are faint citrus, light grain malts and little else. Thin and watery, moderate to heavy carbonation. Sessionable but uncomplicated and boring.
Pours orangy. Aroma not particularly strong, but includes banana and a bit of lemon. Tastes of the same with banana not as noticeable as in most hefe weissens. Slight taste of cloves.

Nice golden body, and a foamy white head. Clove and banana aromas are dominant on the nose and in the flavour. Great golden colour that is hazy and full of bubbles that play nicely in the mouth. The finish is subtle and pleasant. Great for the warm days of summer.
Heerlijk witbier met meer smaak dan de meeste witbieren. Fris en hoppig. Heel lekker bij warm weer.
Lekker luchtig witbier. Mooie troebele kleur met volle romige schuimkraag. Geuren van banaan, beetje honing. Smaken van tarwe, citrus. Lekker vol en romig met crispy bite.

500ml bottle from Morrisons. 
Small bubbly white head, a little lacing. Body is hazy pale golden. Nose is banana, cloves, orange, apple. Flavour is wheat, bread, citrus. Pretty big mouthfeel, medium carbonation and a fair bit of swell on the tongue. Crisp and refreshing.
Bu en bouteille de 50cl, couleur blanche blonde, petite effervescence, mousse juste intense mais aérienne, en bouche une petite attaque sur la banane et sur le malt, rien d’exceptionnelle.
Couleur jaune trouble, petite mousse blanche qui disparait. Nez leger de blé, un peu fruité. Gout levure et citron. Corps un peu acqueux.

Bottle from backlog notes 07/08. Pours a hazy orange golden color with a large off white head. The aroma and flavor have the standard hefe stuff going on; lemon citrus, banana, clove, wheat malt, light sweetness, and mild peppery spices, lighter bodied. Not exciting.
On tap at Elephant & Castle, Winnipeg. Cloudy yellow pour with a dense white head. Banana, orange and soft citrus aromas. Sweet wheat flavour, light citrus. Pretty simple but pretty nice hefe.

Aromas of banana ice cream and soft corn cereal. Cloudy muted orange with a mostly lasting pillowy white head. Nicely balanced, soft wheat malts first, followed by sharp yet subtle grassy hops. Light bodied, finishes very clean with a slight tart yeasty note. Very drinkable, very refreshing.

Bottle - Bottle fermented beer which is hard to find sometimes in the states. Pours an orange color, little cloudy as typical for a wheat beer. Typical wheat flavor byte, if anything kinda a milder Hefe-Weizen flavor. Slight hint of orange and lemon to it. Crisp, great on this hot summer afternoon.

After work pour at The Old Nick on the Danforth is tall & cool with a nice one finger cap. It’s a little crushed & sour on the nose. First few sips bring a refreshing brew. It’s not the most charismatic weissbrau nor does it have a lot of presence. It’s soft & subtle, with a watery finish.

Bardzo przyjemny, delikatny aromat banan, cytrusy, biszkopty. Barwa mlecznozłota, piana pokaźna, dość szybko opadająca.
piwo jest bardzo lekkie, dominuje lekka słodowość i pszeniczne posmaki, w tle lekkie cytrusy, finisz delikatnie biszkoptowy. Goryczki w zasadzie brak. Wysycenie dość niskie, co przekłada się na sporą pijalność. przyjemna pszenica.
16.9 ounce bottle pours hazy golden with the a white head. Aroma of bread, cloves and bananas. Taste is malts, spice and grass.

Bottle. Nice golden colour, solid head.
Some banana, citrus taste, nice refreshing finish.
Seems like a solid introduction to german Weissbier, but lacks character to be a real classic.
Refreshing Weissbier, at true temperatur of service is very good, beautiful cloudy golden color with big white head, equilibrate taste...
50 cl. flaske. 5,3 %. Weiss bier er ikke min kop the. Men en lille smule frisk er den da.
Good old Erdinger. Smokey and cloudy, lovely citrus, slight burn on the tongue, cloves and coriander, good bitter aftertaste. My favorite all rounder weissbier? Well, sure, this and Paulaner.

On tap @ L’Express de Lyon. Cloudy orange with a medium creamy off-white head and some lacing. Aroma is gentle with a touch of spices (coriander, cloves) with banana notes and hints of citrus. Taste is also slightly spiced with a touch of banana, yeast and light citrus. Light body. Medium carbonation. Almost creamy mouthfeel. Slightly dry, but short finish. Good balance. Quenching and drinkable. Well executed!

Draft at Derby Station - pours a hazy gold . Mild banana aroma . Lighter bodied . Not my favorite hefe but solid . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cloudy, white, golden-yellow, white head, mild lacing. Lite wheat aroma, citrus, and mild biscuit. Medium bodied, citrus, highly carbonated, tongue tingler, watery finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy orange with a frothy, lasting, white, lacy head. Smells of cloves, banana, yeast, bread and soft citrus. Light oily body with no carbonation. Tastes of yeast, citrus, wheat, and herbal spices. Super easy to drink but a bit simple.

fra dåse. duft: citrus. lime. hvede. frugt. dog ikke den store duft.
smag frugt. banan. lime. bær.
Bottle. Not as flavourful as most hefeweizen I have had. Very little spice, and citrus taste, but a good amount of wheat. Not a whole lot going on with this beer, but definitely refreshing.
0,3 on tap. Nice yellow hazy color with medium white head. Aroma is yeasty, wheaty, malty. Medium body. Nice one.
Pint into tumbler.. All I had glass wise. Yellow opague. White head. Banana flavor. Slight citrus. Nice aroma. Courtesy of TizzleJizzle.
Pint bottle. Poured a hazy golden color with a frothy white head. Taste of banana, clove, orange peel, small spice. High carbonation, thin body.

Golden color with a persistent white head. It has a slightly alcoholic flavor that highlights the wheat above all. In taste, shows a robust body and medium carbonation in which banana is also present at all times.

500 ml bottle. Pours a hazy golden colour with a big creamy white head. Aroma is yeast, ripe bananas and some citrus. Flavour is yeast, wheat and a mild citrus note. Not bad, but not one of the best either.

50cl shared bottle @ home from Mitra. Hazy yellow color, strong creamy white head. Aroma floral, apple, yeast in the nose, flavor is cereal, more yeast, hint of candy sweets, moderated good balance. Taste medium sweetness, hint of bitterness. Light body, creamy texture, average carbonation, fine moderated sweetish finish. Fine refreshing dessert beer. Just too soft for me, and not my style.

2/V/14 - 50cl bottle @ Schweine Janes (Düsseldorf) - BB: n/a (2014-461) 


Little cloudy beige to pale yellow beer, creamy off-white head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: bit dirty, earthy, some green banana, grains. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: bit metallic, sourish notes, citrus, bit grassy, banana, soft bitterness. Aftertaste: sourish, more banana, spicy, little sweet, soft bitterness.

Beautiful yellow copper hazy pour with medium sized bubbly white head. Mild aroma of wheat and yeast. Way hidden in the back some spices. Wheat and yeast for taste also and quite bitter aftertaste. Sparkly carbo with thin to medium body. Refreshing but also a bit blant, somewhat boring.
As far as white beer goes, this is tough to beat. I place it ahead of Paulaner and just slightly better than Hacker...

Refreshing taste which seems to effervesce like champagne on the tongue. Lovely as an aperitif.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
500ml bottle. Cloudy golden body, big white head, good retention. Aroma of wheat, banana, coriander, a touch of lemon sourness. Taste of wheat, coriander, herbs, a touch of banana. Good.
If they say it’s a weissbier I guess it is, but a very dry one in case. Not much fruitiness at all. It’s ok, but I have tasted better.
Bottle. Cloudy yellow pour with a white head. Big grain notes. Smooth with wheat and biscuit highlights. Good body and mouthfeel.
Rated from notes taken 12 Jun 2011 -- Whenever you need a good hefe, this beer can/will do the trick.

On tap at the Kyoto mini-Oktoberfest in Shinpuhkan. 800 yen, a treat from a friend. A slightly cloudy beer with a filmy foamy head that clings to the glass. The aroma is quite yeasty, with some light cloves & banana. Very yeasty, light cardboard, cloves & some fruitiness. Mediocre weizen.
Halv liters flaske. Flot gylden hvede øl, med tykt hvidt skum. Ikke meget kulsyre, men ellers en god fyldig øl, går Udemærket til en steak.
12oz bottle, typical German Hefe...excellent brew!! Pours hazy golden with a big white head. Typical yeasty aroma, definite some banana flavoring.

Bottle. Pours cloudy straw colour with a large froth, slightly off white head. Excellent retention and good lacing. Aroma is yeasty, bread and hay. Taste is lightly banana, bubblegum, firewood, caramel, spicy, medium to strong sweetness. Thick, dry body and light carbonation.

This was my first wheat beer. Bit of a disappointment really. The head was adequate but nothing exceptional and I just about got a hint of bannana but nothing leapt out at me. The mouth feel was slightly thin and, although not chilled my thoughts were wandering towards a lager type mouthfeel. I will explore more wheat but will hope for better.
Blond and hazy, initial head is generous but at end only remains half cm. Aroma is fruity, citric and banana. Body is medium, average carbonation the finish is sweet.

Bottle 50cl. Hazy yellow blond color, good frothy white head, good retention, some lacing; shy aroma, yeast, wheat, bread, citrus; medium bitter, slightly sweet taste; light to medium bodied; oily texture, bit thin mouthfeel; medium sweetbitter finish with fruity notes. Rerated 140616 0.2 lower.
Bootle and draft in Belgrade.Pour it yellow weizen colour with big white head.Aroma of citrus, banana, yeast.

Dåse 0,5 liter i glas, flot gul støvet farve med hvidt skum, dufter blandt andet af citron og selvfølgelig hvede, smager godt afdæmpet behagelig, i nogens øjne måske lidt kedelig, men jeg syntes at den ihvertfald er over middel, den er nem at drikke og et sikkert valg til forskellige lejligheder, den er en lille smule spids i eftersmag.

Pours Opaque yellow straw with a generous pillowy white head, streamers of bubbles surrounding the glass. Smells of slight banana and clove with a hint of yeast. A good amount of carbonation and light citrus malt on the palate. This is a great refreshing summer patio beer.

Bottle from Brugsen, CPH - fuzzy yellow pour with a medium white head. Aroma and taste is wheaty and citrus lemon notes, medium sweet yeasty, straw, grassy, very light banana nuance in the finish. Pretty refreshing and easy drinking on a warm spring day.

Pours foggy yellow with high white head
Aromas of caramel, bananas, wheat, bready malt
Taste is quite fresh with notes of citrus, bananas, bread
cloudy golden color with tall white head, subtle aromas of citrus, honey and spices, light sweetness with light bitter finish, light body, oily feel, refreshing but lacks flavor

Pours cloudy yellow with tall white head. Aroma of wheat, honey, light citrus. Taste is balanced sweet with light bitter finish. Light, smooth body with soft carbonation.

Overall, not bad. Pours hazy yellow/gold. On the nose there is banana, clove, and yeast. Banana bread like on the palate, with a little yeast note.

Vol in in mond, fris en fruitig, goed gekoeld in de zomer is er niets beters.
Gemakkelijk drinkbaar.
Hazy and yellow. High carbo. Aromas of yeast, grass and some banana. Refreshing. Overall: 11/20.
Een Weizen met erg weinig smaak. Bier ziet er in het glas perfect uit maar mist iets : smaak.
Nice and light brew with lots of head. Very bubbly and perfect on a hot day.
@ Röhällavägen. Flaska från Systembolaget (23:-). Brödig och något fruktig, vete, en del kryddighet, jästtoner, liten beska, något tunn i smaken.

Tap at hole in wall, Waterloo. Pours a hazy straw. Light lemon wheat aroma. Light body, full carbonation. Some yeastiness, lemon, bready. Inoffensive. Fine.

Will always have amazing memories of this beer from my tour of the brewery (complete with full Bavarian breakfast) in 2010. Still the best brewery tour I’ve ever done. Anyway, this is a classic I’ve had many times. Pours pretty yellow with a huge weizen head going over the top of the glass. Aroma a bit weaker than the other greats, and the palate is maybe thinner / not as chewy, but this is still an excellent beer.
Heerlijk troebel weizenbier. Licht romig en lekker zoetig. Heerlijk ijskoud om van te genieten. Met een zacht aroma.
Butelka. Kolor cytrynowy, mętny. Piana jak na pszenicę przystało. W aromacie banany i cytrusy Smak jest rześki, kwaskowy.
Misty orange with a thick white head. Sweet aroma of wheat with some citrus. Medium to thin body, no carbonation, oily texture. Tastes of wheat and a little milky.
Bue à la pression. A vrai dire, ça ressemble beaucoup à de l’eau légèrement aromatisée... Très peu d’intérêt.
On tap. Aroma of heavy banana with slight spiciness. Slight tart wheat. Pours a hazy gold with full, billowy white head. Flavor centers on yeast and a cracker malt. Moderate low spiciness.

500ml bottle, found at the bottom of a box from when I moved house. 3 months out of date but still tastes fine. Very light body with a pale weak taste and a thin yeasty quality. It’s perfectly drinkable but just remembered there being a bit more to this.

BOTTLE 50CL.

Look: cloudy orange body with a frothy white head, surprisingly humble for a wheat beer.
Aroma: oxidized fruit, somewhat acetic even, very light pear. not much esters or phenols.
Taste: quite lively on the palate with distinctive acidic/acetic bite, light grain, yeast, light fruit and malt sweetness. Somewhat thin body.
hay, grass, citrus, dough, floral, golden, pale, clear, hazy, frothy, white foam, rocky head, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, lively, fizzy, light and good,,,,
Botella de 50 cl, adquirida en El Corte Ingles. Color dorado. Sabor a trigo, cereales, suave.

Misty straw color with lasting white head. Aroma is very subdued with hint of yeast, and some pilsner-malt embers. Orange peel is submerged. Despite ample carbonation the beer feels a little flimsy. Very light body for traditional hefe. Dare I say it - almost watery. Hint of orange, wheat again in flavor. Crisp and hint of bitterness in tail. Pales in comparison to some of the eminent hefes - weihenstephan, andescher, franziskaner and Schneider’s tap x hefes.

Cerveja se trigo alemã mais vendida no mundo...
Serve de referência para todos as outras
Perfeita
bottle. Golden with one finger head. Light bodied hefeweizen with banana and clove. Good, but there are better German varieties.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes goldenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, fruchtig, bananig. Geschmack hefig, bananig fruchtig, minimal würzig.

500 ml can. Cloudy, yellowish color, long-life medium sized off-white porous head, slight clovy aroma, from light to medium body, decent fizziness, sweet toffee and malty taste, wheaty sour palate with light hoppy notes Easy-drinkable and well-balanced.

Fles gedeeld met peltmeister. Goudgeel helder pilsner weinig schuim. Aroma haal ik niks uit. Smaak is zoet, waterig weinig body.

Old rating rerated 21.03.2014, 0,5l bottle @ home:

Nice creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly sour-ish, yeast, citrus, wheat, hay, cereal, dough, flowers. Taste is slightly sweet, wheat, dough, hay, yeast, cereal, hints of almond essence. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Easy drinking, that’s all.
Tap på Bishop Arms Örebro. Ljus lite grumlig färg. Doftar lite vete. Smakar först typiskt veteöl men smaken försvinner ganska snabbt. Funkar kanske en varm sommardag men som pratöl nej.
On draft. Dark orange color and cloudy. Banana aroma. Sweet taste with slight carbonation. Decent hefeweizen.
Nice beer. I’m not all that familiar with the style, but it drinks like a pale/premium lager. Eminently drinkable.
Nice yellow hazy color with stable white foam. In aroma some yeast tones. In taste some maltyness with right on spot acidity. Medium bodied. In my opinion this one is underrated here.
this was a quite good beer really smoth tasting not a beer i would normaly go for but i enjoyed it and with a sale on at sainsburys it was worth it
0.5L bottle at home, hazy yellow beer with a medium head, aroma is yeasty, fruits, taste is bit bitter. Decent.

This is my new favorite beer. I really can appreciate the smoothness of this and how it actually quenches thirst with no aftertaste! Perfectly carbonated with the usual weiss flavors of citrus with some grassy notes. It is truly a great beer. I love weiss beers and Erdinger is the my new favorite. I feel that this is truly under rated. Can’t get enough of this beer.
No strong flavour or aroma. Mildly unclear. This beer is easy to drink and well balanced.
Not strongly flavored, but drinkable and with no off notes. All the things that make heffs good are absent from this beer.

Standard weissbier, mycket trevlig. Svag beska som balanserar upp sötman från malten.

Aromas de fermento, pão e especiarias. Sabores de cravo e banana. Coloração amarelo turvo, com boa formação de espuma.

The beer starts mild, slightly yeasty and even a bit bitter. The mainpart is a bit flat - the typical Weizen-aroma remains a bit in the background, no real clove or banana there. The aftertaste is slightly bitter, smooth-yeasty with a slightly sweet and only very slightly banana-clove hints. 
 Not a very good Weizen-example. Easy to drink, but not very deep in aroma. --> 10/12/10/10
500ml bottle from Tesco in Windsor. Hazy golden beer. Lasting foamy head. Banana and pepper. Abv balanced well.
500 ml bottle. Nice yellow color with a quickly disapearing white head. Light aroma, fizzy a bit sweet taste. Nothing extra...

OLD NOTES AUG 22, 2004
Slight wheat aroma, not all much to it actually. Pours hazy pale yellow with a fluffy head. The flavour is very subdued compared to many other examples of the style. Slight citrus fruitiness and a slight malted wheat body. Smooth and refreshing, but not as good as other hefeweizens i’ve tried.

Hazy yellow color, big white head with good retention and lots of lacing. Medium body, lively carbonation. Aroma of wheat, yeast, banana, grain, some strange citrusy fruitiness. Weird hoppiness in taste, almost like tangerine or something. Weird but not unpleasant.

Moje pierwsze piwo, które kupiłem wraz ze szkłem doczekało się powtórki (szkło do weizena solidne - służy ponad 4 lata). Barwa złota, piana obfita, biała. Ładnie się prezentuje. W aromacie nie dzieje się zbyt wiele - trochę banana, muśnięcie przypraw. W smaku również nieco płaskie, mało wyraziste. Czuć, że to pszenica, ale raczej nie postawiłbym jej jako wyznacznik stylu. Taki weizen dla początkujących ;) Lekkie, niezobowiązujące.

DAA; Pours hazy golden with a frothy, lasting, lacing off-white to white head. Aroma is wheaty, banana, yeasty and citrus. Taste is medium sweet and light spicy. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is avarage.
This is an ok brew but honestly a weak weizen. Pour is a beautiful yellow with a nice thick white head but disappears quickly.
Belle couleur typique pour une blanche; arômes et goût fruités et légers (trop); une bière pour la soif

Bottle at home. Pours really clear. Foamy head. Yeast, apple, and spice on the nose. Great creamy mouthfeel. Mild flavor, a bit of fruit and coriander. Crisp, clean, smooth finish. Easy drinking but very tame.
Shared 50 cl can. Pours the golden hazy with a fairly large white head. Yeast, cloves and banana in the nose. Taste follows the nose with some hints of citrus.
Not mutch smell to it, standar appearance. but the taste was very good and easy to drinking.Good beer
Pours a pale straw yellow. Smells of grainy malts and hints of fruit. Tastes of wheat and hints of bananas.

Botella de 500ml. Vaso Weizen. Color amarillo limón pálido con apariencia turbia. Espuma blanca y cremosa que crea una tupida y persistente corona. En nariz, notas herbáceas y florales, trazos de pan y galleta con intensos aromas de plátano. Entrada chispeante con agudo amargor. Cuerpo medio/pleno y carbonatación moderada/alta. Textura densa y cremosa. Sabores de plátano, esteres y leve fenol tocados por amargor cítrico concluyen en un prolongado final amargo y afrutado. Refrescante y de trago fácil. 
500ml bottle. Weizen glass. Pale lemon yellow color. Foggy appearance. White & creamy foam creates a close a lasting crown. Herbal & floral notes, bread & biscuit hues to the nose as well as intense banana aroma to the nose. Sharp bitter & crispy upfront. Medium to full body. Moderate to high carbonation. Creamy texture. Banana, estery & slight phenolic flavors touched by citric bitterness resolves in a long bitter/fruity finish. Refreshing & easy drinkability.

Very light taste. Easy drinking. Big head, super foamy. Great with lemon. Pours cloudy straw.

I had this on draft, and it tasted like a domestic. It wasn’t bad, but it wasn’t good either. Rather boring for a hefeweizen.
Bottle 500 ml in Zagreb. Pours hazy yellow, wheat and citrus aroma. Banana and wheat in flavor, but it could be more intensive. Ok.
50 cl bottle. Pours hazy golden with a big white head. Typical yeasty aroma - and yes - some banana. Sweet taste. I really like this beer.

Big re-rate, last time I had it, it was bottle million years ago. Now tap at Bierkeller, Manchester. Cloves and banana aroma, sweet, bit spicy and fruity. Hazy to cloudy golden color with medium sized white head. Sweet cloying taste, banana, some bubblegum, yeasty. Medium body, soft to average carbonation.
Golden with big white head. Aroma has a lots of sweet grains and citrus. Taste has some citrus and a little bit banana
Gedronken bij Charlie's in Berkel. Prima bier. Smaak is precies wat je verwacht: prima, maar dus ook geen verrassingen.
Not the best looking bear, you can’t see through it. Standard and semi-mild taste. A stable and solid beer, too expensive in South Africa to justify it.
One of my firm favourites served in a tall glass and cold. Love the aroma and taste.
Fruchtig-bananiges Hefe-Aroma, typisch für ein Weißbier, wenig Nelke. Kräftiger Schaum, leicht schleimiges Mundgefühl. Insgesamt sehr süffiges Industriezweigen, bodenständig, aber nichts besonderes.

~grassy sulfury aroma, slight metallic, wheaty.
~Pours a cloudy golden color with lasting creamy white head.
~Wheaty sweet flavor with sulfury notes. Slight banana and vanilla
~Medium bodied, slightly creamy, high CO2, sweet wheaty finish.
~Drinkable, but not too exciting. Pretty lame attempt at a Hefeweizen. I miss the yeasty banana clove flavors.

Bottle Cape Town. Pours cloudy yellow orange with medium head that fades quick and medium light carbonation. Aroma some yeast and slight citrus fruit and some tropical. Did not pick up the typical banana of the style. Taste slight sweet and mellow bitter. Overall enjoyable.

I’ve always really liked this beer, but I’ll admit, it never comes across as a traditional wheat beer. It’s spicy, but lacks the banana flavors and chewy mouthfeel that’s typical of the style (which is probably why I enjoy it! As I’m not a true wheat beer lover). Hard to explain my love for this one, as it has, to me, such a unique flavor.
Not as weiss as some others. Cloudy yellow with quickly disappearing top. Yeasty taste, a bit if citrus, but nothing very dramatic. Refreshing

Big white head, hazy light honey color. It lacks classic weissbier aroma of clove and banana. More like a pale lager aroma. Taste is faint yeast, sweetish and pretty full. A little of banana maybe. Disappointing.

Hazy golden with big fluffy head. Lots of sweet grains, some bitter yeast, some slight funk and a touch of citrus. Something metallic/medicinal too in the aftertaste. Great, slightly creamy mouthfeel. Some metallic notes that I don’t like, otherwise a slightly boring weiss.

Pours a slightly cloudy yellow with a thin white head. Nose is lightly spiced and musty. Taste is sweet. Thin body. Not much carbonation. Not bad, but nothing worth writing about.

Bottle poured into a pint glass. Hazy yellow orange, huge white head. Quite a mute aroma, weizen type banana, citrusy, etc. Taste is quite sweet, faintly yeasty. Nice, easy to drink, but not memorable at all.

Bought a bottle at the supermarket. The beer has a hazy golden color and a large white head, CO2 level is perfect. In the aroma tones of bananas and citrus but it’s not very strong. 50cl bottle at home. Hazy yellow with a full white head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Sweet with some bitter notes. Banana, citrus and wheat. An ok hefeweizen.

Nice but unimpressive. It is a refreshing beer but lacks in flavor. I miss the bready wheat and yeast flavor I like in the style. On the up-side it does not have a funky flavor and sweetness you get in low quality weissens.
Cloudy, pale yellow color. Highly carbonated. Nice white head. Aroma of wheat and yeast. A little sweet. Medium, smooth body. Taste of wheat and yeast. Short but nice finish.
500 mil bottle nice wheezy aroma with some banana pours hazy golden taste is very nice very good beer

el aroma tiene un toque a lúpulo que se caracteriza frente a otros olores como la miel y el trigo, su color es un dorado espeso junto a una espuma blanca que no se mantiene, es muy carbonatada y con poco cuerpo, tiene una suavidad caracterizada por un sabor un poco amargo que al final se debilita y le da protagonismo a un toque de trigo.

Poured from bottle. Aroma of white bread and citrus. Cloudy brownish gold with big head which fades fast. I taste wheat, vanilla, cream, orange, trace of hops. Feel is a bit watery, but nice drinkability. Pretty good stuff.
Pretty decent. Not too many esters, however that would be truthful to the style.
Bottle @ home. Hard to find banana aroma, which is standart for weizen. Some fruit/citrus notes. Hops are missing. Not the best example of weissbier. Won't buy again.

500ml bottle. Pours hazy amber with large light brown head that lasts for a couple of minutes with good lacing on the glass. Aroma is of yeast, clove, and alcohol with the slightest hint of banana. Taste is clove with hints of hop bittering and finishing sour. Average carbonation. Overall, a nice but not exceptional weissbier.

Bottle @ home. Pours haxy golden with a white head that disappears quite quickly. Hay, banana, white bread, some clove and green apples and cardboard on the nose. Taste has some creamy sweetness with dried bananas, wheat, dried apples, some cardboard that doesn’t mix well with the nice sticky carbonation. And a really dry aftertaste of even more cardboard.

Aroma: carbonated smell, typical wheat aroma

Taste: smooth sweet taste with dry floral finish

Appearance: cloudy gold body with bubbly white head

 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I like the slight wheat sweetness of this beer. Liquid is golden and head is full. Hops a bit floral and texture a bit creamy. A very nice wheat beer indeed.

Aroma: Fruity
Appearance: Cloudy dark yellow body, 1 finger of white head which dissipates quickly.
Taste: Well balanced taste. Banana is the most pronounced flavor. Medium carbonation.
Very poor taste for weissbier, dissapointed me. But many woman like this beer for light taste, i prefer more complex wiessbier like legendary Weihenstephaner or Andechs. Don’t want to buy it again!
Pours hazy straw, with a large white head. Not much on the nose (very large head), some malts. Hints of malts on the aroma, some fruitiness. Not that bad, but bad for being a weiss.

Can, 50cl. Pours hazy golden color with big, creamy white-off head. Lovely. Aroma is yeast, wheat, bananas, bread, malty sweetness combined with citrus notes. Flavor follows the nose, sweet and fruity, balanced with clear wheat and yeast. Weak hobs. Average carbonation. Medium body. Pretty standard mass produced hefe-weizen, nothing special, still pretty good though.

Une de mes HefeWeize préféré...
Du meme accabit que la Franziskaner ou la Paulaner...

I had this at Global Brew. Pours a cloudy gold with a white head. Taste sweet, fruity. I thought this was pretty good. I would definitely drink this again.

Just good weisbier, nothing special at all. Bread, citrus aroma, sweetness flavour is annoying.
Coloração âmbar e levemente turva, excelente formação de espuma. Aroma de banana e cravo, típico. Sabor acompanha o aroma. Paladar leve com um médio/baixo amargor.
A bottle 5,3%, golden color, hazy, white foam, medium sweetness with some citrus taste,lively carbonation, A good weisbeer. Good to enjoy with different kind of food.

On tap & bottled, many occasions over the years. A nice example of german weissbier. Fruity, clove, banana aromas. Pours cloudy golden, with frithy white head. Maybe a bit too carbonated. Really enjoyable for wheat lovers.

50 cl bottle, from Vinmonopolet Tromsø.
Scents of apples, lots of citrus notes, yeast, wheat malts.
Tall deutschhhh white foam. Hazy pale body.
Smooth taste with lots of wheat malts, a little mealy feel, some grains. 
Dry ending with dough, apple, cheese, notes of lemon.
Overall this feels as a quality beer.

Bottle. Straw colored w thick white head. Yeasty aroma. Some malt taste. Not much going on though. OK for a wheat but I expect more from German wheat beers so a bit disappointing overall.

Aroma quase imperceptível, saborosa e drinkability alto. Boa para se beber em dias quentes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

How: Draught.

Where: The Bishops Arms Gamla Stan, Stockholm.

Appearance: Golden colour with a large white head.

Aroma: Citrus, fruit.

Body: Medium body, heavy carbonation.

Flavour: Sweet, fruit, some citrus.

Comment: A bit too weak flavourwise. Mild and easy to drink, but lacks some depth and the flavours just becomes too bland.

Pour out of bottle, slight hazy golden pour with white head, aroma brought notes of white fruit, grass, vanilla, hints of grain, touch of banana, clove in there, slight biscuit and bready malts in there, touch of yeast. Taste is a mix of yeast, grass, slight grain into clove, banana, slight earthy tones with some white fruit, finishing fairly sweet, slightly dry.

A: Mildly Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Most Light, Thin White head Ring, No Lacing

S: Wheat, Mild Banana, Mild Corn

T: Wheat

M: Poor Carbonation, Light Bodied, Mildly Watery

Overall, a pretty mediocre hefeweizen with poor carbonation and little to no qualities of a normal hefeweizen. Worse that it s a german one too.

Bottle 500ml. Golden color, hazy, lovely frothy head. Yeasty aroma of cheese, orange, banana. Light bitter taste of wheat. Creamy texture, light bitter finish. It looks nice, smells even better, but when I drink it I feel a little disappointed.
Bottle->taster at BBB Fest in Nashville. Absolutely unremarkable weizen, save for the pleasant fact that it lacked the customary strong banana and cloves in the style.
Pours caramel with 2 finger white head. Smells yeasty and sweet. Taste lovely. Nice and lightly malted, very drinkable. Refreshing and full bodied. Recommended.

Pours cloudy orange. Smells of yeasty cheese, with light aroma of banana, orange and bubble gum. Tastes of orange, with bitter yeasty taste. Low hop, Low+ Malt, Light body, with smooth texture, noticeable carbonation and medium finish. Flavour of bubble gum and banana on the finish.
Pours a light orange with white head. Has a wheat and orange aroma. Flavor is wheaty with some orange and banana. A faint bitter aftertaste.
Had a pint on tap at World of Beer Columbus. Sold, but unremarkable. On the crisp side, but lacking the banana/clove goodness I look for.
gyllen brun farge. Noe uklar med hvitt skum. lukter hvete og noe sitrus. Drikker denne til lyst kjøtt og passer fint til det.
Lys brun med hvitt skum. Hvete litt bananlukt. Medium kullsyre, lite bitter.

The best kind of rate, a 12oz bottle someone left in my fridge. Pours a hazy, dark gold with some very frothy, white head. Nose has orange, coriander, grass, wheat, yeast, white pepper, a little metal, some sweetness. Flavor is exactly what you’d expect, lightly sweet, lightly malty, wheat malt, grass, hay, coriander, some dried lemon peel, white pepper. None of those intense phenols that imitators have. Crisp, dry finish. It’s the gold standard.

500ml bottle. pours a very cloudy yellow with white head that lasts. aroma of wheat, hops and some alcohol. taste is nice. full mouth feel and lots of wheat, citrus fruit and is slightly bitter at the end.
Had on tap at a local restaurant. White foamy head that soon disappears. Goes down really well and doesn’t have a skunky taste or smell to it. Recommended
Golden white in color. Very refreshing, easy drinking beer. Very distinct foamy head, makes a beautiful pour. One of my favorites for sure.

Pours hazy gold/white. Huge white foam head, good retention.
Sulfures, raw wheat flavours. Green pear and cloves hint but no banana.
Palate is fizzy, artificial and short. Short finish.

Bottle 0,50cl. Murky, yellow-orange colour with large, creamy, white head. Light aroma of wheat, banana and spices. Taste is crispy, light acidic at the start, there’s some light bitterness at the aftertaste with strong carbonation.

Pours properly, a big foamy hazy mess on the orange side of yellow. The smell is a little surprising, aromas of stale cheap beer dominate over a tiny bit of banana ester. Sweet with some wheat tang and a bit of banana in the flavor, but nothing inspiring. Solid mouthfeel, thick but foamy. 500ml can poured into a glass. Overall refreshing per the style, but consider as a weizen of last resort.

Bottled bought at Billa in Bratislava/Slovakia today. I have known this beer for many many years. It used to be my favorite locally available. Somehow it has become less tasty then it used to be. I bought the bottle today to confirm my suspision. Recently I drank a Tucher, Krombacher and Schöfferhofer weißbiers and I have to say they tasted far better. 
The Edringer tastes somehow tasteless regarding the hefe weizen characteristics of a weißbier. The Erdinger is somehow watery, light and kind of a bit sour in the finish.
It is drinkable but not so much enjoyable. Too bad.
Une belle couleurs dorée avec une carbonatation fine. Une mousse qui s’estompe rapidement. Au nez une légère touche de banane.

Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow-gold, big white head with very nice retention. Nose is rather uninspired, mostly noble hops (none of the characteristic banana/clovey notes you’d expect in a hefeweizen), hint of lemon. Mouth is medium bodied, fluffy sparkiling wheatness in mouth feel, very dry with some lemon zest and a hint of cider (WTF?), then some grainy cereal towards the back-end. Ich bin diesmal nicht gefällt.
Cloudy lemon colour with a big foamy white head. Lemony fresh with a good refreshing zing. A touch of washing up liquid.

Poured two fingers of foamy head on a hazy, medium straw colored body.
The aroma is dry grain and light banana. Nice and pleasant.
The taste is wonderfully wheat, a mild bitter for balance. 
The texture has a little fizz, fairly soft though.
Quite enjoyable.

Pours hazy golden with small carbonating head. aroma is banana, unhappy yeast and some citrus. stingy carbonation in mouth. Full, round aftertaste with alcohol and yeast. Overall: Enjoyable and easy to drink.

Slightly hazy dark yellow with a fizzy loud head. Soapy then dissipates. Aroma is of banana and a hint of bread. There is slightly more flavor than the Kristallweizen, but not much more. A bit of tang and spice and more banana. Didn’t love it. Didn’t hate it
Bottle. Dark yellow color with little haziness, small white foamy head, hint of citrus in its aroma, fizzy, slightly sour, longish finish. A pretty standard hefeweizen,
Bottle 50cl. Large noisy white head. Fizzy. Hazy yellow green orange color. Aroma is yeast and apple yard late autumn with a citric hint. Aroma is surprisingely sweet of wheat and potato.

Bottle: Golden and cloudy. Pours with frothy white head that dissipates quickly. Very aromatic. Fruit, stone fruit dominates. Honey malt. Clean and bright. Medium dry. Just a hint of bitterness. Not sour. Todd depth and length. Moderate carbonation. Mandarin flavours. Very good refreshing beer.
Cloudy hazy pale gold with a fluffy white head. Aroma of banana, cloves, a little funky yeast. Taste is spicy, slightly sour, slightly sweet.

My husband liked it more than I did, but as fas as hefe weizen this is top notch. The dark is much better than the light and has no bitterness. Smooth finish and great taste. Husband is looking forward to trying the Dunkel.

Bottle. Restrained nose of banana, clove and spice. Cloudy orange body with tall head. Really liked the flavours of this- not overly fruity or sweet, just a solid wheat backbone with a perfect creamy texture. Classy.

Serving type: bottle

Appearance- Pours a cloudy orange yellow with minimal lacing and a quickly disappearing white head

Aroma- Citrus and wheat with banana and clove although very subtle

T/P- Taste is of wheat citrus with a slight banana and clove, everything a good Hefe should be.

Overall- This is very drinkable Wheat, one of the better one out of the brewery. I could easily enjoy this one over and over again.

Appearance - golden color, cloudy liquid and high/medium dense head.
Aroma of clove and banana.
On the palate it is refreshing and light sour.
Taste - fruity and bread.
This is the Weissbier most sold in the world .

Draught, Hotel Erdinger, Erding, Germany. Hazy yellow looks with a plump white head. Muted nose of banana, yeast and wheat. Similar flavour with a touch of spice. Clean and fresh. Its a decent enough thirst slaker after a long day on the road, but nothing to get too worked up about.
Получил в подарок пак из пяти бутылок и бокала этой фирмы. Годный вайцен, но явно не лучший.

33 cl. Pours a hazy golden with a lasting disc of creamy bubbles. Mild aroma of caramel with a hint of soured pear. Taste is the same, but a bit bolder with some additions of wheat and mild notes of oxidized apple and clove. Light body is balanced and has high carbonation.

Bottle 0,50L. Murky, yellow-orange colour with large, creamy, white head. Light aroma of wheat, banana and spices. Taste is crispy, light acidic at the start, there’s some light bitterness at the aftertaste with strong carbonation.

Had this the first time from their 0,5L bottle this weekend. Purely the finest palate I have experienced in a hefe-weizen naturtrub. Every quality down the list that I expect from a fine weissbier. Poured into an appropriate weissbier glass. Three finger head. Cloudy golden orange color, wonderful signature notes and finish. Superb! 

After many years of living in Germany (twice) I can’t believe I am only just now tasting this one. Please give it a try!
Poured hazy golden with a huge white head. Aroma of spiced banana. Medium body, flavour as the aroma with a dry, lingering fruity finish.
500 ml. bottle. Pours a cloudy golden orange with a large white head. Aroma of grain, fruit, malt, and spice. Taste is banana, wheat, cloves, and malt. Excellent Hefeweizen.

Aroma of wheats and light fruits like banana, but not very prominent. The aroma is actually a bit disappointing, it’s promises a lot but it has no finish. This not a bad Weissbier per se, but I’ve tasted better.
For my taste, this is the perfect beer. Compared to most American wheat beers, this one is way above average.
OK weisse bit thin and quite sour. Misses bitterness. Malty aroma, fresh, citrus, pear.
Nice enough. Would get again. Not full on flavour by any means but gluggable. Nowhere near scheiderweiss standard. Thinner but likeable.

Tap @ Bavarian Bier Cafe. Cloudy gold with white frothy head. The nose lets it down with barely discernible aromas of banana and wheat. The flavour makes up for the lack of aroma however, with big banana, bubblegum and grass. Great with a pork knuckle and sauerkraut.

Golden color with stable white head. Strong yeast aroma with light fruits. Well carbonated. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep amber cloudy colour with a thick creamy head. Delicious thick bready sweet banana taste with a sharp zestiness too, making it beautifully balanced, certainly compared to some other wheat beers. Sweet but not too sweet!
Draught. Creamy yellow colour with a large firm head. Aroma is dominated by banana. Flavour is wheat, banana, sweet with some fizzy candy.

Pours a large frothy white head, body is a cloudy amber with medium carbonation. Wheat aroma with a hint of banana and honey. Quite thick, more flat than I was expecting. No intense flavours, but fairly pleasant and tangy, no real after taste either. A fairly nice beer that goes down well, but lacking a bit in excitement.

11.2 oz bottle. Pours clear light golden in color. Aroma of citrus, wheat, ’clean’. Flavor is citrus, grape, grain. A simple hefe that is the best I’ve had. Light, refreshing, crisp with no aftertaste. A lemon can be added, but isn’t at all necessary.

In general, I find this beer, one of the top commercial German weissbier out there. I love the banana taste and the way it looks when its properly poured. BUT the last time I had it, I was very disappointed. Bland and flat taste with no weisse feeling at all. Maybe it was badly stored or something but I did not like it at all.

Delicious, effervescent Hefe-Weizen. Up there with Franzeskaner as one of the best.

Um tanto mais marcante a presença do lúpulo do que em outras equivalentes do gênero, o que a deixa com um amargor um pouco mais destacado. Boa formação de espuma.
Cloudy yellow. Soft wheat and lemon aroma. Sweet taste, washed with a hint of grass and citrus. A classic wheat beer deserving of its popularity.
Lys dunkel farve med hvitt skum. Lukt av banan og gjæt. Smak av banan og gjær. Thime Station.
Fin gul dunkel farge. Tynt skum. Fin duft av hvete og malt. God smak av hvete og malt.
Cloudy, yellow color. White, frothy and long-lasting head. Not very intensive aroma of banana and clove. Light bitterness.
Bleek geel, licht nevelig. Zoetig, beetje bitter, zeer licht zuur. Zacht. Banaan, gras.

Clear bright golden, tiny head. Mild wheat nose, slight hint if banana. Taste of wheat, malts, hint of banana and a little spicy. Starts with a good bitterness but dies it quickly. Not much of a finish going on here.

16.9floz/500ml bottle into a weizen. Served cool.

Aroma: Moderate malt with light cloves and spice.

Appearance: Almost completely clear bright yellow body. Little to no haze. No head.

Taste: Light malt, some banana flavor, but this one is more spice-driven. Interesting. Pretty tame.

Palate: Moderate body. Finish is short and on spice.

Overall: Nothing really stands out about this guy other than the spice vs. banana/wheat ratio in the flavor, and I’m not sure if that’s something I’m crazy about. Good beer though.

citrus, golden, cloudy, white foam, lightly bitter, light body, thin feel, fizzy. This is an excellent "sipping" beer for the hot Georgia summers. A "go to" beer most people can enjoy. I rate it highly in comparison to other Hefe-Weizen. This beer will go well with most foods because it will not overwhelm and compete with the enjoyment of what you are eating.

(Bottle): Pours a hazy gold, small white head. Aroma of yeast, banana and wheat. Flavour dominated by a wheat and yeast combo with banana, bubblegum and grassy notes complimenting it. It’s pleasant, drinkable but not outstanding.

Draught @ Villa Rixdorf, Berlin. Pours a hazy golden colour with a white head. Aroma of grains, wet earth, bubblegum and grass. Flavour of sweet malts, bubblegum, grass, straw and surprisingly strong banana notes. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Finishes sweet, wheaty and grassy finish. Enjoyable.

Draught @ Villa Rixdorf, Berlin 



Pours murky yellowish orange with a smooth head. Aroma of yeast, tartish notes, wheat and banana. Taste is sweetish, malty and wheaty with hints of banana and yeast. Finish is sweet, malty and yeasty. Quite balanced hefeweizen.
erdinger is a fantastic bier.the best weis bier in the world by my opion. fragrant full of hoppy goodness with a great finish
Scotland, Draught. This is a pretty generic and boring wheat beer without much to distinguish it.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours hazy golden with a large dense white head, Aroma is light with banana, wheat and cloves. Taste is ripe fruit sweetness, light smooth bitter. Quite sweet ending, smooth oily texture.

Ein Bier wie eingeschlafene Füße, als Weissbierfan vermeide ich dieses Bier wo auch immer möglich, was in Oberbayern östlich von München nicht einfach ist!
