.5l bottle @ Vihreä Haltiatar 
Pours hazy golden to amber with hi foamy head. Aroma is banana, malts, dried fruits. Flavor is malts, dried fruits, wheat. Regular beer.
Witbier geel, 0,5l @ameland. Aroma nauwelijks aanwezig, lichte mouten en citrus Smaken : zachte fijne goed op elkaar afgestemde smaken. Bijna geen bitterheid,zwak zoet Lichte body goed witbier

Pours a hazy yellow with a great deal of carbonation and a lot of fuzzy head. The aroma is practically non -existent. The flavor is mildly fruity and closes with a slight bitterness, but this mostly tastes like a little bit of nothing. It’s been my privilege to enjoy some delicious hefeweizens over the past year, and this ain’t one of them.

Hazy light amber color. Average white head. Lively carbonation. Bittersweet taste with bread, citrus and a hint of banana. A pleasant slightly bitter finish. Very refreshing beer but nothing special. Just a typical delicious German hefeweizen. (500 ml bottle, best before 1/2014, Schott Zwiesel Bavaria glass).

330ml bottle. Poured a hazy golden amber with a large and mostly lasting rocky white head. Yeast, banana, bread, cloves, some lemon zing and a delicate back end bitterness. Light to medium body, medium carbonation and finishing on a soft intensity and short to medium length bittersweetness. Clean, crisp and refreshing and went swimmingly with a Peruvian lomo saltado bap.

Drat! It’s "cloves", and not "cinnamon", as I have been saying cinnamon (and mispelling it) all the time. Anyway, this is one of the big ones, but when tasted in comparison against a certain Russian pshenichnoe of number 8, this Erdinger came out with a more subtle aroma and flavour. And this was no advantage. Moreover, the flavours here were not roundly crafted together, but they seemed to be lose from each other.
Bottle from Total Wine, Sacramento. Pours cloudy golden with a thick off-white head and a banana and clove aroma. There is a clean wheat malt flavor with a hint of banana and a carbonated finish.

Good beer - responds all espectations and has no weaknesses. The question is that is it too much fun for all. No special characters tough. Had this beer in Bad Segeberg Oktoberfest and it tastes better with schweinhaxe than after sauna in Finland. Taste point in schleswig hollstein festival tent 9pts.

Poured a very nice hazy yellow/orange colour with a nice white frothy head. Didn’t pick up much on the aroma, but the taste i got bread, wheat, malt and a little touch of banana. Nice carbonation. The finish is a little sour/bitter, but all in all a nice refreshing beer.

Erdinger is the safe bet when drinking Hefs in Europe, although take notice of the bottles next time you are drinking them. The picture shown is the long neck which is served all over but if you find the short neck bottles, GRAB one!! The flavor and freshness is noticeably different and you won’t be disappointed.

Дуже подобаються вайсбіри, тому в іхньому оцінюванні можу бути упередженим. Мутно-жовтий колір , висока і густа піна, яка довго не спадає. Чудовий смак і аромат

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Of all the beers we drank in Europe this was our go-to selection. It is comfortable to drink, cloudy in appearance, nice white head, and no bitterness (if you need bitterness skip this). It isn’t too heavy but it lacks some personality. The fact that it became so familiar quickly probably speaks to a lack of uniqueness but the taste is smooth and easy. If this was an athlete I’d describe it as your solid performer with no flash, he won’t let you down but he won’t win the game for you.

Bottle @ home. Birra dal profumo speciale, intensamente di frumento, di lievito, che ricorda il pane appena sfornato, e di banana matura. Il colore è oro, quasi ambrato ovviamente opalescente con una schiuma finissima e compatta. Il gusto è un po’ deludente dopo le premesse del profumo. Vira troppo sull’acidulo del frumento, le manca la componente dolce del malto d’orzo. Ha un gusto di cereali e crosta di pane, un po’ di di fruttato (mela) ma l’acidulo la rende troppo monocorde. Buona , ma più nel naso che in bocca.
Pours hazy orange. White head that billows then recedes. High carbonation. Light and is easy to drink. Nothing special.

500 ml bottle fridge cool at home. I was quite surprised to find I haven’t already rated this. Served in a Weizen glass. Cloudy gold with a huge lively white head. Bubblegum honeycomb and celery aroma. Drier and less spicy than most of this ilk. Less sticky on the palate as well. Lively carbonation, more astringency in the finish than one expects from a wiezen. Went down a treat after a hot afternoon at the shops

Thuis 0,5l fles, goudkleurig met royale witte schuimkraag. Citrus aroma en smaken, gemiddeld bitter, zuur en zoet. Mooie volle afdronk en gemiddeld CO2 en ligt vettig mondgevoel. Iets te zuur naar mijn mening
Pours trouble yellow with a big white head. great wheat taste. This is the perfect summer beer!
Prachtig geel bier met volle schuimkraag. Ruikt, citrus en hoppig. Smaakt lekker hop en frisse en mout.

Hazy golden, tall white frothy head with small & a bit bigger bubbles. Stays a a long lasting film. Much yeast in the aroma. Also spice, full maltiness. Not much fruitiness. Medium body. Quaffable. Sweet malts in the flavour. Spicy. Yeasty. A hint of hops is to be registered. Same notes in medium long finish. It’s different to common samples of the style. And it’s deffinitely good. One of my favourite Weizens.
Cloudy golden yellow color. Smell yeast and bananas. Taste of bread, citrus and grassy.
It ok, but not the best wheat beer from Germany, it is a little bit weak in taste compared to other German wheat beers.
12oz bottle. Pours hazy light golden orange with massive frothy head. Smells like banana bread. Taste is light and wheaty with a little banana.
Nice sweet flavor. A little boring and not as flavorful in body and aftertaste as some of the german competitors. Enjoyable but not special.

Poured from a 0.5 L bottler into a weizen glass, straw gold in color, the aroma is insipid with a little citrus and bread, the taste is a little tang, some bitterness, somewhat bready, crisp carbonation and not much else.

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy yellow with a big foamy head. Smell - not very strong comparing to other heffeweizen, notes of malt, yeast and cloves. Taste & mouthfeel - banana sweetness, crispy, high carbonation, slight sour aftertaste, easy to drink.

Bottle 330ml.
Pours hazy blond/whitish with low white head. Aroma is of yeast, sweet, fruits. Taste is of fruits, sligth bitterness, sweetness, wheat. Palate: Ligth body. Overall: Pretty good. Nice yeast. Refreshing.

Weissbeir à la robe paille et voilée. 
Des arômes léger de houblon herbeux, banane. Soyeuse en bouche. Bonne longueur. Très bien pour accompagner le picnic...

0.33l bottle. Slightly hazy golden body, white head. Aroma of bread, grains, biscuit and some banana. Tastes like bread, bidcuit and banana. Refreshing beer, but the typical weizen characteristics are not emphasised enough, I think. That doesn’t mean it’s a bad beer though.

The rich dark color of this beer hides how crisp and refreshing it is. A very nice aroma gives way to a sweet tastes which reminds me a fresh pear. It finishes clean with a mild pleasing aftertaste.

Bottle at bar. Hazy yellow color, white head. Bittersweet taste with banana, citrus, wheat and grass. Bittersweet finish with banana and citrus. Very nice hefeweizen.
50cl can.  decent weisse but maybe too sparkling and watery. Does not match Paulaner et al. so buy that instead.

Faint aroma of banana. Flavor has wheat and banana, little sweet.
Soft but little too carbonated.

Bottle. Nose is banana, apricot and some summer fruits. Taste is is banana, slight vanilla, bread, slight metallic finish. Would have benefited from more pepper or spice notes. Mouthfeel is full. 

This beer was a revelation to me as a young man trying it in Austria. Now, it’s pleasant and refreshing, and I am muddied by nostalgia, but it’s not a great beer, and I suspect not as good as it used to be.

I think this beer is one of the best I’ve tried so far in the heffe-weissen category. The aroma is sweet, almost honey-like, and the foam has an ideal appearance to it. The taste is sweet too, somewhat, at least it’s not too sweet, which makes it totally drinkable. Furthermore, it leaves a wheat aftertaste in the palate, and the beer itself is very smooth. An excellent beer this one!

Glowing cloudy amber orange color. Light citrus and wheat notes in the scent. Taste delicious and smooth. there is a light citrus mixing with a light sweetness from the wheat. The sip slides across your palate and rinse clean.

Hazy golden straw colored body with a full white head. Sweet, wheaty, yeasty aroma with a bit of banana. Flavor is lightly sweet, wheat, mild citrus, and mild dough with an excellent hefe-style finish. Light bodied, moderately fizzy palate.

Draft my wife ordered at Frisco Taphouse (Columbia, MD) so I snagged a few sips.  Cloudy straw-yellow color with white head.  Somewhat light aroma of malt sweetness, wheat and some fruit (mainly banana) notes.  Taste seemed to subdue the aroma sweetness, adds some spice notes (clove mostly).  Light body, average carbonation, mellow, easy drinking with a minimal finish.  Easy drinking hefe, maybe too easy as there’s not much to it.
Ótima cerveja. Leve, balanceada e com uma espuma cremosa. Sabor tende pro cítrico.

Excellent beer. First Erdinger and man was I right to get it. Confirms that wheat beers are an excellent, clean but complex taste.

Aroma levemente cítrico. Cor dourada. Espuma clara. Sabor tradicional de cerveja de trigo. Desce bem.

Reviewed 3/6/13. 11.2 oz bottle poured into a weizen glass.

A: Pours a cloudy dark gold color. The head is a three finger white shade with that has a foamy appearance to it. Retention is really nice, too.

S: Not only are the typical banana/clove estery aromas lacking here...so is just about anything else. About the only thing I really notice is a mild cherry-like sweetness and the faintest hint of wheat. Not really a bad aroma - after all, how can a nose so weak be considered bad?

T: Well, the aroma suggested a feeble flavor, and that’s what I got. While the lack of weizen esters allows the opening wheat quality and finishing noble hops to shine through more strongly, it really drinks like a dinky-ass US wheat ale (think Widmer Hefeweizen) than a proper German hefeweizen. Okay, so a slight banana presence builds up after a few sips, but by then it’s too little, too late. Just a boring beer in all flavor aspects.

M: The texture does a good job of staying out the way of the lack of flavor by finishing with a mildly clean dryness to it. I could do without the budding wet, syrupy linger, but I’ll certainly give it points for being refreshing and crisp.

O: A score this low would suggest a mediocre-to-poor effort riddled with flaws - however this isn’t actually flawed, just devoid of any good weizen characteristics...or any characteristics for that matter. This one is certainly easy to down, at least. But when both Sierra Nevada and Weihenstephaner make weizens that are both superbly drinkable AND full of character, why should you care about this one?

As far as introductions to beer styles go, the first time I became officially aware of the existence of wheat beer was during a field trip to Antwerp, specifically visiting an Argentinian steakhouse in the city. 

Being first year geography students who had been on a coach driving from Bangor in North Wales to Antwerp all day, we were hungry, shy, self conscious and, perhaps unsurprisingly ready for beer. Hoegaarden is personally responsible for a drunken 3am phone call to my dear mum from one of my friends, demanding that I personally come too reception and open the front door. Woops, wrong number...

Fast forward two weeks from this incident, and after a week of drinking the white nectar by the firkin, I discover that exists several variants of wheat beer, including a large supply of German examples of hefenweizen in the nearby tesco’s.

Erdinger holds pride of place as the first example of German wheat beer I ever tried, and frankly have never looked back since. 

Pouring a beautiful off cream approaching a slightly golden hue, Erdinger produces a mighty head which shakes hands with the nostrils on first sip, and absolutely sticks around fr the party. 

Banana bread, slight hint of cloves, and a subtle but wonderful waft of sweet weetabix, Erdinger is not particularly forthcoming in its nasal charms (not exactly surprising given the fifteen foot of mousse floating on top), however the taste buds start atinglin’ once the volatiles finally punch through. 

In the tasting, again the suggestion of cloves banana bread comes through, backed by a ever so slightly citric acidity and a rich, malty sweetness similar to Horlicks. It is a flavour profile I can only describe as the equivalent to a beer version of a cup of Ovaltine, giving a rich satisfying feeling of well being, while at the same time extremely thirst quenching. Essentially a smile in a pint glass.

On the palette, Erdinger has just the right balance between creamy richness and fizzy refreshment to give that fabulous thirst quenching characteristic wheat beers pull off with such ease and grace. One word to the wise however, the slice of orange is not particularly recommended in weizens...the Belgian examples might have adjuncts that work well with the citrus, but the Teutonic example works best alone.

Happy sipping!

This is a delight to imbibe. The flavor is slightly sour, hoppy but not overwhelming. Wonderful head when poured in the right vessel, bottle fermentation lens a light cloud and adds intensity to the first sips...thick foam makes for a nice nose decoration.

(Re-rated on 24/1/2015)



Rationale: I was new to the style when I rated this. After having some fair exposure and experience to Weissbier, now it’s time to see if this popular big boy still stand as tall as I thought it was.



Looks: Cloudy hazy golden light honey colour with some yeast sediments; Three finger head with crumpety white foam which lasted for 4 minutes; Excellent sticky lacing and fizzy carbonation.



Aroma: Fragment light lager malt, with banana, light vanilla, wheat, light caramel, light cloves, light spices, yeast, light lemon and pretty strong grass.



Taste: Mid to light sweet lager malt, with light vanilla, thin caramel, light wheat and thin tartness, very light phenolic, yeast, light lemon, fairly light bitter hops and notable light grass.



Body: Close to light body. Quite slick and slighty creamy palate.



Mouth Feel: Strong lager base, wheatyness is much less than most Weissbiers with very little tartness. Tends towards a wheat lager. Caramel, fruity ester, cloves and spices are notably lower, yet ther are some creaminess and (relatively) strong hops to compensate. Okay.



Hoppiness: Light lemon and quite fresh grassy hops in nose and taste. Bitterness is weiss low-fi, but quite notable - lager style - for a mostly malty and grassy low bitter finish.



After Taste: Fairly dry. Quite creamy and malty to mouth.



Comments: So a re-rate gives me a better idea of Erdinger’s weiss brewing: from the lowly ‘Champ’ to this flagship Weissbier, they opted for more barley than wheat for a lager-ish palate and universal appeal. For easy drinking that’s okay, but what so less wheat to signify the traditional Weissbier style, this is below standard. Drinkable and not something to be taken seriously.

Hazy, golden colour with a frothy persistent head. Light sweetness with fruit flavours. Less citrus than many similar styles makes it very smooth.
500 ml bottle. Basement, banana and alcohol in the nose. Tastes fizzy and fresh, banana and other fruits, yeast.

500 mL bottle. I really excellent wheat beer. Pours a cloudy straw yellow with a long-lasting head. I really fresh, wheaty, aroma. On the palate is a lot more wheat, really well-balanced. Nice long finish. Really excellent example of wheat beer.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Something off with this beer.  Not very wheat-esque, more like a pale lager.  Didn’t care for it.

Bottle at Bien Bar, Bergen. Pours a hazy dark straw-colour with a big white creamy and frothy head. Aroma of banana, pale malt, sour hay and sweet corn. The flavour is more fruity with pear, pale malt and grass. Has a slick and light mouthfeel, and a light bitterness. A decent hefeweizen, a bit light maybe but fresh.
Served in a beautiful, tall Erdinger glass. Golden haze, with a fine head. Tastes of wheat and hay, sweet with mild spices. Would drink again.

Bottle. This beer has a good claim to getting this beer snobbery of mine started. Used to me the boldest beer I could find in Edinburgh all those years ago. Pours hazy Golden Yellow with a thick white head. Lots of banana and clove. It’ll always hold a special place in my heart.

From bottle to glass.  Strong yeasty funk aroma.  This is usually complemented by a faint coconut note.  Cloudy golden color with low-density head.  More aroma comes out after it fades away. Banana notes finally come out in the flavor, but that damn funky yeast smell kills it.  Overall my least favorite hefe so far.
In the glass it has a hazy yellow color with a medium head. Aroma is yeast along with some wheat. Taste has a mild bitterness with a mild hoppiness. Also a touch of lemon. Good finish.
I like a wheat/white beer. They’re nice. They’re refreshing. This is nice. It tastes like bubblegum and comes in a giant glass. It doesn’t set the world on fire but it’ll do, pig.

Thick, fluffy head on pour, cloudt golden color. Haziness makes it difficult to see what carbonation is doing, but head is fairly long lasting. Mild flavor of wheat, without the strong banana and bubblegum notes of other weizens. Mouthfeel is just about right, but I agree with bierkrug, something’s missing....
Clear golden pour with a generous white head. Nice smooth taste with a good finish. A very nice Hefeweizen.
Bottled. White head, not so cloudy light yelow color, fresh citrus aroma, light sweetness in the taste, wery fizzy, short aftertaste. Drinkable

50cl bottle. Pale golden colour with a white head with good duration. Aroma is wheaty and slightly banana. Flavor is similar as aroma with a light sweetness in the final. Carbonation and body are medium.
Bottle from Jumbo supermarket, Portimao, Portugal. A hazy golden beer with a sweet ’plastic’ toffee flavour, followed by biscuit, slight vanilla and slight lemon and more biscuit on the finish.
Bottle, pours a light hazy, aroma is light, flavour is light, tastes like a lager to me. There wasn’t much spice or any of the good wheat qualities. Overall it was drinkable

500 ml bottle into signature weizen glass, best before 3/2013.  Pours hazy golden amber color with a nice 2-3 finger fluffy white head with good retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers.  Spotty foamy lacing clings to the glass.  Aromas of orange zest, banana, pepper, clove, apricot, wheat, earth, and yeast spiciness.  Nice and pleasant aromas with good balance.  Taste of banana, pear, wheat, pepper, clove, earth, bread, and yeast spiciness.  Lingering notes of wheat, pepper, pear, banana, clove, earth, and yeast spices on the finish for a short bit.  Flavors are well balanced with decent complexity; a bit on the watery side, but good.  High carbonation and light-medium body; with a lightly creamy and very crisp and prickly mouthfeel that is good.  Alcohol is well hidden with zero warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is a good Hefeweizen.  A bit watery, but the flavors are nicely balanced; and this is extremely easy and refreshing to drink.  I did enjoy it.
Good white beer with a nice flavor and then with a nice fruity bouquet.after opening the bottle the joy starts for me

Bottle. Dense and fruity nose, with some yeast. Hazy dull yellow color with a huge pillowy head. Tangy lemony initial; mid palate is balanced and a bit buttery; final is smooth and just a little metallic. Thin-medium body. Pleasant, nothing over the top, but a solid, well-made hefe.
Olyan mintha egy szűretlen Hellest kortyolgatnék, nem tom mi köze lehet a búzasörhöz, de jó, hozzá a hellesek ízvilágát.

bread, cereal, citrus, bubblegum, golden, hazy, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, salty, light body, creamy, slick feel, lively, long finish
Pours golden with frothy white head.  Swirling the bottle to suspend last of the yeast followed by finishing pour looked like adding whipped cream.  Golden clear beer turns cloudy as yeast disperses throughout glass.  Aromas of bread and citrus immediately apparent with some "bubble gum" sweetness.  Carnonation is lively but settles down quickly with a constant upward bubbling maintaining a thin layer of fine white head.  Tast of yeasty bread with only the slightest sweet/bitterness.  A slick, creamy mouthfeel with good carbonation followed by a long lasting finish of creamy bread goodness.  A very nice session beer - will have more of this one.

Aluminium manufacturing process developed. First cremation in England. US general strike for 8 hour day begins. 1st Civil Rights Act passes. Karl Benz drives first automobile.  WG Grace made his highest test cricket score V Australia at th Oval. Friars of Tilburg arrive on Curaçao. 1st national accountants’ society in US formed in NYC. All of these events are just as memorable as this beer. It’s been a long day.

Aroma of yeast and citrus.  Pours a hazy yellow with a volumous  long lasting white head and no lacings. Taste is light sweeetness, yeast, and grain. Mouthfeel is medium and soft carbonation - smooth. Overall, good but not my favorite Hefe Weizen.

#872
 Das Erdinger Weissbier, des is halt a Pracht, lalala...
Soweit die Werbung. Wer auf Pils ohne Hopfen steht, dem gefällt womöglich auch ein Weissbier ohne Fruchtaromen und Hefe, von Nelke ganz zu schweigen. Nein, dieses Bier muss man fleißig im TV bewerben, denn der Geschmack ist eher platter Durchschnitt, ohne Höhen und Tiefen...es ist halt ziemlich auf Mainstream getrimmt und daher auch nicht mein Ding!
	
Test vom 11.1.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 9,7,8,7,10,8 - 7,90
amazing white head and cloudy-golden yellow colour. Full taste and long finish. The only better wheat beer that I know is Erdinger Dunkel.

Bottle. Cloudy orange/yellow colour, no head. Aroma is not as sweet as other wheat beers that I have tried. Taste is spicy without so much fruit as expected. Very carbonated. This is a below par Wheat beer.
Banana, wheat and some yeast aroma. Sweet. Refreshing and a bit thin. I like this weissbier.
Looks nice with a thick white head and lots of lacing. Pours a hazy yellow. Aroma is grassy and hints of cereal. Taste is quite sweet and fruity. Not my favorite Weissbier, but still quite good.

Bottle @ Holiday resort
It looks perfect, as most weizens do. Cloudy blond with firm, white head. Malty aroma. Not very special, just typical weizen and not the best.
Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Milky golden in colour, low head. Aroma of yeast and bread. Taste of sweet bread rolls, bananas and vanilla. Nice Weissbier.
Pours in unclear yellow to green with huge and stable head. Big carbo. Yeast in the nose and aroma. Also some banana and citrus. Very drinkable but the big carbo is annoying. Still a good beer.

Aroma: Very yeasty, with hints of hops (likely due to bottle fermentation process)

Appearance: Gorgeous cloudy, golden color. Head wasn’t as strong as I would like.

Taste: Light bitter, very bready, not sweet like some breads.  Very enjoyable.

Palate: High carbonation, has a good bite/kick as a result.  Also very smooth and full bodied with a clean finish.

The overall impression is YEAST.  This is a very bready beer, and if you like that sort of impression then stockpile this stuff.  My Fiance absolutely loved it.  Surprisingly, she normally hates yeasty flavors and loves this beer.  

My advice: try it.
Pours a cloudy golden yellow with white head. Aroma is citrus, orange and spice. Flavor is similar.
Pint on tap. Pours yellow-gold with a thin white head, quite hazy with lively carbonation. Smells spice, banana citrus, little bit smokey. Taste is smokey bananas and citrus.
Bottle. Cloudy. Big white head. Weak fruity aroma, bananas especialy. Different from other wheat beers. Refreshing.
500 ml bottle. A classic wheat beer with nice hints of citrus, which totally makes it well suited for both being tried alongside food and as a summer day refreshment. In general very well-balanced.
Pale cloudy pour with a nice 2 finger head.  Nice light taste  without the banana Hefe’s usually have.  Good flavor and easy drinking.  There is a hint of alcohol in there at times though.
Pours cloudy golden yellow with a great white head. Aroma of yeast, malts, and wheat. Taste is sweet, wheat malt, and spice; very good beer.

What can I say; It looks like a Weissbier, the armoa is like a Weissbier, the taste is a typical Weissbier the aftertaste is a Weissbier, my stomach(and thereafter)  ten hours later is typical for a "Weissbier-evening in Munich". No surprise here.
Bottle. Lemon and wheat malt aroma. Hazy golden with a large off-white head. Lemon, wheat malt, and musty spice flavor. Light body, lively carbonation.

Can. Hazy dark yellow color with a disappearing head. (Too) clean aroma of malty wheat. Some wheatiness in taste but not much yeast. Maybe this would taste better a bit warmer than just-out-of-fridge-temp. Quite thin body for a Hefeweizen. Lively carbonation.

Bottle@tasting(2000), 50cl. Head: enormous, white colored. Color: hazy, golden. Aroma: almost none, citrus, fruit. Taste: sweet, honey. Palate: smooth, some bitter, medium body, lots of CO2. Overall: very nice.
Pours a cloudy yellow with a nice foamy head. Aroma of bready yeast and some sweet malts. Some citrus in the flavours.
Hazy yellow colour, a lot of carbonation and a lot of foam. Tastes watery and a bit sour. Citrus.
(bottle) Cloudy yellow with good white head. Subtle pleasant aroma. Light well carbonated refreshing palate. Tasty wheat beer with spice and some hoppy bitterness. Overall a decent weissbier.

Las diferencias entre las cervezas de trigo suelen ser minimas y en este caso esta cerveza marca una grata diferencia. Sin ser de las mejores, al menos su sabor y transito es refrescante y agradecido, sin ciertos amargores imposibles de otras mas afamadas.
I’ve always been fond of Erdinger.  I think it’s a nice pint, it has a frothy head a bit of fizz, and a good wheaty taste.
Sehr gutes goldgelbes weißbier. Der geschmack ist hefig und gut. Die  Schaumkrone hält sich lang.

500 ml bottle from NSLC.  Pours a murky golden colour with fluffy white head.  Aroma is banana, citrus and a gentle spiciness.  Flavour is orange zest, light lemon, banana and a touch of coriander.  Fairly fizzy carbonation.  Accessible and decent.

Pours a slightly cloudy golden yellow colour with a slim white head with good retention. light citrus orange aroma with coriander. flavour is light citrus smooth start and a light crisp sweet creamy finish
Ziet er goed uit, mooie kraag. Het probleem is meer de smaak of het gebrek eraan.  Vlak, weinig spannend.  Misschien toch maar met een ander bier op de foto........

50cl. Bottle. 
Poors cloudy yellow with strong white head. High carbo. 
Aroma is banana, citrus, malts. 
Taste is fresh little bitter, little sweet. 
Mouth-feel creamy. 
Great weissbier!

Pours hazy(after swirling) with some lacing head. Nose reminds me of a belgain ale right off just like all the German examples of this style. I assume this is because of the oxidative trip through an oven across the Atlantic deep in the hull of the USS Hell. Either way there are still some banana notes in there along with some light spiciness. Flavor is sweet and semi smooth  some light carbonation bite. Not all the bad drinking but not intense in really any way.

Don’t know what to say about this one. Before i got into this wonderful world of beer, this was a really beer i was looking forward to. Now, when you compare this to champions of this class, like Schneider, Weihenstephaner, Franziskaner, ...) this is just mediocre.
Anyway, here is the rating (bottle from local supermarket):

Pours nice light orange, good head, some lace. I can’t really smell much, some sugar coming upfront which is a surprise and definately not something that i’m just to in this style. Some banana and that’s pretty much it. Most of taste is typical hefeweizen, just that it is toned down so much, that you have to work really hard to notice anything. Some bitterness coming lately, which is a plus for me. Mouthfeel is crispy, light and refreshing. Nice for a hot summer day, although if you want to try a really good summer weizen-refresher i would recomend Scnheider Weisse tap 1.

Overall this is not a bad beer, but as i’ve said, look to heavyweights for true weiss-experience.
Light, crisp, and refreshing. A pale yellow with a white head. Hints of apple, yeast, wheat. Smooth and light in the finish.
Transferring my data before I used to rate at Ratebeer. I’ll add a more detailed description as I drink it again.

Good. The nose is bready with a touch of bublegum and bananas. The beer is a yellowish gold with a large foamy white head. The taste is breadlike with notes of bubblegum and a hint of clove. The beer is medium bodied and displays a crisp refreshingness.
Yellow and a decent head. Aroma is of yeast and the taste had some bubblegum to it. The finish was fairly clean. A decent showing for a Hefeweizen.

Tasted at home can. 
Good head. Yellow clody color. 
Dry taste of wheat. 
Perfect weissbier reference beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap, 0.5l. Hazy deep golden color with thick white head and moderate carbonation. Aroma of grainy malt, yeast, grassy hops, bananas and citruses. Sweet malty taste with very light bitterness in the aftertaste. In my opinion too sweet for hefeweizen, therefore not very well balanced. Medium body, slick texture and soft carbonation in palate. I drank many better hefeweizens, but in general not bad, of course...
Aromas & flavors of bread, wheat, and bananas.  Pale golden & clear.  Generous head, quickly dissipates.
Cerveja boa, leve e saborosa. Apesar de ter um teor alcoólico maior que as normas não aparenta. Muito boa.
Flaska Bishops Örebro. Grumlig orange vätska. Doft och smak av vete, aprikos, äpple  kakdeg och kryddor. Len munkänsla
0.5L bottle.  Big, heady weissbier.   Great aroma, lively carbonation, golden clear.  Medium body, very enjoyable.  It’s Erdinger!

Tap on numerous occasions, the last being at Brewery Tap, Brighton. It pours hazy golden, with a thick white head. The nose is spice, banana, citrus, dough and hay. The taste is sweet orange, tangerine, spice, banana, wheat, tangy citrus, dough and hay, with a dry finish. Medium body and fine-medium carbonation. Decent balance and flavour.
0,5l bottle. A cloudy pale weizen with a nice white head. The aroma has notes of banana, apple, spices and malts. The taste is sweet and slightly sour. A well balanced beer.

Very hazy golden colour, white rich foam, fizzy. Mild sweet grain smell. Very smooth and foamy in mouth. Tasty combination of sweet sour taste. One of first better beers I ever tried and I still love it.
En klassisk tysk weissbier både till utseende, doft och smak. Gyllene, lätt grumlig. Doft av jäst, skumbanan och citrus. Dito i smaken.

Average aroma. Pours cloudy yellow-golden with average white head. It’s a light weiss and it tastes nice. Finish is also very good and a bit sweet. Overall a remarkable beer I would easily drink again.
I really like to drink erdinger, It is an easy way to calm down.  One of the best German hefeweizen.
Light taste, but lighter than a weissbier should. Aroma of cereals very present. But still a very good beer!

Aroma is definitively citrus with lemon sticking out. Also banana. App.is golden and hazy with good lacing head. Attack is a bit acid with lemon sticking out. Kind of a dull beer with no particular defect but no special quality either.

Greg and I compared a series of three respected, true-to-style German Hefeweizens: Paulaner, Erdinger and Weihenstephan. All three were tasty and refreshing; this one was my second favorite. Surprisingly, I liked it better than the Paulaner. The Erdinger was clearer and lighter than the others, with slightly more effervescent carbonation. Aromas of banana and bubblegum. Mild malt and wheat, light breadiness. Not buttery like the Paulaner. Light body and medium carbonation. Palate became less smooth as it warmed. Crisp and refreshing, but I’d love to see/smell/taste more yeast.
Average aroma, appearance, taste and palate. Decent, somewhat memorable. Rated in the past from the bottle.
I would expect it to be cloudier.  Very translucent,  Almost no head.  Very tasty,  Slight banana.
Good wheat beer, sweat and crisp, slightly disapointing head, but overall a good solid typical german wheat on the upper end of the scale (excluding mircos).
Very light for a Weisbeer, but instantly likable. Hints of clove and vanilla, with a clean, crisp finish. A really good entry level wheat beer.

On bottle at Cafe Tamara.
Hazy golden, good foam.
Fruity & some banana
Medium body & complexity
Enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smooth wheat beer with nothing artifical added.  Best freely available wheat beer available in the UK.

Fortunately, Erdinger Weissbier is readily available in my country, for it is simply one of the best wheat beers out there. It is at once fresh and fruity, with hints of lime and melon, but with a slight sweetness that is reminiscent of Danish honey. The ever so airy, white head is persistent, beautiful and attractive as a young maid in the virgin spring meadows.. Yes indeed Erdinger Weiss Bier is the perfect summer drink.

It should be consumed well chilled, in a real wheat beer glass (tall and slim with wide opening). I’ve been through my share of weissbeer in its homeland, and though this beer is often served with something as blasphemous as a slice of orange, it’s still one of the best in its class and type. The only negative thing I notice is the aftertaste, which seems way more fermented than when drinking it from tap. But that shouldn’t be an excuse not to buy bottles by the coli of this, Erdinger’s best.

0,5l bottle. Hazy yellow color. Medium, thick head, stays. Wheat, mild sugar in aroma, very faint aroma. Sweet, light fizzy, wheat in flavor. Very different from all other German hefeweizens I’ve tried. Refreshing indeed.

500ml bottle pours a hazy golden color with a 2 finger white head that settles to some thin spotty lacing.  Aroma is banana and cloves with some citrus and yeast.  Taste is light fruit and malt sweetness with the clove spice and a citrusy bitterness with some yeast on the finish.  Medium bodied with abundant carbonation.  A very well done brew that begs to be tasted.

Golden colour, cloudy appearance, short white head.

Aroma has notes of hops, malt, honey.

Medium body, average carbonation, bittersweet taste, bitter aftertaste.

Tap: golden hazy pour with medium-sized white head. aroma is lightly tart and spicy with some clove, citus, banana and caramel. Flavor has a lemony zing with some caramel sweetness and a light banana. Light but malty palate with nice carbonation and good flavor make thia beer easy to drink.
Good initial taste. Not a very detectable aftertaste, but very refreshing and hardly bitter
I stort sett den perfekta weissbieren. Utseende, arom, smak & eftersmak är perfekt. Men om man måste välja är skillnaden hårfin mellan Erdinger, Paulaner & Weheienstephan.
Bottle. Typical Hefe-Weizen flavors are present but weak. Over carbonated. Finish is dry with a touch of lemon that quickly fades away.

I will always be grateful to Erdinger - both for being so readily available and for being the first wheat beer I fell for - but it is slightly overwhelmed by some of its competition (especially Schneider). This is a fantastically easy beer to drink due to a taste that is perhaps, to be critical, slightly less exciting than it should be. It should be noted, however, that it is better than 90% of lagers you will ever try!

Erdinger Hefe-Weizen has a very thick, fluffy, slightly off-white head and a cloudy, yellow-golden appearance. Some lacing is present. The aroma is not strong, but one detects white wheat bread. Taste is mild, with white wheat bread, sweetness, some lemon, low level coriander, and a touch of hop bitterness. The spiciness certainly increases after swishing the bottom 20% of the bottle. Mouthfeel is light to medium and soft, and Erdinger Hefe-Weizen finishes pleasant and very easy drinking. It’s quite good. RJT

500 ml bottle @ Lorry Restaurant,Oslo, March 16 2012
Served in a weizen glass.
Nice carbonation.A bit dry to be a weizen.A macro brewery in the weizen genre.

Bottle. Light golden, hazy, average and fully diminishing head. Moderate, malty – some wheat and lightly sweetish aroma, light fruitiness and banana, faint citrus and faint yeast. Body is light to medium, malty – lightly wheaty and lightly sweetish flavor, faint  fruitiness and banana. Finish is short to average malty – lightly wheaty and dryish, faint banana and yeast. Dryish and rather light-bodied hefeweizen - OK, but nothing special.

500 ml bottle pours a slighly hazy yellow with a small white head and not much lacing.  Smells like a German Hefe-Weizen.  Tastes like a German Hefe-Weizen with some extra lemon., Aroma has the usual grassiness with  a fairly clean bitter finish. Lively, carbonated mouthfeel that makes me burp a lot.  Well worth a try, but not one I’m likely to try again, given all the alternatives.

This is not a bad beer, it?s just not a great beer... I often think of it as the budweiser of the weiss collection... quite mainstream, quite popular but lacking in quality in character. If your interested in checking out this brewery I would absolutely recommend their Schnee-weiss... you wouldn?t think it is the same people who make this! As for this beer it pour a lazy orange colour, more similar to a yellow, body. Aroma is quite bitter with a minor banana like smell. Taste is watery and bitter upfront with soft backtaste. Overall this is not a bad beer and I would take it over a pint of Fosters any day but of the weissbier... this is my least favourite (though as I say, the Erdinger Schneeweiss is excellent!).
Tap@125 jahre. Three finger foam. Haze light yellow. Dry. Soft. Short finish.
a lovely light hefe.  a nice light doughy taste with a hint of citrus.  Not the best in class but it’s a good one
500ml bottle Pours cloudy pale yellow with a white head, some lacing.. Aroma of malty bread, citrus. Taste is malty & a sweetness, a little spiciness and lemon.
Good typical german hefeweizen with typical clove notes and a slight citrus taste. As far as hefes go this is slightly on the more acidic or sour side which can be a good thing.
Perfect for dinner! Enjoyed best with grilled meat on a hot summer day. The flavor has a distinct yeast flavor with a slight sweetness and malty taste.

Smells a little like wheat (go figure). Soft on palate. Surprisingly strong taste of alcohol for a lighter beer, but there isn’t much character beyond that. Not sure why this is such a ubiquitous beer - it’s available in almost every country I visit it seems. Bottle from the lcbo.
This one just does not cut it compared to the other german weizens. Lacks the full palate and flavor if the others. From the Mitra in Roden, the Netherlands.

Pours murky yellow-gold with huge foamy white head. Faint aroma of bread and grass. Taste is sweet malts, bread, banana, cloves. High carbonation and quite refreshing. One of the better mass-produced a Weizens but still on the watery side.

fromm bottle. the pilsner among the german wheat beers. quite hoppy aroma, some banana and citric notes. pleasent fruity flavour, hints of banana and bubblegum. lively carbonation. perhaps a bit thin and watery but i really enjoy this one sitting in the sun. good weizen!

Orange gold color with rocky head. Very lively carbonation.
Crisp flavor of some fruits. Low bitterness, with wheat and grain.
I recommend this one!

Bottle best by 01-2013. Poured a bright hazy yellow with a big frothy white head that had a thin layer lasting and left light lace. Aroma of wheat and lemon. The flavor found subdued wheat. Medium body and a light wheat aftertaste.
Off keg at derby brewery tap. A little like a lager really, prefer it from bottles. Nice on a hot day.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy amber color with nice white head.  A floral aroma, but not overwhelming. Taste is very good wheat beer flavor, no bitterness. Very smooth and easy to drink (in fact my wife just finished my beer!) One of my favorite wheat beers.
Can. Pours opaque yellow with small white head. Aroma is banana, rust, yoghurt and cloves. Taste is medium bitter and acidic. Body is watery with good carbonation. Finish is dry and short.

50 cl bottle. Nice presentation. Poured into my weizenglass. Around 6ºC. Nice banana, clove and vanilla aroma. Beautiful appearance, light orange colour, cloudy beer as a consequence of being unfiltered. Very generous white thick head that will last till the last sip. Medium sweetness and carbonation, both adequate to a Weizenbier. Creamy texture, medium to full body and pretty long satisfying sweet finish.

Poured in one go, into a Franziskaner Weissbier glass, it looks fine, a very pale golden yellow. 50cl bottle, best before June 2007, drank on 16th Dec 2006. 

The normal bubbles raising through the body to replenish the foaming white head at the top. The aroma is of vanilla and bannanas, as you would expect, but not as pronounced as some Wiessbiers. 

The taste is also lacking compared with other like beers, both in complexity and depth. On a summers day this would be just right, however, this is Great Britain in mid December and its lightness doesn’t work right now. 

I have drank many Weissbiers over the years, in all weathers, this is a lightweight in all aspects. There is very little mouthfeel and aftertaste. 

Not the best Hefe Weizen by a long way!

Clear blond coloured beer with larger diminishing white head and lots of carbonation. Sweet herby and hopped aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is sweet fruited with soft hoppy hints. Easy refreshing drinker. Nice!

Bottle 0,5 l 
Apperance: Cloudy, amber beer with big white, short lasting frothy head. 
Aroma: Not very intense. bananas,  honey, citrus and yeast(dough).
Taste: Not very intense, a bit sweet , a bit sour, a bit bitter. 
Palate: medium carbonation, oily texture, medium body.
Overall: This beer is too toned down. It’s too average.
Hazy orange colour with big head. Aroma is yeast, some banana. Flavour is yeast, not so much wheat. Had fresh bottle and ~1 year old, fresh one was way better.

Unclear bright yellow, big creamy white head settles and lasts. Light citrus fruity yeasty wheat aroma and taste with some mild spice. Lively carbonation, light bodied. Crisp clean and refreshing. Weissebier Light. LF (Lagerboy Friendly)

500ml bottle. Aroma is slightly citrus and yeast. Appearance is cloudy with a two finger fast decreasing head. Taste is light sour and light fruity. Has a medium carbonation. Overall a nice hefeweissbier.
Eh not really much to say about this. Looks great but everything else is weak and somewhat lacking. Just an average hefe; not great by any stretch of the imagination but not bad either.

0,5l bottle from a supermarket, Budapest. Cloudy, pale, straw-colored, with big, frothy, white head. I like it’s appearance very much. Sweet, citrus and malty odor. Interesting aroma, different from other hefeweizens. The yeast gives it a delicious fruity aroma with citrus, banana, mango and some plum. There are two different malty flavour, behind the wheat aroma, the barley also appears. Dry taste with a little sweetness. Medium body with creamy texture and biting carbonation. Fruity, yeasty finish with the two malty flavour. Very good hefeweizen with a delicious yeast, which makes it different.
Probably the smoothest hefeweizen I have had.  When the temps hit 90, this is where I am heading.

April 9 2012. 500ml bottle poured in hoegaarden glass. Aroma has hint of sweetness not citrusy but present, mostly yeast smelling. Very ugly appearance typical of wheat beer. Bright yellow, cloudy. 1" white head is very bubbly, mostly carbonation and fizzy texture. Head settles to ring and no lacing except for bubbles. Clean watery palate, on the fizzy side. Very light, with only subtle sweetness and yeast in aftertaste. Easy to drink but nothing special.
Light orange colour and medium white head.  Sweet flavour (similar to banana), very refreshing and easy to drink. It’s not the best Hefe-Weizen I had, but quite good.

Pours a cloudy yellow. Smells typically like bubble gum, banana, and some orange. Slightly phenolic too. Refreshing carbonation. Decent wheat flavor, was hoping for a little more flavor overall though. Overall respectably constructed but nothing special.

Pours a standard hazy golden ocher... heavy wheat aromas and a hint of clove.... taste is round slightly honey wheat, bit of citrus, and a clean finish. Not bad but I like a little more zip in my hefeweizens.
Mmmmmmmm...... Honestly, I have been drinking and rating beers ail night, so, this is an honest rating.

bottle . hazy orange gold   big white head  .  nose is oranges , yeast , cloves , grass . Taste is spicy and low key orangey citrus with wheat note s   more bitter finish   very smooth   low carbonation  pleasant enough - just missing something to set it apart .

Very refreshing taste and nice golden color. Good white foam and long lasting  taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500 ml bottle. Pours a massive soapy head. Light, but thick. Lasts too! Body is yellow and cloudy (Lovibond 3/4). Aroma is sweet hay. Taste is somewhat sweet but not overstated.  Creamy texture. Great beer!

A clear golden beer with a soapy head that disappears almost instantly. The aroma is citrus, yeast, and slightly grainy. The flavor is wheat, honey, and spicy. Weak flavour compare to other weissbeer. There’s a little funk and bitter in the finish.

A clear golden beer with a soapy head that disappears almost instantly.  The aroma is citrus, yeast, and slightly grainy.  The flavor is wheat, honey, and spicy.  There’s a little funk and bitter in the finish.

Excellent light wheat beer....very enjoyable. Mild sweet flavors with a nice finish. This is not an overwhelming flavored beer but still good non the less. This is a keeper.

pale light orange cloudy with big creamy head. Long lacing. Aromas orange, citrus, honey melon, hay. Palate tart fruity wheat yeasty. Carbonation soft smooth mouthful. Aftertaste is fruity little cereal, and yeast. Overall quite balanced light wheat beer with OK astringent finish.

(First Taste, Home, 500mL Bottle, Vintage Oct. 2011, Lager Glass, 5.3% ABV, Chilled, 23/02/12. #6.)

Mild simple aroma of white dough and some phenols. Appearance pale amber, seems a little thin, large white head quickly dissappeared. Simple and easy wheat flavour at first, but a lovely long bready-yeasty finish, with some banana at the end. Oddly, flavour a bit sour by half way through the bottle. Strangely triggered a strong skin allergy - this only happens when i drink wine (which is why i drink beer). I am sad and my skin is burning like hell. Excluded from rating though.

Bottle. Hazy Orange/Yellow with a hefty wheatbeer head. Surpringly little aroma, but there’s some tang and wheaty/bready tastes. Incredibly light and doesn’t give much palate excitement. Light bitterness. Refreshing.

Dark golden cloudy pour with great frothy head. I’ve Erdinger white a zillion times. Love it. Granted its not the best white in the world but its a regular fixture in my fridge.

500 ml bottle bought @ systembolaget. Pours cloudy pale orange with a huge fizzy white head that leaves some lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is slightly sweet, slightly sour and malty with bread, lemon peal and metal. Paste is sweet and malty with lots of bread, some citrus and some spices. Finish is lightly sweet, malty and faintly sour.
Average Weizen but it’s not too heavy in the sack... Woody sometimes, it’s a fine.

Re-rate. From 500 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy golden straw colour with a tight and lasting white head and lively carbonation. Aromas of lemon, wheat, clove and a touch of banana. On tap. Cloudy light yellow colour, heavy stable frothy head. Aroma of wheat, yeasts, bready, grassy, but overall somewhat indistinct. Taste medium sweet, light bitter. Overall not bad beer, drinkable and refreshing, but does not really leave an impression.

Hard to believe I have not rated all these German classics available at BOTW.  Thank goodness for my new smartphone helping me.  This one could be better though.  Hoppy notes in both the nose and palate which was odd.  Mild mostly fruity nose.  Hazy appearance.  Pretty pale.  Palate is largely boring with a dry finish.

Hazy golden color with white fizzy head that disappears fairly quickly. Aroma is mild, a bit sweet.  Light and wheaty tasting, hop bitterness is well balanced with the malt. Bottle. Great, creamy white head, orange-yellow colour. Aroma of hefe and citruses. Light taste, with dominant hefe and some citrus. I somehow miss the banana aroma and taste, altough it’s there, but in my opinion not well enogh... very refreshing, tough.

This brew poured up a murky, orange-colored body with a foamy off-white head with fairly good retention and lacing effects on the glass.  Careful on the pour of these hefeweizens a yeast is present in the bottle.  Pour 3/4 of the bottle and then gently swirl the bottle around a few times and then pour the rest into the glass; this helps break up the yeast components and enhance the look of the brew. Aromas of wheat, cloves, warm banana nut bread (or is it homemade banana pudding?).  Medium-bodied, creamy smooth, with a nice spicy (clove-like) finish with just a bite from the hops to blend well with all that sweetness. I would consider this a table-brew much like what you would find in a table wine at a restaurant.  Not a bad brew but definitely not in the line of great brews in the hefeweizen style.

Erdinger was probably the first hefeweizen I ever had, and for many years also the only brand I tried. It’s fun to rate new beers, but it’s almost more fun to rate long-time favourites like this one! It looks very tempting: very hazy, medium yellow body and a huge, rocky, fully lasting, white head that leaves large amounts of lacing on the glass. The aroma is also quite nice: it’s very clean and fresh, with spices, herbs, yeast and malty notes of caramel. I think I get some fruit as well, but I can’t find any citrus or banana. And then there are some notes that reminds me of a pale lager or pilsener. That’s strange, I’ve never picked up stuff like that in a hefeweizen before, and it makes the beer a bit less tempting. The taste is light sweet, light acidic and the finish is light bitter. The flavours are boringly faint, and again the lager-ish notes come to play. Quite nice mouthfeel, with a medium to light body and lively carbonation. A crisp and refreshing beer, but far less tasty than I remembered. 

[50 cl bottle, from Vinmonopolet Oslo City, Oslo]

Real good beer had it on a ferry to amsterdam nice lasting head and carbonation great refreshing taste

Authentic German wheat beers (hefeweizens) are among my favorite styles of beer and many beer enthusiasts and critics would say the same. Even though they conform to the Bavarian Purity Law of 1516, beers of this style tend to be extremely robust and complex and yet highly drinkable and land on "Best of" lists all the time. 

However, to use an analogy my friend Henry coined - even Ivy League schools still have C students and Erdinger Hefe-Weizen is the beer equivalent of that. 

I poured a 500ml bottle into a 20oz wheat beer glass.

Appearance: Surprisingly bright banana-yellow hue. Body is crystal-clear until the yeast is added (most hefeweizens tend to be at least a little cloudy at first). It forms a huge, bright white, soapy head which fizzles away like a soda leaving no lacing on the glass at all. This is also unusual, as most other hef’s heads tend to be frothy and dirty up the glass with lacing all the way down.

Smell: I was actually shocked to detect a noticeable skunky aroma at first, but it seemed to diminish after only a few swigs. This could be due to the fact the bottle is a very light shade of brown - almost olive green, in fact. There’s a slight floral and lemon scent which is pleasing, but not strong enough to overpower the skunk.

Taste: While the appearance and aroma were not what I would consider favorable, my first swig of Erdinger Hefe-Weizen helped me remember why I love beers of this style. The initial taste of the foamy head and the top of the palate was sweet, almost creamy, and definitely refreshing. Lemon is the most noticeable flavor here, which, combined with the head, is sweeter than usual and makes for a lemon meringue pie taste.

Unfortunately, I judge beer on its entire performance, not just first impressions, and this beer begins to run out of steam quickly. Once the head dissipates the creamy texture and taste is lost and a palate of generic spice begins to take hold. It’s more of an allspice and pepper flavor with even a lager-like grainy effect. The sourness from the smell begins to make itself known in the palate and gives it a bit of tang. The lemon flavor still hangs in there, keeping this beer from tilting the scales from good to bad, but hangs right on the fulcrum of average.

Drinkability: Although there are definite flaws to this beer, it at least functions as the bare minimum of a refreshing wheat beer. Mouthfeel is on the lower end of medium with some crispness at first and tepid thinness later on it. Some spices dance on the tongue and linger, but are expected from this style. 

Overall, a disappointing beer considering the brewery and country of origin. I have to call it like I see it and while this beer isn’t truly bad, it’s nothing more than average.

The best hefe ive every had.  This beer, when it is poured correctly on draft is hands down better than any other german hefe.  nice golden color with a slight haze through the beer.  great flavors that are strong but not overpowering on the back of the palate.  There is a linger but not a overpowering long lasting finish.  The nose is slightly of banana, vanilla, and a little bit of yeastyness.  great beer
Think this is the most well known weissbier in my region. To me it’s just another, just one of so many in this style. Average all the way.

50cl bottle at the strand beach bar, katwijk
Hazy blond pour. Nice. And refreshing.
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of wheat and citrus. Flavor is sweet, wheat, citrus, and fruit.

A nice weissbier with good drinkability. Wheaty banana and citrus aromas with a nice smoothness and flavour to it. Some yeast, grass and bananas in taste. Works great on a hot summer day but there are more interesting weissbiers.

50 cL brown bottle with cap, bought in a supermarket. Appearance: Yellow, cloudy (yeast), fluffy white head with medium bubble diameter. A lot of bubbles in the liquid. Aroma: Sweet note (Pilsner malt), banana, hoppy (grass note), yeast aroma and hint of lemon. Taste: Sweet note (like aroma), hint of wheat character (grainy), light bitterness. As I poured the yeast in I noticed a metallic taste in the beer afterwards. Palate: Light body, lively carbonation, malty aftertaste. Overall: For me this beer has to much hop character and bitterness. It makes this beer less drinkable to me than other wheat beers I had. Well, this is beer is really on the edge if I would order a second one or not. But all in all a decent beer with no flaws.
Bottle 50 cl. Yellow, hazy with a large white head. Wheat aroma with some citrus sence. Mild wheat taste with some bitter lemon aftertaste. Quite fresh. Tried in Svolvær with propper glass.
Average weiss at best. Watery feel and very soft taste. Misses the traits of a good wheat beer.

Hefe-fruchtig im Geruch mit leicht alkoholischem Hintergrund, aber sehr lecker. 
Im Geschmack ordentlich perlig. Deutlich kommt die Hefe durch. Im Nachgeschmack zieht der Alkohol wieder an. 
Das Erdinger Weißbier punktet vor allem beim Geruch. Im Geschmack ist es mir aber zu metallisch. Ab der Hälfte der Flasche wird das Bier sogar uninteressant. Die Aromen bauen rapide ab. 
Es gibt schönere Hefeweizen.

Bottle. Cloudy golden body with a pillowy white head that slowly diminishes. Moderate aroma of clove, banana, toasted grain. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet, lightly to moderately bitter and lightly tart. Medium body, watery texture turning slick, lively carbonation. Light on the clove and banana. Body is too thin.

500mL bottle.  Poured fairly clear light-medium golden with a tall cap of dense white head.  The aroma picked up muted banana sweetness and cloves, with a dry, earthy impression.. touches of lemon zest accented.. not bad, but not a whole lot to it.  The flavor found dry banana and wet, earthy sweetness at the core, with mild cloves and lemon laced throughout.. watery on the finish with a light hit of cardboard.. tacky and unsatisfying in the end.  Light-medium bodied and well carbonated on the palate.. not a great feel or flow, but it was drinkable.. meh.

the generic wheat beer if there every was one. not the best one ive every tried, nice on tap grand out of a bottle. Huge white foamy head fills the glass, gradually giving way to a cloudy pale yellow beer. Tiny bubbles, decent carbonation typical of most German beers
Mild nose of fruit, banana, very faint yeast.
Taste is light, crisp, a little watery. Hints of lemon,
Overall the flavors seemed muted, subdued.

Has a nice rich foamy head and has that familiar banana like aroma that I’m familiar with this type of brew. Has rich gold gold creamy color. Taste is soft with very active carbonation. Very refreshing and pleasant to drink. Has a soft aftertaste.

Bottle to wheat glass. Pours cloudy orangish yellow with a decent sheet white head.  Tastes a sweet very robust orange with some lemon zest, a big wheat malty finish with some orange, graininess, and a touch of sugary sweetness. Lots of wheat in this one, it is good but not exceptional like some wheats i’ve had.

Das Bier kommt rüber wie ein "Gold-Weizen", soll heißen der Geschmack lässt einiges vermissen. Der Antrunk, kaum würzig, kaum hefig, gar nicht fruchtig, geht in einen mittelherben uns wässrigen Mittelteil über, der Nachgeschmack bietet wenigstens eine minimale Fruchtigkeit. Es gibt bestimmt 1000 bessere Weizen... 	 
Test vom 26.12.2005, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 13,7,9,8,9,7 - 8,15

Nice hefe indeed. Pours a cloudy yellow body with a massive head. The head disappears relatively quickly though. Fruty aroma. The taste is banana-ish with a bit of yeast. Is high on carbonation, but may be a bit too fizzy for some. Enjoyed on a sunny summer evening in which it is perfect for:)!

Was introduced to this in Dover after a long day at the castle.
I’ve never looked back since.

On tap @12 apôtres Strasbourg. A cloudy yellow orange beer with good head. Nose is malty, aroma is medium malty and medium sweet, very creamy, fruity side is there on banana as usual, bit watery body. Pleasant but not exceptional.
This is quite a regular hefeweizen beer. The good thing about this one that it’s a bit less sweet then the other hefeweizen. Easy to drink. But still, this just isn’t my style.

30May 2011, bottle. orange, very hazy, foamy white head that fades fast. nose is a spicy banana aroma but not very strong. thin body and very fizzy. really bland. its so fizzy that carbonation competes w/ flavours. orange/banana flavour in background. meh.
Bottle. Thick white head, hazy golden body. Wheat, leomny, grassy. Gentle bitterness. Dry finish.
Aroma is a nice wheat like quality, Palate is smooth and refreshing with generous hints of citrus.

Bottle @ Home


I must admit I thoroughly enjoy a good weißbier and thus I must give considerable approval to this one. Pours a thick cloudy straw colour with a massive white head. The aroma is of citrus and fruit. The flavour adds pleasant spice and fruit notes. The palate could stand to be a little fuller, and a tad more bitter. Other than that an excellent beer.
Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma is wheat, light banana and clove. Flavour is wheat, sweet notes, light banana and clove.

This is a banger. I tried a 0,5 liter bottle and I loved it. I poured it into it’s own tall glass and that is a quite impressive sight. It builds a nice bubbly head that stays on for a while. The aroma has hints of lemon peel and is a bit grainy. And there is a lot going on in the mouth as well. Again the lemon with other citrus fruits like orange and lime. Again, the wheat returns and leaves you refreshed after each sip. An absolute banger for in the summer.

Fine head. Cloudy
Nose with rubber and a light banana
Small body and short
Light rubber taste with touch og banana

Bottle. Orange hazy with a big white head in a wheat beer glass. Aroma of citrus, banana, yeast esters and spice. Taste is sweet with refreshing citrus acids. Finish is not very bitter. A real thirst killer

From a 500ml bottle on 10/5/2011. Pours a slightly cloudy straw colour with a big head. Has a mild aroma of citrus, apple and spice. Has a pleasant lemony flavour with a touch spice. A solid if not spectacular hefe, which is both pleasant and refreshing.

50cl bottle. Pours a golden colour, disappointingly not very cloudy, with steady bubbles and a big head. The nose has pale malt, some creaminess and not much of the usual banana. The taste has more of the same with some sweetness. The palate is medium bodied and fairly refreshing though there is a slightly cloying note. Overall, this is an easy drinker but not one of the best Weiss.

Orange/straw color. Big white head. Medium amount of lacing. No aroma to really speak of. There is some muted malt behind some alcohol. The taste was citrusy at first than just became bland. Not the best Germany has to offer, that’s for sure. Will pass on this in the future. Although it is not undrinkable, it’s just not worth spending good money and time on.

Hazy yellow pour with a head of big bubbles that quickly fades away.  Aroma is faint of faint wheat and a little spice.  Watery body with mild flavors of malty clove and some mineral notes.  The malt is heavier than most hefs and I would really like the spice and yeast notes to be more accentuated.  Not bad, but I’ve had better.
Cloudy yellow pour with big head. Aroma of wheat, yeast and a bit of banana. Taste of citrusy wheat and a bit of yeast. Not a bad beer but so many better.

500ml bottle.  Pours a cloudy golden orange with a good sized white head.  A maltier nose than most weissbier I’ve tried, with spice, yeast, and faint citrus.  The taste is very thin.  Disappointing really, and again much maltier than other weissbier.  A little sweetness with faint hops, doughy notes, and very faint weiss traits but they’re mostly in the finish (banana, spice).  Not bad, but there are so many better choices.
Picked up on a whim. Love a good hefe-weizen. Nice lemony with a barnyard aroma. Not great, don’t need to buy again e en though low priced

This one stood out among a few, looking rather similar to the Weihenstephaner. OK, so it pours rather quickly with a thick head, which isn’t too aromatic or pleasing. The flavor is tasty and light, I’d say lightly spicy with an also lightly zest to it. This beer isn’t overall impressive, with a rather low ABV and overall flavor, I must say I am overall disappointed with this one. It’s hard to pick out the flavors in a beer where there isn’t much going on.

Native German Wheat Beer. Not the best taste. Painfully light. Being a fan of Stouts and Porters, with my preferences compared to Erdinger Wheat, this phrase has never rung so true, "Once you go black, you’ll never go back".
I like this beer and it was my favorite weissbier for a long time.  Perfectly refreshing and good all around.  It is a great one to give to friends that say they really don’t like beer.

On tap at Rustico - Alexandria. Served in a pilsner glass.

Pours a hazy yellow color with a single-finger white head and a bit of lacing. The nose is really quite plain. There’s a bit of light grain plus a bit of pear and apple. There’s really nothing going on in terms of the yeast, which is quite disappointing. I’m not getting any clove, banana, or bubblegum. Just really plain in general.

The flavor is about the same--there’s a very slight amount of sweetness and not all that much going on. The feel is pretty light with moderate carbonation. In general, this is just not a good German weissbier. The main characteristic of this brew--the defining characteristic of the style--is the yeast and this beer simply just does not have that. It doesn’t hit any of the right points for the style. At the same time it’s light and somewhat refreshing, so it’s not terribly difficult to drink.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 12-09-2010

Bottle. Hazy yellow color with a bubbly big white head. Could mistake the head for zalo (dishwashing soap). Yeasty aroma with bread, banana. Sweet taste of malts, fruit peels, banana and some wheat. Good finish
Cask @ The Hillsborough Hotel. Pours cloudy yellow. Aroma is of wheat, grains and citrus. Flavour is wheat and citrus. Medium bodied and refreshing.

500 mL Bottle poured into a pint glass at home.  Prodigious head as poured straight to remove gas.  Orange yellow foamy beer.  Good wheaty aroma.  Sits well on the palate, but could have a little more flavour.  Its pleasant, but I’ve tasted more striking beers of this type.  Familiarity breeds contempt?  Used to really love this when I first tried it but tasted a lot of other beers since that I prefer...  To be honest I’d rather have a Hoegaarden or Paulaner.

Tap @ Erdinger Bar, Berlin. Pours a hazy orange body with a small white head. Nose is mild with some malts. Subtle hints of wheat, yeast and some citrus. Low carbonation and medium-bodied. Tastes your typical Erdinger: Refreshing, sweet mild banana, and yeast. Erdinger is a classic, mild and refreshing hefeweizen, but in my opinion a bit to mild and blend to be a great weiz.
Hazy orange body, white head. Malty, small hop aroma, really small yeast aroma. No bananas. Taste is slightly roasted malt and yeast. Medium bodied.

I poured the beer from the bottle, german-style, into a weizen glass. The appearance of the beer is different than most hefe-weizens that I have had. This beer appears to be darker…somewhere between a typical hefe-weizen and a dunkle. The aroma is of darker citrus and metal, like a cyborg blood orange. The taste is similar, a little metallic, but not bad, and just a hint of citrus. This hefe-weizen is really enjoyable, very crisp and smooth. The carbonation is not overly done like most wheat brews.

Bottle
Aroma - wheaty 
Appearance - cloudy golden color thick white head
Taste - mild wheat nuttiness
Palate - creamy then caspers on the finish
Overall - drinkable, but not very exciting or memorable
Poured from tap. Faint, faint, faint wheat aroma. Nice cloudy goldenness. Taste is pure foam. None of that wheat or fruit notes you expect from a hefe.

Poured a nice hazy golden with a thick 2 inch white head that had impressive retention and left patchy lacing down the glass. The aroma was shielded by the head and somewhat faint but I could detect the wheat and some trace banana esters. The taste had a solid wheat backbone with the banana tones appearing again. There was a touch of citrus to the taste. There is a bit of bitterness in the finish. I found the mouthfeel a bit thin and watery as I progressed through the beer. It may be a tad bit over carbonated as well. Overall this was a stand up wheat beer and I look forward to another while barbecuing in the summer.

Cloudy golden, with a nice creamy white head. Soft fruity aroma, a little alcoholic. The taste is the classic heffe-weizen, but softer, maybe more citrus than others. Nice and refreshing, but nothing special.
dissapointing;  aroma of citrus  Taste of a light bodied hefe with some banana  waay too thin and bland.  pass

Pale yellow color, small head. Citrus smell with some noticeable wheat tones.  Light and bubbly with a bitter palate and sweet long finish, a little too carbonated for me. But would be a great in the summer.
This is a delicious wheat beer. Pours a cloudy blonde with citrus and banana.
Quite good weizenbier. Maybe a bit thin, still enjoyable. Nice thin top. "Easy" taste.

0,5 l. can from the supermarket. Aroma of yeast and hints of bananas and fruit. Poured deep gold/yellow in colour with a medium-sized , off-white head that lasted throughout. Hazy. Very sparkling, almost in a champagne style. Flavor is lightly sweet and lightly bitter. Tastes of yeast, banana, citrus, slight hops, and a hint of malty sweetness. Medium body. Somewhat thinish, dry body. Average to lively carbonation. Lightly sweet, slightly malty, yeasty finish is dry. It´s a cheap beer (15 DDK/2 EUR) so I did not have high expectations, this one is OK compared to the price

pours pale yellow with a slight hue with a huge head, good retention and lacing. sweet malts, wheat, fruity, some spicyness. lively carbonation - very nice. light to medium body. a lot more boring than i thought it would be though.

Bottle. Mount Albert, Ontario. 
Rock me sexy wiessbeer! Awesome entry from erdinger. Not the best of the best but an altogether great hefe. Big head, great colour. I love the graduated pour. Smooth and sleek going down. Nose is strong. Cloves, orange peel, some lemon. Pure drinkability. Excellent.
11.2 ounces. Wheat, yeast, pale sweet malt aroma. Flavor is pale malts, yeast and grains. A relatively solid wheat beer.

Light yellow beer with big and white head. Aroma is freshly wheatish, bananas and some sourness; typical aroma. Taste is refreshning, wheat, bananas and also some herbal hoppyness; overally quite dry taste. Medium bodied, lots of carbonation, nice to drink. Enough taste, nothing to complain, refreshning and easy hefe.
Cloudy yellow colour with big white head. Aroma is yeasty but not very strong. Nice weiss flavour, not very special.

It´s the exemple of a great Weiss Beer... Smooth, Creamy, Very Tasty, Smells really good and makes you want more...

Simply The Best! EVER!!! If you really wanna make me happy, give me a Erdinger Weiss!

A long time ago this was the first weiss bier I tried and I loved it, although after trying others since, this is not the best, thin in texture and taste and not too many strong flavours this is still an ok beer though

50cl bottle from a local supermarket. It pours a hazy yellowy golden liquid (with some amber tones) with a medium white head that somehow lasts throughout the beer, but leaves no lacing. The aroma is yeasty, with wheat and a little barley malt. It sure does not smell like other hefe-weizen. It tastes different too: some herbal hops appear, then some wheat, but no fruitiness. It is low sweet, a little tart and medium bitter. In the mouth, it feels too carbonated and even a little watery, but it leaves a pleasant dry aftertaste of wheat. A weird one; it is refreshing and goes down well, but fails to be attractive enough. Presentation (bottle and crown cap) is decent.

500ml bottle from LCBO.

Appearance : Vigorous pour yields a cloudy pale yellow beer with a big foamy and creamy white head. Light lacing.


Aroma : Light citrusy hops with light notes of banana and wheat. Light notes of floral hops. Get a bit more bananas on the final pour. Nice malt too.


Taste : Nice yeast and wheat. Light bananas. Finish is quite dry for the style. Carbonation is a bit too fizzy too. Finish is a bit thin but it gets better on the last pour with all the yeast.


Overall : Nice weizen fix but not on par with the better examples of the style. Too thin, too few bananas notes and too shy on the nose. Very drinkable and refreshing. Carbonation gets smoother at the end but it still was too fizzy at first IMHO.
a nice smell of caramel, refreshing taste and a mild finish. great summer beer.

500ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a hazy pale gold with a nice sized white head. Aroma is wheat, lemon, some light spicing. Flavour is wheat, yeast, some spices and light fruits. Very malt forward. Bready mouthfeel, Still, very refreshing. Just not my favourite style.

Cloudy orange with a large white head, that disappears quite fast. Aroma is light wheaty, a bit of banana and light yeasty. Flavor is medium sweet. Soft with a sweet finish. This doesn’t have the very estery aroma that most Bavarian wheat beers have, and that’s a shame. Lacking in both aroma and flavor. 260211

Bottle (500ml): Light smelling with hints of fruit, possibly banana some wheat & citrus traces.   Hazy golden in colour with a large, foamy white head that lasts throughout leaving some lacing.  Very sweet to begin with some nice citrus & fruity notes upfront. There is also a spicy clove flavour mixed with a banana & wheat taste.  Light to medium bodied & quite smooth but not overly making it easy to drink. Lots of carbonation too which tingles the tongue.   A very nice beer to start off proceedings with, light enough & easy to drink. Plenty of flavour & a good blend with decent carbonation. - - - abarwithnoname.wordpress.com
Flaske 50 cl. Diset gul hælde med stor formfast hvid krone. Aroma af svag malt og hvede. Sødelig smag med noter af kiks. Lidt flad mundfornemmelse og afslutning. Ikke en stor hvede øl, men drikkelig
Nice and lemony, this is a great Bavarian style Hefeweissbier comes in a paper box which is nice.

A hazy yellow-grey beer with a traditionally thick and creamy head, though this diminished quickly.  The aroma is of light spices, banana, clove and bread.  These carry into the palate, where one finds a slight tartness and a development of the malts.  The mouth feel is thin with a lively carbonation.  It finishes with an increasing banana fruitiness and a soft touch of malt.  A refreshing if somewhat simple beer.

Typical cloudy pour from bottle with a nice head.  Taste is fairly dull and uninspired, which is disappointing, considering that I love Hefe-Weizen beers.  Far better choices out there for the same price or less.
Pours cloudy yellow, with a frozy head. Aroma of wheat. Flavor of lemon and grassy hops. Palate is light and fizzy from the carbonation. Enjoyable beer, always very drinkable.
500ml bottle in a Weizen glass.  Pours golden with a lacy, white head.  Aroma of dough/bread malts, the weiss yeast, and a very small amount of hops.  Average texture and a decent beer.

Pours a cloudy yellow colour with a frothy white head. Subtle aroma of wheat and fruit. Taste is dry with traces of fruit and spice.  A bit fizzy in the mouth. Overall not an OK Weissbier but not great. I’ve had better.

A sűrű és tartós hab alatt függőleges sávokban esztétikusan gomolyognak az apró élesztődarabok. Finom malátás illata mögött  ott van a határozott de nem túl erős alkohol. Talán az első olyan búzasöröm ami nem az erjedt kukorica szúrós szagára emlékeztet. Kellően szénsavas. Ha komló határozottabban jelen lenne még a kedvencem is lehetne.
Una delle weizen più bevute e conosciute al mondo, è sempre un discreto bere via...

500ml bottle sample purchased at the LCBO. Pours a cloudy yellow, with a large pillowy white head, some decent lacing. Aroma is of wheat and lemon. Taste is sweet and of wheat, lemon and a little hop. Really sweet brew.

Received a mixer pack of beer for Christmas with this in it. Pours a slightly hazy, deep yellow with a large white head that sticks around for a while. Aroma has a modest wheat nose with a light accent of lemon. Flavor starts off with a smooth wheat presence which quickly moves into a light grassy hops note and lots of lemon. Light density, very high carbonation creates a bit of a sharp feeling. Overall pretty good brew. Great for the warmer weather.
Slightly hazy gold pour.  Aroma of banana, grain and yeast.  Pretty standard hefe flavor.  Okay, but meh....

This poured a cloudy darker yellow color with a white head. Aroma was of light spices and some yeast. Flavor was very subdued and bland, but mainly yeast and some clove notes. Not the greatest example of the style.

500ml bottle. Light golden pour with a huge frothy head that lasts damn near forever. Mildly spicy on the nose with a solid wheat presence and a little fruit. There’s a real bubblegum feel on the palate with a lot of effervescence but a really dull finish.
Very solid and light drinking hefeweizen withlight notes of mushy banana and perhaps some clove. Very refreshing summer beer, nothing more and not really less.
Bottle shared with the wife. Light barnyard in the nose, breads, banana and slight bubblegum in the sip. A nice hefe!

Tasted on tap in Vail, Colorado. Pours a hazy yellow orange appearance with a nice foamy white head. Citrusy, yeasty, wheat-like nose. Body is a little more citrusy and a little less banana-like than most German Hefeweizen. Body is a little thin. There are better German wheat beer out there.
Bottle. Quite chilled. Cloudy like most wheat beers. Similar to a Hoegaarden, but maybe less citrus.

Világossárga szín, szűretlensége ellenére nem is olyan zavaros megjelenéssel. Hófehér habja igencsak méretes, de hamar leapad. Illatában, amely lehetne jóval karakteresebb is, megtalálhatóak az éretlen banán, mandarin és az édeskés búzamaláta illatjegyei. Az íze sem túlságosan erőteljes, banán, zöld alma, mandarin és kevés szerecsendió, na meg egy enyhe élesztőízt fedeztem fel benne. Lecsengése keserédes, egész hosszan tartó utóíze pedig búzamalátás és trópusi gyümölcsös. Lehetne sokkal kerekebb a történet, az ünnepi búzájuk emlékezeteim szerint egy sokkal jobban sikerült főzet.

Shared with steptin.  Cloudy yellow, large bubbles in the head, which dissipated quickly.  Light flavor, but banana and bubble gum appear more after letting it linger on my tongue, rather than when I taste it.  Not bad.

Beer poured a cloudy pale yellow. Aroma of lemon, clove, spices and bread. Taste was spicy with cloves. Slightly sour with a clean peppery finish, dry. Mouthfeel was slightly astringent. Light in body. I longed for a little more sweetness from this beer. It was good but not outstanding.

A little biased here - had several of these during my last trip to Europe; Cloudy yellow/gold color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of wheat, clove, & light citrus; Flavor of wheat, some yeast, clove, bananas, and citrus; Fairly well balanced; Overall, not the best hefeweizen - but I enjoyed it.
Bottle 50 cl. Cloudy pale orange colour with a white head. Aroma is slightly citrus and banana. Flavour is more wheat than banana. A bit dry.

Cloudy honeyish pale yellow. Fruits dominated by citrus and some malt in the aroma. Tastes of spice, citrus, bread and yeast. Refreshing and crisp mouthfeel, and a nice, vaguely bitter finish. A good brew.

Aroma is fairly firm, wheaty and yeasty with a faint sweet citrus undertone. It pours a slightly hazy golden hellow with a thick, rather persistent cream off-white head. You have to pour this one properly! Yeasty, fruity and malty flavor is quite pleasing and enjoyable. Smooth, rather tingly texture leaves a lasting fizz.
