Rating 448, bottle that Amer had bought somewhere 
 


A really beautiful looking beer. An opaque straw-coloured beer with a high cream-like head - a real weizen-look. The aroma is dissapointing though, some grain and oatmeal is everything I can get out of this. Flavor is wheat, grain and straws ending in a medium bitter finish - quite average wheatbeer. Easily creamy palate. This must be the standard of hefeweizens.
Nice creamy white head. Aromas of bananes, fruits, spices and cereals. A good weissbier, but not the best.
Yellow orange unclear beer with nice head.Light weiss but easydreaking,Light taste and smell.Sweet,yeast,vanilia,light spices and banana.A weiss with lager feeling.
Aroma is lacking - slightly citrus and wheat.  Taste is fairly weak malt with banana and wheat flavors.  Finish is a little sour.  Fairly unmemorable Hefeweizen.
Slightly hazy golden, smaller white head... Aroma of banana clove in a very mild way... Slightly spicy flavor with notes of wheat... Lively, light body, dry dry dry finish...

Poured a hazy orange color with a bubbly white head.  Aroma has lots of oranges and is slightly tart.  Some yeast and wheat is noticeable but not as much as other hefeweizens.  Taste has wheat and orange with some bread.  Not really much banana or other yeast flavors.  Slightly tart fruitiness in the finish.  Overall very refreshing but not one of my favorite hefeweizens.

Bij de lokale slijterij zag ik al vaker mensen met kratten Erdinger sjouwen. Nu dan ook zelf een keer mogen proeven bij een vriend. Het is een lekker witbiertje, zo’n echt duitse troebele! Heerlijk voor een Duitse avond  .

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a Samuel Adams Perfect Pint glass. Best before end: 07-2011 printed on label.

Appearance: Pours a cloudy pale golden color with a 3 finger fizzy white head.

Smell: Lemon, clove and yeast. Not as sweet as I expect from a hefeweizen.

Taste: Bitter citrus up front followed by a dry malt flavor in the middle and ending with mild spices and wheat. Finish is fairly dry and somewhat bitter. The typical banana and clove flavors are missing and this degrades the overall flavor.

Mouthfeel: Light-to-medium-bodied with a high amount of carbonation.

Drinkability: Decent drinkability. There is a bit too much carbonation and the flavor doesn’t do too much for me.

Overall: Average beer. Nothing to write home about and definitely loses style points for missing the key banana and clove notes in the flavor. I wouldn’t recommend this beer but it isn’t the worst option out there.

Bottle. Cloudy yellow body, head vanishes within a few minutes. Somewhat weak aroma. Palate is thin, taste has some wheatiness but not much fruity nor spicy aspects. It is dangerously close to being bland.

Originally rated July 2005. Erdinger Weissbier pours a beige-yellow colour with some cloudiness. The fizzy-cream white head has good retention, leaving slowly great lacing. The nose is bitterness with wheat, but mild. The taste is also mild, with wheat, bitterness and a Perrier mouthfeel. Not really bad, but not one of my favorites either.

Yellow-orange colour with a frothy white head. Herbal, yeast and citrus aroma. Lightly sour, citric and light sweet in the taste, it gets round flavour in the mouth at first strike but then turns a bit flat. Light body I would say, and a light bitter after taste. Ok.

Bottle. Smells of satsumas and lemon zest. Cloudy yellow-orange colour. Decent head. Frothy mouth feel with a hint of buzz on the tongue. I’m drinking this at about 5 degrees centigrade which I understand from a quick search on google is about right but... at that temperature all the flavour’s gone (assuming it had any in the first place). It’s like a drinking slightly orange-citric froth. There’s a hint of bitterness in there somewhere but it neither dominates or lasts. The after taste is slightly pithy or soapy. It’s very easy drinking, quite refreshing but ultimately unmemorable.
Fra flaske, dejlig aroma, flot flot hvidt skrum højt skum...dejlig weissbier ! medium fylde. Dejlig Øl!
Tap. Good one. Aromas of citrus, and banana. Taste was sweet, with a touch of bitterness. Palate was velvety, with a medium body. Dark yellow, cloudy, with a frohy head.

I hate to repeat myself but this is nearly identical as the Tucher. I had both tonight. This was just a tad better. Pored from a 1 pint bottle into a Weisse glass. looks and pored like a hefe should - hazy gold with lasting head - nose of yeast, peach,- this one is a fairly clean and refreshing version of the style, lacking the dense yeastiness that most hefes have - however, this also means it lacks character, and that it is almost watery at times - lemony tartness and light floral notes enhance its light, refreshing nature. A good hefe but it’s no Weihenstephaner or Haker -Pschorr. Still good overall.
Hazy yellow colered brew. Yeasty, spiced, citrus in the nose. Flavor has citrus, yeast, some herbs. Overall a pleasant brew.
Bought in Schwedt/DE. Great weisen beer with a nice luquid a passion taste. Recommended!

Pours a cloudy dirty gold with a touch of white head. Nose is weak with a little banana and generic sweetness. Flavor is wheaty with a little hazelnut, banana, and hops, especially on the backside. Finish is sticky and bittersweet. Typical hefe-weizen.

Aroma of wheat, lemongrass, light clove and banana. Appearance was cloudy gold with off white head. Flavor matches the nose; the banana was not as apparent as other Hefe’s. Palate is creamy. Just felt like an average Hefe for me.

12oz bottle, pours like a good hefe with a large, white, foamy head.  Nice citrusy aroma, not overpowering.  Light gold / yellowish color.  Mild taste, a little sweet, but refreshing.  Medium body, avg carbonation, clean finish.  A pleasant hefe, but I prefer Paulaner.
500 ml bottle a hazy yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts banana and some bitterness taste malts banana citrus some spices and hops

50 cL bottle from the LCBO, served in a weizen glass. Pours hazy golden with a tall white head. The head slowly fades and leaves no lace. On the nose, there are aromas of yeast, wheat, citrus and a touch of clove. The flavour is moderately sweet throughout with a slight acidity and a touch of hop bitter towards the end. The finish is average in length and slightly hoppy-citrusy. On the palate, it is light-medium in body with a milky texture and soft carbonation. Overall, this is a passable but not spectacular hefeweizen. The head has poor retention and the nose is small and simple. The taste is acceptable but not very complex. 2010-09-01
Gold hazy looking with a persistant yhin head. Fruit, citrus and lollies in the aroma. A little hop bitterness coming through the fairly high carbonation. Thinish mouthfeel. Meh hefe.
Very cloudy, dark yellow, very tall head.  Aroma mostly of grain and yeast.  Very strong bubblegum taste and a clean, carbonated finish.  Still, another hefe-weizen in a whole field of ’em.
500ml bottle.  Pours a hazy dark lemon with a medium head.  Aroma is sharp lemon, some yeast and nuts.  Lemon starts on the tongue, yeasty in the middle, with a sharp, strong bitter finish.

Bottle Mike’s Haus, Santa Teresa, Rio de Janeiro. Pours golden, a little cloudy, with thick white head, well presented by restaurant. Typical grainy aroma of a hefe, Taste as expected of a beer of this style. Rating relects my relief to find an escape from the dull Brazilian macro lagers. Mike’s Haus a little haven of pleasure. On the Bonde line.
OKay German weisse. Expected pour, tastes of wheat and grass, and little overcarbonated and not exactly refreshing
Light gold, strong fluffy white head, full and proud with the strong carbonation.  Light honey wheat aroma.  Little bubble gum character, soft wheat, sweet and tasty, full bodied.
Cloudy pale yellow gold colour with a frothy white head,Nice sweet malt, honey, lemon, grass and wheat flavors. Silky feel with a crisp finish. Very nice!

Bottle from Systembolaget.

I think this is a rather uggly and dull hefe, Weihenstephaner is a much better choice.
Hazygolden with white head - wheat in the aroma - tastes of wheat, hints of yeast and spice - good beer

Sampled from 12 oz. bottles at Chicago Beer Society’s Deutchland Uber Ales & Lagers event. Poured a hazed, straw/light yellow, with a billowy, off white head, and clingy, wavy lacing. The aroma was light grain, light syrupy sweetness, some citrus as lemon, and light spice. The flavor was similar, along with low hop bitterness, and effervescent carbonation in a rather light body. Not the typical banana and clove duo, which was refreshing to me. A light, sessionable, warm weather brew, but nice any time.

Bottle--Pours a cloudy yellow with a super, large head if you are not careful.  Aroma was citrus(y) with a bready base.  Wheat flavoring with more citrus taste than what you expected, but the flavor wasn’t too overwhelming.  Become the summer of ’10 beer.  Produce Place.

The flavour  should consist of a wheat beer style but it seems to stray a little from the style. It is low on the wheat. I get some a lot of citrus note’s coming through and a little banana.  Not a huge amount of hops but at the same time a little spicy for the style

The aroma is nothing special. I found there was nothing that really stands out on the nose.

Pours a cloudy straw colour with some orange hue’s. It has a nice creamy white head and some spotty lacing that tends to stick around for awhile. A good solid amount of carbonation in this one.

The finish has a spiciness taste that tends to linger on the palate.  Not a bad wit beer but I have had better.

Lightly orange coloured. Cloudy medium big head. Should hold some longer... Not good yeast-citrus, lightly spiced smell. Don’t like it. Should smell some harder, really hard to smell a thing. Hard to taste also. Some spices and fruits and wheat... Taste unflavoured, not a good beer for me. Drinkeable if very thirsty...

Bottle-  Most of the beer was poured in to a proper logo glass. The last bit was swished around the bottle before being poured directly into the glass with gusto to create a head. The head slowly disappears but with some traces around the edge due to the carbonation. The color was a hazy gold and the smell was primarily grainy. The taste was crisp with a bitter edge. The feel was light with much carbonation and the finish seems a bit rough not really refreshing as I hoped. Still a good beer and change from all the pilsners.
Bottle from Whole Foods for the low price of 2.99. This is a nice clean and crisp heffe-weizen...im surprised that i have never rated it before because im sure i’ve enjoyed it prior.

Színe ködös (arany)sárga, habja szép tömött, mely lassan esik össze, szénsavassága élénk/pezsgő.
Illata egy nem túl intenzív gabonás, gyümölcsös.
Nagyon picit csípősen kezd, íze körtére/almára emlékeztet.
Aromájában semmi szegfűszeg vagy egyéb fűszeres(ebb) hatások nem érezhetők, csupán a gabonamaláták és némi citrusosság vannak jelen édes karakterében.
Befejezése is édeskés és végül száraz, mely után semmi nem marad, rosszindulatúan akár azt is írhatnám, hogy jellegtelen a végkifejlete.
Teste könnyű, emiatt könnyen csúszik.
Összességében ill. önmagában nézve nem nevezhető egy rossz búzasörnek, de azért jobbra számítottam...
50 cl can, pours a nice golden with a solid white head, aroma is banana like, taste is pretty plain banana/wheat, very abrupt finish, refreshing but boring.

A hazy yellow colored beer, with a big foamy white head. The aroma of some fruits like banana and touches of citrus. Wheat and yeast notes. The taste of a little fruit with wheat. Some sweet and a small bitter. The aftertaste is flat, sweet and in the back some bitter.

Guy’s check this out! I don’t mean the beer?  Attach the PREMIUM to anything and you can almost guarantee that it’s made for mass consumption. now this beer isn’t bad but it is nowhere near the best Hefeweizen. It’s a good regular drinker.  

Aroma:  next to none. 
Appearance: light but decent
Taste: too light
Palate: wouldn’t offend a baby....maybe this is what they feed German babies. ha ha
Overall: good but weak
Erdinger’s classic is to weissbiers what Carlsberg is to pilsener: plain, mediocre and always ok on a hot summer’s day, but never anything outstanding.

0,5L bottle poured into weissbier glass. Hazy yellow color with a lovely white, dense, head. This beer smells and tastes like ripe bananas with some other fruits and the taste of malted wheat lingering in the background. I love the fact that this beer is bottle conditioned. I imagine that you if stock this one for a year or two, a whole range of amazing tastes will develop. Erdinger Weissbier (bottle conditioned), is a premium example of this classic Bavarian beer style.

Bottle. I love wheat beers but this one didn’t impress very much. Poured a cloudy yellow with a substantial white head. Wheaty and yeasty nose with faint spices. Flavor was lightly sweet with more wheat and yeast, as well as some apple fruitiness. Light to mediumin body with average carbonation. Finishes relatively crisp and smooth. Not bad, but not great.
Drank a while ago at l’Autre Oeil. One of the MANY that I lost my notebook... As I recall, that one was pretty much : Standard Hefe Weizen. Bland. Oh well, I’ll give it another shot someday.

Tap:
Nice big frotty head, disappears quick.
Smell is mix of malts, fruit (orange and some yellow fruit), hops and hints of water and yeast.
Color is hazy yellow.
Hops and malts nicely balanced with good touch of yeast, fruit and spices/herbs.
Slightly bitter very refreshing.

Bottle. A good color and head on this Austrian hefe weizen. Average aroma, not very fragrant, but there. Good taste, although not really special at all. Rich malt, banana undertones, seems to me like a good, very typical hefe weizen.

Bottle.

Hazy golden with a large white head.

Aroma and taste of citrus, yeast, spices, some banana. Shortly aftertaste, however, quite refreshing. There are better tasting wheat beers.

Pours hazy orange with a large white head; aroma is sweet citrusy, malty and wheaty with hints of banana and glue; flavor is sweet citrusy, malty and yeasty with light bitter and sour touch in the finish; light banana sweetness in the aftertaste; quite full-bodied, soft carbonation. The aroma isn’t really that inviting, but then the flavor turns out to be one of the maltiest - and, for me, best.

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy yellow with a frothy white head that disappeared quickly.  Nose has some apple and citrus, with hints of wheat and yeast.  Taste is watery, some wheat, slight spice.  Refreshing but nothing exciting.
Bottle.  Cloudy yellow, big fluffy white head.  Aroma of wheat.  Light body, flavors of wheat and malt.  Uninteresting and a bit simple.

500ml bottle. Pours like a typical weizen: cloudy pale gold, with a pillowy, lasting head. This does make it a little difficult to pick the aroma, but there are both grass and banana notes present. The taste starts with some spicy German hops, and quickly moves into typical weizen territory - sweet and fruity. There are some weak banana flavours in the finish. This is little more than a standard weizen. Nothing bad, but it isn’t exactly inspiring either.
Bottle from Morrisons supermarket. Hazy golden pour with a thick white head. Aroma of spice, malt, banana. Tastes similar, banana, apple, citrus, spice. Pleasant enough but lacking in complexity.
Had at Erdinger restaurant in Erding.  Good but not my favorite in this style.  Less complex than others. Serving: Tap
Very good beer,very refreshing and with a quite strong tase.It’s aroma is intriguing.
Hazy golden, thick creamy white head, foamy lacing.  Notes of yeast, banana, citrus, and spice.  Taste reflects aroma.  Medium-bodied and well balanced.  Excellent hefeweizen.
E’ difficile trovare una weizen meno bananosa di questa Erdinger. Molto meglio la cugina Pikantus, almeno sa di qualcosa
Refrigerated bottle poured into weizen glass.  Pours a hazy light orange with nice off-white head.  Taste is wheat, banana, and citrus.
Cloudy yellow pour with a thick foamy white head. Scent is malts. Taste is sweet malt.
Large sized white foamy head with strong lacing. Aroma is malty and fruity and not very estery.

Pours hazy light golden with fluffy off white head. Fruity (bananas) and yeasty aroma. Rich yeasty and grainy flavor. Fruity and crisp on palate. Finishes short with slightly yeasty and hoppy aftertaste.

16.9 oz. bottle- Pours cloudy golden with a beautiful white head, aroma is of yeast wheat  and somewhat citrusy. The taste is very mellow and subdued, not the most flavorful German hefe I’ve had, and probably the blandest. This is still way better than any American made hefe I’ve had ( with the exception of Sierra Nevada Kellerweis) but there are better German hefeweizens on the market.

On tap at a German restaurant.  Enjoyed it very much.  Poured a light, only moderately cloudy, yellow.   Had a citrus-y aroma with a sweet, bread-like undertone.  Had siginificant carbonation and, if not poured correctly, would foam up like crazy.   Taste had notes of citrus, wheat, and caramel and was extremely refreshing.
Pours golden copper with nice creamy white head. Nose and taste of fruits, lemongrass and wheats. Rated 12/28/99

tap @ kulminator with slice of lemon

head: foamy large

colour: hazy blond

smell: nothing special actually , thin watery , cold

taste: refreshing , yeasty , slight hops , the lemon slice ads some bitternes to it witch is good i think , otherwise there would be very few taste in it...

but very enjoyable as starter/refrescher of a hot beertasting day

Draught at La Brasserie in Montreux (CH). Pale and milky blond with beautiful white foam. Smell of sweet wheat, spices, yeast, fruity, typical of the kind. It is creamy, fragant spices yeasted, touches of bread, banana and marshmallow, tip of lemon. Beer pleasant, digestible and supple.
Light golden body, very carbonated, fluffy head.  Slightly carbonated, sweet and toasty aroma, rather light.  Sweet light body, not particularly complex.  A mediocre beer.

Pale yellow color with a disappearing white head. Aroma: yeast, fruit, peach, pineapple, hops. Taste: wheat, yeast, coriander, low sweetness, dry, fruity, a little bit of alt. A little thin. High carbonation. Ok weissbier.
Bottle. Color very cloudy dark yellow with a white head. Aroma of apples and spice. taste is fruity with bitter sour finish. I like this beer.
33 cl bottle. Pours hazy golden color, Medium fruity aroma and taste, medium body, fresh fruity finish.
Tap @ Spitfire as a warm up for Djurgårdens IF fantastic win over Trelleborg. A clean but quite anonymous hefe. Notes of fruit and yeast.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden yellow with a large white head. Aroma of sweet banana, wheat and citrus fruit. Banana, wheat and spice show through in the flavour, but all only at low levels. Slighty grainy with some lingering bitterness. Not very fruity and not the best example of the style.

Bottle. Pours a golden, light hazy beer with a good white head. Good aroma with hints of a typical German Weizen beer. Had some better ones with a better taste. Not much flavours there. Gets better along the way with hints of banana in the aftertaste. Decent but not great.

Good reintroduction to Weissbier. From the bottle at JDW Acton.  Looks good, big fluffy head, nice and pale. Good aroma little citrus and skunk, repeats in the flavour. Easy to drink, nothing radical and good to give to a beginner.

In short: A bland dry yeasty german hefe.

How: Bottle 500ml.  Consumed fresh a few weeks after purchase.  As fresh as it can be in North-America

The look: Partly cloudy yellow-blonde body topped by a medium white head with good retention

In long: Very light aroma of banana peels.  Taste is on the very light side.  Basic flavors of dried bananas, dry wheat, a bit of lemon.  The wheat flavour is very much reminiscent my breakfast cereals Shredded Whreat™.  The strong yeast signature becomes a bit annoying.  Something dusty dry in there (yeast?).   Body is airy and a bit fluffy.  This is a hefe with a real industrial feeling.  Not much to hate about it and not much to like either.  This is not something I need to drink ever again, especially considering that any store that sells this beer usually has the much much much superior Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier sitting right next to it.  Erdinger is just not a brewery for me, not only are their beer bland but also half the beer they make are German Hefeweizen, a style that I find about as sexy as TaktikMTL in a thong.

Slight hazy orange pour, medium off white head. 
Aroma of citrus, spices, herbs and some fruit.
Flavour has a medium bitterness of hops, quite fresh, with subtle sweet fruity smoothness. Nice simple hefe.

Provata in bottiglia da 50 cl.
Aspetto ottimo, colore giallo oro e schiuma spessa e corposa. Molto aromatica e profumata: il sentore di banana prevale sugli altri. Buona e abbastanza corposa risulta piacevole al palato. Un finale normale ma di gusto.

Pours a pretty standard light orange body with a white head. Smell is mild and citrus-dominated, with some floral notes and hints of barnyard yeast. Taste is equally mild; doughy and smooth with small hints of banana and citrus but far below most hefeweizens. Kinda bland, all in all, but still drinkable and refreshing. With all its commercial success, Erdinger hefeweizen feels like the "standard" weissbier, and works fine as a referance beer towards judging others of the same style.

Subpar hefeweizen. I don’t know if this beer is incredible at the brewery or something, but I don’t really get it as is. It lacks nearly all of the wonderful wheat flavors of the best entires in the style. On the other hand, this beer doesn’t look bad at all. It’s a hazy light golden color with a good head. The smell is underwhelming, and the flavor is worse. It has funny off notes that almost take like cheap adjuncts. I imagine the beer is all wheat and barley, but the flavors just aren’t there.  It’s not really an awful beer, but there are some great German hefeweizens out there with excellent distribution.

Probably my second German Hefeweizen experience way back in the day was the Erdinger Hefeweizen. That was quite a few years ago, and since then I have supped many an authentic German hefeweizen and many an equal German-style hefeweizen. In that time inbetween, I never revisited the Erdinger Hefeweizen, that is, until now. A few weeks prior, I brought home a bottle of Erdinger to see if memories are indeed sepia-colored and all is not as I remember.




A slow pour reveals pale straw, hay, and yellowish hues rather unassuming for a German hefeweizen. Near the end of the bottle, I make sure to swirl the last little bit vigorously along the bottom to gather up any yeasty dregs of delight that have settled. One last pour and a creamy white head greets skeptical eyes. This is one of the lightest German hefeweizens I have gazed upon, and as I partake of her nose, one of the lesser aromatic ones also. Very mild, I dig deep to search for any endearing characteristics. Eventually I unearth lemon cream, raw meringue, and white bread flowing underneath a meager showing of clove and banana. I happen to be a huge fan of robust German hefeweizens, and at this very moment, I am none-too-impressed. It’s proven science that our nose can detect far more in aroma and thusly flavor than our tastebuds can, so such a faint nose does not bode well for her palate. After a couple generous quaffs I have come to the distinct conclusion that I am in for a whole lot of nothing. A very light mouthfeel and body is matched perfectly by a very light array of hefeweizen flavors. Mild banana bread puffs in the finish while the middle is mild banana cream topped with old cloves and raw whipped meringue. Digging deeper, lemon cake joins her shadowy brethren with equal despair. Wholly underwhelming, I still finish the Erdinger Hefeweizen because, while she may be weak-willed and mild-mannered, she is far from a drain-pour.




Memories are indeed most endearing when lingering in the sepia recesses of one’s mind, at least, in regards to Erdinger, but at the same time, it was nice to revisit one of the progenitors of my destined journey. Even still, beer is beautiful.
0,5 liter Can. Light banana taste. White foam with medium sweetness and it is lightly bitter. Good beer on a hot summerday.

Bottle, 500ml. Pours a murky golden colour, typical hefewizen. Aroma is citrics and some earthy malts. Taste has notes of banana. sweet malts, wheat and spices. Plenty of carbonation, almost no bitterness. Average.

Erdinger Weissbrau Brauerei	Erdinger WeiSBier-2004 16.9 oz. Bottle.    5.25% ABV--15 IBU’s.?  (4.0 / 5.0)  Hefeweizen.  Big foamy mild lace head.  Small tight BC pellicle.  Light wheat spice hop front.  Very clean smooth Hefe creamy mild wheat spice citrus body.  Mild cloying sweet mild hop end.  No Bavarian Accent or Stank.  Sampled 10/18/2004.

Erdinger Weissbrau Privatbrauerei--WeiSBier--2006 16.9 oz. Bottle.  5.30% ABV--15 IBU’s.?  (4.25 / 5.0)  Hefeweizen--Foamy lacy head.  Cloudy rich lemon yellow color.  Rich Bavarian wheat spice Hefe front.  Tangy malty wheat body.  Tangy tasty wheat spice refreshing clean end.  Sampled 10/22/2006.

Smooth and quaffable.  Nice light citrus flavors. Hops really not noticeable so leans towards an enjoyable, sweeter character.  Beutiful coloring - like sunshine in a glass.  Nice lacing.
Had again on tap in Berlin.  MUCH better.  As above, had great body, long malt finish.  Sweet but still refreshing

A subtle Hefe Weissbier, though fizzy in some glasses and flat in others. You have that classic Bavarian flavors of clove and banana, but somewhat muted in this refined brew. Paler than some of this variety. Nice aroma. A bit less robust than I like.

Bottles from Tesco & Lebanese Restaurant, Nainz. Draught in Berlin. Mild sweet banana & straw aroma.  Cloudy ochre yellow colour with good head.  Sweet and sour flavour with suggestion of banana. Smooth & good on palate.  Not much aftertaste.  Applies to bottle. Draught has much better flavour with more aftertaste.

I’ve tried over 50 unique beers now, and I keep coming back to this one as one of my favorites.  Nice golden color, light bodied, good tasting, though perhaps not as complex as the Hefe-Weizen from Franziskaner.

Pours a cascading cloudy straw yellow with a good white head. Aromas of tropical and citrus fruits.  Tastes of harvest wheat with lemon accent, with a herbal note on finish.  A very nice Hefe but probably not the best.

Re-Rate:  Had the opportunity to try this again, added +1 to toaste and +1 overall.  Still a very nice beer!

Another one from my dad’s beers from around the world series.  Not a bad beer really, but not bold enough for weisse.  It tastes more like a light lager with just a hint of weisse flavor.  Pretty decent and drinkable, but not really where it should have been according to the style it claims to be.
Wheaty, farm aromas.  Pale-gold, moderately hazey with ok head.  Light bodied, not much in spiciness, just a clean drinking hefe.

Bottle from the LCBO. 

Pours a cloudy golden color with a quick dissipating head.  I mainly get citrus on the smell and not alot else..  No banana and not much spice surprisingly, if you went by appearance you would expect it.  This is good but I prefer others..  Still nice to grab a bottle or two at a time.

Pale golden yellow color that pours a bubbly white head with a lightly cloudy liquid.  Not much of an aroma. Suprised by the taste, not much banana - wouldnt not have guessed that it was a Hefe Weizen. Lightly medium sweetness with medium bitterness with a light saltyness blended in.  Decently balanced, but not as well as many other hefewizens.  Medium body, but less than expected (and wanted) Lightly oily texture.  Unfortineuately abrupt finish.  Decent hefe had much better

Pours a cloudy gold with a fluffy white head. Was surprised that this was a hefe- certainly didn’t taste like many i’ve tried. Would say its almost more of a pilsner, actually. Crisp flavor, short finish with a litter bitter
Hazy yellow with a huge head. Aroma of wheat, bubblegum, perfume and yeast. Sweet wheat flavours but also a dry metallic feeling too. A bit boring compared to other hefeweizen.

500ml from Goody Goody.  Pours a hazy, dark yellow body with a fizzy, quickly dissipating head.  Aroma is lightly spicy and bready malt.  Flavor is light sweetness, some spicyness and a negligible hint of banana in the finish.  Medium mouthfeel and a mild bitter(?), short finish.   Not very hefe-ish.
Almost immortal foamy head. Mild soft fruit smell and taste and very soft palette. A small amount of bitterness to round it off. Really easy to drink.

Pours a cloudy yellow with a white foamy head. Aroma is mainly citrus, less on the banana and clove. Flavour follows accordingly, with a smooth, but lacking in character, palate. Good, but one of the weaker German hefs.

Pours hazy orange/pale amber with fading white head.
Nose shows faint bready wheat with hints of lemon. No cloves or banana. Almost boring.
Similar flavours (weak) though the wheat makes more of an impact.
Too much carbonation.
0,5 liter fles. Dit is niet de beste weizzen dir ik gedronken heb. Het voelde niet echt als weizzen.
toast, appel aroma,yellow,cloudy, white foam, light sweetness, short finish,medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation.

Pours a hazy dark yellow with a thick, foamy white head. Aroma is slightly spicy and with average pilsner malts and somehow reminds me of a Belgian tripel. The flavor is slightly watery, a bit spicy and quite medicinal. Slightly bittersweet but also a bit stingy in the nose, not like most German hefeweizens I have had. Decent carbonation and a nice creamy texture still makes this a well drinkable brew.

Pours golden straw color with a large white head. The aroma is wheat, yeast and a little citrus. The flavor is not really what I expected as I am not really getting much banana and clove. I am getting citrus fruit as well as wheat and yeast. Light to medium mouthfeel and highly carbonated. Slightly disappointing overall.

Classic hazy gold/ white head appearance, although the head didn’t last all that long. Smells and tastes very wheaty. Some citrus and clove aromas, but really quite plain. No fruit flavours. Less sweet than most in this style. Typical carbonated mouthfeel. Slightly bitter finish. Pretty bland.

Bottle at the Skyview Bar in the Burj Al Arab in Dubai - way overpriced but that’s that place for you. The aroma isn’t so great, has that detergent smell that I don’t enjoy about some weissbiers. Look is very smooth, a cool mix between a regular beer and a brighter wheatbeer, along with a solid foam on top. The flavour is a complex blend, not all wheat, not all other stuff, and you can pull out attention to detail in this one. It’s a unique and memorable weissbier.

bottle @ the Cornerstone in Cork, nice weisbier, good representation of the style, strong wheat taste. good pour, was a little too carbonated, took a few minutes to pour into a weissen glass, good color and flavor, if this is your first foray into the heffeweisens its a good place to start.

Draught at John Scott’s Stable 2016-12-16
New rating 3,4 old 3,9

2007-04-25, Göteborg, bottle (in the right glass - bought in Kiel 1995 :-))
AP: heavy white thick head, golden coloured body
AR/F: yeast, wheat, citrus and banana

Cloudy golden with white frothy head. It was actually clear at first, but I swirled the remaining 1/2 dl or so to add the fall-out. Faint spicy aroma. Taste is bitter, sweet and a bit metallic. Light to medium bodied with a dry texture and lively carbonation.

Bottle from Wine and Cheese Place in Clayton.  Pours a somewhat cloudy orange-gold color with a big off-white head that dissipates in about 2 minutes.  Aroma is mostly lemon citrus, alhough the banana-clove-wheat hefe aroma is there, with notes of candy sugar and peppery spices.  Wheaty flavor, with notes of malt, citrus, pepper, hops, and banana.  Mouthfeel and body are lighter than expected, with active carbonation but less malt than expected.  Not bad, but not exciting.
Bottle from the father in law. A mostly unimpressive Hefe with the standard notes. Not real sure I can elaborate on this any more than the other 1000 ratings.
Bottle. Light orange pour. White head. Mainly wheat on the nose. Taste is a little atypical for a hefeweisen - not much for clove, etc. But very drinkable.
Taste’s more like a light beer than a Hefe.  Very little wheat or malt, thin overall flavor.  Pours typical gold, but not cloudy.  Total absence of yeast.  No real foam or head to it.  Bland overall.

A nice bottle pour, hazy/translucent, heavy head that dissipated after a few minutes. Moderate carbonation. A slight citrus aroma with hints of bubblegum and bananna. Not typical in Hefe taste.....actually has more of a clean wheat malt punch with more of a hops finish than I typically find in this style....not much in the citrus/spice taste department. Finishes clean and refreshing. A nice brew, very satisfying. The unexpected was actually surprising and good.

hazy gold, smooth med-body, ^head, ^co2.



aroma: bright fruit, very wheaty, complex ester mix with a banana note.



taste: sweet-wheat §malty §hoppy T1, wheat T2, wheat yeast T3, hoppier Tf.



a very good wheat beer, good straightforward flavor. Nice esters. Less dry and more complex esters than paulaner, hacker-pschorr, or weihenstephaner. 

 

------- 


Aroma is sweet , fruity, and complex. There’s oak, bubblegum, strawberry, and watermelon. 

Appearance is hazy gold. 

Taste is bright and fruity, with everything in the aroma carrying through. There’s a musty funkiness in there too, along with some stale malt and minerality. 

Body is medium-full and fairly creamy.

In bottle; golden in color. Taste of citrus, followed by spice and very subtle banana. An OK weissbier, just OK. Not as good as other german selections available. Oct 3rd (Update)-tried again, I enjoyed it more this time (maybe it was a better bottle). I would still say there are better German weisse beers available though

Bottle at blind tasting 5/09.  Pours clear bubbly yellow with white head.  Incredibly mild aroma and I can’t get anything.  Flavor is mild and sweet, with a touch of sour citrus.  Extremely lively, with an off-flavored long finish.  Worst pour of the evening with 11 other hefes
0.5l bottle. Rocky head with good lacing. Hazy golden color. Malty and citrus aroma. Wheat (not too much) and yeast flavor, slightly sweet. Medium body, lively carbonation. Refreshing beer.

bottle - poured dark gold with white frothy head, very lively carbonation. The nose was a bit muted with nothing really standing out, there was a bit of spice and citrus with only the fiantest hint of banana. Nothing very notable in the taste either, quite typical.....average Weisse
Pours moderate golden hazy with a good sized white rocky head. Aroma of yeast and citrus. Taste is light sweet, some easy citrus and yeast. Easy drinkable.

smells yeasty, alcoholic,  it is golden hazy with a thick white head that lasts. a little banana bread taste, sweet for a weisse, not sour at all. very good body, creamy, medium. a little too sweet really.

Pours hazy yellow with a white head.  Nose is bread, citrus, lemon, and sweetness with more citrus behind it.  Flavor is similar with bready, citrusy sweet finish.  Fizzy beer, nice weizen and flavorful and sessionable.  A stalwart beer.

12 oz. bottle from Total Wine in Chesapeake.  Hazy yellow pour with a thick white head.  Banana, clove, apple, and pear aroma.  Good wheat flavor, banana, bubblegum, and cloves.  Nothing citrusy, just a solid hefeweizen.  I thought this was very good.

Another one I’ve had more times than I can remember on tap and bottle. Good, but not the top of the heap. Pours cloudy yellow with decent white head. Not a big aroma, but some bananna, honey and yeast. Taste of bananna and yeast, and spices. Boday is  a bit thin.

Pours a moderately hazy (for a hefe) pale gold with a 3 finger chunky, white head that fades to a skim after a couple of minutes and holds for a few more. Aroma is sweet malt, toasted grain, floral notes, a little raw yeast, lemon and mineral notes. Flavor is sweet wheat bread, raw yeast, light mineral notes, some lemon, a little metal, light raw yeast and stale white toast. Palate is medium bodied, with a light ot moderate carbonation and a slick/sticky feel that is more like the stickiness that comes from pork fat than that of sugar content, weird. Not a very good hefe on any level, but still isn’t undrinkable.
Rather bland and disappointing. Pours a nice golden color, but lacks an impressive aroma or flavor.
Nicely cloudy orange-yellow with a lumpy pure white foam. Aroma is empty, metallic, some coriander. Taste is oranges, coriander, some wheat for body, but a bit thin.

from tap@kulminator. Served with a  lemon in a ridiculous glass. White colour with white head. smell: very sweet. Taste: sweet, a bit sour, very watery and yeasty. I don’t like it. This beer has no power at all!

Bottle; best by 12/09. Pours a hazy gold with a large, fluffy, white head that falls slowly to a thin cap. The nose is of big, fruity/spicy yeast notes: bubble gum, spicy clove and a touch of banana with a bit of white pepper over a subtle wheat body. Light-bodied and aqueous with moderate carbonation and a clean finish. A clean wheat body fronts light supporting notes of clove, white pepper and generic fruitiness. This is a refreshing and satisfying wheat beer that imparts just a touch from the standard German hefeweizen.
pours yellow, frothy white head that lasts good first sip and crisp bite.  Medium body kind of creamy,   Not much carbonation, clove and banana flavor very yeasty.

Draught at the Tyrolean Inn during their Oktoberfest.   Opaque yellow with a lasting thick meringue head.   The aroma is basic with sweet malt and very light esters that are almost clearly banana, but not really when you get the expectations out of the way.   The flavor is pretty sweet with a light graininess, light touch of spice and very mild bitterness in the finish.   Fizzy and light on the tongue with a somewhat creamy texture when the carbonation gives it a chance.   As German as it can be without being any good at being German.   Seems like they know the style well, but want to make it as mainstream as possible.   Certainly nothing really bad about it, but probably the most uninspired version of the style that I have ever had that actually came from its land or origin.
Pours Hazy yellow tall white head. Aroma is very yeasty, notes of banana, But a but dull on the nose over all. The flavour is slightly spicy with lots of wheat malt. Not bad but pretty uninspired.
50cl bottle@Virgin Oil, Helsinki.  Nice frothy white head, fruit and hint of citrus in aroma. Banana flavour, smooth, very nice hefe-weizen.

This beer seems a little bit underrated here. I normally don’t go for hefe-weizen, because often they have too much citrus, a sort of weak palate and not much complexity. This beer surprised me because it is quite balanced for a hefe-weizen, with some citrus, fruit and floral undertones. It seems mature and is very drinkable. The aroma is faint, but the palate is actually quite nice with a little bit of thickness/oiliness. There are even some hops present in the flavor and finish. Overall a nice beer.

500. Pours a crystal clear pale gold with a loose, sudsy whitish head. Not much lace or legs to speak of. Mild banana nose. Watery, somewhat woolly body. Carb is hard to pin down but definitely there. Sweaty banana mid-palate. Not much finish.
Pretty boring, not much flavour, what was there was a little yeasty and some clove. Decent thirst quencher, thats about it.

a nice heffe. Faint aroma with a cloudy appearance reminiscent of most good hefes. Taste is wheat, banana, faint lemon and more wheat. Lots of head on this one. Tastes good on tap and in bottle. not as good as schneider weisse!

Cloudy yellow pour at the BarleyPub
decent sized offwhite head.  Aroma of wheat, Bubblegum, spice.  mouthfeel is wheaty with flavors of bubblegum, green apple, a bit of lemon zest.  Overall not bad but certainly not thrilling.

Source:12 oz bottle from Mount Juliet Beer Company. 

Glass:Warsteiner lager. 

Appearance:Hazy, but not cloudy gold pour with a one finger white head.  

Aroma:Very fruity, but no banana.  A slight presence of clove. 

Flavor:Again, lots of fruit and muted clove. 

Palate:Light body with solid carbonation.

Overall:Drank well, but I wouldn’t classify it as a German Hefe.

Nice cloudy colour. Had a decent head on tap but not out of bottle. Fruity aroma. Less so on the taste but still wasn’t bad. Hoppy and a had more than a hint of bubblegum. Finish continued to be hoppy. Not the best wheat beer going but you could do much worse.
Bottle at home. roasty, spruce, pale, hazy, frothy, lightly sour, lightly bitter, light body, creamy, average carbonation,

Pours a clear golden yellow color with lots of visible carbonation bubbles and a thin foamy white head that quickly dissapears. Aroma is quite bland with slight apple presence as well as some lemon peel. Very quaffable with a crisp apple and pear taste as well as some slight citrus.

500ml bottle (BeerAngel.de) (5:3:6:3:12=2.9)

Pale hazy straw colour. Not much aroma. Crisp carbonation, heading towards fizzy. Full malty body, light on the spice, and light on the yeast too. Finish has some of the malts, and a hint of noble hops. Slightly underwhelmed.

Bottle. A golden yellow body with a big fizzy white head , high carbonation and no lacing left . Aroma is light yeast and sour wheat , lemongrass and really faint banana . Flavor is slightly fruity ,maybe lemon light metallic note, a light hop bitterness , more like a lager than a wheat beer . Drinkable and good but not as flavorful as I would expect from a Hefe . Light body ,with a thin oily mouthfeel .
bottle at Sohwi in Jyväskylä. metallic lemon with cereals, medium body, golden almost murky with a nice big white head

Bottle. Pours a cloudy pale yellow body with a huge fluffy white head which seemed to grow even larger after i finished pouring. Kinda cool actually. Weak grassy aroma with some lemon zest and musty notes. Yeasty, malty flavor with a faint lemon kick. Nice full mouthfeel. Easy drinking Hefe, but I was quite dissapointed in this beef after the beautiful pour.

Bottle. Hazy yellow, big white head. Fairly faint aroma, some citrus, yeast and banana notes. Flavour isn’t all that either. Mild, sweet citrus, some yeast and banana. Standard fare, nothing special. A bit thin and too sparkly carb.

From a bottle, this poured a cloudy yellow with a fat white head that did not last and left light lacing. Nose of banana and citrus.. Light mouthfeel. Flavor is mild and the same as the nose. Not much in the finish. Pretty average hefe.
A farily decent hefe.   Scents of bananna and citrus.   Cloudy and slightly thick and a nice smooth finish.

A: Poured with a fairly large, white head that dissipated quickly to a half-finger size. Body is dark yellow and very cloudy.

S: Smell is a little disappointing; some light traces of wheat and lemon there, but that’s about it.

T: Also disappointing. I get the light sweetness and wheat at the beginning, along with some citrus, but it disappears very quickly, and really doesn’t have much personality. Pretty bland-tasting for a hefeweizen, actually.

M: Pretty good mouthfeel, body is light with oily/creamy-textured. Average carbonation, good amount for the style.

D: Sure, you can drink it easily... barely even notice it going down, really. But I like to taste a hefeweizen more than this, so it’s a little disappointing for the style.
In a word, boring.  some head, some aroma, some citrus flavour, but very close to a standard lager (without the advertising)
Single bottle into a wheat glass.  I don’t remember many specifics, as this was awhile back, but it’s a nice, typical weizen that is tasty and easy to drink.

This beer came in third in a tasting that included Weihenstephaner, Erdinger, and Paulaner. Had a distinct lemon citrus aroma and taste and was therefor fresher then the others, however it ws laking in the banana/clove esters and malt characterics of the better examples of the style.

(bottle)  Each time I drink this beer I forget to rate it, so here goes:
Beautiful dark straw colour, only slightly cloudy (for a Hefeweizen).  Faint malt and banana impression.   Does not ’taint’ my tastebuds as the glass empties like some other Wheat styles can. Overall not as full-on in any flavour as most German Weissbier, and that is its secret: subtle but consistent!

Straw color, thin head. Aroma of lemon spice, cookie and honey. Moderately tart and mildly sweet. Seems less fruity and more dry than other German Hefes not bad but I’ll take a Paulaner Hefe over this.
Cloudy gold,lasting white head.Light tart/yeasty nose.Wheat malt sweetness,light spicy yeastiness. Faint cilantro finish
pours cloudy straw gold with a thick effervescent head. aroma is citrus and yeasty. flavor is complex for the style, more than most. definitely in the top tier.

Rerate - @coopwinespirits February discovery bag. Same old banana-clove hefe. Yum.

Bottle @ Metro Billiards. Delicious wheat beer. Strong, grainy aroma, but a light smooth finish in taste. Fairly hazy yellow colour, and a thick white foam. This has definitely made the A-List.
Nice head,nice body, nice taste - the king among Weisbier, but make sure to drink it while its cold
Good looking white with nice foam. Tasted less good than I expected from its looks.
From bottle. Large white foamy head. Golden colour. Aroma of yeast. Flavour of wheat, lemon and some banana

This thing poured a massive frothy white head, minimum seven fingers, and it stayed a LONG time.  Simply amazing.  And, the lacing was among the bext I’ve seen, too.  Colour was a nice golden straw, with a lot of haze.  The aroma was quite subdued, with really nothing standing out.  The taste was on the sweet side of the board, but not overpowering.  Mouthfeel was smooth, and the aftertaste was clean.

Bottle. Pours with a frothy white head that fades over an orange body. Aroma of banana, clove and wheat. Flavor is spicy with banana esters and some grainyness and light citrus. Medium to high carbonation and a dry mouthfeel.

Hazy dark golden with a frothy off white head. Classic clove banana and tart wheat aromas. Smooth medium body. Easy drinking flavors of mild clove strong banana, grainy pale malts, with a tart wheat taste to finish.

330ml bottle.  Pours cloudy golden orange, thin white head.  Aroma of banana and lemons.  Classic German Hefeweizen.   Cool and crisp,  very clean malt character.  Nice grainy wheat flavor.  Hint of fruit, mostly bananas.  some light spice in the finish of cloves.   Premium.

(Bottle 0,5l)
Hazy light sparkling yellow color. Minimal creamy white head. Light wheat and fruit aroma. Medium sweet and light sour. Soft body. Sticky texture.

Bottle in the international mixer from steph’s sister (hey that rhymed).  Hazy orange with large, billowing white, long lasting head.  Aroma is citrus, semi-sweet, some wheat, not bad.  Favor is sweet citrus and lemon with spice, wheat, some yeast, banana, clove and light grain at the finish.  Medium to light body with light carbonation and a slight bit of creaminess.  Pretty sweet but refrehing.

Bottled.
Yellow with white head. Aroma of wheat and yeast. Flavor of wheat, yeasty banana and spices

Bottle from Systembolaget, Karlstad. Poiurs a cloudy yellow color with a big white head, looks nice actually. Aroma is lightly spicy, yeasty, with some touches of banana, and some metal. Flavour is lightly malty, spicy, and fruity with whispers of banana. Mediumbodied mouthfeel, average carbonation. Not one of the better weissbiers out there. It’s drinkable but otherwise meaningless compared to great giants as Weihenstephaner, etc. I’m quite dissapointed.

Appearance: Presents a quite cloudy, dull, muted gold-toned body with a half inch of fizzy, white head. Give me your best shot, Erdinger!

Smell: Notes of clove and yeast lead followed by lesser touches of malted wheat and barley. Well, it’s definitely not the most bountiful aroma on the block.

Taste: Mildly tangy-tasting malted wheat along with some simply barley. Lightly sweet. Good pinch of earthy spices with flavors of coriander and clove. Sadly lacking in fruity touches of banana. Bit of lemon. Spicy, floral hops with a medium-low bitterness. Finishes dry, spicy, and somewhat crisp.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied, but lacks the creaminess of many of it’s wheat-based brethren. Medium-high carbonation -- a bit too fizzy for me.

Drinkability: Average, at best. Comes up short in both the flavor department and texture of body, but one thing it isn’t lacking in is carbonation. There are many far better hefes to be had out there.
Hazy yellow colour. Quite a sweet aroma. Not much to the the flavour, this is a fairly average white beer that is a bit flat.

500 mL bottle from Once Upon a Vine South, Richmond, VA. Best by 05/2009, even though I bought it in June. Hrm. Pours a hazy light orange color with a large fizzy, frothy head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma is very bready with notes of butter, spice, caramel and citrus. Taste is citrus, caramel, bread, yeast, apple and other fruit notes. Medium bodied, tart finish. Fairly refreshing and nice.

Essa German Hefeweizen alemã tem espuma média, cremosa e branca, de reduzida longevidade. Boa formação de colarinho. Corpo turvo, denso e amarelo-escuro. Aroma: banana, cravo, leve levedura e pão branco. Sabor inicial: moderado dulçor e leve amargor. Sabor final: leves dulçor e amargor; média duração. Paladar: textura aguada, forte carbonatação, final metálico e corpo médio-leve. Dulçor de mel, com pouco gosto de banana, lembrando em alguns momentos uma Bohemian Pilsener, o que me fez considera-la muito abaixo do potencial de outras Hefeweizen. Como eu já disse outrora, infelizmente perdeu seu encanto.
Poured perfecty into a .5L Erdinger tall glass that came in the gift pack.   Light bodied Hefe, has a lemony zing, but other than that unassuming beer.

On tap

Pours. A hazy golden with a large white head. Aroma is wheat malt yeast and esthers. Flavor is wheat esthers banana clove light fruitiness. Easy to drink and refreshing.

500ml bottle. Clear and golden amber colour with a mountainous rocky head of loosely compacted bubbles with a mixture of big and little bubbles. Mild aroma for a hefeweizen. Nice bitterness and well balanced with a hint of sweetness. Lively in the mouth

Bottled,  hazy light golden, huge creamy head, looks great, thick lacing. Aroma is a bit citric, typical weizen. nose is sour a bit, tpp. very nice sharp flavour with mix of citric notes and sweetness ofthe weizen. Nice
33cl bottle. Pours cloudy whit thick white head. Wheat and herbal aroma. Yeast and banana taste. Light and refreshing. A very good weizen.
On tap. This is exactly what I expect from a weissebier. Smooth and refreshing, but it wasn’t as complex as I would have liked. I would order it again for sure, it was nice.

cloudy yellow with a nice two finger fluffy white head. aroma is lemon wheat with some clove, banana, and a touch of grain. has a light body with some lacing and good carbonation. flavor is lemon wheat, banana, and a touch of clove. mouth feel is a bit watery, but this is a good session hefe. has a little bite on the tongue from the carbonation and also has a small creamy feel to it as it warms. sweet  malt and grain taste also as it warms.
(bottle). Pours a semi cloudy yellow color. Medium white head. Light wheat aroma and flavor. Short duration. Spare lacing. Slick texture. Soft carbonation.
no real aroma. poured cloudy golden with a white head that faded quickly,  taste is pretty boring .  no real after taste

Draft @ the Lookout in Hongkong. Cloudy honey yellow, nice head that stays with the beer the whole glass. Very nice looking beer. Very subtle honey and lemon aromas, not very much happening in the nose. Flavor is similarly subdued and, well, kind of boring. Nothing offensive, but lacking the fruit/clove flavors.

22oz pour @ Zanies. Cloudy pale yellow gold color with a frothy white head. Light banana and lemon aroma. Relatively clean, some light lemon flavor. Light bodied, prickly mouthfeel. Enjoyable and a treat.
50 cl bottle. Cloudy golden body with a large white head. Aroma and flavour is banana and wheat.

Erdinger from the tap. Body was a hazy golden color with a white head. Smell of yeast was faint. Intial taste of banana and orange and left me with a slight clove aftertaste. Clove flavor was a lot less that other weizens I’ve had. Enjoyable and refreshing after a round of golf.

Bottle, Tesco, Carlisle. Been a while since I had this. Quite a soft hefe, much more subtle than some German wheats, doesn’t have the immediate citrus and herbs hit. However, it lingers on the tongue with more apple than anything else and also has a pleasant yeasty flavour. Good stuff.
Pours cloudy with a white head. Smells of banana and yeast. Good carbination. Very enjoyable...it is what it is...

Bottle. Pours a cloudy golden with a small creamy white head that diminishes quickly leaving behind good sticky lacing along the glass. The aroma is banana, lemon zest and clove. Thin mouthfeel with a light yeast taste with banana and nice dry finish. A decent hefe from Erdinger.

500 ml bottle from LCBO, served cool in a Weissbierglas.



App.:  Cloudy golden with a large white foam.
  
Aroma:  Slightly green, grassy and floral to start (odd), bread and yeast, perfume, lighter banana bread esters, bubblegum, oddly bright, not really any clove, quite unexpected.
  
Palate:  Medium body and fairly full effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Closer to a Weizen with a good helping of banana and other esters, bread/biscuit/toast, some slightly grass hay, still some light vaguely tangy fruits; dry with minimal bitterness and a slightly nutty, bready finish.



I’ve drank this often and this is the strangest bottle ever.  Will re-rate

Pour form a 12 oz bottle. Cloudy golden color with two fingers of solid head. Mild aroma of yeast and wheat. Nice light flavor but all in all, not much of a flavor. Nothing offensive, but overall rather mild and bland.

Massive pillowy head that was slightly off white, and had a cloudy gold body this beer looks beautiful, but thats the only good thing I’ll be saying about it. The aroma is not so plesent with mainly sour apple candy and some slight wheat. The taste is very heavy not watered down at all, mainly yeast is what I taste, the yeast is even over powering the wheat flavor, there is also a peachy taste hiding in the back ground. There is a strong alcohol presence in this beer what is very strange giving the fact it has a low percentage. This taste nothing like a normal hefeweizen, not was I was expecting I’m very disappointed in it.

03.04.2004, 0,5l Bottle. Colour is hazy yellow. Nice wheat aroma with hints of lemon. "Til å være et av verdens største øl-merker smaker erdingeren ganske lite. Den er god og frisk men taper litt på manglende fylde og smaksrikdom. Alt i alt er den lettdrikkelig og god."
Light, crisp, but all in all, not a whole lot of flavor.  Lots of carbonation, could use some spice or just plain flavor.

On Tap at Chappy’s.  Hazing beer with a thick white head.  Yeast in the aroma.  Slight citrus flavor and some yeast as well.  Nothing special but definitely light and refreshing.  If it were just a little stronger on the flavor.

Beautiful weizen body, and nice head for a wheat. Not much aroma in this one. Some wheat and yeast flavor but very mild overall. I still like it, but can’t say it is my favorite weizen.It just lacks something.

Lemon cracker nose, tiny bit of pepper.  Hazy amber gold color, big head that lasted.  Was fruity sweet, minimal bitterness, slight lemon peel.  Big carbonation, medium body, fairly clean finish.  Not a bad beer, just not remarkable, definitely could use more spicy notes.  Almost seemed more like an American Hefe-Weizen?

500 ml bottle. From Germany.
Hazy orange colour with massive fluffy white head. Quite weak wheaty and citrusy fruity aroma. Some sweetness. Very malty, wheaty, somewhat fruity, mostly citrusy flavour. Not very Hefeweizen-like. Lighter and more like wheat ale than real Bavarian Hefeweizen. Not bad but quite unexpected.

On tap at the Beechtree.  Pours a very hazy gold with a thin to medium white head.  Light wheat aromas.  Very thin, though the carbonation helps it along a little bit.  There’s an odd off flavor in here. Sweet, with a touch of banana at the end.  Uneventful.

11.2oz Bottle: Cloudy gold w/ a large, fluffy, white head. Wheat, yeast, banana & clove in the aroma. Flavor = Aroma. Nothing mind blowing here, it’s a nice wheat beer. I would choose several others before this though.

hazy yellow pour with a good white head that held its own. The flavor and aroma exhibited simple Hefe characters: banana, wheat, yeast.  Light and fizzy on the palate - to style.  Overall: not too interesting but refreshing and a nice treat in the beer desert that is Cape Town.
Bottle 0,5ltr: Hazy yellow classic with great thirstquenching abbilities and the good banana hints.

Light lemon scent, pours hazy straw yellow with frothy head and lots of carbonation. A little bite on the tip of the tongue and finishes bitter-sweet with lingering yeast. Light bodied, easy to drink. A really good wheat beer.
Bottle. Poured a yellow color with almost no head. Aroma was yeast and citrus. Flavor was the classic wheat beer. Medium body. Decent beer, nothing special.

Pours a cloudy gold with a nice white head. Aroma is mostly bananna. Taste is wheat, bananna, cloves, and a slight cereal note. Slightly tart finish. Drinkable and enjoyable. Refreshing and thirst quenching.

50cl bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Pours a cloudy golden color with three fingers of creamy frothy head.  Smells of citrus and yeast.  Tastes about the same as nose.  Very smooth with slight carbonation.
Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a frothy white head. Wheat, banana, citrus and yeast. Soft carbonation with a thin mouthfeel. Average hefe.

Bottle.   Pours a cloudy yellow color with a large white head.  Aroma is subtle and bready, fruity hops.  Taste follows, a traditional tasting hefe.  Thinner palate than desired, but a pretty standard german brew.

Bottle from Bevmo.  I am sure I have had this before at some point.  Nice looking ruddy and murky pour.  Aroma was fresh; with alot of wheat, yeast and lemon.  Flavor was mellow and drinkable.  Nice thirst quencher.  That being said, there isn’t too much going on here.  Some yeast, wheat and banana.  Serves its purpose.

Pours a nice hazy yellow color with loads of carbonation bubbles. Great creamy white head with moderate lacing. Strong and fresh aroma of citrus and yeast. Really refreshing flavor of citrusfruit, bananacandy and a very soft touch of malt. Very drinkable and easygoing pleasure.
bottle, creamy head, medium body, average carbonation, long finish, relatively flat, but refreshing
Aroma of yeast and clover. Very nice and smooth palate. It’s really a refreshing beer.

[Tap] Cloudy orange with a cream colored thick head. Stong citrus and yeast aroma.  Taste of citrus and banana with a little clove and fresh bread.  Clean finish.  Very smooth and refreshing.   Easy to drink and quite enjoyable, one of my favorite Hefes. 

Side note:  I had the opportunity to have one on tap in Germany and it tasted very similar to one here in the States.

500ml bottle purchased for $3. Cloudy yellow and orange, bubbly, super foamy white head. It smells like cloves and yeast. The taste is also very yeasty, earthy, good stuff and incredibly easy to drink. This would be a perfect hefe for those hot summer days...

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-11-2009 21:56:47
Bottle.  Wheat and fruit aroma.  Cloudy yellow-orange body, large white head.  Flavor is muted, but fairly typical for the style.  Overall, a rather meager effort, but still refreshing.

In my experience there hasn’t been a bad hefe, but it is hard to be a great hefe.  Erdinger is a nice aroma-ed hefe, with classic yeasty bubblegum, banana, clove aromas.  The appearance is nice gorgeous cloud gold.  That said, the flavors are too mild, too watered down.  It does have that yeasty, soft malt flavors, but its too thin.  Noting awesome, but its ok as an introductory hefe.

Have to say I’m baffled by the high ratings and positive reviews this one’s getting. Sure, it looks great, with a big, foamy head that takes a long time to dissipate, but where’s the flavour? Even of a Hefe-Weizen, this one’s weak, and watery up front, leaving a slightly metallic tang around the sides of your mouth. I don’t mind subtlety, but if I was looking for something tastless, I’d drink American beer. All that’s missing is the corn and urine, and this would be Budweiser.

Bright yellow with a fairly large white head and nice lacing.  Nose is not very potent and consists of yeast and wheat.  Flavor has notes of citrus and apple.  Finish consists of a fairly nice balance of hop and malt.
A balanced one . Nice taste and aroma. Pretty good for a blonde one and a very nice choice for greece&#40 not easy to find a good beer anywhere&#41. However it hasn’t got the classic heffe taste.

330ml Bottle:  Aroma of yeast and hints of bananas and fruit.  Poured deep gold/yellow in color with a medium-sized , off-white head that lasted throughout.  Hazy.  Very sparkling.  Flavor is lightly sweet and lightly bitter.  Tastes of yeast, slight banana, slight citrus, slight noble hops, slight resin, and a hint of malty sweetness.  Medium body.  Lightly tingly, thinish, dry body.  Average to lively carbonation.  Lightly sweet, slightly malty, yeasty finish is dry.

Nice and cloudy like a good wiess should be.  A nice amount of head, not too much but more than just a bit. Malt, yeast and hops are just barely visible in the aroma. Flavour is a bit bitter and very easy, The hops cover the yeast up nicely and still leave a good malt aftertaste. This was the first wiess I ever had where I remembered what a wiess is. To me, this is the constant wiess  that I compare all others to.

500ml botte.  Pours a very hazy golden yellow with a large, clingy, foamy, pillowy white head that. Taste is of malt, hops, yeast, citrus, spice and some banana.  Similar aroma.  Has a nice chewy and full body. Clean, enjoyable, filling, easy to drink and rather refreshing.  Well worth purchasing again.

50cl bottle. Best before 2009-04. It poured a very thin and pale golden colour with a medium big creamy head that settled down slowly in the glass. The aroma is sweet with notes of banana, wheats and yeast. The flavour is dry with notes of apples, yeast and some wheat. It has a short aftertaste.
Clean and very refreshing. pours cloudy-golden, flavours of apple, banana, general fruitiness, tea, slight buttery backing. excellent summer beer.
Bottle - pours a hazy yellow with a clean white head. light citrus and banana aroma.  Smooth medium bodied beers with a citrus flavour which is fairly light, dry finsih with some grapefruit.
Bottle.  Faint hints of banana in the nose.  The flavor is smooth.  Would make a decent session beer, but there are better hefe’s out there.
Bottle. 50cl. Pours cloudy golden orange with a thick, forsty white head. Only hints of bitterness, finish is slightly metallic.

Really nice creamy hefeweisen type beer. cloudy tan beer with pretty and robust white head. Sweet nose of grass and wheat. Taste is grapefruit and bubblegum, but more robust and malt-based than some hefeweisen. Spritely carbonation, creamy. Quite nice

Bottle. The smell is very light, a little bit of vanilla and banana. The head is medium large, white and foamy, fast disappearing. The body is pale yellow and clear. The taste is only light bitter with a short duration. The texture is creamy without much carbonation and quite light.
Pours slightly hazy light golden color with white head. Faint wheat aroma and grassy hops. Wheat, banana, and slight clove flavors. Medium body with soft carbonation.

On tap. Suprised to see it on tap in town (pop. 1400). Served too cold. Aroma of malts wasn’t as pronounced as the other times I have had it in bottle. A good beer that tastes refreshing. Nice yellow color with some carbonation. Should of let it sit in my hands to warm up.
Bottle. Fruit and wheat malt in aroma. Light yellow unclear colour with white head. Sweet flavour, the malt though surprisingly discrete. Mild character. Moderate carbonation.
0.5l - Pale gold over off white head.  Small bubbles.  C antelope and applesauce nose.  Starchy cooked macaroni palate fading to nice sour notes.  The right beer at the right time for me.
Bottle.  Pours hazy yellow whith thick creamy head.  Smells of wheat, banana, and clove.  Tastes smooth, wheaty, lots of banana, and some clove.

Szűretlen bajor világos búzasör az Erdinger Weissbräutól. Színe világos borostyánsárga, illata üdítően virágos. Habja finom szerkezetű, tartós. Íze könnyed, minden szélsőségektől mentes, sem túl csípős, sem túl kesernyés. Bevallom, a Dunkel változata nekem sokkal jobban ízlik.

50cl bottle from Sainsburys. The usual cloudy straw body with a billowing white head, and the usually grain and banana aroma. Quite lively in the mouth with sharp grapefruit flavours and some sweet caramel, and a smooth creamy finish. An excellent Weissbier.
(bottle) pours a hazy light yellow colour with a white head. unusual aroma of grapes and powdered sugar. flavour is the same, with light hints of wheat. thin body with fizzy carbonation.

Banana and lemon bready aroma.
Has a hazy beautiful straw color with minimal white head and lots of action.
Grainy wheat taste with a hint of salty grapefruit. Banana may be a minor flavor I swirled the yeast up so its covered.
Light bodied, some well balanced resin, with lively soft carbonation.
I like the wheat grain taste so this is a session beer for me, well balanced.
One of the most subtile hefe-weizen: delicately light sweetness of mild citric fruit. Smooth and easy. Keeps palate refreshed and ready for more ;)

Pleasant sparkling feel arising from its "style" of carbonation. Attractive cloudy appearance. However, body is light on consumption. Have to let your taste buds saturate for while to appreciate its character. Could be due to low hops bitterness. Nice balance of wheat, vanilla, clove, banana and citrus flavours. Aroma is subtle but delicate. Very smooth and easy on the palate. Great on hot days. Aim for draught/tap as far as possible. Have it with your grills, sausages and other rich foods.

500 mL bottle. Pours a deep somewhat cloudy gold with a white frothy head that quickly dissipates to  a wispy pattern over the surface that left no lace on the sides as it was sipped. After all, wheat beers tend to be cloudy and that is just part of their character. Like most wheat beers, the bottle has a layer of sediment at the bottom leading me to speculate that this beer is likely unfiltered, unpasteurized, and carbonated in the bottle. This sediment is common in German and other European beers and being unpasteurized with live yeast in there would allow the beer to really show its true colors as I see it. In my beer book, that alone will win more brownie points. The aroma is actually quite delightful; fruity-malty with a hint of yeast. The carbonation is very lively yet the flavor is defiantly smooth. Banana, pear, a whisper of vanilla, and a whisper of grapefruit peel all together in a fine malty bouquet ending with a creamy aftertaste followed by a subtle spicy note. No slouch for flavor. Brownie points for originality.

Bottled. Murky yellow, basic pale weizen head. Slightly alcoholic, simple wheaty nose with some cellar, not much fruitiness. Similar cellary wheaty flavor, little old banana, yeastiness, pretty mediocre. Medium bodied, strong lush carbonation. I couldn’t check the dating, but this didn’t feel all that fresh.

Tack vare en genomtänkt helhetskänsla - på gränsen till "konceptuell" - blir den här populära veteölen till en gemytlig upplevelse. Nedbruten i mindre enheter - smak, lukt, utseende osv - är den inte särskilt märkvärdig, dock.
This is a delicious German wheat beer.  Pours a cloudy blonde with strong citrus and banana.

Erdinger Weissbier pours a cloudy orange color with a very foamy head.  Light smell of citrus.  A taste reveals clove along with the citrus and something sweet that I can’t quite pin down.  The well blended flavors and smooth texture make for an overall great beer for a breezy summer afternoon conversation.

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy, hazy blond with an extremely large head, white and frothy.  Fairly good lacing.  Aromas of bananas, fruit, citrus, and a bit of yeast.  Lively mouthfeel with a very nice, almost dry finish. Taste is pleasing with a light, citrus initial flavor followed by the taste of pear.  Great beer.
Golden orange color with a small white head. Aroma is of clove, yeast and citrus. Taste is of vanilla, clove and citrus.

500 ml. bottle. Pours a thin white head, minimal duration, no lacing, over a cloudy pale yellow body....nose of mild clove, cardomom, yeast.....taste is mild, even after warming, with a bit of grain and light lemon tones....mouthfeel is very light, almost watery....not as much character as many others in the style.
this weisse beer is particulary flat, no taste is very up in the mouth.
Cloudy yellow-orange pour with a white head. Sweet aroma of malts and some citrus. Medium body with a light citrus flavor. Sweet finish.

Straw yellow body tall foamy white head. Aroma of apples, citrus, some vanilla and clove. Light citrus taste, late lemon and a hint of vanilla on the finish. Medium filling on the palate and a bit creamy.

Bottle shared with Grand Genie.  Light yellow amber apperence with aminimal white head.  Aroma:  lemon, banana, cinnimon, apple, vanilla, orange peal.  Flavor: salty, Perier miniral water, nothing else I can say for the flavor other than verry disapointing.  Palate:  light and fizzy with a no taste finnish.

Acheté à la LCBO et dégusté dans un verre de weizen avec agaguk. De couleur ocre au reflet brûmeux avec une alternance de couleur ambre, orangé et brune en arrière plan. Une bonne effervescence de grosses bulles avec une bonne mousse tenace. Olfactivement, la banane est l’odeur principale suivis de la vanille, la pelure d’orange, la canelle, le citron et la levure de pain se partage à dose égale la seconde place. Un goût d’eau gazéfier au citron légèrement salé avec un goût moyennement prononcé au début qui disparaît rapidemment pour laissé pour goût qu’une fine amertume.

Amber hazy body with a nice medium head. Moderated aroma of phenolic banana, vanilla, fine citruses and some malt. Smooth mouthfeel with the tastes of malt and caramel, moderated top frementation character, some vanilla and cinnamon in the medium body. Hop in the finish. Fine and easy drinkable, typical hefeweizen, but nothing more.

Cloudy yellow. Citrus on the nose. Orange, butter, and pepper flavors. Complex for the style. Good, complex, drinkable. Not my favorite hefe, as I don’t prefer the "slimy" butter flavor, but I’m aware that other people love it, and it was better than most buttery hefe’s that I’ve had.

Hazy yellow, orange color. Medium fizzy white head. Yeasty vanilla aroma. Sweet yeasty flavor with hints of caramel and vanilla. Rather spicy than sour in the ending. Refreshing lively carbonation. Good Hefeweizen, but nothing exceptional.
Bottle. Poured a hazy pale yellow color with a thick white head. Aroma of grape and grass. Tastes of wheat and lemons with a grassy finish.
Hazy bright yellow pour with a fluffy white head.  Zesty aroma.  Grassy, yeasty, grainy flavor.  Crisp clean finish.  Slightly metallic

12 oz bottle poured into Weizen.  Pours a soft orange with a lot of stark white foamy head.  A sort of sour, lemongrassy odor to it.  Tastes better than it smells, with a nice soft pallet, and a light hint of apricot and wheat in the aftertaste.  Decent, I’m not that huge into hefeweizens, but this one is at least drinkable.

PPours a hazy, golden-orange with a beautiful thick head. Aroma is light and fruity. Lemongrass, grapefruit, etc. Flavor is light and wheaty. Decent citrus flavor. Perfect mouthfeel. Great. Much better than the Dunkelweiss.
A tasty German hef.  Nice grassy spicy notes in the nose, not too cloudy, sweet and frothy, wish it was a little less malty.

330 mL. Pours a hazy dark orange with a large white head with lots of carbonation. Musty, yeasty, white grape aroma. Taste is white grape juice with some cloves. Very metallic, unpleasant aftertaste. Quite possibly the worst German hefeweizen I have tried.
smells nice lite and fruity. taste does not reflect. much lighter than expected. not much going on, finish’s week

Hazy blonde in color with a medium lasting head.  Aroma of light citrus, some earth, clove, and wheat.  Taste has some dry wheat, some citrus, a touch of metal, and spice.  Medium bodied, very malty but dry.
Golden orange murky liquid with giant head, some acidic metal aroma with low sweetness, citrusy flavor with yeasty banana flavor, I have had better hefeweizens.

Hefeweizen beer is just not for me.  The head boiled over the pint glass.  The  beverage was cloudy and not inviting.  It was thin  and just not special. For lovers of this type of beer it may be very good.  This was a Christmas 2008 beer.

Bottle from Tesco.  Cloudy yellow with impressive white head.  I really wouldn’t pick this as a Weissbier as it lacks all the characteristics, apart from the appearance.  Not much in the aroma, perhaps mine was over-chilled.  Refreshing palate but not a great deal of flavour apart from a hint of grapefruit and a bitter finish.  Not unpleasant at all, but lacking in character.
Cloudy straw colour.  Frothy head.  Fruity tones with a clean finish.  Does not have as much taste as other wheats but a very good beer.
Rocky head, lively, with a fair bit of carbonation. Quite yeasty and musty. Slight spicyness to it.

11.2 oz bottle-pours a big foamy white head and cloudy yellow color.  Aroma is spice, pear, grainy/musty.  Taste is spice, pear/white grape, grainy/musty, yeasty.  Starts somewhat sweet, finishes dry.    Thanks jwc215 for picking this out.
citrus, cereal, hazy, white foam, rocky head, lightly bitter, light sweetness, freshmedium body, lively, astringent,

Bottle 50cl.
Drank in a big crowd so couldnt really give this a proper rating, but it wasnt really to my liking.
Lots of carbonation gives it a lasting a good head, smell is very yeasty and so is the taste.
Bit dissappointed in this one.
Popular e facilmente encontrada. Aroma frutado, sabor pouco acentuado com paladar ligeiramente metálico.

Nice yeasty orange nose, a thick white head and a cloudy and enticing gold color. A slightly spicy start, then fruity tones develop with bananna and a slight citrus note. Finish is dry and leaves an interesting yeasty flavor on the tongue.  The body is light and a little creamy.
Hazy blonde, decent head. Nice bitter, sour balance  a mild sweet floral hoppiness. Very easy drinking .

On tap.  An attractive pour.  This is a smooth, lightly sweet wheat ale, with a touch of hops.  Pleasant and drinkable, but bland - doesn?t taste like a real hefe.  Had some on draft at Bronx Ale House with a slice of lemon - that improved things.

Pours a pale hazy soft yellow with a 1 to 2 finger creamy eggshell head. The nose is soft, wheaty, grassy, some lemongrass, minor phenols. The flavor is wheaty, lightly grassy, corn, some citrus, disappointing. Feels crisp and easy.
SMOOTH CLOUDY WITH A SLIGHTLY GOLDEN COLOR. MILD BITTER AFTERTASTE. MEDIUM RANGE HEFE WEIZEN I HAVE TASTED A LOT WORSE.
Hazy blonde pint, decent head.  Nice bitter, sour balance with a mild sweet floral hoppiness.  Very easy drinking and I’m not usually a fan of wheatbeers.
Draught in pint glass. Goes down very easily. A bit bland but still a decent hefe.

Rating #100! Gotta hand it to Erdinger, I do not like this style much but this beer was very drinkable and a testament to good brewing. Completely fogged golden wheat color with big white head. Flavor and aroma burst with earthy notes of wheat, citrus fruit, and banana on the finish. Fruity but not too sweet with a touch of spice and hops. Quite drinkable with a smooth palate. The best Hefeweizen I’ve had so far.

Bottle from the LCBO
Very nice wheat beer the wife even like this better than Hoegaarden

Pours nearly opaque haze fog of straw and gold hues with bright white head. The light aroma is mainly smooth and blended malt notes of light colored malts, some mild graininess and hints of wheat. The hops show up in the form of floral and a bit of earthiness. The taste is lively and nearly crisp with solid wheat notes and mild grainy malts bleeding into moderate ripe banana and slight bubble gum. Midway and to the finish floral and spice hops show up and mingle nicely with the other flavor players.
I was a little bit disappointed with this one. I had heard REALLY great things and it was just sort of bland for a hefe. I did like that it didnt have the strong lemon kick that some of them have.

An easy to find german hefe I’ve not rated!? - it’s about time I corrected this - first of all, this beer is underrated, but far from great - the head totally disappears on this one, whereas the greater german examples have some of the most lasting heads I’ve ever seen - points off there - the aroma is citrus, melon, and yeast - the flavor is a little tangy, with prominent but indistinct fruitiness, some grain on the back end, fairly strong yeastiness - fairly dry in the finish, but it remains grainy/wheaty - not terrible, but it lacks a lot of the earthy complexities some of the finer examples exhibit.
bouteille de 500ml, blonde trouble, nez épicé agréable, bouche légère mais ronde, manque de profondeur.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy yellow body with 3 finger head.  Yeasty spiciness, then lots of wheat, a bit of light citrus fruit but nothing in particular that stands out, maybe some stale banana as well.  Simple beer.

Large frothy head,good carbonation,misty straw coloured hefe weiss.Aromamalt wheat,a sweetness,note of nutmeg.Flavour malty nice wheat taste,hoppy,mild bitter,a spicyness or herb along with an alcohol taste that is plesant.Very nice wheat beer.Finish malt very hoppy,good flavours.
nice fluffy head with an egg yolk yellow cloudy body.  nice fruity aroma.  dry fruity and very refreshing beer.  after the long day i’ve had this really hits the spot.
Bottle. Pours unclear gold with a fluffy white head. Light fruity aroma with yeast and some spices in the background. The flavor is rather bland with a general fruit sweetness and yeast. Not bad.

Light lemon scent, pours hazy straw yellow with frothy head and lots of carbonation. A little bite on the tip of the tongue and finishes bitter-sweet with lingering yeast. Light bodied, easy to drink. A really good wheat beer.
Hazy yellowish coulour with bubbly head and some yeast residues in the bottle. Quite fragrant with hints of lemon and coriander. Flavour yeasty, dry and fruity with an acidic finish. Sehr gut!
Cloudy yellow with citris aroma and light malt taste.  thin body finished smooth.  A good summer brew.
