Tap at The Yardhouse.  Served wtih a lemon.  Cloudy yellow pour. No real head.  Boring ass aroma of some yeast, and malt. Flavor is boring ass too.  Damn.  A bit of yeast, tartness and grain leads to a watery finish.  Bleh.
bottle, hazy yellow color, nose is banana, flavor of banana, spice and lemon, finish is a bit too light but a decent beer overall

Good hefeweizen, but not nearly as good as some other german ones such as franziskaner or weihenstephaner.  Light and soft feel. Citrus and yeasty wheat flavors, but nothing all that special.  Recently had it on tap.  Much better than the bottle!  Much fuller flavors will more spice.
Not quite sure whats so amazing about this beer, hard to see what all the fuss is about, pretty plain in all aspects really and can be over-priced too. It looks nice though.

Bottle from Kegs & Barrels in McKinney, TX.
Pours a very nice looking cloudy deep gols with white head. Aroma of bannana & orange. Flavor of nice wheat malt, bannana, slight citris. Mouthfeel is light with soft mouthfeel. Overalll, not bad but not great.....

Taste 8/8 Bottle(best by 10/8). Looks: Orange/pale gold. Nice full foam. Needs a slow pour. Looks nice in my Weihenstephan weizen. Aroma: Nice fresh lemon/orange zest. A little spice. Banana. Taste: Mild and smooth. Fruity, dry with a nice bitter touch. Fills the mouth well. Good finish. Really even and well made.
Bottle. Hazy yellow colour with a big, creamy white head. Fruity and malty nose. Flavour is malts, banana and yeast. Smooth and medium bodied. Maybe a bit mild but still very good.

11.2 oz bottle:  Pours a light pale yellow color, slightly cloudy.  Large, creamy white head.  Very faint aroma of straw and yeast.  Refreshing initial taste with a subtle finish of sweet spices.  Much more carbonation than I expected and also more light to medium in body.  Good but nothing special.

500ml bottle. Pours a hazy yellow, thick white creamy head that smells of banana bread. Deceptively smooth and simple on first taste, upon hitting the back of your palate the sweet flavour hits. Wonderful beer, if somewhat lighter than most.
50cl bottle, hazy yellow colour, white head, caramel and yeast aroma, banana notes, sweet flavour, clean finish, light for this style but good brew

(Drank on 4/11/04)

Pours a milky amber like color, it starts very good with its German malts, not bitter, but leaves a bit of sourness at the end

Can, 50cl. The beer pours a cloudy and light golden beer with a big head. The aroma is citrus and malts, has notes of fruits. The flavor is thin, but nice and clean. Has some spices in the finish. Overall an average german wheat beer.
Pours cloudy with a white head. Smells of banana and yeast. Good carbination. Very enjoyable.

Looks so good in a tall Weissen glass and has a nice creamy head.  This is an awesome beer on a hot day.  I could sit outside on a summer evening and drink these for hours.  There is lots of banana and yeasty flavor.  Good carbonation and very light bitterness.
Bottle. Hazy yellow colour, thick white head. Aroma of yeast, banana, wheat. Flavours are faint, dry, yeast, wheat. Lots of carbonation. Not a very good hefeweizen.

Semi-cloudy body with a fluffy white head that dissipates quickly.  Very light aroma of yeast and bananas.  Lots of carbonation on the palate.  A smooth and sweet enrty with a little banana flavor leads to a slightly bitter finish with a touch of clove(?)  A good hefeweizen.

Poured from a 500ml bottle (Best before 2-2009) and served in a weizen glass.  This hefe poured a hazy golden with a thick, foamy, white head that quickly settled into a few lingering bubbles.  A small amount of slippery lace was left around the glass.  The aroma of the beer was made up of wheat and faint citrus.  More oranges than banana.  The flavor included sweet oranges, bananas, lightly spicy yeast, some very smooth wheat, and just a kiss of hop bitterness at the finish.  The mouthfeel was light-bodied and well rounded with ample, soft carbonation.  Highly refreshing.  Quite a bit better than I was expecting.  A pretty good hefe.

500 mL bottle. To me, this is a standard for hefeweizen’s everywhere. Not necessarily the best in its class, but something to judge by. Kind of similar to how Hoegaarden is to white beers (to me anyways). This beer is full of wheat, with some hop accents, as well as some flowery, fruity notes. Golden with a solid head. Smooth, light finish. Just plain good stuff.
Poured it as usual. Had a hugh white head (half the glass). Honey colour. cloudy . Slight citrus smell. Quite smooth with lacing on the glass not alot of flavour though. Sweet taste quite refreshing.

This pure weiss beer from Germany was not very rich in flavor, but smooth as a pure German beer should be. 
The color was not cloudy, but had a nice creamy yellow to it.
500 ml bottle. orange yellow colour. big quick fading, white head. taste like all white-beers, not really for me ...

Some notes of citrus in smell, homogeneous white-yellow colour, and frothy head. good experience in the mouth, creamy texture and the taste is a good equilibrium between malt, hop and alcohol content, siomething difficult to achieve. althoug is a dense liquid it doesn’t make it less refreshing at cool temperature. great!!!

Pretty average Weissbeer.  Does not have the bubblegum smell.  Maybe their Urweizen is more of a southern style weizen.  Just okay.  Big head, average color, wheat taste/smell with a tiny bit of banana in the flavor.
Bottle, 500ml.  A refreshing taste, one of the more mediocre tasting weissbiers I have suckled on.

Bottle from Total Wine in Roseville. Brassy gold color with a substantial frothy white head. Light spice aroma. Medium body with fizzy carbonation. Flavor is wheat, spice and very subtle banana. Finish is smooth. No citrus sour. Pretty decent real ale.

big white head and medium straw color. Aroma is weak of faint cloves. Mouthfeel is sparkling with little bubbles.  Flavor is more like a lager than heffe weiss.  Not the bready yeasty flavor or full belly feel that I’d like.
Crystal clear yellow gold with huge fading dingy white head.  Aroma of sweet wheat and vanilla.  Flavor notes of honey, grain, and wheat.  Medium body with moderate carbonation but no carbonic bite.
Pleasant citrus gives way to a mild and undistinguished finish. Not memorable, but Sam’s in Durham NC had a good deal on these so I’m not sorry.
Cloudy gold, nice lasting head. Notes of frutis, citrus and yeast. Mainly sweet flavour and little sourness in finish. Reckon it is ok, but indifferent.

12oz. bottle, nice abundant head that slowly collapses. Very yeasty aroma that seems to be low in esters, but it is still very cold. Taste is a bit wheaty but more pils-like overall. Lacks the mouthfeel of other weissbiers, has an effervescent bite. Flavor is lacking any real standout characteristics, but is nicely brewed and has no glaring flaws other than that it doesn’t seem to fit the style ’guidelines’ very well. Still, in my opinion, rates higher than it’s average score.

can, aroma:refreshing pilsner like flavor, citrus notes. looks hazy golden with large white head, flavor : sweet, more like a pilsener, than a hefeweizen, strange sweetness also present in the aftertaste. refreshing, but a bit too sweet for me to call it really refreshing. alc. well hidden, good taste, but a bit boring. not a bad brew though.

Pours a cloudy yellow orange with a large foamy white head. Aroma is very heavy on the wheat and malt with some sweet banana notes along with some zesty lemon. Flavor is mild on the start with some sweet malt. Tasted a bit stale to me but it must have been an older bottle. Very heavy on the wheat and not much by way of fruit or tartness. High carbonation as well. Very little crispness and a long grainy aftertaste. Medium bodied. This was a disappointing beer that I had high hopes for. Unfortunately it fell into mediocrity.

Cloudy yellow with a huge white head, guess I poured it wrong… Aroma of grassy hops, lemon, yeast, toasted malt and very light banana.  Banana comes out more in the taste but it’s still muted compared to most other hefe’s I’ve had.  Wheat, light mint and mild spice join the banana flavor.  Body is semi-thin, somewhat grainy and it finishes a bit dry and chalky.  Not my favorite weiss beer, but passable.

This was a nice brew indeed. Golden amber pour with nice white head. Aromas of spices and malts. Many hefes have a banana character to them but this one had more of a citrusy character to it, in a good way. Good brew and would get it again.
I love the golden color. Nicely carbonated. Perfect balance of  maltiness and spice. The aroma of citrus while tasting malt is nice.  Buy far my favorite so far.
wow...a Hefe I actually liked. surprisingly light very mild. lacked the overpowering citrus character that makes me hate hefes in general.

Bottle. Cloudy gold, little banana. I was surprised at how mild this one was for a hefeweizen. When my GF said she liked it, I figured it wouldn’t be a very good Hefe. It’s pretty forgettable and far from a top 10 hefe for me. Meh.
Mosty diminishing white head. Hazy medium golden colored body.  Sweet aroma.  Soft carbanation.  Hint of banana. Excellent beer.

Cloudy yellow amber body.  Large quickly diminishing head.  Very muted flavor.  A little fruity with a large amount of yeasty texture.  This beer would be great for pounding.  This would be an awsome session beer.

(bottle 09-2008): Pours a very pale yellow body, cloudy. White head, somewhat lasting. Malty aroma, some light fruit. Nutty. More tempered banana taste, spices, maybe clove. Lots of body. Fizzy. Tasty.
smooth flavor, with yeast and spices. lacks the banana spices common in other german hefes, nevertheless a nice, if muted flavor.

Sunrise orange-tan head with luscious creamy head that poofs above the glass like a muffin top. Mild yeastiness and wheat in the aroma, both fresh and refreshing. Although the body lacks effervescence and seems under-carbonated, it has a luscious flavor of medium roasted grains, yeastiness, and smoothed with the essence of wheat, with a touch of yeasty alcohol on the finish.

From bottle. Spicy, sweet and fruity aroma. Im getting herbs and spice. The beer is hazy with a big frothy white head. Lace clings to the glass.  Smooth rich flavour, gain herb and corriander coming through. A little to sweet maybe.  Very drinkable with no nasty finish as some cheap version have in this style.
Decent wheat beer, in both bottle and draught. Brilliant white head with some lacing, clean and refreshing nose, fairly rounded taste,

12 oz bottle that came in multi-pack called "Beers of the World". Pours light hazy golding with a fizzy white head. Aroma is wheat. Flavor is light and crisp and only flavor is of  wheat and a little citrus. Refreshing brew but does lack complexity.
Quite a good wheat beer, not too heavy with a pleasant after taste.  I prefer it with a piece of freshly squeezed lime in it!! Give it a go!

Bottle at Flatbread: White head, light citrus aroma, light straw color. A very light hefe (paired well with semi-ripened soft cheese). Although lacking normal banana & clove, the full palate and yeasty finish make this a nice drink.
Just read the comment by joeyplush as I agree 100%. This is probably the weakest wheat I have had.

ole
ole
ole
ole
espaNa
espaNa

esta la hemos probado en todos lados desde el hotel aleman en santa elena hasta la ultima alucinacion

Golden color with a white, carbonated head.  aroma not very strong, and taste is bland and lacks any strong sense of fruit or spices - weak for a Hefe-Weizen.  Carbonation is evident in the finish, but no distinct taste.

500 ml bottle purchased at Lukas, KCMO.  Pour is hazy straw yellow - golden with a big, fluffy snow white head.  Aroma is really soft and full - wheat and yeast are primary, with the yeastiness offering up a nice earthy fullness as well as the spicy clove.  Some ripe fruitiness is present as well, not quite the typical banana, more of an apple pear.  Engaging nose.  Taste fall a bit short of the nose, though has the same apple - pear fruitiness, the wheat and the spicy earthy yeastiness.  The fruitiness in the taste also has some banana and pineapple.  There is also an acidity to the taste which does not entirely meld with the other tastes.  The acidity is not quite tart or sour, more of a metallic sour.  Palate is full without being heavy, and it is refreshing.  Overall, this is a good enough Hefe, though the flavor left me a bit wanting after the nose.
(bottle) pale gold with huge white head. Citrus aroma. Flavor is wheat, citrus, some fruity notes.
Bighead on an amber body. Quite a typical Weissbier, with all the characteristics. Fresh and a little fruity, really thirst-quenching. I’d have it again any time!
Bottle. Pours hazy yellow amber with a big fluffy head. Fruity aroma with citrus and wheat. Flavour is fresh and fruity but it lacks the banana to be a real good hefe-weisse.
Nice big head, cloudy amber body.  Full wheat taste, with a subtle citrus note or two.    A very nice wheat beer

Had on tap at the Frisco Grille in Columbia, Maryland.  very nice wheat.  Lots of citrus, but exceptionally smooth.  very easy to drink.  Poured a nice shade of yellow with lots of the weiss cloudiness. Good beer.

Cloudy gold with a large head. Aroma is light, more citrusy than banana/clovey. Very yeasty flavor. Not necessarily traditional hefeweizen yeast, but plain old yeast. Refreshing, crisp, but somewhat unsatisfying.

On tap at the Village Pourhouse in New York. Erdinger Weissbier (Hefe-Weizen) is an unclear orange yellow color with a very small head. The aroma is light and fresh with citrus undertones. The taste is dominated with lemon notes and the finish is dry with a nice little bite. This hefeweizen is missing the traditional banana and clove characteristics I expected.
Not bad for a hefeweizen. There was some mild carbonation and a citrus flavor. There was also a yeasty flavor and consistency in the brew.

50cl bottle from Willow Bend Liquors (Tampa). Pours yellow with a bright white three finger head. Smells of fresh fruit, grass and straw. Tastes slightly bitter and hoppy with notes of citrus and fresh fruit.
Served cold from tap. A nice beer that is refreshing and quite easy to drink. Hazy in color, nice white head, and a light-bodied feel. tastes of spice and sweetness. So-so carbonation. Enjoyable.
Huge long lasting white head. A little fruit in the aroma. A little sweet but easy to drink.
NIce beer in the setting sun. Poured with a hazy yellow apperance. The taste is lightly bitter, light body, average carbonation. But a nice way to end a day of work.
Bottle at bottlescrew Bills calgary, ab. Pretty plain and unexciting. Dry and nutty wheat aroma. Taste is pretty plain and nothing special.

Standard, so-so hefe I was hoping for a little more character. Sweet, dry wheat aroma with minor notes of banana and a touch of clove. Vibrant, cloudy, golden-orange color with a fluffy head and spotty lacing. Light bodied mouth feel that is fresh and quenching. Easily a good session beer, but I prefer more body. Crisp wheat malt, grainy along with a light citrus taste. Mild banana and mildly spiced cloves are present.

0,5l bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a small but strong head. Nice wheaty aroma and flavor. I might be overrating this a bit but I really really enjoyed it when I tasted it. Flawless hefeweizen. (758416)
Re-rate by lowering the score a bit closer to objective.
Can 50cl from Fakta. Hazy, dark yellow body with a large, creamy white head that mostly lasted. Light, sweet, yeasty taste with a slight bitter finish.

I was a bit disappointed with this one. Hazy yellow color with a big fluffy white head. Aroma is grassy and malty with only a slight hint of fruit. The flavor is somewhat bland with some spice, grassy and malty. Bottle is labeled as a hefeweizen but is seems more like a cross between a hefe and a lager to me.

On-tap at Bishops Arms, Järntorget, Gothenburg. Cloudy golden color with a fluffy white head. Light aroma of wheat, fruit, light spiciness and some citrus. Taste of malty sweetness, wheat, light cloves and light banana. Crisp and a bit dry.

Fruity, slightly zesty aroma, cloudy golden appearance. Initial tastes of spice and yeasty citrus with a dry almost astringent finish. I find this a refreshing weissbier--good for a hot day. Only down side is perhaps a little too fizzy, but that is nit picking..
Pours a nice hazy orangish color with a pretty decent head.  Flavor is fruity, kind of citrusy.  Overall, the beer is very smooth and finishes rather dry and grainy.

[16/5/2008 - on tap at Copa of Reading] Superb tall sinuous branded glass had all my friends wanting this beer too! Beer itself is a rather disturbing clouded brownish-yellow.  Taste initially surprisingly malty and hoppy for a wheat beer; the classic lemon and grass flavours only really come through in the aftertaste.  Not a particularly memorable example of the genre. [re-rate 3/4/2010 - 500ml bottle, gift from Jim - cheers!] Yellowy-amber, less cloudy than your usual hefe.  Huge fluffy white head. Citrus and wheat aroma.  On drinking the flavours are weak and watery - a hint of lemon, a touch of spice, some malt and a slight sourness in the finish.  Pickly carbonation at first mellows into quite a creamy mouthfeel.  Overall tastes like a macro-brewer’s low-cost imitation of a wheat beer.  Pretty poor.

Managed to finally get ahold of one of these, my preferred bar is usually out.  Pours a beautiful gold with a thick white head.  Has a clean grain aroma and simply tastes of purity. Very clean and smooth, a beautiful beer.

Bright, hazey golden coloured body with a thicker, creamy texture lots of wheat. A hint of coriander with subtle cloves. Nice lovely head, white top. Sticky and resinous lacing left behind. fruity attractive aroma.
Unclear light colored, thick head. Sweet and tasty, just not exceptional. An ok hefe-weizen.
Dark brown with big foamy tan head. Aroma is sweet and malty.  Taste is dry and biscuity with lightly malty finish.  Fairly neutral product.
Light grain and fruity malt aroma. Cloudy golden color with a large white head. Mildly bitter in the beginning with a sweet ending. Thick palate in the finish.

This beer pours a golden color with a thick head.  The smell is very wheaty with some spice in there too.  The flavor is lightly malty and wheat.  These are well balanced with some hops.  The body is light and so is the carbonation.  This beer goes down very smooth and I would imagine it would be great after mowing the lawn.
Pours a cloudy golden color with a large white head. Aroma of wheat and a bit of banana. Decent flavor, easy drinking. Quite passive, nice lawnmover beer.

This is a good beer.  Great head!  I think it would work well with any meal or just to drink by itself. It’s a really smooth drinking beer.  I only wish I would have let it cool a little more in my fridge before sampling (my bad).
(Draught in Berlin on 2008-02-08) Cloudy, yellow and brown in colour. Big lasting head. Hops and banana in nose. Some bitterness and banana in taste.

Nice pale gold, tan body. Foamy white head. Slight malt smell, very light citrus?, very little banana. Very light flavor, endind a bit metallic, almost offensive. Very drinkable but there is a tartness that doesn’t really belong. Not as full bodied as I would have wished.

Pours a clear straw yellow with a copious white soapy head that dissipates quickly.  Aroma of yeast is pervasive.  Taste-yeast, bread.... some hops and citrus.  One of the better Hefe’s I’ve ever had.  This is not my favorite style.

330ml Bottle - Gravity Beer Market - Olympia, WA 

Aroma – Nice wheat aroma with a good use of hops in the build.  A tas light struck skunk aroma. 

Appearance – Golden yellow in color, Nice head and hazy as they come. 

Flavor – A decent Hefe with lots of wheat and malt flavor. 
 
Palate – Crisp Mouthfeel, Decent texture with a dry finish. 

Overall – A decent average Hefe.  Had a good flavor just was average for a beer.
Probably my favorite German Weissbier from what little time I’ve spent there.  The same basic character as all the rest though.
tap ... i´m not a big fan of weissbeer, but this one is not too bad. very nice finish with this beer, but still not outstanding.
everything a hefe-weizen should be, great colour, perfect head, fantastic finish and excellent flavour!

Quite an impressive pour, a big creamy white head sits atop the cloudy yellow hefe-weizen.  The problem is that the appearance is this beer’s best quality as the body and flavor fall short of expectations.  At this time of year, I’m on a constant search for good, refreshing wheat beers for the upcoming summer months.  Erdinger, however, lacks my favorite wheat traits.  Overall, this hefe is rather bland, boring and rather nondescript.

Bottle. Huge, creamy, white lasting head with good lacing. Lightly cloudy yellow body. Average malt aroma of bread, hay, straw and cereal. Light hop aroma of grass, light yeast aroma, and in the finish some banana aroma. Medium body, oily texture, watery feel and average carbonation. The flavor has a short duration and is moderate sweet and lightly bitter. A fresh fruity beer.
...one of the better Hefe’s.  Nice citrus hints, with a sweet maly, slightly fruity notes, and slight spice.  Nice balanced beer, under the purity law.  Definitely worth trying.
pretty good wheat beer, sweet to sour taste. pretty strong. definitely one i would go back to, very consistent
Cloudy yellow - thin to medium body , medium carbonation. Sweet, wheaty.  Maybe a hint of banana. Slightly watery finish. Pleasant enough but not particularly interesting.

A cloudy orange/yellow colour with an initially huge frothy white head which rapidly dissipated to nothing.  Medium bodied though a little on the watery side. Fairly high carbonation. Fizzy mouth feel, sweet, slightly fruity. Tastes a little of bananas in the low to moderately bitter finish. - 500ml bottle.

(cleaning out my beer bottle collection as pictured in my profile and utilizing ratebeer.com)
As I recall, this was a pretty good wheat with tones of fruit and a touch of sourness.

Bottle thanks to shigadeyo.  Pours a gold with very small white head.  Nose of wheat with hint of sweet fruit.  Flavor is really crisp and clean of lemon and wheat.  Very basic and striaght forward flavor.

I tried this again recently.  The first bottle was pretty good, but It’s not a session beer.  Towards the third bottle, it started to develop a cloying, adjunct-like taste.  Kind of middle of the road for a German weisse.

Hazy gold-orange color.Foamy white head.It has a dusty earthy aroma, accented by orange peel, banana and a hint of clove.The flavor is rather bland, only slightly sweet.It has a milky texture, and is not very interesting.Hopefully their dunkel weiss is better.

This is a poor example of the style- especially coming from Germany.  Soapy, sudsy head, weak sparkling taste.  Somewhat metallic on the palate; maybe meant to appeal to the masses- @ 2.69/ .5 liter bottle... no thanks.
Pours a hazy golden colour, with a thick white head.  Tastes of straw, bananas, and cloves, with some hoppiness.  Quite good...
Golden in color with a pretty big foamy head.  Nice aromas of wheat and lemon.  Taste has wheat and yeast in it.  Cloudy look.  Thinner body.

Bottle poured into weizen glass- poured cloudy light golden yellow color, medium carbonation, decent white head formed and stayed, aroma of yeast, wheat, and lemons.  Hits the mouth with a thin body, an edge of sweetness from the start, wheat comes through ok, finish has a hint of banana.  Average heffy imho.
yeasty aroma, with cloudy golden color. Light sweet flavor. Decent, but not wowed.
Nagyon kedvelem a szüretlen búza söröket legyen az belga vagy német stílusú.Ez sem rossz,csak nekem egy kicsit olyan "vegytiszta" ízű.
pint at the dukes head in putney. It’s definitely one of the more quaffable wheats. Light in lemon and malt in nose and taste, destinctly cloudy in colour and unoffending.

a clear light beer with a quickly faind head. aroma of hops metal and slight notes of esters. 
the flavour offers some faint banana notes, some rust and not much more. Far from my favourite!
My favorite hefe-weizen. I would recommend it for anyone durring the wonderful month of October or any other time during the year.
Clean to the point of almost being boring.  Very light fruit flavors, but quite drinkable.
Uni Staff Club Tasting 29/01/08 Cloudy pale yellow, big clean white head. Lacking in wheat character, chalky generally unremarkable.
[WBA styles tasting] Cloudy amber color, with a seriously dense head formation. Yeasty, banana aroma. Slight  phenols, vanilla. Very bready, almost papery, oxidized. High carbonation; mouth drying.

17 oz of foam out of a 16.9 oz bottle. Excellent, just like a good weissebier should pour. Settle down to a pale yellow, slightly golden color, that is almost clear, just barely cloudy. Pretty clear for a claimed to be bottle fermented weisse. The head is active and thick and last a while. The aroma is nice like citrus, lemon, oarange peel, lime, and fine wheat, but too much sweet sugar comes through on the smells finish. Flavor is like cheap grain, corn, ,and such and not resembling a hefeweissebier, Quite a dissapointment. Don’t recommend this impersonation. Medium/light watery mouthfeel, almost flat (no carbonation.) Must be popular in Germany, (i.e. heavily marketed, to make up for the lack of performance).

On draft at a local bar - 
Excellent beer - a golden color with a white head.  The taste is that of a typical wheat beer - a nice slightly sweet taste with a hint of banana.  A very good, solid hefe, but not quite an outstanding one.
May 2007 - Little head, caramel brown color. A lot of caramel in this one and very sweet.  Not a lot of wheatness.  Maybe I had a bad bottle, but this wasn’t very good.
Typical hefeweizen appearance and aroma: wheat, some orange.  A bit light bodied but good overall.

Tasted 2008-02-13. Fresh bottle. Pours hazy, dark yellow with diminishing, white head. Aroma: Wheat, banana, cloves and bread. Flavours: Very little bitterness, a little sweet, nothing else - boring. Very weak, not really good, but not particularly bad either.

(500ml bottle) Purchased at Willows Parks in Calgary. Pours a large, lasting white head with a cloudy, mellow orange-golden body. Nose of wet wheat and bananas. Good yeast and wheat in the base, not as sweet at Schneider but you can tell that every bottle will be identical. Amazing consistency. Very nice to look at and taste.
Sampler-Firewaters Tropicana Atlantic City- Pours a nice crisp amber with little head, slightly bitter, mild after tastes. distinct malt flavoring, but slight on armoa.

pint bottle.  pours a hazy, cloudy orangish brown with direct aromas of citrus and other fruits, the initial hit to the palate is a cornecopia of fruit medleys with none taking center stage, rather all of them relaxing gently in as the hops attract some of the spotlight, tastes slightly bolder than a traditional hefe but nonetheless is decent...

1pt bottle:  Poured a dirty ater color with a thick white head that is quickly disappearing.  Bre itself seems a bit hazy in the glass and not really that appetizing.  Only thing i can really smell is a watter down hop.  Little surprised that the taste is better than everything else so far.  It lacks a bit of a finish to it though.  But otherwise a "decent brew"

A lovely wheat beer. Fruity.. actually refreshing. Medium Carbonation, Large White head and orange body. On tap at the Porterhouse, Dublin and from bottle at Coolers Dublin. I think I’ve found another regular...

Rated 5.12.2006 , then 27.12.2007

Bottle 500ml, brown, extract of wort: 12,4% of weight 

Appearance: Pours cloudy - hazy, orangy-citrusy, a bit metallic, very bright as for a German Hefe body, carbonation is almoust medium. Head initial appearance is average but than collapses in a minute, head colour is white without any shades and body hue is very light or weak. You can see yeasts floating in the body texture.

Aroma: Clementine, lemon, pineapple, kiwi fruit, lime, strawberry, but withought any considerable influence of yeasts and wheat. Rather refreshing and more hoppy in generall than a common German Hefe.

Flavour: Front is a wattery strawberry compote, then comes practically nothing but sweet water. Sweet wattery with some accidity becouse of effervescance that feels quite natural. Aroma is much more interesting than flavour. Very weak wheaty taste and perfume fragrant hoppy nose giving way to a slight fruitiness of lilac elder, clementine, pineapple, strawberries and lime. Not typical, interesting though somehow a bit below the average being not close to its style.

Palate: Body is medium, texture is wattery to creamy, not that easy going beer, carbonation on palate is soft. Finish is flat.
Bottle, yellow body. white head. malty and wheat like apple and a little banana. a medium beer.
Botella. Comprada en supermercado. Cerveza aceptable. Muy buen cuerpo. Un poco cremosa en la lengua, apenas.

draft @ papago. pours a hazy straw color with a quickly dissipating head. subdued aroma is fruity, yeasty, pale malt and some spice. the palate is lightly sweetened with notes of wheat, orange, lemon, yeast and vanilla. banana comes in the aftertaste. medium body and a smooth creamy texture. a great beer for drinkin’ in the heat in the summer.
Poured like a lager, with a slight haze. Weak palate, watery texture and not much to shout about here. Definitely not a good example of the hefe style

Pours like a pilsner, golden with large bubbles and medium sudsy white head, odd.  Smells like a pilsner too, grassy?  I guess the lager yeast explains this... I checked the label 3 times to make sure I was rating the right beer.  Tastes like someone poured pilsner into a glass that had a hefe in it before.  Slight apple taste, a little sour, definitely not like you’re typical hefe.  Sparkly full-bodied palate.   Interesting.    "The World’s #1 Hefe-Weizen" as the label says... I think not.
Pale yellow with large head. Aroma is yeasty with wheat and banana. Fruity flavor with primarily banana and wheat.

11.2 oz. bottle labeled as “Erdinger Hefe-Weizen.” Clean, yeasty, floral, fruity aroma. Cherry, bubblegum, banana, vanilla, and strawberries and cream scents. The aroma is not as powerful as that in some hefeweizens, but it certainly is not weak. I did two separate pours. The first was a translucent, sparkling, pale gold with a large amount of long-lasting bubbling. The second was a hazy, cloudy, golden tan that succeeds in making the liquid largely opaque. It looked a bit like apricot nectar in the glass. Both pours produced a large amount of tight, uneven, near-white head. Both pours smelled and tasted roughly the same. 

The flavor is dominated by lemon sourness. It is not a gross sourness, but it is not particularly tasty either. This bottle may be going slightly down the spoiled path; I’m not sure. It is a couple months old, but then again it’s only a couple months old. I suspect that it’s not quite at its fresh best, but it hasn’t yet gone bad either. Light fruit sweetness in the flavor. Reminiscent of apple juice and white wine. Bread, bubblegum, and tangerine flavors. There’s not much in the way of aftertaste; perhaps some dryness. Light body. Fluffy and soft in the palate. Easy to drink but insubstantial.

Erdinger Hefe-Weizen is inoffensive and acceptable but nothing to get excited about. As is the case for most beers in the style, the aroma and appearance surpass the flavor and the palate effects.  Unfortunately, the aroma and appearance are merely good, not great, and the flavor and palate are subpar.
Hazy yellow colour, white head. Aroma is initially dusty, followed by some fruit aromas. Flavour is very plain, some fruits and spices. Drinkable, but a mediocre hefeweizen.

Bottle (500ml). Poured a slightly cloudy off-yellow with golden highlights and a big frothy head which shrunk down to an average size. Aroma was mainly of honey with light vanilla and wheat notes plus some faint banana in the back. Flavor was grainy with honey, very light notes of banana and wheat. Light bodied with a watery texture, fizzy carbonation and a short finish.

16.9 oz bottle-A mild hazy yellowish body with a decent head that dissipated quickly into a small covering. Aroma of citrus and fruit. Taste of a light bodied hefe with some banana and cloves coming out but otherwise not very impressive, No hefe characteristics stood out. I was expecting more.

Não impressiona em comparação com outras cervejas do estilo. Falta aroma e gosto de fermento e banana, típicos das Weiss de estirpe. O resultado é uma cerveja fraca, um tanto aguada e sem muito caráter.

A very good hef but somewhat boring. I loved the smoothness of it but was a little disappointed with it’s lack of malty taste and fruitiness. Nevertheless for reasons I probably can’t explain, I really do enjoy this beer and seem to always have at least one in my fridge.

Nothing special here, in fact, nothing out of the bottle screamed a typical Heffe, no clove, no banana, and just a hint of wheat... no hops, no reall malt. Not watery, which is okay, but at least I would have expected SOME flavor. Rather boring beer. Poured golden yellow, thin 2-3cm while head. Nothing much on the nose except, um, corn sweetness. (Bottle Pour 1/2/2008)
Wasn’t over impressed with this guy.  Pretty standard stuff here.  Aroma lacked a bit.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours a cloudy yellow with a big but fading white head and a fruity, yeasty aroma. The taste is a bit sweeter than your average German hefeweizen. Also yeast and citrus, but the sweetness makes this a not so good hefeweizen

Re-rate: On tap at Concordia Ale House--Poured very hazy bright yellow-golden body.  A small white head.  Nose of spice and yeastiness.  Not s nutty or clovey as the better imports. Fruity, soft and a bit over priced.  Not too bad, but nothing spectacular
12 oz bottle. Aroma is yeast, wheat, and orange/citrus. Body is hazy orange with nice head. The taste is pretty standard for a german hefe - which is good.

Bottle, 50 cl. One of the best germans weissbiers.
Hazy blond color, with white head.
Aroma soms yeast, coriander.
Medium body.
Taste very good. Bit sweet, yeast, coriander, fruity.
OK !

500ml bottle.

Pours a hazy yellow orange with a good sized white head. Barely any lacing Smells yeasty and bready with some malt and hop presence. Taste is similar but somewhat more restrained than the aroma. Warm and bready with a bit of a hop finish. Not to bad.
bottle.  small white head into cloudy orangish-yellow body.  aromas were more muted than the hefes i am used to but had malts and hops.  flavor was also a but muted.  not a big fan of this one.

Poured into Erdinger Weizen glass. 

Pours a beautiful unfiltered golden color with an awesome pillowy head leaving great lacing all the way down the glass. Clove and banana in the aroma. Taste is of bread and yeast, followed by banana and clove in the finish. Higher carbonation than most, medium bodied. Very refreshing on a hot day here in Iowa. 

Note: Getting yourself a fresh bottle from Germany really helps, this one was from the local store and didn’t seem as good as the fresh ones in Germany.
You know, it was ok. I was crazy about it, but then again I also don’t like hefe-weizens. Wheaty, yellow color, wheaty taste. crisp, some carbonation..it was ok.

Appearance: sparkling blond color, some turbid. Great head, white color, dense and lasting.
Aroma: wheat, yeast with aromatic banana’s reminiscences. Some vanilla and pineapple. Metallic hoppy smells.
Flavor: wheaty start. Like in noose, the yeasty inject banana’s reminiscences. Fruitiness like pineapple, papayas and syrupy lemons. Low hoppy final taste. Wheaty and yeasty aftertaste.
Palate: light body and medium carbonated.
Mediocre beer.
One of the finest beers ever made. A classic weissbier with a crisp, sharp finish. I lived on the stuff and drunk it many times in bars in Bayreuth during my year at uni, 1997-98. Marvellous!

OK, nice fluffy white head, good cloud color, nice orange.  So far, so good.  Take a swig.   Hmmm, kinda sour.  Where’s the banana and clove?  The finish is .....water.  No body.  This is imported German beer?   OK, down the sink with this one, I’m going to crack open an Ayinger.  Don’t want to waste my time on this watery sour stuff.
Absolutely superb weisbier!  No finer beer to swill as the sun sets behind the horizon.
Ein Durchschnittsweizen, nicht so gut wie das Dunkle, muss ich sagen. Schon die Flasche ist nicht so ansprechend gestaltet. Mann kann es schon trinken, aber es gibt weitaus bessere Weißbiere.

Pours a pale yellowish color with a nice thick head that takes a good solid time to die down. Smells mostly of faint grassy hops.  Flavor is creamy and light, with hints at citrusness.  A little bit spicy in the finish, but pretty nice.  It feels very creamy in the mouth but not quite chewy, and carbonation is pretty low.
Fairly average wheatbeer, pretty much needs more of everything....nose, flavour the lot, it’s one redeeming feature is a slight tartness that is quite quenching.

On tap at Firewaters in Atlantic City.  Poured a cloudy orange color into the Erdinger Weizen glass.  Two fingers of white, frothy head stuck awhile.  Scents of clove, bananas, dried fruit, yeast and honey.  A nice drinkable hefeweizen, but not one I will seek out again.

Defiantely not my favorite heffe.  Aroma is weak, hard to pick out the apples, banana and clove.  The head was a creamy white that disappated quickly.  I could barely taste the fruit, clove lingered at the end.  I definatley will not be purchasing this particular bier again, especially with so many other fantastic heffe’s out there (franziskaner, schneider, ayinger, etc...)

Hmm. Everything about this Hefeweizen is slightly less than others. Its not as cloudy or dark. The aroma doesnt pop out at me like a Franziskaner. The taste is lite and easy. Overall I akin this to a Belgian White rather than a German Hefe.

Aroma is a yeast scent with mild malt tones.  Color is a deep hazy yellow with very active carbonation a big head.  Taste is mild and light.  It starts with a light body that goes down crisp with a fizzy feel.  Finish is very mild coming on with a faint malt taste backed by a very mild bitterness and yeast flavor.  This is just a weak Hefe, other the its appearance it has no Hefe characteristics at all.
Extremely mild flavor, aroma, and palate. Slight lemon hints with wheat and malt flavors. A little weak.

purchased at red apple in bremerton, washington.
pours cloudy pale yellow with a 3 finger white foamy head, lively carbonation.
smell is faint, wheat, lemon, subtle malts.
taste is wheat, banana, slight lemon, a bit tangy on the back of the tongue.
okay brew, bit on the weak side, not too much of a strong flavor.
Thick head and a hazy golden color.  Aroma is light and appealing.  Flavor is lighter than most hefe-weizens but enjoyable nonetheless.

Appearance: Hazy (duh) blonde  with a thick white head. 
Aroma: Wheat and light citrusy lemon with a slight sulphuriness.
Flavour: Crisp and wheaty. Light citrus from the nose comes through on the palate. Very low clove phenol. Bready with a pleasant yeast character a sweet and almost peppery taste.
Mouthfeel: Light bodied and spritzy.
Overall: Wheaty and spritzy fading into light citrus followed by lingering yeastiness with light sulphur. Slightly bready. Initially sweet on the palate but finishes dry.

Had this on tap at All That Beer after capping a mad run at the Bar-Hopping Thursday night event with my bud Robert in Seoul.  Nose of sweet wheat, citrus, and vanilla.  The brew is sparkling hazy blonde.  The tight uber creamy white head is mostly diminishing with good lace.  Mostly balanced with a high level of acidity and an accompanied tartness.  The medium uber creamy body is soft to lively.  The finish feels dry.

On tap at Krah krah, Vienna on our honeymoon.  Pours a cloudy yellow with a tall white head and lots of lacing.  Aroma is lemony but little else.  Sweet flavors of lemon, yeast, candy, and a creamy texture.  More bland than others hefeweizens.

A nice light beer.Canadian type carbonation. I could drink a lot of them. I look forward to trying others.Not your typical beer of the German people. But easy to drink and down to bottom before you know it left me wanting more. But only had 1 bottle. Sad but I will be getting more.

Bottle...OK beer, but as far as hefeweizens go this is the most mediocre German example I have tried. It’s overcarbonated, and the typical aromas and flavors from the yeast are very hard to pick up if they are there at all.

Have had in bottles but this rating pertains to my recent tasting at the brewery outlet in Munich. I would classify the Erdinger as an above-average Bavarian weissen. It doesn’t rock my world, but remains a fine example of the style.

Bottle - 500ml. Nice golden/orange cloudy body with low carbonation and a thick, lasting white foamy head. Malty/hoppy aroma with typical citrusy and yeasty hints. Its taste, however, lacks strenght. It ends with a decent bittersweet, yeasty finish. Good, refreshing Weizen.
not much to say, normal hefe color, but fainter smell and taste. very mild, nothings stands out.
Not the best Hefe I have had but not bad at all.  A lot of banana and wheat in the aroma and flavor.  A little clove to finnish.
nice amount of foam musty wheat aroma some banana bubblegum not as much as other German wheats, kinda clove banana taste very refreshing

500 ml bottle: Shared with the King after the awful Blanch de Chambly. This was a much better experience, however, my rating could be skewed by having the over-rated Blanche de Chambly. Very good. Yeasty flavourings but they don’t dominate. Very pleasant and I must agree witht the King about the mild banana like flavouring in the finish. A solid wheat choice.
500 mL bottle:  Unlike the over-rated Blanche de Chambly, this wheat beer has some solid flavour.  Yeasty, but not so much so, some nice rounded out flavour including banana.  Nice finish.

500ml and tap.  Easily one of my favorite hefeweizens while living in Germany.  Classic hefeweizen pour with maybe a bit more carbonation than usual.  Great mouth-feel with distinctive fruit and a slight creaminess from the lees.
classic unfiltered orange appearance with a nice frothy head. good aroma of orange peels perhaps and coriander, citrus at least. pretty classic hefe.

I’ve been looking for this one for a while and finally found it today; it seemed like something the LCBO claimed to carry, yet was never stocked. It pours a very nice looking pale orange, with a large, frothy white head. The aroma is typical, yeast, malts, some spices in their too. The taste seems to be very simple, malty, a small kick of hops and spices, with a very malty aftertaste. The mouth-feel is smooth with some roughness added from the carbonation. It seems to me to be a subdued, but still enjoyable German Hefeweizen, and I’m glad I finally could try it.

Subtle for a hefeweizen, but grows bolder as it reaches room temperature.  Lightly balanced hops and malt, perhaps more toward the hops. Subdued notes of dough or bread, hints of lemon in the background.  Color is a deep gold if your sure to stir the dregs and don’t leave them in the bottle.  Finishes dry for a weiss, and suggests a lager in disguise.

Tap. Light malt notes of light bread, light hops of herbs, and light yeast of dough with banana in the background. Head is small, white, and creamy with good lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is a hazy gold. Flavor starts lightly sweet and acidic then finishes moderately acidic and lightly bitter. Palate is medium, creamy with a soft carbonation. A full and rich hefeweizen.

On of my favourite beers of all time! The longer it sits the better it tastes (within reason). Drinking from the bottle does not allow the taste to come through. Erdinger tastes best when it is served in its specially designed glass. Very best in draught form.

Melissa Smith Dublin, Ireland
Wine smelling aroma on popping open the bottle. Poors a merky orange color. Bottle fermented. This beer is supurb!!!! Fantasticly smooth balanced taste. We have a winner!
500 ml bottle. a very good german hefe. pour cloudy orange with a fair sized white head. yeasty banana citris aromas. classic hefe flavours but  better then most. very enjoyable.

0.5 l bottle. Pours murky yellow body with big white head. Fine aroma of citrus mixed with something similar to banana but not exactly. A bit sweetish flavor, like honey, not even minimally sour. Nice long finish, medium carbonation. Very nice and after all interesting.

Looked good but wasn’t. Pours a yellow cloudy color with a soapy white head. Smells very sour and tastes like wheat and sour malt. Just not very nice taste. Even with the addition of lemon it was still weak. No thanks.

Bottle. Decent head. Minimal aroma of banana and bubble gum. Rather plain bready flavor. Thin mouthfeel.
An inoffensive, drinkable weissbier but, not the best by any means. Not nearly as good as their dunkel weiss.

Poured a cloudy gold color with a nice fluffy white head that lasted a while.  Aroma is the standard hefe smell....banana, clove, spice.  Mouthfeel is a little thin on this one.  Taste was a bit citrusy with banana.  Not bad, but maybe a bit subdued.  Easy enough to drink, but lacking something.  OK.

pale yellow gold with a fluffy white head. nicely carbonated. faint yeasty aroma with some lemons and banana. sweet yeasty flavor fairly bitter and a little spice and bananas. okay but i think its a little too sweet

Bottle, pours a fairly light yellow cloudy color with a good sized white head. Faint aroma, not much saaz or wheat notes. A touch of citrus. A bit of wheat flavor, some citrus, no breadiness or banana or spice to note. Easy enough to drink but very tame for a german hefe. Very average.

While inoffensive and certainly thirst quenching, this has none of the bananiness or spiciness which I’d usually expect from a German wheat beer. Very boring really. Easily the blandest example of this style I’ve tasted

500ml bottle 

5.3% ABV 

I tried this beer on September 4, 2007 after pruchasing from my local LCBO store.  It poured a murky gold colour into the glass with a large, loose white head that dissipated slowly.  The aroma was slightly malty with a hint of fruit.  The mouthfeel was medium bodied with a bit of carbonation on the tongue.  The taste was a little bit of malt with some spices and fruits in the background.
Not very many ’hefe’ like qualities in this one other than the appearance. Less than average.
Light golden, thick lacing head.  Pretty typical for a weiss style beer.  Wheaty, corn, light and fluffy.  Very clean, very smooth.  A consistent and tasty weizen.

Pour is a cloudy golden body with a white tight head.  Aroma is banana extreme.  Flavor is slightly metallic with the same banana flavor.  A little overcarbonated.  Not a top of the line hefe.  Slight honey flavor is detected.  Not terrible, but not my favorite hefe by any means.

Eh....terrible hefe. I always think a German style is best represented by German brewers but not in this case. Aroma was very thin and weak. Could pick up hints of yeast. Pour was a somewhat hazy orange with a nice 4 finger white head. Carbonation was medium and taste was very weak. More bubbles than anything. Very thin mouthfeel. Can pick up hints of yeast and spices but very faint.

Name: Weissbier (Hefe-Weizen)

Date: 06/09/2005

Mode: Bottle

Source: Tasting



cloudy yellow, fine white head, light sweet clovy aroma, good body, nice sweet carmel malt flavor, hint of banana, touch of spices, a good beer but a hefe?

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Name: Weissbier (Hefe-Weizen)

Date: 06/08/2006

Source: ww

Score: ii to ii+



huge fine bright white head, very tasty but still not very hefe



Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 13/20

Rating: 3.4/5.0
Drinkability: 8/10

Score: **+/4
Nice. Very nice. Glad it made its way to me. Will be buying again. Tasty. Cloudy, nice mild fruit finish.

A pale yellow/orange color, with a thick off-white head, which dissipated slowly. Smells sweetly of wheat & Lemon. Upon drinking it you know it’s a whitbier, wheaty taste with traces of lemon and coriander, though very light. Drinks very smooth. This is an incredible HEFE, one of the best.

On tap. Fluffy white head. Cloudy pale body. Slight banana aroma. Taste is the obvious banana taste with some malts. A little bit of spice to spice things up. Bready finish. Not too much taste, but overall it was an ok hefe... not watery at all like some of the style.

Tap at the Queen Adelaide, Wandsworth, 5th Aug 2007. Standard wheat beer appearance - cloudy, carbonated light straw colour with a decent head. Aroma is fresh citrus and straw, but with a bit of a soapy note. Refreshing taste of citrus and wheat. Drinkable, medium weight - this is a decent summer beer.

Nice sweet, slightly spicy aroma - pours a beautiful but only slightly hazy dull gold with a thick white head and great lacing. Taste is unfortunately quite bland - like a lager, mostly, but with just a touch of breadiness. Creamy body with slightly low carb. No spicing or hops to speak of, a nearly offensively bland beer.

Bottle: Pours a bit murky greyish yellow. Big fluffy persistent white head. Yeasty/bready aroma with strong undertones of spice. Strongest flavor is bready/yeasty, with some sourness. Nice feel in the mouth. Refreshing, simple, nice.

Bottle, Hazy yellow poured into a Weizen glass, prominent head which lasts. Has a mildly fruity/yeasty aroma with a surprisingly bland/weak flavour, it is such a let down considering how handsomely this beer pours. Very very average. *Sidenote* on a positive note, it cost only €8 for 6 bottles.

bottle.  slightly cloudy yellow with a foamy head that hangs in there.  aroma of malt, grain and light yeast.  taste of dough, biscuit, and malt.  the flavors are balanced nicely by sharp carbonation.  its a nice tasting hefe (if lacking the fruity a bit) but the doughy flavor wore on me  a bit.  worth a sample but i wouldn’t make it a regular.

revisited. excellent beer. well rounded. all the flavors and balance you want in a hefe.

500 ml bottle to drink by 1/2008. DId I get a bad bottle? This looks nice, all hazy orange/yellow with white foam that fades sehr schnell. It seems over-carbonated to me, with none of that creamy hefe texture. The flavor is only slightly fruity and spicy. No banana. Pretty lame, and I like the style.

Re-rate: first bottle must of been bad. A second bottle is still a little over-fizzy for my tastes, but more flavorful. Not a top-notch hefe, but pretty good.

Pours a pale yellow color with a bit of haze but not nearly as much as expected for a hefe. Head is one finger thick and snow white. Aroma is minimal and slightly sweet and spicy but actually more bitter than anything else, which was also surprising. Taste is interesting because all of the traditional weissbier qualities are there such as sweet and spicy with a bit of bannana thrown in but everything is on a much more subdued note. A really weak showing in flavor side of the house, not nearly as flavorful as many hefes I’ve had before. A beer that is simply OK and I won’t buy again. Perhaps I got an old or bad bottle?
Lattina 50cl ad un Bar a Castellina Marittima (PI). Very cheap hefe con aroma scarsino, sapore canonico e corpo acquosissimo. Un drink estivo di scarsa qualità, in tutti i supermercati italiani.

0.33L bottle. Classic hazy light yellow colour. Almost no banana and bubble in the mouth, very dry with some spices (cinamon and clove) and some faint pineapple notes. Very refreshing but not too complex.
golden brown appearance with a strong white head.  flavor is of esters with hints of clove and cinnamon.  aftertaste is almost bitter and it really brings the beer down.  nothing special at all
My all-time favorite beer.  Almost sweet, grassy taste, fantastic light color.  Very cheap to buy in Germany.  Top-notch.
Draught. Hazy straw color. Citrusy aroma. Sweet candy sweetness, lemon, slight banana. Unique tasting. Not your typical hefeweizen.

Drank this on 06-05-07 out of a weizen glass from a bottle. This beer was fairly common all throughout Germany and Austria. Cloudy gold pour with a 1/2 finger white head and lots of visible carbonation. Lots of banana, light citrus, a little coriander and very little wheat to smell. Wheaty and lemony with a little spice and clove thrown in initially. Fades to a pale malty and banana aftertatse. Carbonation is a little heavy but the beer has a solid medium body. A bit weaker and paler than I like my hefes, but an ok standard that is readily available.

Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a big sudsy head that can’t wait to disappear.

Smells of hay and not much else (which is strange, because other reviewers are mentioning so much that is definitely not coming from this glass).

The mouthfeel is crisp with perfectly balanced carbonation.

Tastes of sour apple, hops, citrus, and a smidgen of cloves. Very light in this department.

For a Hefe Weizen, this was a major disappointment. Of all I’ve had from Germany, this is not up to snuff. It almost seems more like a typical German lager, which it shouldn’t.  I won’t be having this one again.
Bottle. Cloudy amber with a big white head. Banana aroma with some cloves and yeast. Flavour of more bananas and spice. This was a bit one-dimensional.

Pours with an immense white head, audibly crackling as it fades rather quickly to a sudsy froth over a thick hazed, golden/amber body showcasing moderate-to-heavy carbonation. Banana bread aroma, albiet a loaf that has been sitting out overnight. Notes of cinnamon and allspice. Dank undertones. Thick, full body with tail-end chalkiness. Yeasts and malts meld nicely with the same-as-above bananas vs. breadiness, but a lemon-tart wash clears (or covers?) these flavors quickly. The impression that lasts is sadly that of 50/50 (lemon-lime soda). I was saving this for the occasion of saluting the late, great dortmunder as I passed him within the ranks of the Weizenvolker, but I’m now rather glad the event slipped my mind as this would have been a mediocre epitaph. 


Purchased last October from Archer Liquors, Chicago, IL 60638 (Obviously, phone first)
Meh.  Still in search of a good craft-brew hefeweizen.  Not much offered in aroma or flavor.

Hazy yellow body with a two fingersized white creamy head.
Aroma of mostly wheat and some subtle notes of citrus and fruit. The flavors is kinda weak but good tasting.
Theye are of wheat and dried fruit.
Palate is mediumthick.

Very nice looking beer.  Hazy wheat color with a large white head.  Aroma is spices, yeast, some citrus, and wheat.  Not all that exciting.  Flavor is light, but refreshing.  Spice, malt, yeast and some sweet fruits, though none of the flavors are all that strong.  Nice bubbly mouth.  Nothing too exciting, but not bad.

Poured cloudy orange, with a bit of head.  A much lighter tasting hefeweizen than I’m used to and it is much better.  More bubble gummy, banana, and light fruity orange flavors, rather than the spiced clove, coriander scent and taste I don’t care for.  Overall, probably my favorite German Hefeweizen, and one I could see actually getting again, unlike pretty much any other hef.

Bottle. Pale yellow golden colour, small carbon bubbles and small thick head that does not dissipate.  Aroma isn’t distinctive and smells mostly of wheat. Very strong banana taste. Quite light and smooth.

Pours a hazy golden colour with a small offwhite head. Aroma of wheat, citrus, cloves and yeast. Initial taste is wheat, mix of spices, clove and finishing slight banana. Medium Body. Long lasting palate.
Very nice hefe-weizen. from a bottle from woodman’s.  Healthy wheat flavor, very nice head citrus flavor.

Bottle. A classical german weissbier. Colour cloudy golden with huge head. Aroma wheat, citrus, banana and cloves. Taste nice typical wheat.

Rated first time 2007. I still agree in the rating.

Goodness, never realised this was a needed rate until tonight. Tap, Aikmans Cellar Bar, St Andrews. Cloudy straw colour with the huge white head expected. Some fruity citrus, quite light on the nose, some spices, cinnamon and banana, cloves and a touch of paprika. Flavour is watery but full of banana, citrus and dull spice. Quite lax on the palate. Enjoyable, but nothing special.

Pours a cloudy yellow, forming huge foam head.  Aroma of faint lemons, yeast?  Maybe spiced banana’s.  Flavor is of lemons, spices, perhaps some mild biscuits.  Fairly good beer from our friends in Germany.
Draught. Cloudy yellow orange body with decent head. Aroma is of spices, cloves, banana. Flavor is subtle and weak. Banana, spices, and light yeast.
Bright hazy yellow with a typical hefe head. Sort of a bad caricature of a hefe, a lot of yeast and and a little banana. A poor version of the style.

Lemon grass and clove aroma. Cloudy golden pour, very thick billowing head. Weak lemon flavor and even weaker hint of banana, off balance and almost flavorless. Thin mouthfeel. Not a drainpour, but horribly disappointing.
From tap. Pours hazy yellow to orange with a creamy white head. Aroma wheat and light citric. Creamy mouthfeel. Wheat and slight citric/mild spiced flavour. Soft wheaty finish. Good.

Had this the other night on tap and I could swear they mixed up the line with Labatt Blue.  The bartender denied it and I was left with a pint of uninspiring bland beer.  Will have to compare against the bottle sitting in my fridge.
Truly a drink of the Gods,With it’s cloudy appearance and great taste,not to mention the greatest pint glass in the history of man kind.
Bottle. Pours cloudy corn gold, yellow head. Aroma is citrus, hops, grass, slight skunk. Flavor is grass, wheat, slight citrus. A little on the sweet malty side and I can detect some skunk.
50 cl bottle. Unclear golden color. Big, long lasting white head. Fruity, some citrus. Very balanced, but also a bit thin and very boring.

Pours very hazy copper-orange, with a large, foamy white head. Light aroma of lemon zest, and semi-sweet wheat malt. Not really much going on flavor-wise. A bit of lemon zest, a slight hint of caramel, and wheat are all I’m getting. Palate is light/medium, a bit watery, but still has some body to it. Very small hint of peppery spice in the short and dry finish.

Hazy yellow-orange with a somewhat fizzy, large-bubble white head.  Light aromas of wheat and some banana.  Not a whole lot of spice.  Flavors accentuate the grains and the light toast malt.  A little spicier on the palate, but refreshing and crisp.  A bit metallic on the finish.

Pours a cloudy yellow/gold with a generous whjite head.  Smells of lemons and bananas with some grape qualities.  Tastes of dry malt, caramel, lemons, some tartness.  Mouthfeel is watery with a slightly peppery and citrussy finish.

Tremendous, overflowing white head, but little carbonation in the mouth.  Decent aroma.  Hazy golden color.  The flavor is decent though not as thick or as sharp as I like.  I still have yet to find a better hefe than Paulaner.  The most impressive thing about this beer is it’s tremendous white, foamy head.
as a bavarian beer taster  I have to rate "Erdinger" in the top 5. erdinger is one of the best, try it and try it again!!

Pours a hazy golden with a two finger head. Aroma is light malts with cloves and banana. Taste is typical hefeweizen dominated by cloves with some banana and sweet malts. Rather light and watery for me. Not particularly drinkable - I had to force myself to finish it off.
A very good Weissbier, with subtler taste than a Paulaner or a Hacker Pschorr.

Hazy gold with 1.5cm of frothy white foam. Grainy wheat, banana, other light fruits, and a touch of airy yeast. Same flavor, mild, easy. Light body, just a bit more carbonated than balanced. Lawnmower beer.

On tap at the local.  Fantastic match with the pizza burger.  Hazy like my brain after todays marathon computer session. Head dissipates slowly even after slice of orange is dropped on top.  this puppy was made for springtime!  Slightly sweet and smooth as a babys bottom.  I thought for a moment that my wife might like it (her being German and  all).... You can lead a horse to water..... A bench mark brew.  I am stumped as to why the low ratings.

5/22/2007:  Erdinger Hefe-Weizen has a hazy, lemon-yellow color with a large head.  The remaining crown is small, foamy, and off-white in color.  The aroma is lacking and really just smells like generic beer.  However, the flavor is better with some wheaty malt and subtle fruitiness.  This beer has a medium-light body, is nicely balanced, and is an easy to drink hefeweizen...




11.2 oz bottle (L165108; 5.3% ABV; Best Before End 08-2006) shared with Rob.

Hazy and golden with a nice head. The aroma has a discrete wheat note and the flavour is mild. It’s a good place to start if the weiss biers with more flavour are too strong - and it was my own start in the world of the weiss bier. It’s slightly sweet, a bit sour and has very light notes of wheat. When it becomes warmer, it has discrete notes of fruit. After I really have learned to appreciate weiss bier, I thinks it’s to weak.
On tap @ Mr Goodbar. Pretty good hefe. Smooth crisp & flavorful. Fruity apples & bananas not bad at all

Bottle. Hazy golden with large but shortlived fluffy white head. Hayish malt aroma with some fruity and spicy notes, and actually some alcohol, perhaps it was not cold enough.  Medium bodied, good carbonation. Good balance, but nothing special to it.

I’m not sure of the date, best by years go from 2001-2003, and the code is 1107 L145211. It may be from 2004 or earlier. 

Pale gold color with medium diminishing white head and no lacing. Aroma is very nice- huge apple and fruitiness. Flavor is still good- Strong fruits- apples, bananas, and just the smallest note of malts.

Bottle. Muddy pale brown body. Full creamy head. Very light sourish aroma. Flavour has some bitterness and is a bit sourish, but there is surprisingly little flavour in this. It is quite refreshing though. (Hotel bar Potsdam, 15.05.07)

Thinking i had a bad bottle of this, Poured typical within style Aroma was a little off not much bananas here little sweet and citrus.  Flavor was a little to much caramel and not enough bananas.  Not bad but not high in style for me if this was a good bottle.

bottle.  Nice white head when poured.  Maintained good head retention throughout the glass.  There was lively carbonation, aroma was of apples, pear, and bubble gum.   Very light and fruity on the palate.  Finished crisp.  I liked this one.
not quite as good as teh dark one but probably mostly due to appearnce... had it on tap in berlin and still highly enjoyable german hefe
Cloudy pour with a decient head. Not much taste which makes it a bee rot drink all night. Did nit impress me much at all.

Bottle from Bavarian hefe glass.  Pours nice reasonably cloudy, slightly pale orange with reasonably nice white head, though not a very fine bead.  Very mild aroma of banana-like esters with some citrus.  Refreshing light-medium body.  Very light flavors, perhaps excessively restrained for a German hefe-weizen, IMHO.  Ok to drink again, but definitely not my first choice.

Pours medium cloudy amber with one hell of a snowy-white head.  Nose is nothing remarkable, light on the esters.  Taste is fairly typical but with fewer of the fruity notes typical of Bavarian weizenbiers.  A pretty good weizenbier but not the best.
Not a great white beer. The aroma is sour, looks good, tastes alright but lacking any lasting flavour.

Pours a bubbly pale gold with a medium white head.  Nothing special looking.  Smells of wheat, grain, light spices, a little citrus, pretty much a typical wheat beer.  Taste has mostly wheat characters, light bodied for a wheat, with just a touch of cinnamon.  Easy drinking summer beer, good on a hot day.

Coloração âmbar clara. Bom creme branco, mas não persistente. Há sabor de weiss, mas bem leve. Suave, mas não chega a ser "agüada". Aroma fraco, com sugestão de banana. Leve amargor. Retrogosto agradável, embora não marcante.

Very nice, I’d say one of the best hefeweizens I’ve had. Not drowned by the too common overripe banana stench, but rather fresh oranges and grapefruit. Maybe sour apples. Fresh and a little bitter too. Yeast, ofcourse, has a small part too, but not too doughy. Some vanilla and toffee can also be detected.

On tap: Hazy pale gold in color with a nice sized white head. Aroma, wheat, lemon, some light spicing. Flavor, wheat, yeast, some spices, and light fruits, very malt forward. Bready mouthfeel, very refreshing.

Bottle 50cl. A hazy yellow beer with an enormous head. Aromas of strawberries, fruity, slightly spicy, a lot of yeast. Medium flavours. Some notes that remind me of mint. Not a huge amount of fruitiness. Rather watery. Strong yeast presence. It’ s not a great hefeweizen, pretty average. Quite refreshing though. Slightly fruity, minty finish. Sour, bitter elements in the aftertaste.

Pours cloudy copper with a large rocky white head. Aroma is very thin, light citrus, vanilla and banana. Smooth mouthful, flavours of vanilla, yeast, banana . Thin finish. Sadly I cant really get into this style.

Pours a hazy gold into a Weizen glass.  Fluffy bright white micro head with excellent retention.  Slight clove and grass aromas.  Sharp with upfront caramel and apples with a lasting yeast finish. Not the strongest flavors, but crisp, refreshing and satisfying as a summer ale.

Bottle 500ml. One of the best Weissbier, the arom is a little bit weak, but the fruity flavor was percepted. The white head disappear quicly. Remember that I did all ritual to drink this beer. Palate is bitter at finish. Amazing appearance, looks like a gradient color between yellow and gloden. :)

Uma das melhores cervejas de trigo já bebidas, com uma cor degradê entre um dourado e turvo, com um aroma fraco e um sabor frutado, deixando um pequeno amargor no palato. Eu fiz todo o ritual para beber a cerveja, tudo como manda o figurino. Inclinar o copo (copo próprio da erdinger), deixar 2 dedos no final da garra e mexer e em seguida dispejar no copo deixando uma espuma densa mas que some rapidamente. Mas é uma excelente cerveja e sempre que a encontro eu levo pra casa! :) Enjoy!

Bottle and tap - this is an excellent example of Weisbier.  Had this in Bonn recently too and it’s much better there than here in the US.  The appearance is cloudy, but bright.  Taste is slightly citrus and smooth.  Easy to drink and very refreshing.

Not a bad beer, but missing something to be a good one. Looks good, aroma light sharp and yeasty. Flavours yeast, wheaty sourness, hint of bubblegum, citrus hops. Mouthfeel develops very smooth and pleasant, soft lingering bitterness on palate. Easy drinking and quite refreshing but a bit bland.
good looking beer but lacks some things. it is a little too clean to be a hefe. I think it does have a nice mouth feel.

THIN WHEATY MOUTHFEEL. THIN CARBONATION AS WELL. CHALKY LOOKING BUT SOMEHOW I ENJOY THIS BEER. INTERESTING RAISIN BANANA BREAD PUDDING FLAVOR (HIDDEN). THE YEAST IS VERY CLASSY... CHEWY. AND THEN WHEN YOU SENSE IT, THAT MAKES THE AROMA BETTER. NICE BIG BREAD HEAD (WHITE). JUST A TOUCH OF SOMETHING TO BREAK IT UP BERRY ORANGEE CREAMSICLE (AGAIN LAID BACK) SPICEY CINNA/NUTMEGGEY. NICE,FOR A WEISSBEIR
Mmmm and it’s in a fun glass.  I poured a big head but it was worth it... love this beer!

Looks hazy and yellow in the glass. Head is huge as usual with weissbiers. At first feels quite crispy and a bit bitter in the mouth but vanishes quickly leaving a nicely balanced mouthfeel with earthy and sweet elements. Aroma has also quite much hops with a hint of citrus. A quality weissbier from Bavaria.

Poured from a 500ml bottle into a weizen glass, hazy pale yellow with a big fluffy head. Aroma was of yeast and citrus. The taste was sweet at the start with perhaps a hint of banana and then it settled into the typical wheat flavor. Easy to drink, but does not measure up to other German Hefeweizens.

500ml bottle. Slightly hazy yellow body with a big white head. Quite discrete aroma, a hint of sweet malt and yeast. Flavor is really refreshing but not so tasteful as I prefer from a weissbier. Relatively mild, neutral and one dimensional.
Bottle. Hazy golden colour with a large white head. Aroma of wheat & raspberries. Light sourish flavour. A bit bland.

My second rating sample which was an Erdinger hefe-weizen from the bottle was taken at my desk. The serve by date is March 2007 - so within range. A heavy malty smell rushed from the bottle as I popped it open with my Homer Simpson churchkey. The initial malt rush settled into a satsifying caramel aroma. I have to get more practice pouring weizens, as the glass quickly filled up with a frothy off-white head. Once the beer settled, a cloudy dark yellow brew appeared. I was a bit disappointed with the initial taste as the aroma and appearance promised a flavorful beer. It tasted moderatly sweet with a short sour finish - it had me reaching for another a sip to search for the taste ... a real tease.

on tap. cloudy orange yellow appearance, nice white head. yeast, citrus and banana aroma. citrus flavour with a bit of banana as well, medium body, smooth, very drinkable but definately not the best weissbier
A good weissbeer.  Hazy yellow with largishh white head.  Bananas & citrus.  Pretty drinkable.

[236-20070324] Tap @ Dark Horse (Toronto, ON). Smells clearly like banana wheat. Hazy, yellow orange body with a medium-lasting foamy white head. More banana and wheatie yeast in the flavour with some sweet citrus aftertaste. Medium body. Nicely blended, good to repeat.
Got some musty yeast and some light malt in the aroma.Pors a hazy gold with a large white head.Lots of sweet malt in the flavor.Medium mouthfel with a sweet finish.

pours a dark cloudy yellow with a nice two finger fluffy white head. aroma is lemon wheat with some clove, banana, and a touch of grain. has a light body with some lacing and good carbonation. flavor is lemon wheat, banana, and a touch of clove. mouth feel is a bit watery, but this is a good session hefe. has a little bite on the tongue from the carbonation and also has a small creamy feel to it as it warms. little malt and grain taste also as it warms.
Pours a cloudy light orange with a soupy white head. Aroma of bananas and some bread dough. The flavor are of light citrus fruit. Acidic all the way to the finish. Average Hefe-weizen.

(in can, 50 cl.).
The color is orange and something cloudy. The head is white, creamy and great, good lasting cord and. Has a beautiful appearance. The aroma is hoppy, with fruits. The flavor is slightly bitter, like the end. It has something sweet and pleasant in the language. The body of good. Is a very good “weisbier”, special for the strong and aromatic meals.

Re-rate 5/19/11: Bottle sample at a blind Hefeweizens tasting. Hazy golden. Aroma of yeast, a bit of caramel, fruits, some graininess and slightly honey-ish malt. Sweet sugary flavor with some malt, fruits and hints of wheat. Light-medium-bodied. My 14th place of the tasting. 5/3/5/2/9=2.4



Bottle. Cloudy yellow with a big, fast-diminishing, white head. Aroma is yeasty and a bit fruity (some banana). Flavor is sweet and yeasty and the finish is very lightly acidic. Light to medium bodied. Not a good example to what a hefe-weizen could be. 5/3/5/2/10=2.5

I’m not normally a wheat beer fan.  But, this beer was quite nice.  Pours a light straw color, with an enormous white head.  The aroma is only faintly wheat, with a bit of lemon in the aroma as well.  Very light body and pretty delicate flavor of wheat and lemon.  In fact, not much flavor at all.  But, as I said, not being a wheat beer fan, that’s a good thing.

Had it in bottle a number of times, but best of drought.  Also best in Erdinger’s tall glass. Nice hazy yellow appearance with slightly off white and reasonably sized head. Citrusy aroma, but not the high point.  Wonderful fruity taste dominated by citrus, though not to the extent Hoegaarden is. Palate is quite smooth and nice amount of carbonation. Can’t forget to mention the malt to. Quite well balanced. One of my favourite Weissbiers, which I am quite the fan of.
Bottled. Hazy yellowish with a rather large off-white head. Typical weisse with notes of banana, fruits, yeasts and citrus.
The best beer I`ve drunk so far. Malt taste is great and it has perfect dose of CO2. If you look at it you can`t see through and it has to be served in a typical erdinger high, slim tap!

On tap at local Taco Mac.  Good hefe, although very light.  Cleam smell, slightly citrus.  Cloudy yellow with a very creamy head.  Texture was very smooth going down.  Flavor was good, but compared to say, Paulaner, not as good.  Had mild banana flavor.  This was easy to drink, but I was left wanting a little more flavor.

Hazy yellow appearance with a decent white head. Sweet yeasty aroma, but very lacking in fruitiness. Flavor is sweet of wheat. Hobs are hard to recognize. The carbonation seems abit over the top, almost hurts to take a big zip of this one. The malt comes through in the finish and changes the sensation from sweet to bitter.
Nice smooth hefeweizen.  Not as sharp as I would have liked.  Would drink it again.
Refreshing citrus flavor you would expect in a in a weißbier, but also has hints of banana, and is reasonably smooth in comparison to some others. Very good.

Pours a cloudy yellow color, nice white head. Aroma is light with weak orange charcter and yeast primarily. Very Boring, refreshing and highly drinkable is the best way to describe this one. good but not the best.
A clowdy yellow, with a sharp wheat hop nose. a light sour citrus wheat, rather pleasent

Let me start off by saying, this rating is slightly biased because I am not a huge fan of wheat beers to begin with. That being said, this is one of the better wheat beers I have had. Much MUCH better on tap however, not impressed with the bottled version. A refreshing drink that I found went pretty good with my meal when I had it on tap in a restaurant.  Not a super appealing look or smell to the beer. Has murky yellow color, with decent head, and an aroma of yeast. Yeast was very dominant in the flavor, their were slight notes of sweet and biterness. Would drink again off tap, but not out of the bottle.
ReRate: Must have had a bad bottle the last time I had this, I decided to pick up another one the other day, and I’m pretty happy I did. Still not quite as good as Schneider’s but not bad.

Had in London over the summer and enjoyed greatly. Poured great out of the tap and left a nice head and cloudy appearance. Mouthfeel was amazing and went down smooth and refreshing. Flavor was equally as great."

Erdinger Dunkel is one of my favorite brews so I can’t wait to try this one, Erdinger Hefe-weizen.  I Was pleasantly surprised that it was no more costly than all the other brews in my beer store.  The cost was just $2 for a brown 11.2 oz bottle.  Gently pouring the beer into my mug, it first looks like any other ubiquitous clear pale yellow american beer.  Then comes the aesthetic impression; near the bottom of the pour the yeast starts to make its appearance.  Swirling, hypnotizing clouds and particles of yeast. Now the brew is cloudy like I expect from a good hefe.  The aroma is that of uncooked bread dough and citrus, perhaps lemons. No head on this brew but there is a constant stream of rising carbonation from within the brew.  The commencement on the tongue is pleasurable, it is well behaved and nonoffensive.  Beautiful above average carbonation greets the back of your throat. The taste is much better than troegs dream weaver and penns weizen.  Very little if any bitterness can be detected in this smooth tasting brew.  Not much similarity to the american lager, tho very gentlemanlike in its flavors. After many drinks, I think I am beginning to detect just an ever so slight mild linger. Very good and very nice, everybody should have a chance to taste this at least once. Has the personality of an orval with a hefe flavor and personality.
Cloudy straw color with good but fizzy white head / Weak nose of banana and grain / Light body, watery with fizzy carbonation, and faint finish / Weak flavors of banana, lemon, and grain / Poor.

A fine Hefeweizen Brew. Very nice  hazy yellow color and off white  half inch + / - head that doesn’t disappear . Classic  yeasty-bready aroma, banana, clove,  and slight citrus flavor. Great finish with tones of sweetness and yeast , a truly fine beer.  I would consider the Hefeweizen for it’s drinkability with a little swager. Erdinger should  make no apologies for tradition here.
Very low fruitiness, almost lager-like. Delightful taste, but way too tasteless. A weiss for the masses.

The first hefe-weizen I ever tasted, and it wasn’t half bad. Lovely soft texture with a light smell. Nice, faint banana taste with wheat lingering after a smooth mouthful. Looks good, has a nice fluffy head.

Okay, I’ve had more than a couple of different hefeweizens lately and this tastes less like one than anything I’ve had.  Yes, it’s a dark wheat beer....but it doesn’t smell like a Hefe, it doesn’t taste like a hefe.  Sorry, very bland and very forgetable
Yelow-Gold pour with a thick fluffy head.  It has a smooth wheat taste and very little bitterness.  I liked it a lot, and I’ll probably come back to this one again.
Nice wheat beer, with a good amount of head.  Has a nice flavor that ends with a good finish.

Bottle. Nice hazy golden with a big creamy mostly lasting white head. Frash aroma of malt, yeast, bit fruitiness and citrus. Flavour is fresh and clean with good maltiness, wheat, some yeast, citrus, bit fruity with some bitterness in the finish. A good Hefeweizen though not like a Franzizkaner.
Golden colour with white head and tast of yeast,coriander and bananas light sweet and light finish.
decent weisse, nie aroma of banana’s and cloves, not much yeast though. found it pretty thin compared to other weisses.

Bottle. Head was average with a white slightly frothy sparkle. Spare lacing. Cloudy body and color was yellow-orange. Aroma was light citrus, caramel yeast, banana, coriander, fruit and some perfume. Medium bodied and an average carbonation. Light sweet flavor with light notes of bitterness. Average finish I thought. Ok Weissbier.

Biggish creamy white head. Hazy orange body. Milky, faintly acidic wheat aroma with citric notes. Taste is wheaty caramel and citrus with a dry, spicy aftertaste. Clean, fresh. Really nice. One of the best globally distributed beers. (0.5l bottle.)
Clear golden brew with a nice fat layer of white foam. Me and German brews do not get along. They have that skunky hop aroma and taste that make me think they have already been drank once before.

Aroma is slightly lemony and citrus. Flavor is very bland with slight amounts of lemon and citrus. Very mediocre beer. I ended up squeezing a lemon slice into this to try and get some more flavor out of it.
Has a very wholesome delicious wheat taste, which when poured produces a nice, fluffy head. Definitely recommended
Pint Bottle... Poured a bright, hazy orange with a white head, nice lacing. Malty, fruity and grainy aroma. Sweet flavors of fruits and malt, quick finish.
