Flavour is again banana focused, wheat notes, very mildly spicy. Overall, it seemed light, perhaps thin, lacking a bit of clove/spice bite and fruit/citrus that other Weisses I’ve tried had.

I find this Weizen a bit thin and watery also, and acidic, whether on tap or bottled. It’s quite drinkable but I like more of a banana sweetness underpinning the hops, and more evocative spicy complexity. A solid but workmanlike Hefe.
[b] slight re-rate - poinmts removed for fresh, bottled example that is now unremittingly lifeless and BORING. Holy fuck LCBO, aren’t there better hefe’s you can sell you bunch of crown-corp sissies? Screw you for wasting my three bucks!!!!!
My first Weizen Beer. I tried it in Switzerland in it’s original 0,5 glass. Full and smooth taste. Always enjoy it.

Bottle from LCBO. Light golden colour, slightly hazy, with a generous white head. Aroma is muted and dusty, with some lemon and clove notes. Body is thin but refreshing, definately hit the spot on a warm summer evening. Flavour is simple but pleasant, and typical for the style. Certainly not the best weissbier I’ve ever had, but decent enough that I might pick up another couple of bottles for the hot weather that is supposed to continue all week.
hazy yellow, big full on frothy white head.  Watery palatte with hints of clove and a definite wheat yeast.  Smells faintly of apples as well.  Not bad.
HAzy pale yellow, thick white head. Sweet fruity nose with hints of clove. Acidic flavour, quite thin and watery. Notes of orange.
Berlin - Dark Gold Pour with an extreme wheat smell.  Taste is crisp, fruity, very nice.  This was a smooth one, I liked it alot.

Hazy, deep straw body with a tight sudsy white head. Aroma of ripe bananas and ripe pineapple with an odd artificial grape note like Big League Chew. Decent wheaty flavor with nutty and some light fruit notes plus a touch of black pepper and yeast. Smooth texture. A fair hefeweizen.

clouded dark yellow with a white head. aroma is lemony with something dusty. taste is pineapple and light banana with some caramel on the base of the tongue.  a butterscotch finish that doesn’t fit well.

looks ready to bite, hazy golden beer with a Huge head. smells citrussy, banana and a bit malty. taste: apricot, banana, cloves and a bit sweet/sourrish. finish is smooth with notes of  banana,  bit of apple and is sourrish. nice hefeweizen!

Bottle from Peace St. Market, Raleigh.  Hefes are great in the summer, but I’m desperately trying to rekindle my appreciation for them.  Maybe I need an Imperial Weiss?!  This one excites me.....not as much as current Playboy model and the hottest woman I have ever seen, namely Joanna Krupa, but fairly close.  The pour is canary with big, frothy white head.  Aroma of citrus, hops, sour mashy apple mush.  Tastes very well balanced with some hopcit, cloves, and apricots in the taste.  The finish is very smooth.  This one was initially ugly, wrinkled, and boring, but it came alive and got super smooth and welcoming as it warmed.....sort of like the Sophia Loren of beer.
Aroma of a wet field, pure white frothy head.  Taste is a little sweet, with some clove.   Yeast has a unique character.  Finish is short and dry.
Cloudy and golden, some decent white head. Typical basic wheat beer, nothing very complex but good nonetheless. Palate is very smooth. Enjoyable, could be a nice session beer.
750ml bottle somewhere in France. Enjoyable and simple beer. Nothing offensive here, and goes down very easily. Unfortunately, there isn’t a lot to enjoy but there’s enough to make it worthwhile.

Pours a hazy, very pale gold with a thick frothy ivory head. no lace. Smells of clove and a bit lemony. No banana....I take that back, some faint banana fruitiness in the background. Crisp wheat malt in the nose.

Taste is much like the nose. Lemony and spicy cloves. Lightly sour wheat malt. A bit of a spicy zing on the tongue. A little thin in the mouth, a little watery. Not bad. An easy drinker even though it doesn’t measure up to the Weihenstephaner and Paulaner examples of the style. A cute little hefe.

a consistantly underrated beer.
probably the best german wheatbeer available in the usa, in my opinion.
light banana notes and...only drawback...a slight iron aftertaste that makes me wonder if i ’ve bitten my lip too hard or something. 
still.
one of the better weissbeers. far above all the stuff coming out of oregon, and fellow weissbeer tucher.
Bright golden yellow.  Slightly sweet nose.  Subtle flaver that is ever slightly sweet with fruit (?)  Little aftertaste.  A tad wattery.

(Bottle 50 cl) Very carbonated, this beer makes it way out of the bottle by itself. Hazy, dark golden. Very soft, less spicy and fruity than most other Hefeweizens. Apparently this starts off with a topfermenting yeast and is then refermented with a lager yeast? Maybe that’s what makes it less wheaty. 170100

Light golden and somewhat cloudy.  Vigorous fluffy head and sparkling body. Spicy phenolic aroma.  Musty flavour.  Unexciting hefe due to restained yeast esters, missing prominent clove and banana notes.  Refreshing, but could be alot better.

Bottle made trip from Germany with future father-in-law.  Pours cloudy golden ornage with a thick, forsty white head.  Aroma is of yeast, honey, and a strong orange peel citrus.  Taste is soft, smooth, and full.  Palate is exceptionally smooth.  Taste of wheat with a sweetness underneath.

Bottle poured hazy yellow with a good head.
Soapy dishwater aroma with more of a swill beer flavor than anything..not that great...not bad cold.
Nothing too special. Very watery, with the palest of yellows as coloring. Good thing I had this at a ridiculoulsy expensive restaurant... Oh, and I drank like six, so that helped too...

A basic wheat bier, nothign much goign on here, thin almost watery. Usual banana clove flovours.
Session beer and will go down well with friends at partys and so on, but needs more.
Dry finish. RERATE: Becom,ing more and more bland it sems, the amount of wheat seems to have gone down and has become sweeter.
Quite clear for a hefe. Huge loose growing head fed by generous carbonation. Floral aroma with some hay and citrus. Indistinct in flavor for the style. Almost like an American Wheat.

Enjoyed a bottle at the Black Forest Restaurant in Nederland, CO, USA.  BTW, the meal and service were fantastic -- genuine German food, well-prepared, served hot and fresh. I extend a really STRONG recommendation for this restaurant!!!)
Apperance: nice pour, blonde with a snow-white medium head that reduced fairly soon to a small ring. Note: Nederland is at 8,200 feet altitude -- I suppose that effects the head retention?
Smell: mild banana, mown hay, light spices, light hops, lots of wheat/yeast. Really nice aroma.
Taste: nice wheaten flavor, mild hops, a bit of orange and clove.
Mouthfeel: too much carbonation for me.
Drinkability: only had one, so I can’t tell a lot here. Seemed very easy to drink, though the high carbonation might make one feel overfull. Could that be due, again, to the altitude at which this was consumed?
Overall, a nice H-W. Calls itself "The World’s #1 Hefe-Weizen," which is probably a bit of advertising hyperbole. I would drink this by choice in many situations.
Thin head, golden yellow. Dry, skunky corn aroma. Medium, frothy mouthfeel. Taste is sweet, with orange citrus. Only hints of bitterness, finish is slightly metallic.
I had this in a weizen which looked fantastic,hazy orange colour and large white frothy head.Gorgeous citrus aroma and sweet mouthfeel.I loved it1 Great Beer!!!

Pours a hazy golden color with a large white head, leaving behind brussels lace as you drink it. Fairly bland aroma yeast and a little fruit. Fairly bland flavor to go with the nose,just a clean wheat flavor with very little esters.

Nice looking hazy golden color, full white head. Very mild, some yeasty esters, little else. Medium bodied. Pretty uninspired. I honestly thought it was bland because I drank a Belgian strong not long before, but after reading over the reviews it seems that it was simply boring.

Draught in some upmarket bar in Birmingham. Looks the real deal in a glass the size of a vase; all gold and fluffy white head. Reasonable aroma, wheaty whiff with a bit of bananary shenanigans underneath but I thought it would be more pronounced. Clean tasting, rather refreshing.

My first beer of this style. Good white head. The colour was exactly like a jar of set honey. Sour aroma and something else in there too. Beeswax? Definitely a hint of floral sweetness. A lot of bubbles rising. Taste was intensely refreshing and satisfying. I waited and waited for the bitterness, but it was (to my taste), just a background hint.
draft, a typical hefe, just like the one i brewed.  small head, medium bodied, fruity and yeasty.

Re-rate: Bottle.  Not quite as good as the on tap version.  still very nice though.  full of flavour.  the finish is a nice woody, wheaty flavour.  not as oily as in bottle.

On Tap.  cloudy orange-yellow with big fluffy white head.  served in a very tall glass.mouthfeel is slick.  taste is fruity and wheaty. 5/3/2005 - 9/4/8/4/18

Tap : Poured in tall 0.5l German glass with a huge pale white foamy head with better then average retention. Aroma of wheat is extremely dominating with some subtle floral and sweet notes. Taste is extremely refreshing with light banana notes and great wheat taste. Body is just medium full and carbonation is excellent. Great refreshing beer with good mastering of this style.

This was a pretty good wheat beer but lacked the flavor to be called great.  I have tried many wheat beers and in all contexts of ratings, this comes out pretty average.  if you are new to wheat beers, this might be a good starting point.

A  brilliant lurid yellow color and has a perfectly even surface of head.  No sediment to be seen in the glass, nearly opaque besides the upper top of the weizen glass, and has heavy carbonation bubbles rising rapidly. Nose  has a aroma of yeast and small amount of hay and malt. Smooth flavor that is light, but is made up of slight use of pepper, bannana and a moderate amount of wheat. I almost finished the beer down to its finish before i wanted to add my slice of lemon becasue i was enjoying this hefeweizen so much. Fine example- what do you expect? it was brewed in Germany
Nice fresh citrus-aroma, head OK, flavour: powerfull finish bitter but good, light body,  soft carbonation, wonderfull feel in the mouth. Very good weiss-beer.
Pours golden with good white head.  Yeasty aroma with a little bit of banana.  Some spicy clove flavors as well as the bread, yeast, and banana.  Well carbonated.  A pretty decent Hefe.

Honostly...I really liked this beer.  The flavor is great, but not strong.  It’s got a light, cloudy look to it.  Apparently this beer has good head but I cannot say i saw that.  Good beer though, but not for the money ($11/6 pack).

Apple cider in color and clarity.  Honey, hazy golden.  The 5.3% crept through the solid wheat body fairly well.  A little bit of banana and clove esters.  Pretty good, would like to try with some kraut and bratwurst.
Decent head, with a sour aroma.  I’m going to steal something from Bark.  I drank this beer with some smoked cheese, and found it quite refreshing.  Sans the cheese, it’s watery.
Brewtopia ’05. Pale yellow and very clear? Nose was all yeast for me. Nothing special going on here.

04.16.05  Brewtopia ’05  500ml bottle.  Pale and pretty but clear for a hefe.  Big white head.  This is probably the ’World’s #1’ hefe because it is quite tame.  Light on flavor, and only very mild aromas although banana and and savory spice figure most prominantly.  Decent quaff but uninteresting.
Bottle. Cloudy pale yellow gold colour with a frothy white head. Light banana and lemon aroma. Relatively clean, some light lemon flavour. Light bodied, prickly mouthfeel.
Nice cloudy straw color with  medium white head. Lemon, grass, honey and malt aroma. Nice sweet malt, honey, lemon, grass and wheat flavors. Silky feel with a crisp finish. Very nice!

Cloudy golden color with a medium white head. The aroma and flavor hinted at lemon, wheat, yeast, sweet/honey tones. The feel was not as crisp as I would like...generally soft carbonation with a wet finish.

1 pint 0.9 fl. oz. bottle.  Best before date:  06/05.  Pours a hazy gold with HUGE white head.  Effervescent.  Aroma is lemony and yeasty.  Taste is sweet/sour yeastiness with lemons and just a touch of bananas.  Leans more toward the sour side.  Hints of perfume in the finish.  Thin and not as complex as other hefes I’ve had.  Still refreshing though.
On tap. Fine looking pale weissbier with good heasd retention. Unfortunately this is where the exfellence ends. Watery mouthfeel with small aroma and almost no flavor. Not bad, just uninteresting.

From bottle. Pours cloudy light straw with a nice fluffy white head that retained well and left some lacing on my wiezen glass. Light sweet yeasty banana aroma, not much else. Extends through to the flavour, which lacks the strength and subtle complexity of my referernce hefe - Weihenstephaner. Mouthfeel is also a little on the watery side. Still, a nice refreshing drop (but then, I am biased as I love the hefeweiss style).
Very fruit.  Got tastes of sourness and bananas.  Cloudy gold, thin/no head.  Decent carbonation; not stellar.
Carveza blanca o por lo menos rubia muy clarita. Esta muy buena. Buena rubia alemana. ;)

Bottle. The colour is yellow-orange and shady. The grand foam is white and airy. 

The smell is rather mild, sourish and rather neutral with some notes of vanilla and … soap?

The carbonation is strong, soda-like. Very refreshing. 

The taste is cooling and refreshing with a sourish taste and an unexpected body. There are notes of yeast and some bitterness. The aftertaste is surprisingly soft with a gentle sweetness and a fruity sour note. 

This beer accompanies robust, hot or smoked food well, but I found it a bit plain on its own.
Nice  weissbier here.  The wheat really takes the taster on a journey into WeissLand, population YOU.  Exquisite with lemon, as it really accentuates the wheat.  Recommended.
500ml bottle.   Pale straw color with a short lived white head.   Mild but decent flavors of wheat, yeast and a bit of fruitiness.   Enjoyable but unremarkable.
I thought this beer would be better than it was. but I am almost cretain it was not in good shape by when it get to Mexico.
On Tap. Hazy yellow. Slight aroma. A bit of honey and lemon flavor, very nice mouthfeel, fresh tasting and genuinely refreshing.
Pours a thin hazy golden weisse. Aroma with no bite, no fruitiness as a good weisse. Flavor only of wheat, no other impressions which was disappointing.

Bottle. Huge head on a light straw body. Nose smells like whaety cherry goodness. Notes of grapes, black pepper, sweet, honey, apple, and wheat. Very creamy soft mouthfeel. Finishes nice with a crisp tart taste. Overall, very enjoyable.

On tap at The Fly In The Loaf.

Bloody brilliant, killer hangovers though.

Very bright initially on the palate, leading to some sweet fruit and keeps it’s liveliness all the way till the end of the pint.
Tap. Cloudy golden color with medium white head. Aroma was mild of wheat. Flavor good of wheat and some yeast. Small finish.
Lovely mottle gold colour.  Light aromas of wheat.  A grippy not to wheaty taste.  A cracking beer.  Will buy again.

Roll the bottle on the counter a few times, pour 3/4 into weizen glass then shake last 1/4 and pour, then looks the way a Hefe-Weizen should, golden, cloudy and mysterious. Mild but very pleasant wheat/yeast smell of banana and spices. Lightly hopped but very nice mouthfeel and overall flavor with a great aftertaste. Only a decent hefe-weizen, but a great beer.

On tap at Alex P Keaton.  First of loved the glass it was seved in.  Straw coloured body,with thin white head.  very cloudy, with sedementation.  Aromas of yeast, sweet bananas, cant pick up much, not very aromatic.  Tatse is slight bananas bready, and somewhat sweet.  creamy on the palate, nice finish.

Bottle, at home.
Light yellow, not filtered. Aroma of coriander, light flavor of yeast.

On tap at Alex P Keaton in London, Ontario.Straw coloured body, very cloudy, with a thin white head accompanying.Lots of sediment....nice. Aromas are cloves, apples, bananas, sweet. Taste is sweet, citrus, spices, and a little watery at times. Smooth, creamy mouthfeel, nice bite, lingering apple aftertaste. Decent!
Nice, yellow color and creamy white head.  It lacked the typical bubblegum, banana aroma.  Very mild aroma.  The flavor was mild as well.  Mild spices apparent.

Hazy yellow-orange beer with snow white fluffy head. Aroma’s of wheat and yeast. Little bit of citrus in the nose and also hints of straw. the taste is a bit flat with an outspoken wheaty accent of (Wheatabix) and chalk. A good witbeer with a lack of freshness.

Consumed @ European Beer Cafe in Melbourne.  Nice enought place and they are having a crack at serving the beer righ and educating the punters in the process.

This one looked the business in the weizen glass - a perfect cloudy light yellow.  Nose was very neutral, perhaps a touch cold, but gave nothing away.  The palate was also flat, only faint spice and banana coming up, and in any event excess fizz killed much of the flavour.

malty as excpected, but not much of a citrus  
prescence.   Very heavy and strong bodied.  Flavor was too weak.
On tap. Sweet odor was clearly noticable. Body was yellow, cloudy with an average head. Was nice for the palate went down cool and crsip and was really a thirst quencher. Would order this beer again.
lost the notes on this one.  A month of europe and a lot of beer does that to ya

Bottled. Yellow and cloudy. Huge white head. Citrus and other fruits in the aroma. Taste is mainly sweet and fruity and very mild. Lacks taste and sting in my opionion, there are better Weissbier Hefe’s around.

Cloudy yellow body with a fluffy white cloud of a head.  Some citrus in the nose.  The body had a grainy yeast texture at first, which was not unpleasant, but tastes a little soapy towards the end.  Pleasant and refreshing, but not a champion of the style.

(16.9 ouce bottle, best by 8/05) Big white head atop a cloudy lemon yellow body.  Aroma is medium sweet, banana, light clove, lemon, metallic.  Taste is medium sweet, banana, apple, some clove.  Finish is mildly metallic.  Light-medium body, light acidic, some crispness.  Decidedly mediocre.

Nothing really special about this beer.  It wasn’t bad by any means but nothing really stood out in it.  There was flavor but it wasn’t as strong as I thought it would have been.  Has a white thick head that stays there for awhile and has a golden appearance to it.  Overall this was an above average beer.
Pours golden with a thin head. Aroma has a bit of hay and thats about it. Flavor was dry. Body was thin. Very mild beer, not much to rate. Would pass on it next time.

Strange aroma, alcohol and some unpleasant (polish, puke?) notes. Wheaty but without typical fruity notes. One dimensional, boring with unpleasant components. Famous beer, really poor taste and bad aroma.

Pours a hazy golden with a huge white head. 
Aroma is mildly grainy. Flavor is a little sweet and wheaty. Tastes more like an American wheat beer than any other German hefeweizen I’ve had.
Solid Hefe brew, very nice.  Cloudy lighter golden beer. Very sweet and yeasty aroma with hints of hops. Almost a green flavor with some tartness. Tangy finish.   Sehr gut!!

Tasted from the bottle (not my first time) it poured a pale hazy gold, with a big fluffy white head that stuck, glued to the side of the glass. Aroma was subtle, almost distant. Grainy, sweet malt and fruity esters. Palate was medium, with medium carbonation. Flavour was also subtle, sessionable (with phenols and esters prominant but balanced), low spicy notes, bananas, pale malt sweetness, yeast, wheat and a fruity bite. Decent and very quaffable, but undemanding. Still a good Hefe Weiss for the summer months.

Pours a cloudy pale golden with a frothy white head.  Aroma has some mild wheat and yeast notes, but not nearly as much as I’d prefer.  Starts with a subtle sweetness and banana flavor before turning more dry and thin toward a more malty than wheaty finish.  Almost has some lager-like characteristics to it.  This is just not yeasty and wheaty enough for me.  Sort of a standard run-of-the-mill German Hefeweizen.
Lovely apple like aroma, very refreshing,  a bit thin bodied, a little bit winey, i’m not a big wheat beer fan but this one is a really nice summer beer.

December 2004:  500 ml bottle served in an Erdinger glass at Resi’s Bierstube in Chicago.  Not often I get to try the dunkel and hefe from a brewer in a row...and this time the dunkel clearly wins.  This is cloudy light gold with a healthy creamy head...light, ethereal nose of banana, vanilla and clove...in the body alas its rather bland and watery, as low-level caramel/banana maltiness struggles to rise above a watery body...metallic elements at the finish hurt. 6/4/5/2 12 2.9

June 2008:  500 ml bottle from City Market in Burlington VT (June 2008), exp date Nov 2008, served a bit below cellar temp from a Ramstein weizen glass.  The pour is excellent with a typical lasting huge fluffy head and lightly hazy gold body....standard banana-clovy nose, somewhat muted but fairly fresh....this sample has more to it in the body, much fuller, juicy and lightly syrupy, with a nice sweet/sour maltiness/breadiness throughout.  Still far from a great hefe, but quite nice at this price -- and this freshness level.
Cloudy orange with a quite quickly disappearing head. Bana aroma, banana flavor. Quite mild and not very refreshing. Kinda boring, to be honest...
Large head, typical opaque Hefeweizen apperence. Low on flavor and palate; too light for my tastes. Wold not get again.

Big bellowing head, cloudy appearance, aroma displayed a touch of wheat and honey, less fragrant than I tought it would be, taste is very light hint of wheat and banana, nice thirst quencher not bold enough to drink for its own sake

Optimal foam of long persistence and much supporter. The veiled color is but little fizzy. Olfatto intensity much lowland, little perfumed. Lean aroma, lacking in the typical characteristics of the Weisse bier. Send again.

Cloudy orange with a rocky off-white head.  Aromas are yeast and lemon with the obligatory banana.  Flavours are initially hard to place because of the amount of carbonation.  Once the beer settles down we get wheat,  banana, lemon and spices with a dry finish and fairly long aftertaste.  A good refresher on a hot day.

draught    Dark straw, orange shine, fully cloudy; good firm head, leaving lace. Much citrus in the nose, even some hops, rather than the usual banana. Clove-y at best. Bit of dishwater. Dry taste, fruity and more "ale-y" than most Weizen. Bit of nutmeg aroma, more than the cloves. Well bodied, wheaty-slick, fairly carbonated, extremely dry. Better than the average Weizen, even when this is the epitomizing. Not very phenolic, more fruity esters.

Plenty of cloves and light banana aroma. Hazy, golden-orange with decent white head that recedes to ring. Strong, crisp wheat flavour with light banana and cloves tones. Clean, well-balanced. Fine-bubbled carbonation and medium body and strongly carbonated. A nice beer that seems a bit simple. Bottle enjoyed with MartinT and Rastacouere.

Cloudy sunny day pale gold. Nice full white head diminishes slowly. Interesting banana bread aroma with a wall of wheatiness hiding anything else fmo my olfactory senses. Big yeasty wheat taste, cookieish with shredded cloves and creamy bananas complements. Rather airy body, never biting, thin yet balanced with the taste. Approachable summer quaffer, but nothing distinguishable about this.
This didn’t really blow me away, just another imported beer, I didn’t get any fruity taste from it at all, just beer which didn’t taste that bad but won’t get again.
Looked the part with a good head. Very smooth easy drinking Weiß. Not much after taste though.
Pours cloudy pale gold .Nice banana nose. White creamy head . Medium bodied, nice to see yeast character with wheat malts, slightly acidic.
Very cloudy dark yellow body with a white head. Aroma of apples and spice. Flavor was sweet with bananas and a slighty sour finish.
Pours a hazy yellow, with a big white lasting frothy head, aroma is mostly yeast and banana. Taste is kind of .. relaxed. it’s a beer without to much character and complexity.

Draft @ BeerMarkt. Hazy pastel yellow with golden touches and a big fluffy white head. Looks like a wheat beer should. Bit of yeast, touch of estery lemon. Nice full bodied beer, flavours are a bit muddled but very nice. Wheaty tang and touch of spice - clove? in the finish. Touch of sweet banana, pleasantly yeasty. Not the most complex wheat but quite servicable.

Bottle from Erdinger glass. Huge rocky white lasting head. Yellow orange sparkling, consistent clouding. Light yeast aroma with apple, pear, banana and clove. Flavour a little bland for the style. Medium creamy body with good natural carbonation. Lasting chalky mineralic finish.

I’m not sure what surprised me more - finding this in Kunming or discovering I’d never tried it before.  I guess I just assumed I’d had it.  Light tan colour.  Hazy.  Gentle but insistent carbonation, leading to a thick white head.  Aroma is surprisingly light - slight spicy, sweaty yeast note.   Fairly light body, even for a wheat.  Watery flavour with faint bananas and a dusty yeast note.  Sweet, slightly cloying finish with a minty accent.  Poor example.
Good German weiss bier type. Fruity and spicy: aplle, banana, nutmeg, clove.

A typical wheat beer light yellow color with a finely beaded white head.  A slight hint of sourness in the initial flavor.  A smooth, creamy mouthfeel accentuated by the lively carbonation.  Finishes with hints of bubblegum.

Appearance in this weizen fits the bill to a T, with a hazy, pale, straw-yellow color, and a thick, fluffy, cloud-like head of foam.
Aroma is likewise on the mark for a typical hefe, lemony and sweet, but with a little bit of citric sour, as well.
On meeting the lips, this beer is remarkably smooth, with a nice texture, and a light body. Extraordinarily drinkable, but utterly lacking in any complexity or nuance. A simple, pleasing, nice little ale, with continual contributions of flavor. Not bad at all, by no means, but lacking anything in it to rise above the ordinary. As hefe weizens go, it’s an adequate sample, and goes down nice, and refreshing.

On tap, keg tapped only an hour before. Spice, soft wheat and bubblegum aromas. Hazy apricot, fair sized, rocky white head. Flavour has wheat, banana and some corriander. Light bodied, spicey and refreshing. Lucious!
Cloudy orange colour. Yeasty, herbal, banana aroma. Standard weizen,  slightly bitter. Lightbodied.  I don´t like it.

Sampled at Mr. Pickwick in Lucerne, Switzerland.

Cloudy Pale.

Aroma of wheat and notes of banana, clove, smoke and nutmeg.

Slightly sour, moderately bitter with notes of banana, clove, nutmeg and vanilla. At the time, this hit the spot. A few weeks later I sampled it again in a beach town near Venice, Italy and it wasn’t nearly as good so I lowered the original score a little. Still, a pretty solid Hefster though.

Beautiful cloudy yellow beer with a thick white head that lasts and lasts.  Very yeasty tasting with a hint of bubble gum.  Slightly oxidized, wet cardboard flavour.  Very thin body.  Looks great, but tastes like shit.
Nice and inoffensive, lacks spunk and spice.   A slight bananaflavour makes adds fun though.
Hmm.....murky yellow/orange colour. Not one of the better hefes I think, no spice, some very weak banana flavour, a bit metallic, and I drank it from the bottle. Enjoyable, but not much.
New beer for Turkey.Bit cloudy yellowish colour.Nice head,good aroma but finish is not so long.I will love to drink it after poor lagers over years of time.

I paid $5 Australian dollars for a 500ml bottle.
Was anticipating something much better than what I got. head retention was poor and the beer lacked flavour. I’ll probably try it again just because I always give things a second chance, but I’m not holding much ope. Drinkable and pleasant, but just not exciting.

Middle of the road average beer. Nothing spectacular. It’s definitely drinkable simply b/c it doesn’t have flavor to offend anyone. Much better after I added a lemon to increase flavor and to not make this one so dry.
(on bottle)A kind of alcoholic-banana aroma, strange for such a mild bier. Weak wheatfullness and ditto  carbonation. No finish to note, pretty boring for the type.
Fizzy and creamy, nice but rather dull taste. I’m a sucker for Hefe-Weizens, but this one I will only drink when there’s no other one available

Pours golden, average head that dissipates quickly.  Aroma is minimal.  Initial taste is smooth, very mild.  Almost no finish.  Average to thin body and mild carbonation.  An average brew, but much better than the more popular pale lagers.

My roommate had this in Germany and talked about how good it was.  I think he overhyped it, unless the bottle I got sat a little long on the shelf or something.  Nice example of hefeweizen but not as spectacular as he made it seem. Might need another try
On tap.  This was a very run-of-the-mill hefe.  Mild citrus flavor, almost too mild; but the beer is very crisp and thirst-quenching overall.  Good.
tap-old chicago, Rockford, IL-pours cloudy orange hue with nice sudsy white head-light aroma of banana and orange-light flavors but refreshing.  Pretty run of the mill hefe.

Rather dull, sludgy, colour. The aroma is rather restrained - not much in the way of banana esters and just a hint of citrus. The flavour has grapefruit, with hints of vanilla and clove but, again, isn’t very assertive. Slightly acidic finish. I found this quite refreshing, but a rather bland, commercial, weiss - OK to slake a thirst, but not really one to sip and savour. 500ml bottle, BBE 31 May 2005 from Morrisons supermarket.

On tap.  Great bubblegum and clove aroma.  Cloudy yellow with thiin white head (lack of head might be due to pour).  Tart flavor of wheat, clove and bubblegum/banana.  Medium body.  Very good hefeweizen, my 2nd favorite behind Weihenstephaner.

Pours light orange with a tall soapy white head that leaves minor lacing. Light malty aroma with a slight floral hop presence and a nice wheatiness. Very smooth going down with a very light mouthfeel and a crisp finish with a hint of citrus. Some good wheaty straw flavor in the light malty start and ends with a delicate bitterness providing a nice finish to this brew. A bit of a yeasty/bready taste to it, a great summer brew.

Cloudy orange pour with a soapy white head.  Speaking of soap, I think I caught some in the aroma along with a little yeast.  Wheat/straw taste.  Very thin and watery.  Becomes almost undrinkable when warmed.  I have no idea if I got a bad bottle, but I feel no urge to get another to find out.

500 ml big ’ole brown German bottle. An authentic Bavarian wheat beer, if ever there was one. Freshness date is of 02-2005. Slightly dated, but still lively nonetheless. Poured out a pale straw golden yellow color, with a volumous white head at first. It slid back rather slowly to a thick matting of lacing on top of the beer. Aromas are of slight bubblegum, lactic wheat malt, sweet yeasty bread, slight citrus, and phenols. Tastes are of a slightly phenolic nature, with the tang of the wheat shining thru. Just enough hops to balance the tang of the yeast and the wheat malt. Medium mouthfeel. Crisp, and tingly on the tongue. Refreshing, easily drinkable, especially on out famous Washington, DC summer days. I found it to be one of the better Hefe-Weizens I’ve had recently. I think you’ll find it everything I’ve said it was.

Had this at Pappys in Panama City.  It just couldn’t measure up to the offerings by Tucher, Paulaner, and Franziskaner.  This beer poured a cloudy yellow color and formed a huge foamy white head that took it’s time disappearing, but left little lace in the process. A medium amount of carbonation is present. It had an aroma of hops, banana and clove with a hint of grain. A flavor of hops and grain. The body is fairly light and rather weak. Not one of the better hefes I have tried lately
Hazy golden color, Medium fruity aroma and taste, medium body, fresh fruity finish.

Pours a cloudy yellow with a massive foamy head. Flavor and aroma-wise, this one is pretty bland; there are hints of fruit, yeast, and banana in both, but not to the extent one would expect given a beer of this style. It’s very thin bodied and crisp. Exactly what you’d expect from a hefewizen, which is why I wasn’t too impressed with this one. When garnished wiith a lemon on a hot day, however, it’s quite refreshing. Not bad, but not worth going out of your way for.

Cloudy colored with big bubbled head. Aroma is sweet and slightly fruity, but no "normal" banana aroma can be found. Crispy carbonatrion bite in start and mild banana flavor comes up later. Leaves somehow dry feeling in mouth, maybe it comes from mild yeast and alcohol flavor in the end. Not the most traditional weissbier, more body would have done this beer better.

It looks like a hefeweizen, but this one is way too muted in both aroma and flavor. It’s got a bit of the clove thing on, but hardly any citrus or banana flavors or smells that you’d expect from that style. It’s cloudy to look at, but it tastes filtered.

50 cL bottle, weizen glass.  Light bread malt nose followed by a generous helping of earthy, German hops.  Cloves and, to a lesser degree, bananas make the expected apperance.  Typical hazy peach body is topped by a somewhat disappointingly fizzy head.  Moderately sweet, moderately acidic flavor turns into a lightly sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter finish.  Medium body, watery texture, fizzy carbonation.  The bottom line is: I have a fever and the only cure is...MORE BANANA!!!

Cloudy milky yellow with fine head somewhat thick. Metal and banana on the nose.  Light sparkle, somewhat creamy mouthfeel, though very light citrus balances it.  Finishing with banana and soft vanilla. Simple though very refreshing.
Cloudy deep yellow color with a typical large white head. Aroma is rather weak but essentially a yeasty citrus. Mouthfeel was creamy smooth as it should. Flavor also a bit restrained.
Bottle.  Big foamy head, a hair less cloudy than a hefe typically is.  Dry, slightly wheaty smell.  Dry yeastiness, some hay/straw, a bit of barnyard in the finish.  Pretty good.

A very solid German weizen just a notch below the best in the style. +++Sampled from a 16.9 oz bottle this beer poured a cloudy orange-golden color with a large creamy white head. There was a moderately strong citrus aroma with a hint of sweet wheat. The flavor was predominantly sweet wheat with a subdued citrus undercurrent. The mouthfeel was thick and creamy for a wheat beer.
Overall a very decent tasting beer.  Medium bodied with a slightly bitter taste.

50cl brown bottle. Poured a cloudy gold with huge white frothy head. Refreshing citrus wheat nose. Crisp fresh fruity flavour quite unlike the Belgian wheat beers more like a really good lager. Full mouthfeel with a fine finish. A refreshing beer great at lunchtime and good value for £1.59 at Safeway.
This beer looks good and tastes good. It satisfies all the criteria for a hefeweizen. Quite enjoyable.

Subtler aroma than most Hefes.  Good head.  Flavor of banana and cloves than again is more subtle than most Hefes.  A very good Weizen but lighter than most.  A good choice for those who don’t like a strong Weizen
On Tap at The Cellar in St.Andrews.  A wonderful wheat tasting beer.  Slight Fruit....very good.

Eh. A little weak tasting and thin for a hefeweizen, but not bad overall. Poured a cloudy amber ... not much in the way of aroma ... a little yeast in the nose. Flavor was like a hefe, but as I said before a bit thin. Hints of bananas and cloves. Kind of like a hefe-light. Not bad, though, just not overwhelmingly good.

Has a generic fruity taste and some banana flavors, but not much in the way of the traditional "spicy" hefeweizen flavors. Large foamy head forms and retains well on this one. Very easy to drink, but quite simple.

well for 8.99 a 6 pack, id say this lacks a bit.  it tastes good, but it really lacks smell.  and when you get down to it it just tastes like beer, there isnt too much lemony sweet wheat flavor that most hefes have.  all in all its not bad, but not something i will buy again.
Bottle. Not much aroma or flavor to this one. Disappointing since German Hefeweizen is one of my favorite beer styles. Not a whole lot going on with this one. Watery and thin flavor and mouthfeel.

As I am finding. most of the stuff from erdinger is pretty wattery. There is just a kick of yeast and wheat to it, but overall it is mostly watery. Easily drinkable... So it gets some points there. I guess

Weak, watery stuff.  Amb
er with frothy white head.  Aroma was weak and perfumy.  Flavor was forgettable and regrettable.
Medium head; dissipates a little too quickly. Nice aroma, great citrussy taste. Refreshing and extremely drinkable.
A really fine Weiss. Well balanced and come in the coolest cup I have ever seen.

I agree with legion242, this is underrated! Bottle purchased at a local grocery store. Huge white head and a nice cloudy orange-yellow color. Lots of lacing. Aroma of tangerines, grass and some bread. The taste was light with a little grass, nutmeg spice and a sweet cidery finish. The mouthfeel is full. Overall, a very nice hefe. I would definitely try this again.
Pours a cloudy yellowish orange with thin white head. Faint yeast aroma. Tastes of thick carbonation, watered down yeast, a hint of wheat, and maybe a little sweetness.
Pours a cloudy yellow. Not much of a head.  No real aroma or flavor. I can get spices and vanilla but thay are very weak.  Not the best of its kind.

Poured a cloudy dark-straw color...lovely chunky 3-finger cap that lasts! Lots of effervescent activity. Not overly perfumed to the nose had little of  the standard hefe-weiss aromas of banana-cloves... very subdued. Started with a mild but refreshing maltiness which then gets peppery as the carbonation kicks the palate and the mild fruity-spicy "bubblegum" tastes are imparted then finishes sweet and sour with a slight sweetish malt after taste.

A good commercial weissbrau, subdued, light body...but very thirst quenching and very drinkable.

Pours cloudy yellow with a nice fluffy Weiss head. Great banana aroma. MOuthfeel has the neccesary grittiness. I am quite surprised that his beer is not rated higher. I think that it is a great representation of German wheats.
This is a very good Hefeweizen. Tasted great from first sip to last. Not much head out of the bottle. It didn't matter. Still a good drinking beer.
Cloudy tannnish color with a white minimal head. Faint aroma of cloves and yeast. Flavor lacks some character. Mild not much body. Still sweet and a little tart which leads to a pleasant aftertaste.
Sweet mild taste. It's creamy head disapears quickly. There is a fruity aroma and a sweet finish.

I'd say that the character of this beer comes from the carbonation at least as much as it comes from the grain.  The taste and aftertaste are very like a wheat bread, but there's a sourness that comes from the heavy carbonation.  Just behind the initial bready taste is the taste of unadulterated club soda.  The beer lacks the sweetness of other weissbeers I've had, which is unfortunate.

Big foamy head, and a little on the cloudy side, but not as cloudy as other hefes I've had. Also, not as much citrus taste as I was hoping for either. The flavor was disappointing, but the beer is still very drinkable, just not what I was expecting.

Hazy orangish-yellow color.  Nice medium head.  Contrary to previous posts, minimal lacing with mine.  Nice citrusy aroma.  Good balance between slight sweetness and slight bitternes.  Taste is not as strong as appearance and aroma would indicate.  Minimal aftertaste.
Had this on draught in Chicago.  This was an outstanding weissbier.  Crisp, refreshing, not too heavy.  Recommend to anyone.
Very cloudy with thick white head. Excellent wheat beer taste. Not the citrusy wheat beer, but flavors of clove and yeast.
Cloves in the clouds!  As good as weissbier gets.  Only the occasional Aventinus is more dear to me among weissbiers.
Excellent taste. I have not had a bad hefeweizen. This proves that germans can make a good brew

Bottle. Hazy, orange body.  Large white, creamy head, good lacing and mostly lasting.  This is a beauty.  Hoppy (citrus ) aroma.  Lightly bitter initial flavour.  Lightly bitter, lightly sweet finish.  Soft mouthfeel.  It looks nice but the flavour is just weak and not very interesting.  Perhaps this is what big breweries are looking for: nice looksm but the hell with the flavour.  I prefer it the other way around.
This is a good Weissbier, which is still not my favorite kind of beer, but it is good.  Sweet taste, good aftertaste, and a nice beer overall.

Quality aroma, beautiful appearance of an effervescent medium golden. Tasted very carbonated and enjoyable on the tongue, though perhaps too bubbly for regular eins, zwei, gsuffa mode, if you know what I mean (and you probably don’t). Good, but not the best. Ayinger Braeu-Weisse or Paulaner Weissbier is still better.

Woha!  Massive, creamy head from this pour, but it only lasts a minute or two and then falls flat.  Pours cloudy yellow/orange, thanks to the bottle conditioning.  Strange aroma of fruit and chedder cheese.  Quite light in flavor.  Very little spice and lighter flavor.  Definately not a top hefeweizen in my book, but it is crisp and drinkable, even if it is a little boring.  I definately prefer a weizen with more of a sharp citrus taste.  Definately LOOKS good, but lacks in taste compared to better beers of the style.  Almost tastes like an American Wheat.

Additional notes:  Upon trying this one again, I must mentions that I find it to be a bit too much like a lager.  The hops and yeast mix seem to displace it a bit.  Not bad, but I’d prefer a Paulaner any day.  Added a few more points because I’m enjoying its crisp finish.
Fantastic hefeweizen, can't really say much else. I feel this gets a bad wrap, too; on visits to Germany I have found very few selections that can rival erdinger.  A good beer no matter the occasion.
I believe this is underrated. A cloudy unpasteurized wheat, this has a good bit of lemon to go with it's pepper, much less banana sweet than some cousins. I liked it a great deal.
Hazy golden body, huge frothy head, looks like a hefeweizen should look, nothing special there. Aroma is yeast, fruits, bread. Very neutral taste, wheres the yeast? Although a creamy mouthfeel.

Light hazy golden in color with a medium white head.Aroma is of subtle yeast and fruit,nothing distinctive. Flavor is of a subtle wheat tang. Not offensive yet nothing impressive. No banana character is evidant at all.
Nice head... Standard weissbier... Nothing more to sat really... Its a beer

The German version of Bud light. You find this everywhere in Germany. Pours like a wheat with a sharp aroma and little mouthfeel. You can get a nice buzz off of this and it makes a great session or party beer, but you won't take it home to momma.
It is what I would expect in a standard wheat beer. Nothing special but enjoyable.
Hazy like a hefe...sparkling eggshell head.  Coriander and clove in the taste, citric background....typical....a pretty decent take on the style, but nothing outstanding here.

Cloudy appearance with clean white head,  Slight aroma of wheat and lemons.  Taste is pleasant but nothing special, in fact a tad bland.  Obviously mass produced and none too good for it.Score 2.9
Subsequent ratings scored 2.9, 2.9, 2.8 and 3.2 Score unaltered
only slightly cloudy, and very light in colour.  Pours a massive tight, white head.  Wheaty aroma, and crisp taste, makes for easy drinking.
Cloudy yeallow color with a big full head. Fruitty nose and thin mouthfeel. Malty with a crisp finish.

Bottled. 
Cloudy pale yellow, rocky cotton-like head. Big estery banana nose with pretty much of phenols. Flavour is big, with a mouthcoating estery feel and phenols. Actually some biiterness. Very good balance!
Big white head, cloudy dark yellow beer. Nice mouthfeel, bland taste. Slightly sweet flavour with little wheat character.
Tons of carbination, banana and bisquits notes, very light.  My first wheat beer, and it is pretty good, somewhat bland I guess, doesn't leave an imprint in my mind, but it will do for now.

Hazy medium gold color with a prolific head, lots of carbonation and a mild citrus/melon aroma. This beer was light bodied and creamy with a pleasant wheaty flavor but wasn't particularly fruity or spicy. Typical short finish.
Incredibly huge, nearly impenetrable head on a wheaty-gold beer.  Ashy-musty with a dirty sock flavor.  After the Ayinger, this wasn't as good.  Their dunkleweizen is much better.
Good hoppy aroma, hazzy appearance and a nice big white head. Medium body with a lot of carbonation. Perfect on a warm summerday.

Hazy, very light yellow lager with a huge, frothy, white head. Very good retention and cool lacing.
The aroma is very fruity and citrusy with notes of orange blossom honey, bubble gum and butterscotch... yeasty as well with notes of bisquit.
Malty, sweet, fruity flavor. Well-balanced with a generous, perfect hop addition. Flavors of pineapple, nectarine and overripe apricot. Medium-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Medium-length, malty, dry finish.
Yellow color with a great white head. Strong yeast and wheat aroma. Flavor of wheat, yeast, citric acid and some fruity notes. Unpleasant.

Murky lemon yellow colour with a good frothy head and slight lacing. Soft banana taste along with cloves and no vanilla as I had in my last wheat beer. Overall generally good but needs more body for me.
If this is not the best wheat beer in the world i would like to know what is. lemons a plenty, yeasty cloudy and tastes pure and natural. This is fantastic, why are most wheat beers so boring?

The most accessible foreign weissbier in Denmark. Not very interesting.
Had it on draught at Boutique Lise, Vesterbro, Copenhagen. It has a OK yellow hazy body with a good head. Nose is yeast and wheat malt and a little citrus. Watery flavor with some malt.
I like a little more spicy character in hefeweizens.  This one is balanced, and drinks easily, but is a little boring to me.  Good summer beer I'm sure.

Draught, at the Anchor, Birmingham.  I've had this from a bottle, and I know it must taste better than on tap.  From the bottle, the yeast is more detectable, and adds more flavour.  From the tap, the cloudines is regulated, and everything becomes a bit lemony, and, more worryingly, a bit watery.  It also suffers from being too chilled.  Having said all that, this is still good stuff - fresh, tasty and with a wonderful head.
One of my all time favourites. A lemony aroma and a bit watery taste but one of the best German Weissbiers there is.

Beer pours (in Chimay glass) a cloudy yellow-orange with a small amount of white head that dissipates somewhat, but leaves a thin film of head.  Aroma is of lemon, a faint black licorice, and citrus.  Flavor is of lemon, wheat (watered down) and alka-seltzerish.  Very effervecent.  Not my style of beer, but my brother's.  Sampled at 67 degrees Fahrenheit.
Cloudy beer with and interesting aroma of yeast and fuits. Taste is very faint though. A bit Watery. I had better beers.
A good standard wheat beer. Usual taste and aroma of banana and cloves. Nothing really comes out and hits you though. There are far better examples of this type of beer.
standard wheat beer. nice thick fluffy white head. weak nose and simple taste.
Cloudy, has a very fresh, fruity taste that is very refreshing. Goods alcohol balance.
Nice wheat flavour without being overpowering.  Quite easy to drink and nice amber colour.  Slightly cloudy appearance but all in all not too bad.

Bottle, expiration dating system on side of rear label, but unmarked thus unused.  This is a pretty generic hefe that would be in the bottom half of the pack compared to US hefes and near the bottom of the German brews I've tasted.  Not a BAD beer, but very mild hefe style, wheat taste very attenuated.  A good hefe entry point for bud drinkers.

Not as much flavour as I remembered it once having. This was once what I considered a REAL good beer. Still looks fabulous, hazy gold but that huge head dies down too soon (admittedly drunken from a Duvel chalice). Nice, if little aroma, but that taste isn't quite as big as I remembered. I'm still trying to pinpoint what the taste is like, but it's still a smooth drinking, comfortable beer.
Yellow and cloudy, nice white head. Weak and yeasty aroma of banana and spices. Sweet and spicy flavour with some yeastiness. Hard to drink. Some wheat notes in it's bland finish.

Keg
Cloudy blond color. Spicy aroma. Too weak taste, dry. Too bitter.
(Draught)  Hazy yellow colored Hefeweizen with nice thick head.  Descent tasting beer overall.
had this one after the weissbier dunkel.. Neither one impressed my palate. had some some nice wheat flavors but i dont plan on buying again.
Hazy pale straw colour with hugh fluffy head. heavy wheat aroma. bitter/sweet taste.

This brew poured a very large invigorated head of white colored mostly diminishing bubbles that left behind a fair lacing and a transparent softly carbonated straw yellow colored body.  It had a skunky aroma and a smooth mouth feel.  The flavor is malty and mildly hopped.  Not to much to this one and a disappointment form Erdinger whose Dunkel Weiss is most excellent.  Re-rate 6/7/2004  This second bottle had a very mild aroma but definitely not skunky.  The flavor contained more yeasty notes than before.  The palate is smooth with no bite and mildly tingly.  Hence, the previous rating of 2-3-4-3-8 was changed to 5-3-5-4-12.

9/20/03:  bottle.  
  wheat and sweet honey nose.  straw colored body.  honey and wheat flavors with some fruitiness mixed in.  smooth and light.

Hazy yellow body with a white head. No lacing.

Nice wheat and yeast aromas. Somewhat spicy smell.

Malt and spice. A slight sour note in the end. Alcohol becomes apparent.

Light body with a crisp finish.

Pale yellow color, snow-white sticky head. A bit fruity, banana and, attention, wheat (!) aroma. (Unfortunately, wheat aroma and flavor are rare things in Erdinger weizens). Malty, spicy and sourish notes in the palate. Amazingly refreshing in a hot summer day.

Pressure tap in Bled, Slovenia. Gold straw colour with impressive head. Juicy fruity, grapefruit & banana flavours but with little balancing body. Sweet and refreshing but ultimately not enough complexity to keep you interested.

On tap in the Cellar, St. Andrews.  Despite being completely opposed to wheat beers, I found this to be quite enjoyable.  The wheat flavor is certianly there, but not as overpowering as it typically is in other brews.  A little banana flavor.

A masterpiece! This beer has not been rated highly enough to date! The Erdinger line is as close as I have found to the beer on tap in Germany. And this Hefeweizen has a great complexity not found in North American beers.

Great straw colored cloudy beer with a nice smell of wheat and yeast. Pours with a typical big head, but missing the typical banana/clove flavor of German Weiss beers. Nice first flavor, but leaves you wanting more. Good for a hot summer day, but not overly interesting.

Cloudy hazy pale yellow color, with a small white head that doesn't stick around. Light banana-clove aroma, light wheaty, yeasty flavors, very light in body, somewhat watery mouthfeel, finishes too sweet, bland and uninteresting, not very much going on here.

A cloudy straw color with a 2 finger rocky head. The aroma is a hint metallic with some sourness and hops. The flavor is hoppy right up front with strong wheat flavors. The banana flavor and aroma I tend to enjoy in a german wheat were not there. I would say this is close to what we make here as an american wheat.

Big head that died back too quickly over a hazy gold body.  Very soft, a little sweet, and faint hops echoing in the distance.  I think I heard them at least, it may have been the hum from my computer monitor.  Although refreshing, the typical German wheat esters were almost non-existant.  If it hadn't been so smoothly soft, with such a subtle hop imprint, I might have mistaken it for an American wheat.  Refreshing, but not interesting.

Color is a cloudy golden, pale yellow color. Nice big fluffy white head about an inch high leaving patchy lace. Aroma is lemony and clean with some clove spice. Taste is crisp, sweetly tart of citrus followed by the spiciness of cloves, ending with a slightly yeasty bread that gives it a nice airy dryness. Feel is a bit on the lighter fair for the body, kinda empty. It's a pretty decent Hefe-weisen, very crisp and clean, citrusy sweet and slightly spiced. This is a highly drinkable beer, light and refreshing, clean and crisp, not bad at all, but its no Paulaner.
Almost like a very dry champagne.  Unfortunately, this dryness masks any flavor.  Typical clove and banana overtones are nowhere to be found
Fairly typical German wheat beer; nothing particularly stands out about it; nice yeast aroma

Cool and clear taste, thick white head.  I am just glad that Safeway have seen fit to stock this bier in the UK.  Simply one of my favourite beers.  However, it cannot be stressed enough how impprtant a genuine weissbier glass is when pouring the drink.  Without it, the head can easily vanish.  The only weissbier that ever beat it for me were the locally brewed varieties in Regensburg.  With this beer, I am drinking something that that ranks in my personal shortlist of beers.  The fact I can get it in a UK supermarket is a massive bonus - it's the best weizen easily available in the UK.
Nice cloudy golden color with a thick white strong head. Taste i fruity with a nice balanced bitterness.
Very clean enjoyable german wheat beer.  Low on both phenolics an esters but they are present and balnced with a d dry finish.  Good tart character.

The first beer of my Germany trip, on draft my hotel's bar in Frankfurt.  This wheat beer was hazy, golden with a rocky white head and looked beautiful in the sculpted glass.  Aroma of wheat, citrus, malts and hops.  Flavor initially sweet wheat, tart lemon and cereal with a pleasant hop finish.  Mouthfeel was medium bodied and highly carbonated.  Very drinkable and welcome after 15 hours of airports and flights.
Outstanding weissbier! Malty wheaty goodness with perfect balance.  Surprisingly refreshing for such a substantial brew.  Hard to find a better expample of the style.

Bottled, at the Wenlock Arms,  I’m trying leave at this point but somebody offers me another beer. Of course I accepted. This weisse was smoother then the first, head good body and character. I still think there the uglier of the most beers. 7of7.

(on draft) Nice head with good lacing.  Unfiltered appearance, but not to the extent of many other German hefe's.  Same could be said of the taste:  refreshing without the dominant taste of cloves and bananas that many hefe's display.  Carbonation replaces some of the traditional smoothness.  Overall, though, a very nice 
satisfying beer.

I used to fancy Hefeweizens and this was always a solid choice. Creamy yellow body with thick white head. Smells of bananna and wheat. Refreshing, wetted flavor. Medium bodied thickness, with tastes of bananna and sweet spices. Above average quality at a bargain price.

Not as manly as the great ones like Paulaner or Schneider, but on a hot day I wouldn't turn down on of these.  A light, almost fizzy body with modest banana-clove flavor.  Evaporates in your mouth, leaving it lemony fresh...the detergent of beer!  Good choice for beer novices.

Hazy golden color with good head and lacing, light-bodied. Aroma of banana, clove, lemongrass, and brown rice. Fizzy mouthfeel. Good balance, not too fruity, not too wheaty. Not as lingering of an aftertaste as some German hefeweizens, didn't have the "pop" I want for a hefe. Still a good example of the genre. You can do much worse.

A classic hefeweizen. Good aroma of banana, vanilla, and clove. Bright gold color with a huge white head. Above average carbonation which made it very refreshing. Excellent with a lemon wedge or without.
A good creamy head on the original pour that stays the whole way down. The wheat profile has cloves and banana esters with good hop presence that is not overly prominent. An easy drinking beer.
Large white head, diminishing. Cloudy golden. Slightly sweet aroma and taste with notes of banana and not much bitterness. A little thin and unexciting.

Brilliant looking light cloudy brew that you can really taste the yeast in. I did notice the most wonderful honey suckle sweet aroma the very first time I tried this. I didn't notice the banana flavours which can turn me off lighter wheat beers but still got a nice amount of the malty wheat flavour. Great first beer that can be nicely followed by the Dunkel.

On draft in the US, starts with a hint of banana and light malt, almost sweet at first.  Stands up well and is good with dinner.  Very comparable to the same beer I had in Munich, unlike many other imported Bavarian beers.

From can. Cloudy yellow with lots of bubbles. Big long-lasting head. Not much nose to it. Aroma of banana, lemon and malt and a hint of something metallic. Nice clean flavour with malt and banana, but thin. Light bodied and too much carbonation for me.

This beer poured a cloudy yellow color and formed a huge foamy white head that took it's time disappearing, but left little lace in the process. A medium amount of carbonation is present. It had an aroma of hops, banana and clove with a hint of grain. A flavor of hops and grain. The body is fairly light and rather weak. Not one of the better hefes I have tried lately

I bought this beer in Tampa, Florida under a different name, Erdinger Weissbier, and with different packaging. Nonetheless, according to this site it is the same beer. This brew had a cloudy blond appearance, little aroma, a large frothy head, and a smooth crisp wheat and malt taste. This hefeweizen is a good refreshing beer that quenched my thrust, but overall not a beer to put in the record books.
I quite like this hefeweissen, though I prefer the Dunkel, but for a fist drink this one is very mild and nicely balanced. It is just lacking a bit of character
This beer has the ordinary appereance (cloudy golden, huge head) and the typical yeast (banana) aroma. The flavour is a bit too light. A refreshing wheat beer, but too much standard.

Cloudy golder wheat beer with huge white head.  Nothing special, and there are many better German and American wheat beers in this style.  Some clove, some banana, but little sweetness, little yeastiness, no real hoppy bite, but a bitter sour finish.

Big fluffy head on top of clear light golden body - full of swirls of carbonation.  Herbal lemony and malty, the flavor was much "flatter" than I had hoped.  Beautiful, but boring.  (Label stated that this is bottle fermented - that didn't seem true)

Has a cloudy light orange/yellow color with some carbonation and a light malt/yeast smell.  Taste lighty fruity/yeast and finishes a bit fizzy.  Overall I was not too impressed with the beer, a bit too thin for me.

This one is very popular in Munich and for a very good reason. It's a well balanced weizen with a nice wheat malt flavor and a great strain of yeast as well. While not my favorite weizen, still a sure bet for a good beer. Very nice on draught and out of a bottle stands up well.

Dark hazy straw color with a tall, rocky lasting, white head.  VERY light slightly malty and perfumy aroma.  LIGHT malt with a light sour finish.  Very light!!!  Reminds me of Michelob hefe weiss.  I expect more from a Bavarian Weisse.
Hazy-medium-pale-yellow with a fizzy white head.  The nose is faint, the taste is almost water with a bit of hay.  Nothing in this one. Strange.

Had this at the Bon Vivant Beer Lovers Club on 3-28-03. Pours a cloudy blond. Coriander, banana, and citrus fruits dominate the aroma. The taste was malt with wheat and spice. Slight yeast. I was expecting more of a yeast presence, but I am not disappointed. Very smooth and refreshing this evening considering it's still in the 60's. Great hefeweizen.
Draught - Has a more wheaty than Banana Aroma.  Full-bodied with a deep yellow-golden color. Not the best Hefe, but right up there.
Solid Hefe.  Basic clove and phenol, but far more restrained than in the Schneider or Hacker Pschorr versions.  Good, not great.
Cloudy lighter golden beer.  Very sweet cloying yeasty aroma with hints of hops.  ALmost a green flavor with some tartness.  Tangy finish.
sweet sugary nose, cloudy amber hue, good head, grapefruit and orange peel tones, long aftertaste, traces of wheat, good weissbier

Light cloudy appearance with giant head that you want to put a cherry on top.  Sweet yeasty aroma.  Not as yeasty in taste as a lot of these beers.  Has a sweet light palate but overall is quite bland yet very drinkable
A nice attempt at replicating the ever popular Hoegaarden, but misses the mark. Still, refreshing if served extra chilled.

Poured light golden color with a thick white head.  As the head began to disappear the yeast began moving to the bottom giving the appearance of egg yolk then finally a cloudy, golden appearance with a small head that lasted through the whole beer.  Sweet aroma with some citrus.  Flavor was slightly sweet with wheat, hops and citrus.  Seemed a little thin even for the style.  Overall good and refreshing.
Nice color and head. Not too suprising of a taste. Is definately a clean tasting beer. This one is perfect for pizza night.
Pale, cloudy yellow color. Good head. Scents of citrus, plenty of banana and clove in the taste.  Doesn't live up to its aroma, however.
Has the same inviting look of the best examples of this genre, but, sadly, aroma and taste don't quite stand up to the comparison. Dry, and a bit monodimensional. Not too bad, anyway.
aroma of yeast and a tad fruity. Pours a light yellow, cloudy, with a mid-range head. Clean and crisp like a typical wheat beer should be. Would go down well on a patio in the summer.
Huge head, mildly hazy straw body, not much of a nose, with a hint of perfume. Rather bland.
Hazey golden color, big white head. Citrus aroma. Weak wheat flavor. A little over carbonated
Nice head,nice body, nice taste - the king among Weisbier, but make sure to drink it while its cold
Creamier than a cream bun, good head, nice appearance. Citrus flavours too, easy to drink.

This one poured a very light golden color with a thoroughly MASSIVE head that practically engulfed my kitchen. A white...foamy, long lasting but nonlacing head. The aroma was pretty weak. Hints of wheat and yeast, but nothing interesting. The taste is pretty bland at that. Watery palate to begin with followed by a mild yeast and wheat shock, and then a nice wheaty finish, but like i said, very very subdued. Extremely lively carbonation that takes away from the enjoyment of this as prickly bubbles batter the mouth in an assault on the taste buds. Overall a fairly unimpressive brew. Nothing characteristically strong in the taste or aftertaste, or in the aroma that makes this stand out more than any other macro weissbeer.
Slight skunk to this. Clean and crisp, well carbonated. Nothing special IMHO.

Yeasty smell, cloudy colour, big head with big quickly disapearing bubbles.  I wasn’t all that impressed with my first one but two years and a few dozen later and it is one of my favourites in the style.
very faint aroma and a cloudy white/amber appearance. A bit to sweet for my taste.
Very persitent head, Citrucy and clovey, as one might expect.  Light wheatey finish, clean and crisp.
Pale amber colour, very opaque. It has an aroma of yeast and bread. The flavour is well-balanced with a touch of acidity. Smokey and bready aroma.
good Hefeweizen cloudy /golden in color. a bit yeasty undertone. Ok.........

Aroma - not very strong - missing that banana-like quality that I look for in German wheats.  Flavor - a bit too yeasty and not enough fruitiness - missing that tartness that I like in wheats.  Appearance - nice fluffy long-lasting white head and quite hazy light golden color.  All in all - an everyday heffy - but have had much better.

Frothy, hazy deep amber. Head doesn''t last till the end but easy to drink. Lacking complexity and predictable banana taste. Bare hints of spice which disappointed me. The Dunkel version by Erdinger is better, but Maisells Weisse still rules the Bavarian Wheats IMHO. This is pleasant but boring. $3:50AUS 330mls
Ok wheat beer.  A little sweeter than some of the others I think.  I probably like franzikaner and paulaner better but erdinger dunkel was one of my gateway beers so I got a special place for that

Aroma... hmm what aroma? perhaps hints of wheat? I dunno, it''s hardly noticable. Initial appearance is good; cloudy light yellow colour with a frothy head. Unfortunately this head doesn''t last long. Taste is like a typical hefe weisbier, only very weak. Spices are there; it''s even hard to call this one refreshing. Palate is like water. Dirty? No I love water! ;)

Inferior brew for a german wheat. Usual cloudy yellow white color. Head is initially large, creamy, but diminished pretty quickly to a short but lasting head. Weak spicy aroma, not much perfume furthermore. Taste is not as refreshing as a wheat should be. Thin palate, watery. One of the worst wheats i''ve tasted, and i usually like german wheats.

Not too bad of a Hefe.  Pretty thin for a hefe.  Very light tasting beer.  Drank this on a warm day on the pool deck of a cruise ship.  Tasted pretty decent then.  Retasted recently and Not like I remember.  Not as good I should say.

The Erdinger I am drinking is labeled "Erdinger Premium Weißbier". I was re-directed to this Erdinger
"Hefeweizen" as it''s claimed they are the same, only going under different names when shipped
to different countries. 
Not cloudy. Dark, bisque coloration. It doesn''t smell like much of anything, except
a small amount of kitchen-cleaner and plastic. Small fizz. 
Pleasant taste, slightly watery with a tiny banana. This reminds me of well-water. 
I think this beer tastes slightly like broiled chicken.
Bottled(500ml). -erdinger champ is better than this, flavorful aroma, dry...
Fine, easy to drink, weissbier. Not exiting but it goes down easily.........
Despite it''s reputation, quite a regular Weissbier. Try the rare Roggen !!! (Rye-Beer)
Tap.  Cloudy yellow-orange.  Dry, clove, and a little banana spice..........
lacking in esters you''d expect.  Lite on the palate.  Might be a nice summer brew when having more than one.
What can I say I am a sucker for white beers in the summer.  Especially when they are drank on the beach in Mallorca with my beautiful girlfriend at my side.

I think this was my first ever wheat beer taste so I was very happy when I tried it. I`ve only had a couple others as of now, and still think it`s a pretty refreshing wheat beer by comparison. Um I dunno, if a place has it, I`ll get one. How`s that for a review then? Um...
Ho-hum, not the best but not the worst.  Sweet aroma with a malty taste.....
weak but flavorful aroma, mildly cloudy, thin head. mild sweer with a strong hops finish.
Blond slightly milky with a big head. Slightly sweet, malty taste with a long mild bitterness.

A yellow unclear beer with a good head. It has an aroma of yeast so commen with wheatbeers. The flavor is that of yeast with a slightly bitterness that lingers. It doesn't have the fruityness that most wheat beers have - which makes the flavor tame.
I have heard that this is THE Hefeweissbeer, but I have had it better. I find it weak, was expecting more wheat flavour and taste. A decent brew though..
Interesting beer without too much aroma yet it's taste is good. Looks good anyhow!
Rather bland example of a German wheat. Not alot of fruity or clove presence in the aroma or the taste.

Nov 2019 330ml dark bottle, unfiltered with some wet residue that can be swirled into the glass, from BeerWulf for under £2. An acceptable but rather bland wheat beer. Underperforms. [2.4] 

Oct, 2014 500ml brown bottle. Vintage 1990. Dark amber. Soft, watery texture. Iced tea and peach flavour. Quite mild. Hints of sweetness. Pleasant soft carbonation, like fresh spring water. This is a subtle, soft, refreshing and agreeable drink, but does lack character and impact. [2.5]

July, 2005. All Bar One, Canary Wharf. Keg.Tastes like Fanta and Savlon mixed, fermented, then allowed to settle so long it has gone dull and stale. The carbonation in this keg version is artificial and aggressive. [1.8]

Sept, 2002.  Bottle. A wheat beer - just another run of the mill wheat beer. Yawn. [2.2]

Of the three different beers offered at User_Ex's wedding reception over the weekend, this was the most popular judging by the weight of the three kegs at the end of the reception.  This is no surprise as there were few experienced beer drinkers at the party but I did my best to enlighten as many of the guests as I could to the pleasures of the more flavorful fare also offered.  I volunteered to help take one of the kegs from the reception back to the hotel so I carefully lifted each of the kegs and chose the lightest one.  I really enjoyed trying to look inconspicuous entering the lobby of a luxury hotel with a huge stainless keg and avoiding eye contact with the hotel staff at the front desk while making a beeline for the elevator.  Bright hazy yellow with very fine yeast particles.  Citrusy aroma with a hint of yeast.  Crisp, citrusy, slightly acidic taste without overt banana or yeast twang.  A solid beer that is quite tasty but different than most hefes.

boring....what a disappointment. when i pick up a german wheat, particularly one from germany, i am expecting to get pummeled by bananas and cloves and yeastiness. no such luck here--very akin to the pinkus i recently tried and wasn't impressed with. 

blah, bland, blehk. BORING

Hazy lemony orange with a thick but foamy off white head. Streaming carbonation. Lemony aroma with very mild Weizen qualities, hints of clove and bubblegum. First sip is toasty, light bodied and mildly crisp. Lemony tartness. Full carbonation although not spritzy. Weak Weizen flavors and a lackluster body. Easy going and refreshing but boring and hardly a top example. Finishes toasty, fuller and bit more sticky. A strange version.

Bottled, 500ml, 5.3% ABV. Somebody who visits Germany often brought me back a bottle. Darkish yellow, cloudy - I swirled and poured in the yeast as recommended. Rather large head (despite my slow pouring). Wheaty aroma. Wheaty, yeasty & slightly bitter flavour, also what I might describe as ‘mellow’. My favourite of the style so far. Rerate. Sweet bananas. Not quite as I remember.

Wimpy head for a hefe. Nice reddish gold body. Nice estery nose, but not overly strong.  Flavor is superbly balanced  among the wheaty malt, citric fruitiness (although it leans more towards orange than lemon), bubblegum/banana esters and the cloves. A very mild drinkable hefe, nicely balanced.

Faint aroma, mostly of yeast but with the requisite wheat malt, too.  Deep, attractive golden color.  I swirled and poured and was able to generate the always lovely "yeast tornado."  Head is white colored and quickly fades.  Flavor is very mild, even for this style.  Wheat malt, some suprisingly good spiciness, very light lemony citrus, a gentle hint of bitter towards the finish and a very clean profile overall.  Aftertaste has just a light touch of honey-like sweetness.  While I can appreciate the uncomplicated nature of this brew, I also appreciate having some flavor!  Also, the palate was so carbonated as to be unnerving.  It also made this beer take longer to drink, not quite a plus for a light-bodied wheat beer.  Good beer but certainly not great.
A slight caramel taste with a strong long lasting head. A good beer.........

Mild is a good way to describe this wheat.  It smells pretty decent but it tastes a bit bland compared with others of it's style.  On a good note I did find it to be pretty easy to drink due to a lack of sweetness.
Beautiful wheat body, and nice head for a wheat. Not much aroma in this one. Some wheat and yeast flavor but very mild overall. I still like it, but can't say it is my favorite wheat.

Raining orange and apple juice on clover-laden banana plantation...An assertive, beautiful wheat character develops within the yeasty body...Very well made yet it’s not getting to me nearly as much as the Weihenstephaner can...
A regulary wheat beer. Very easy to drink. Weak head and body. more neutral than most German Wheats.
dark yellow with a big thick head, not much of aroma ,hints of caramell and banana in the taste, nice and easy to drink

Rerate: Hazy yellow orange colour with huge creamy lasting head. Green woody sap, hops, faint floral nectar and something volatile reminiscent of floor cleaner aroma. Medium thin body. Light bitter start, slightly sweeter grainy malt middle and fading soft bitter finish. Not quiet as good as the last time I had it but still quite drinkable. First rated 3.0 6/20/2002

Beer retasted. Bottled. Golden coloured. Hazy. Dense off white head.  Has a distinct wheat aroma of banana, sweetness and spice. Flavour similar. Meidum bodied. Ends fruity and sweet. Original rate 2-3-3-2-7 Bottled: This is the most boring wheat beer i’ve ever tasted. A decent appearance but not much aroma and flavour. Very waterish and dies instantly. Absolute disappointment.

Wheaty, spicy, sweet and banana aromas - must have gotten a good bottle. Cloudy golden amber with creamy head. Medium thick body. Nice flavor, fruity and estery. Bit of alcohol. Slighly too sweet but definitely refreshing and tasty.

This is a hefe gone wrong. Sweet cereal aroma (no banana or clove). Almost no head. Flavor has some wheat, but this is definitely not the yeast that I expect in a hefe. High carbonation. A disappointment.

This beer really seems to run the full range of scores from omhper's 2.2 to User_Experience at 4. I admit I do like this style but I prefer Schniederweiss. A orange hazy beer with a frothy head. Very good but not the benchmark for the style.
Sweet banana nose and taste with a hint of lemon and yeast. Cloudy yellow, little bit greenish. Nice refreshing light beer.

Slight banana nose – very pleasant. Tight head atop a yellow-greenish and cloudy brew. A light, citrusy taste with a little spiciness. Full and crisp mouth feel. This is an understated beer but very nice and very well balanced. Went great with the Maultaschen and salad I made for dinner.

Nice beer on the whole.  I like the appearance in this style, especially the murky color and fine carbonation.  The flavor is less distinguished, but it has a nice combination of sweet and bitter. (bottle)
This was the worst hefe in my 8-hefe tasteoff. Interestingly, this tastes a bit like a dunkel.  The alcohol is more noticeable here than on most.
Hefeweizen beers are great and this is no exception to the rule.  I enjoyed this one.  I like it better than the Krystalklarr or whatever the hell it is.
Nice colour & head. Almost no aroma & weak taste, very thin. Pretty Ordinary

Bottled:
 A cloudy pale, brownish yellow beer  with a nice head. Aroma and taste of some yeast and green bananas with some grass. A typical weissbier.

Golden cloudy color with light amber reflections. Huge white resilant thiny and creamy head.
Aroma is fruity with herbal notes. Flavor is balancend in the beginning but very soon turns into a nice wheat, bread and crisp finish. Medium-bodied.

cloudy orange colour with a dense white head.
citrus nose with evidence of cloves and some zesty yeasty character.  
mild taste with hints if bananas, clove  and citrus. good balance between wheat and yeast flavours. a well msade hefe-weizen  whichj id very refreshing.
cloudy pale orange colour, fine head, the aroma is perfumy, citrusy, fresh with notes of grapefruit, full-bodied, sweet with a long fruity finish
The colour is cloudy yellow with a very nice head. It has an aroma of grapefruit. Pleasant acidity. Lot of character.
I definately have to agree with the "smooth and very drinkable" comment, but it lacks complexity.
Re-rate: nice hazy gold colour and big bubbly head, a bit thin on the palate, a bit to ordinary and neutral tasting in the end.

The beer excavates itself from the 500ml brown bottle an unclouded golden amber color with a generous white head that is semi-creamy in texture; the resultant lace forms a thick and sticky sheet upon the glass. Nose has hints of wheat, citrus crisp, fresh and clean to the senses with the start sweet and it has a nice grain profile, the top a bit thin. Finish is meek in its acidity, the hops also benign in their spiciness, a nice summertime beer.
Cloudy appearance, full body, soft mouthfeel and a sweet crisp finish. Easy drinker without being special.
I can't believe that so many people have given this beer such an average rating, its beautiful! Very sweet and drinkable and comes served in a very impressive glass!
Nice cloudy appearance but very malty. Not bad but not my favourite beer....
Excellent Weiss beer. You do need the right glass for this one, also because of the initial head.

Bottle, from Tesco. Hazy lemon gold, good fluffy white head and moderate condition. Low lemon citrus aroma with a touch of fruitiness, gently yeasty in the mouth with hints of lactic milkiness and a low yeasty-fruity finish. A bland Weissbier designed to appeal to as wide an audience as possible.
Malt dominated, not too balanced. no citrus or banana notes.................
not my kind of beer. but it's fun to fill a special weissbierglas in one row.

Cloudy appearance (drink it with the yeast!). Thick head that lasts. Fruity taste (bit of banana). Smooth and very drinkable. Re-rate tap: less carbonated as in the bottle. Yeastier. Yoghurt. The banana flavor now really steps forward.

Head is initially huge, frothy, white, fully lasting. Body is hazy light yellow, bottle conditioned. Aroma is lightly yeasty (dough, cheese), lightly malty (bread), with light notes of banana and lemon. Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic, moderately bitter, slightly unclean. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Bland, poor yeast quality, virtually no esters, not among the cleanest tasting.  Very disappointing.
A lovely sweet and fruity weissbier with high carbonation and a full body. Very pleasant!

Dark yellow, hazy. Fruity aroma, but where is the esters? Medium bodied, rather thirst quenching, but one-dimensional and with an industrial feeling to it. Having tried perhaps 50 or so German brands of hefeweizen, I must say this is the least delicious of the bunch.
Ja doch hat was. Schön gekühlt macht direkt aune auf mehr!..................
Ahh! Eines meiner Favoriten, neben Paulaner das beste Weissbier der Welt!...
This beer was either too old, or way too bland.  There are many a German Wheat more worthy than this.
Lecker, aber zu viel davon wird 1. teuer und 2. übel!!......................
