Very nice semi-opaque color, not too much head.  The flavor reminds me of a mixture of yeast rolls or bread and fruit, mainly banana or orange.  It is so easy to drink, so little aftertaste.  I like Kristallklar alot as well, but this one has more body.  If I could pick just one beer to drink "because", it would be this one.  Ausgezeichnet!
A refreshing and crisp summer beer. However, my initial admiration for this beer has been somewhat lowered, after finding other weissbiers with more flavour.
I am not a Hefe drinker, but this one is ok...it looks beautiful when it comes in a tall pint...would reccomend it to almost any kind of beer drinker...way to go Erdingers!!!!
This settles it: weissbier are not to my taste..............................

Upon pouring the head is quite impressive, and sticks to the glass. Nice fruity notes on the nose, which are more subtle than a straight weissbier. Taste is fruity but milder than regular weissbiers, which I like. I even prefer it to Erdinger's dunkel version, which is saying something for one who prefers darks.
Great beer!  Hard to find but worth it......................................
Nice pale, cloudy yellow color.  Good head.  Scents of citrus, plenty of banana and clove in the taste.  Pretty good.
Sorry - my fault, this should have been a rating for Erdinger Weissbier Dunkel. I re-rated it to reflect the avg since i never had it - and cant seem to delete it. Sorry

not very cloudy, but a tarnished gold color.  sort of looks like a kristalweisse.  nice banana aroma, maybe some vanilla.  flavor is a bit spicy, with yeast and bready malt.  there's something to the finish i don't quite like, but otherwise, very drinkable.  a good one for introducing the style to others.

"Mit feiner hefe in der Flasche Gereift" -- compare fine yeast bottle conditioning, the yeasty orangey aroma, the crisp snap off a light medium body to a comparable experience with a mass market pils. If you have a nose and experience more in taste than merely bitterness, you must agree that the Bavarians kick ass on the Czechs and Northern Germans. Not to mention its greater alcohol content (my bottle is 5.3%) and the other great beer styles and superior examples of foreign styles in Bavaria. This is an easy drinking dirty blonde brew that's as great with salads as it is with pizza. If "I'd like to buy the world a Coke..." were about beer, I'd wish this were the beer sold at every sports stadium in America. I just saw some megapimp on MTV's Cribs. He had several tens of millions in automobiles alone. In his fridge : Corona and Heineken! What a total dumb fuck. He was stocked with Tombstone frozen pizza as well. I'd like to buy this dumb ass this or another fine example of the Bayern weiss style. One thing I might add is that this isn't as crisp and bright and banana ester laden as smaller examples.

Nothing real fancy here.
Just a good, descent beer.........................
Very solid wheat beer. Might have the most perfect yeast level of any beer I've ever had.
Very pleasent beer on tap, beautiful cloudy appearance, lovely wheaty taste and aroma.
Respectable example and better than most US-versions, but didn't measure up to the company of Franziskaner and Hacke Pschorr. Very nice and refreshing but just lacking that fruity yeast depth.
all i can say is this is a another good beer by erdinger....................
not the worst wheat but had a sour finish...................................

On tap in Helen, GA -- I sat in awe -- I could only say Oh my lord this is the best weisbier on earth -- even my dad, who swears by Bud said "Damn, that is good!"  A definite champ.  I see that other raters rated this poorly -- perhaps the draught is better than the bottle?
A very good example of the style.Far better than average....................

Erdinger Hefeweozen is THE definition of a good german wheat beer.
Perfectly balanced in flavor, smooth texture, great subtle overtones of clover, banana and hefe (yeast).  I haven't found a wheat beer to beat this one.  when purchasing this beer, make sure the bottles are not too old. As usual, draft is preferred.
Fairly pleasant but agreed that it is rather plain.  Not much of a wheat character.  Still drinkable.
Very good beer, strong and with great and full palate.......................
not the worst wheat beer but probably the least interesting.................
A bit too "focus-group tested" and "premium" but still a very drinkable Weissbier.
A pretty good wheat, nice balance but nothing terribly innovative. 15 is the max for this style in my book.
A pretty good weisse. Lots of cloves and spices. ...........................
Not really fond of the grainy taste of this one, can't really explain why that is.
